Active glucocorticoids (GCS), such as cortisol or corticosterone, are a prerequisite for the induction of surfactant synthesis in the fetal lung.	3.841872739652875
In fetal serum, biologically inactive metabolites (cortisone or 11-dehydrocorticosterone) outweigh the active forms.	2.7899092272360297
The inhibition of 11-HSD by the licorice extract glycyrrhetinic acid completely inhibits this central metabolism.	2.794318316703202
On the other hand, GCS induce the reductive activity of 11-HSD and, therefore, they increase their own activation by positive feedback.	2.7977385684927785
In a community sample of 394 eldery aged 61 years and older from East and West Germany, diseases, contacts with general practitioners and specialists, the use of medicine, attitudes regarding health and illness, the subjective health, psychic problems, social support, social integration, social burden, and socio-demographic variables were assessed.	3.159193224413583
Based on these data the determinants for the contact of physicians and the use of medicine were analyzed.	2.8191141678848908
The results confirmed the frequency of multimorbidity in the elderly; on average we found three different diseases at the same time for each person.	3.9103159730278008
In nearly 10% of the sample we found seven diagnoses existing at the same time.	3.0632076107846986
88% had contact with a general practitioner at least once a year, 97% had contact either with a general practitioner or with a specialist once a year.	3.6968946911288407
55.8% took at least one medicine each day.	3.943924693175864
The number of diseases existing at the same time was the most determining variable for the contact of physicians and the use of medicine.	3.1433787690766946
Furthermore, the elderly had more contact with physicians and took more medicine if they thought they were susceptible to diseases in a high degree, and if they rated their own health as poor.	3.3015812447167887
Fewer contacts with physicians and a lower use of medicine were found in those elderly that rated health behavior as little useful, that had low control beliefs regarding their own health, and that experienced only a low degree of health-related limitations in their everyday life.	3.5825214396663156
Furthermore, we found a higher use of medicine if there was little social support.	3.5621955990839216
There were no significant age-related or sex-related differences regarding the contact of practitioners or the use of medicine.	3.4321828115090134
Inflammatory bowel diseases (IBD: Crohn's disease, ulcerative colitis) are chronic inflammatory and frequently relapsing diseases of the gut that ultimately lead to destruction of the intestinal tissue.	3.135115670337731
Recent evidence suggests that a pathologic activation of the mucosal immune system in response to antigens is a key factor in the pathogenesis of IBD.	3.775340365568776
Furthermore, changes in cell migration and cytokine production appear to contribute to the perpetuation of IBD and the postoperative recurrence of Crohn's disease.	3.357312623906611
Based on recent advances in our understanding of the pathogenesis of IBD, several new therapeutic strategies are currently being tested in clinical practice, including recombinant anti-inflammatory cytokines (IFN-, IL-10, IL-11) and inhibitors of cell adhesion molecules (ICAM), proinflammatory cytokines (TNF, IL-12) and their receptors (TNF, IL-6R).	3.841758238305368
Dysregulation of apoptosis may play a major role in the pathogenesis of systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE).	3.302478049935762
A defective clearance of apoptotic cells or inappropriately high rates of apoptosis may lead to a pathologic accumulation of abnormal cell material with a secondary autoimmune response.	3.363313231311396
Experimental findings in apoptotic keratinocytes and C1q knock-out mice suggest an important role of C1q in the clearance of apoptotic cell material.	3.438084405504461
In addition, there are several links between C1q and SLE: Most the patients with C1q deficiency develop a SLE-like syndrome.	3.1674942381557734
SLE itself often causes secondary C1q deficiency and autoantibodies to C1q are detected in almost all patients with active lupus nephritis.	3.6502222534529793
These observations suggest a central role of C1q in apoptosis and in the pathogenesis of SLE.	4.131350622108282

A prospective randomized clinical trial was performed to evaluate the use of self-reinforced absorbable composites (Biofix) in the fixation of ankle fractures.	4.577386180693637
The benefits of Biofix rods and screws are: a reduction in costs since no secondary operation is needed, prevention of stress-shielding and thereby diminishing the risk of bone porosity.	3.4886918431792098
Patients aged between 16 and 75 years old with closed, non-comminuted fractures of the lateral and/or medial malleolus and dislocation of the fracture fragments greater thean 2 mm were included in the study.	4.091649900153599
22 patients were treated with Biofix rods and screws and the control group of 19 patients with a standard technique.	5.227231807542842
After 3, 6 and 12 months, rontgenograms were taken.	3.925169527153106
At the same time functional results were evaluated following the criteria of Olerud and Molander.	3.3249755364389637
Two patients were withdrawn from the trial for non-medical reasons.	3.3825785807264848
22 patients (12 from the Biofix group, 10 from the AO group) operated two or more years ago were contacted to see if any complications had occured since they were last seen.	3.0534253449220623
In 4 cases a Biofix screw broke down just beneath the head during insertion.	2.727085222537884
This did not result in an insufficient fixation of the fracture.	4.177398302443219
There were no early post-operative complications.	3.3342553153197954
The functional and rontgenological results in both groups were equal.	3.7231057281850175
In three cases a sterile sinus developed at the site of screw insertion.	3.3232980063245283
Biofix rods and screws, made of polylactic acid, are a good alternative for the fixation of fractures of the ankle.	4.535494380990335
The use of resorbable fracture fixation material has the advantage that a second operation to remove osteosynthesis material is not necessary.	3.1609276391226415
The long term results are good.	3.9019002820483295
There is, however, a possibility of development of tissue reaction to the resorbable material.	3.8753478374799513
In current textbooks of dermatology, lichen amyloidosus is said to be a papular, intensely pruritic type of amyloidosis of unknown aetiology.	3.2931029058534813
When this concept was developed, there was no way of discriminating between the different types of amyloid.	4.114728314395761
It is now known that amyloid in lichen amyloidosus is not derived from immunoglobulins or serum proteins, as it is in systemic amyloidoses, but from keratin peptides of necrotic keratinocytes.	2.944575217700387
Even several years ago, chronic scratching was invoked as a possible cause of damage to keratinocytes in lichen amyloidosus.	3.392913356980128
In support of this hypothesis, four cases are presented.	3.672056993182739
Apart from amyloid in the papillary layer, all biopsy specimens revealed histopathological signs of chronic scratching (epithelial hyperplasia with hypergranulosis and compact orthokeratosis, coarse collagen in vertical streaks in the stratum papillare), such as are also found in prurigo nodularis and lichen simplex chronicus.	2.776086922940752
Lichen amyloidosus is considered to be a variant of these conditions.	4.184350166608514
Just as in prurigo nodularis and lichen simplex chronicus, pruritus seems to be the cause and not a symptom of the papular skin lesions.	2.9854229304781463
Consequently, treatment of lichen amyloidosus should not be directed at removing amyloid, but at improving the pruritus.	3.515455619409947

With the introduction of each new technique for registering eye movements, the question arises concerning whether these provide a reliable and accurate alternative for the  diagnosis of labyrinthine dysfunction when compared to the most commonly used electro-oculographic technique.	3.847799702202588
To answer this question we compared mean slow-phase velocity (SPV) using three different recording techniques: electro-oculography (EOG), video-oculography (VOG) and infra-red oculography (IROG) during four different types of examinations.	2.822057058064916
The examinations were the eye target tracking test (ETT), horizontal and vertical optokinetic nystagmus (OKN) tests and the rotating chair test of the horizontal vestibulo-ocular reflex (HVOR).	2.7829267224989263
For the ETT tests the VOG provided consistently higher mean SPV values with low variance, presumably because of the accuracy and stability of the calibration.	3.5103756909157835
For the horizontal OKN and VOR rotating chair tests no significant differences were found between the mean SPV obtained with the different recording techniques, although the IROG recordings were associated with a larger variance.	3.915446959418743
Vertical OKN mean SPV was consistently lower with IROG and VOG techniques presumably because of non-linearities and resolution limitations inherent in these techniques.	3.181283687731434
These results indicate that the EOG technique despite its disadvantages of noise, time to apply and variability of calibration still provides an inexpensive, reliable and accurate means of measuring slow-phase eye movements.	3.1149487932462923

Aim of this study is to investigate the microvasculature of the quadriceps tendon by injection techniques and immunohistochemical methods (antibodies against laminin) with regard to the pathogenesis of tendon degeneration.	3.9694615100144777
The blood supply of the quadriceps tendon arises from descending branches of the lateral circumflex femoral artery, by branches of the descending geniculate artery and by branches of the medial and lateral superior geniculate arteries.	3.437923363769445
Compared to the surrounding synovial layer, the amount of vessels in the tendon substance is greatly reduced.	3.2253587332335445
The distribution of blood vessels within the quadriceps tendon is not homogenous.	3.1074416101995417
The anterior or superficial part of the tendon has a complete vascular network that extends from the musculo-tendinous junction to the patella.	3.2901884072456924
Within the deep portion of the quadriceps tendon there is an oval shaped avascular area which measures app.	3.2369546476341844
30 mm in length and app.	3.5396723649645145
An explanation for the absence of blood vessels may be compressive stress caused by the patellar groove which serves as hypomochlion for the quadriceps tendon when the knee is flexed.	3.5058242747984463

Lesions of the acetabular labrum should be treated by correcting the causes.	3.7937548009366995
In a steep acetabulum where the femoral head brings the acetabular labrum under tension and traction, the acetabulum should be rotated by triple pelvic osteotomy to slightly overcorrected acetabular measurements.	2.965845578502621
Severely diminished acetabular and femoral anteversion can also lead to tears and impingement of the labrum.	3.2208133258426273
Then rotation of the femoral neck and/or rotations of the acetabulum by triple osteotomy to 15-20  ° of anteversion are indicated.	3.9906991241417145
Our triple osteotomy technique differs from that of others mainly in the ischial osteotomy.	3.3037383673800305
It is performed from the posterior approach between the sciatic notch next to the ischial spine and the obturator foramen and is directed 20-30  ° anteriorly from the frontal (coronal) plane.	3.1128534119654367
The osteotomies therefore are placed close enough to the acetabulum to allow free rotation, but they do not interfere with the circulation of the acetabulum, and the ligaments between the sacrum and ischium are left in normal tension.	3.55674970970345
Our normal values of the acetabular position were tested by correlating the measurements with the absence of pain.	3.848109005861495
The optimum is reached with a CE angle and a VCA angle of 30-35  °, an angle of the weight-bearing zone of +5 to -5  ° and a migration index of 10-15 %.	3.4452294103512124
Overcorrections again caused pain and should be avoided.	3.63412724314046
Diminished anteversion of femur and acetabulum towards 0  ° also caused pain and should be corrected by triple and femoral osteotomy to 15-20  ° of anteversion.	3.0136453680514603
Survival rate curves regarding the absence of pain demonstrated that pain was experienced again when joints were corrected insufficiently or overcorrected, while in good corrections the joints were free of pain in about 75 %.	3.248134243886839

Technically, this plastic embedding can be performed at least as rapidly as the classic paraffin embedding after decalcification.	3.7997310495781567
The advantages over the latter method are: (1) the cells can be better differentiated because semi-thin sections can be made; (2) the immunoreactions can also be performed on the basis of semi-thin sections, which means they can be interpreted more easily; (3) morphometric analyses yield more reliable results because of the constant thickness of sections; (4) osteological examination of bone trabeculae, especially the search for mineralisation deficiencies, is possible; (5) the plastic embedding procedure is less dependent on individual instabilities in the quality of performance of the staff members involved.	3.784871471586561

Between 1981 and 1994 at the Bergmannsheil Ruhr University Hospital in Bochum, Germany, we treated 145 patients with femoral diaphyseal nonunions following initial operative treatment.	3.4167988055998673
Of these patients, 138 received this initial operative treatment at an outside institution.	3.179032969279494
The primary reconstructions for the fractures utilized plates in 112 cases, reamed nails in 24 cases and external fixators in 9 cases.	3.051066402699941
The average age of the patients was 35 years and the mean time from the initial operative treatment was 2 years.	4.096694432967477
Twenty-seven patients (19 %) presented with a hypertrophic nonunion and 118 (81 %) with an atrophic nonunion.	3.466635239241329
There was a significant correlation between primary "classic" plating and development of an atrophic nonunion (2-test: P < 0.01).	3.5452892255813437
We observed 34 wound infections (23 %) with no significant correlation to the type of primary osteosynthesis.	4.060567383074088
We determined that 73 of the pseudarthroses were due to improper osteosynthesis techniques.	3.0871178725676143
Of these cases, 41 % involved the use of plates, 83 % involved the use of reamed nails, and 78 % involved the use of external fixators.	3.9703056866680737
Fracture location near the diaphyseal-metaphyseal junctions was common in this problematic group.	2.9576584020597285
Ninety-two percent of all plates led to atrophic nonunions.	2.88643527129365
There were 21 open fractures and of these 90 % (n = 19) developed an atrophic pseudarthrosis and 29 % (n = 6) developed a wound infection.	3.184283454787969
Fifty-seven (39 %) of all patients had additional injuries, but we found that did not increase the risk of disturbed bone healing.	3.884624335024555
Our revision operations focused on the elimination of wound infections, refreshment of bone healing, and improvement in fragment stability.	3.4809434074265186
Only 28 % of all "classic" plates and 11 % of all external fixators were changed to an intramedullary implant at the time of the first revision surgery.	3.4452262068086825
Hypertrophic nonunions required a mean of 1.3 revision operations to achieve bone healing whereas a mean of 2 revision operations were necessary to fuse atrophic bone ends (P < 0.05).	3.2061954077374897

Since lack of fracture healing can often already be observed directly from postoperative X-rays, we recommend that revision procedures be performed early.	3.4396106608900894
The prolonged length of time to care for femoral nonunions underlines the importance of appropriate primary fracture treatment.	3.1608688073894564
That takes into consideration both the biomechanical and the biological aspects of bone healing.	3.475129741861234

Results: Recurrences were diagnosed after R0 resection in a mean time of 13  +/-  6.8 months.	3.6933213589527796
Patients treated with octreotide and tamoxifen had a significantly (P < 0.05) longer median survival time (7 months; range: 3-12) vs 3.5 months; range: 1.5-5).	3.7002067340220144
The octreotide-tamoxifen group suffered less from lack of appetite, nausea, fatigue, and pain and needed fewer analgesies.	3.002773217260582

Design: Prospective, randomised, placebo-controlled study.	3.33254821385116
Patients: Twenty adult patients undergoing elective pulmonary resection.	3.411604312120883
Anaesthesia: General anaesthesia was performed using propofol, fentanyl, N2O and vecuronium.Volume-controlled ventilation was performed to maintain normocapnia over the whole investigation period.	3.6897265427159094
During OLV, the tidal volume was reduced and the respiratory rate was increased to avoid a peak airway pressure exceeding 40 cm H2O.	3.296503149674334
Furthermore the FiO2 was increased to 1,0 and the external PEEP was removed during OLV.	3.748286903278256
Interventions: The patients received either dopexamine at 2 µg/kg/min (group A, n=10) or 0,9% saline as control (group B, n=10) after assessing the baseline values.	4.101247147651338
Measurement and results: The following cardiorespiratory variables were recorded: Heart rate, mean arterial pressure and mean pulmonary arterial pressure.	3.2841943994099605
Cardiac output was measured by thermodilution using a continuous cardiac output thermodilution catheter.	3.452995414422749

Patients characteristics, data from the preoperative lung function testing and surgical procedures did not differ significantly between the groups.	3.9314334978345014

The course of the intrapulmonary right-to-left shunting did not differ between the groups.	3.086516089974759
In the dopexamine-treated group the DO2I increased from 430 +/- 143 ml - min - m-2 (T0) to 652 +/- 255 ml - min - m-2 (T1) and 653 +/- 207 ml - min - m-2 (T2).	2.247274528985946
Regarding the pressure-flow-curves there was no difference during OLV between the two groups indicating no major blocking effect of dopexamine on hypoxic pulmonary vasoconstriction.	3.230795298228089
Conclusion: It is concluded that dopexamine can be used to improve haemodynamics and oxygen delivery during thoracic surgery without increasing venous admixture during one-lung ventilation.	3.1325703145937513

The deformity in severe spondylolisthesis consists of two components: the parallel anterocaudad slip of the spondylolisthetic vertebra, and its tilt into kyphotic malposition.	2.8095525179830343
The influence of the two components is very different: the anterocaudad slippage has not much impact on the sagittal profile of the spine and is easily compensated for by a slight increase in lumbar lordosis.	3.802603733513941
The kyphotic deformity has a high impact on trunk imbalance and the sagittal profile.	3.390354187770727
There are two compensation mechanisms: hyperlordosis of the lumbar spine to its anatomical extremes and - if that is not sufficient - verticalisation of the sacral bone, performed by contracture of the hamstrings and uprighting of the pelvis around the hip joints.	3.0171639051634105
The latter mechanism is followed by functional disadvantages.	3.4328343003362125

Materials and methods: We reviewed a total of 50 [18F]-2-fluordeoxyglucose positron emission tomography (18FDG-PET) investigations performed in 44 patients who had undergone surgical resection of oral cancer.	3.7166299007044636
In 23 cases, re-staging (group A) was indicated due to suspicion of recurrent or secondary tumor manifestation.	3.1696683419913274
In 27 cases, PET served as a screening procedure (group B).	3.0417503512315687
Statistic evaluation included sensitivity, specifity, positive/negative predictive value and accuracy of 18FDG-PET for the detection of tumor manifestation.	3.546145081424025
Results: 18FDG-PET correctly identified 23 of 26 tumor sites (88%) in the re-staging group and 9 of 10 tumor sites (90%) in the screening group.	4.257982348241713

In 5 of these 6 patients, the PET findings for the latter tumor sites determined the patient's fate.	3.643999349307517
Specificity was 63% for local recurrence, 97% for secondary lymph node involvement and 90% for distant metastasis.	3.3642708265415013

There were not any complaints, or the complaints were so much diminished that complete division of the carpal ligament could be viewed as accomplished in 51 of 55 cases.	3.327987659283733
There were continuing complaints in four cases, and after an additional check two patients were operated on again.	4.364094599060749
The advantage of the endoscopic method is the inconspicuous scar and the reduced postoperative disablement.	3.216762637944653
For surgical removal of a malignant choroid melanoma, it is necessary to reduce systolic blood pressure to around 50-60 mmHg in order to prevent choroidal haemorrhages.	4.410350449796256
However, blood pressure reduction is associated with the risk of cerebral ischaemia.	5.042222446803003
We report a patient with a malignant choroid melanoma in whom waves I and II of the brainstem auditory evoked potentials (BAEP) disappeared during surgery under controlled arterial hypotension and hypothermia (31.1 ° C).	2.9357855930657344
The waves could be recorded again immediately after the mean arterial pressure was increased from 48 to 77 mmHg.	3.512419575443148
The oesophageal temperature had dropped by 0.3 ° C at this time.	3.111758325235772
The 2-channel electroencephalogram (EEG) showed no irregularities during this time period.	2.9341865048812004
A bilateral, reversible, apparently blood-pressure-dependent loss of waves I and II during arterial hypotension despite a normal EEG has to our knowledge not been previously described in the literature.	3.1670499230941136
The isolated loss of waves I and II with maintenance of waves III, IV, and V is unusual.	3.125229555754663
The literature contains reports of acoustic neurinoma patients in whom only wave V could be recorded.	3.1767750764291303
This is regarded as an indication of continued impulse conduction despite the loss of waves I to IV.	3.6230754312223503
Others have observed a patient with temporary and reversible loss of BAEP wave I due to vasospasm of the internal auditory artery that apparently occurred during or shortly after manipulation of the internal auditory meatus.	3.31345720759292
Assuming anatomic peculiarities in the blood supply to the generators of the BAEP waves, a stenosis of the basilar artery could be considered as the cause of the bilateral reversible loss of waves I and II.	3.4134095736489214
Another potential source could be the induced hypothermia, but this does not seem very likely because the patient's temperature was 0.3 ° C lower at the return of the waves than at their loss.	3.3890023203314716
In the syndrome arrhythmogenic right ventricular dysplasia cardiomyopathy, little is known to date about the mechanism for the development of arrhythmias.	3.5428541079333833
In a group of 54 patients with documented ventricular tachycardia during longterm ECG recordings, the determinants for the development of VT and the relationship between signal-averaged ECG and the morphological characteristics of the disease are investigated.	3.9649163813898824
The analysis of the long-term electrocardiographic data includes the measurement of RR-intervals 30, 15, 5, 1min and immediately before onset of the VT, the determination of the morphology of the previous ventricular premature beats, and the frequency of the atrial arrhythmias.	4.2649000738781115
Normal values for the analysis of late potentials in the ECG signal accquisition with bidirectional filters between 40 and 300Hz were defined a maximum of 113ms for a QRS width, LAS of 38ms, and RMS40 of 16uV.	3.300233887118355
The analysis of the long-term ECG produced monomorphic VT in all cases without previous atrial arrhythmia and in only 4 cases with previous polymorphic ventricular premature beats.	3.4956854900788494
A long-short phenomenon could only be proven in 4VT episodes.	3.2433222601128646
In 84% of all tachycardias, no arrhythmia were found immediately before onset of the arrhythmic event.	3.106582965044128
According to the circadian clock, two peaks, mornings between 6 and 9h and evenings between 6 and 9h, could be determined.	2.8011777788302217
In patients, who were recently diagnosed with ARVD, a significant shortening of the RR intervals before the onset of VT as an indication of an acceleration of the sinus rhythm was observed.	3.8426747526167246
This effect could not be observed in patients with a past medical history of AVRD.	5.291333629885472
Late potentials were determined with a prevalence of 74% overall.	3.78720898061794
Increasingly, late potentials were observed with morphologically diffuse forms of the ARVD.	3.8522685707952102
A correlation to the severity of spontaneous arrhythmias (ventricular, sustained or not sustained VT) could not be established.	3.5430561928165925
In comparison to the origin of VT in coronary heart disease, previous arrhythmias play a less important role in arrhymogenic right ventricular dysplasia cardiomyopathy.	3.4504436673240653
Most importantly, an intensified sympathetic tone before onset of VT and an increased prevalence of positive late potentials are observed.	3.4110298201518283

A  local infection of the stump was treated successfully with two  endoscopic debridements and lavage.	3.6379951155613943

If physiotherapy and neurosurgical procedures such as nerve repair do not have the desired outcome, muscle transfer operations are possible.	3.4041333098975923
The results of our favored transfer of the trapezius muscle to compensate paralysis of the deltoid muscle will be presented.	3.1663730564907726
Preoperatively radiological, clinical and electromyographic examinations are necessary.	3.6594941092004736
Our results are based upon the clinical and radiological check ups and the subjective assessment of the patients.	4.388366796465995
Thirty-one patients (7 female, 24 male) underwent a trapezius transfer between March 1994 and December 1996.	3.119685254784522
The average age was 29 years (range 18-46 years).	3.0852167461262536
We performed the operations using a modification of Saha's technique.	3.1012974418853303
With the patient in lateral decubitus position and protection of the opposite plexus, a sagital skin incision is the first step, followed by the preparation of trapezius and deltoid muscle as well as the bony parts of the shoulder (acromion, clavicle, scapular spine).	3.847252448713358
The deltoid origin is cut from the lateral third of the clavicle, the acromion and the lateral half of the scapular spine.	3.567642045796103
The next step is transection of the root of the acromion and the lateral clavicle.	3.0193396215637773
After elevation of the remaining trapezius insertions from the clavicle and scapular spine, the proximal humerus is exposured by splitting the partly detached deltoid muscle longitudinally.	2.9966381753771496
Then the acromion fragment and humerus are prepared for the bone-to-bone contact.	3.854890239402692
In 90  ° of abduction the acromion fragment with its trapezius insertion is transferred and fixed to the humerus with two 4.5-mm screws.	2.9058107699442437
Finally the deltoid is sutured on the top of the trapezius and the skin is closed over two suction drains.	3.256728506088096
Postoperatively we immobilize the operated arm in an abduction support for 6 weeks.	3.2829696556663746
The physiotherapy program starts on the first postoperative day with active training of elbow, hand and fingers and electrostimulation of the transferred trapezius muscle.	2.926694227339404
Six weeks after the procedure we take an X-ray and start with progressive adduction of the arm.	3.395335774905751
The preoperative subluxation of the humeral head was abolished in all cases.	3.3031075267281476
We achieved an average increase of active abduction from 7.3  ° (range 0-45  °) preoperatively to 39.2  ° (range 25  °-80  °) 1 year after the operation; the increase of forward flexion was from 20  ° (range 0  °-85  °) to 43  ° (range 20  °-90  °).	3.4504858440226074
All patients were satisfied with the improvement of stability and function of the operated shoulder.	3.952389054889043
Finally we can conclude that the trapezius transfer for flail shoulder gives a satisfactory outcome regarding shoulder function and stability as well as the subjective situation of the patients.	3.6438062956970505
We analyzed psychiatric and criminological data from 103 arsonists.	2.9735460532034286
The following criticisms of the definition of pyromania according to DSM-III-R and IDC-10 seem appropriate.	2.964995577361448
First, the categoric exclusion of aggressive motives does not seem very promising, since approximately one fourth of arsonists whose firesetting is based on motives quoted in DSM-III-R may also have an aggressive motive.	2.9403183928177903
Second, ICD-10 gives being drunk and alcoholism as a criterion for the exclusion of pyromania.	3.164792392184669
This seems untenable, since the behavior classed as pyromania is largely a product of alcohol misuse.	3.0076222698640063
Repeated firesetting, resulting from being fascinated by fire etc., may be less a disturbance of impulse control but rather the manifestation of a psychoinfantilism, which, supported by alcohol abuse, extends into older age.	3.3440606771013055
The mean age of such arsonists is slightly above 20 years.	3.072357530578063
The tendency for relapses after imprisonment seems to be low; this tendency probably decreases spontaneously in older age.	2.9614056699633706
The mean age of arsonists with aggressive motives is a little below 30 years, those setting fire with suicidal motives have a mean age of 35, deluded arsonists have a mean age of 40 years.	3.1785160544763995
Concrete sexual motives are relatively rare.	3.4866119188975393
Approximately 50 % of arsonists have a purely aggressive motive.	3.234453785148599
Retaliation is a rare cause, however, since most of them do not even know the victims.	4.6258362652336515
One third of these persons set the fire in their own homes.	2.963210061582462
Most arsonists show a personality disorder, with insecurity and narcissism predominating.	3.1787498824575384
Data on firesetting are to be treated with caution, since two thirds of all cases are newer resolved; one fourth of cases concern minors, and in Central Europe arsonists with rational motives are hardly ever referred to psychiatrists.	3.6720232049013672
A normal ciliary beat frequency of ciliated cells is necessary for the mucociliary clearance of the nose and paranasal sinuses.	3.0326836613026273
An in vitro investigation was performed to eval-uate the influence of topical corticosteroids and antihistamines on the ciliary beat frequency of human nasal mucosa.	3.4889614387906
The nasal sprays examined contained the corticosteroids budesonide or fluticasone propionate and the topical antihistamines azelastine or levocabastine.	2.663748983569306
All tests were performed on cell cultures of human nasal mucosa during constant conditions.	3.55548761967022
Three of the four nasal sprays tested contained benzalkonium chloride as preservative.	2.9310318460900926
An irreversible cessation of ciliary movement was observed in all cells exposed to nasal sprays containing benzalkonium chloride in a 50 per cent solution.	3.405973544110841
The nasal spray containing budesonide was benzalkonium chloride-free and caused minor but fully reversible decreases in ciliary beat frequency after 20 min.	2.9314012054378575
As benzalkonium chloride can cause complete standstill of ciliary beat frequency in vitro in human nasal mucosa, we recommend that this preservative should not be used anymore in topical nasal medications.	3.1988516972085383

The usual method of surgery for this is to lift the bladder neck towards cranial and ventral.	3.457837806353985

It is well known that alterations to the oral cavity caused by dental prostheses may affect speech articulation, although influences on the voice are not assumed.	3.0649843944265602
In addition to the vocal fundamental frequency, vibrations of the vocal chords generate overtones.	2.8798476771792996
Through the shape of the larynx and the upper airway, resonances and antiresonances are formed, and in this way overtones are amplified to a variable extent.	3.7735250893335763
Nozzle changes caused by a dental prosthesis in the oral cavity may possibly influence overtones but influences on the vocal fundamental frequency seem unlikely.	3.640040257465807
The influence of dental prostheses on the voice is demonstrated in a patient who owned two different dental prostheses.	3.6960019501153707
The fundamental frequency rose by up to five semitones during speech and his vocal range increased by up to four semitones when a thin denture was used instead of a normal denture.	3.050622785492882
When the position of the mandible was checked by intraoral needle point placement, a more rostral position of the mandible was recorded with the thin denture than with the normal denture.	3.492118366890374
Sagittal magnetic resonance tomography imaging also showed that the larynx was in a more cranial position.	3.9100402900801634
This change was presumed to be due to an upward movement of the larynx induced by the tongue, which itself was found to be in a more cranial position with the thin denture.	4.000932723185886
In this situation, increased tension of the laryngeal muscles were believed to induce a rise in fundamental frequency, shifting the voice range toward higher frequencies.	3.138940587440197
These findings show that dental prostheses can cause vocal changes in individual cases.	2.8764436123796897
The etiology of this occurrence is still not clear.	3.1035436716482363
Its consequences, however, should be known to the dentist, ENT surgeon and phoniatrist if patients notice changes in their voice after having altered or replaced their dentures.	3.247801068112016

This may simulate tumor areas, resulting in false assessment of the resection or resection of non-tumorous areas.	4.04114700966458

The basic is a systemic view of illness and health.	3.120423109905093

In the ancient times, Aristotle, Herophilos, and Galen discovered basic anatomical structures.	2.7551215282134045
Paul von Aegina, in the seventh century a. c., had the idea of a nerve suture, which was first performed in an animal 1000 years later by the Italian surgeon Gabriele Ferrara.	3.719230347387766
Systematic investigations on nerve crossing date to the beginning of the nineteenth century and were conducted by Jean Pierre Flourens.	3.038852883250148
Within 1 week in summer 1864, two French surgeons (Laugier and Nélaton) independently carried out the first nerve sutures in humans.	2.6999959237085163

Methods: The diagnosis of fibromyalgia was made according to the American College of Rheumatology criteria.	3.524784263177712
Urine and serum were collected under standardized conditions from 39 patients and 55 age- and sex-matched controls.	3.1446160351552375
Pyridinoline (Pyd) and deoxypyridinoline (Dpyd), which represent products of lysyl oxidase-mediated cross-linking in collagen and are indicators of connective tissue and bone degradation, respectively, were analyzed by ion-paired and gradient HPLC method with fluorescence detection (HPLC).	3.186690169931525
Levels of hydroxypyroline (Hyp), a collagen turnover marker, were also measured.	3.4666487271102406
The findings were related to creatinine levels and the Pyd/Dpyd ratio determined.	3.159543996522711
The Pyd/Dpyd ratios in the urine and serum and the Hyp in the urine were significantly lower in patients with fibromyalgia than in healthy controls.	3.6830262402650655
Conclusion: Decreased levels of collagen cross-linking may contribute to remodeling of the extracellular matrix and collagen deposition around the nerve fibers in fibromyalgia and contribute to the lower pain threshold at the tender points.	3.1963418448420375

We therefore tested whether minimal tracer washout (10-25%) in the presence of normal renal function could justity a non-operative managment.	4.362437164595709
The lateral decubitus position is the standard position for nephrectomies.	3.815597889496743
There is a lack of data about the effects of this extreme position upon respiratory mechanics and gas exchange.	3.0618003189597
In 20 patients undergoing surgery in the nephrectomy position, we compared a new closed-loop-controlled ventilation algorithm, adaptive lung ventilation (ALV), which adapts the breathing pattern automatically, to the respiratory mechanics with conventionally controlled mandatory ventilation (CMV).	3.804050688542378
The aims of our study were (1) to describe positioning effects on respiratory mechanics and gas exchange, (2) to compary ventilatory parameters selected by the ALV controller with traditional settings of CMV, and (3) to assess the individual adaptation of the ventilatory parameters by the ALV controller.	3.4673908391841683
The respirator used was a modified Amadeus ventilator, which is controlled by an external computer and possesses an integrated lung function analyzer.	3.563666614514233
In a first set of measurements, we compared parameters of respiratory mechanics and gas exchange in the horizontal supine position and 20 min after changing to the nephrectomy position.	3.3358564558931856
In a second set of measurements, patients were ventilated with ALV and CMV using a randomized crossover design.	2.999091586611
The CMV settings were a tidal volume of 10 ml/kg body weight, a respiratory rate of 10 breaths/min, an I:E ratio of 1:1.5, and an end-inspiratory pause of 30% of inspiratory time.	3.6292559714057324
With both ventilation modes FiO2 was set to 0.5 and PEEP to 3 cm H2O.	3.1604602507822284
During ALV a desired alveolar ventilation of 70 ml/kg KG - min was preset.	3.2890090258294418
All other ventilatory parameters were determined by the ALV controller according to the instantaneously measured respiratory parameters.	3.991527102049182
Positioning induced a reduction of compliance from 61.6 to 47.9 ml/cm H2O; the respiratory time constant shortened from 1.2 to 1.08 s, whereas physiological dead space increased from 158.9 to 207.5 ml.	2.88337467978304
On average, the ventilatory parameters selected by the ALV controller resembled very closely those used with CMV.	2.7536776541401395
However, an adaptation to individual respiratory mechanics was clearly evident with ALV.	2.875517237864998
In conclusion, we found that the effects of positioning for nephrectomy are minor and may give rise to problems only in patients with restrictive lung disease.	4.138514581521928
The novel ALV controller automatically selects ventilatory parameters that are clinically sound and are better adapted to the respiratory mechanics of ventilated patients than the standardized settings of CMV are.	3.0353086835601037

The defects are usually unilateral.	3.4362488755753766

The role of hip sonography in neonatal hip screening is still a controversial matter.	3.278187770963831
This paper reports the results of the Austrian ultrasound hip screening program, in which all Austrian babies undergo hip sonography twice: at the birth clinic during the 1st week of life and at an age of 12-16 weeks.	3.6785460444292797
Data from all public health insurance companies since 1985 and all ICD data about children hospitalized because of CDH in Austria were collected and analyzed.	3.014575577136137
The rate of sonographically pathological hips was 6.57 % (1994).	2.7029398502343476
The treatment rate before introduction of hip sonography was 13.16 % (1985).	3.0636527225928387
The rate of open reduction went down to 0.24 per 1000 newborns, including a high number of unscreened children born abroad and also children with teratological dislocation of the hip.	3.135198251427734
Hip sonography screening proved to be effective in detecting true instability of the hip joint as well as dysplasia.	4.718493118789937
The optimal time for sonographic screening does not seem to be immediately after birth when only "high risk" hips (clinical instability, positive family history, breech delivery) should undergo hip sonography, but at an age between 4 and 6 weeks when the hip has already shown its true nature.	3.1561194631615637
Since one sonographic scan appears to be sufficient for screening, a further reduction of costs could be accomplished.	3.7564352968883736

This intention lead some of the following authors to superficiality and a "happy-go-lucky" perspective.	3.504179761087676
Others, most of all European transactional analysts went back to the roots of the original contents and aims and showed that they offer great clinical relevance for the understanding and treatment of a variety of disturbances.	4.0902885561172635
This article will illustrate these aspects, using the borderline syndrome as an example.	3.465534422770944
The structural model of egostates serves to describe the borderline structure, concepts of the frame of reference and the script as patterns for the development and maintenance of the pathology, the concepts of transactions, games, symbioses and passivity as indicators for the stable instability of the relationships, and devaluations and grandiosities as examples of defence patterns.	3.225236877922858
Practical ideas about the therapeutic contract as a basis of various working agreements, about methods of decreasing anxiety in therapeutic processes, and about contact and attachment as a substrate for corrective experiences, a healing atmosphere and dedramatisation of the process follow.	2.950869644174832
The article ends with transactional analytic considerations of transference, counter-transference and how to deal with regression processes.	2.769042105376312

It is characterised by a uniformity of psychic experience in the face of circumstances which would otherwise give cause for depressiveness, despair, great anxiety, self-accusations or aggression directed against others.	3.008879494834351
Early diagnosis and specific therapy may decisively improve life-quality of the patients and may also prevent detrimental individual and social long-term consequences.	4.587993673509852

In Europe, saprophytic pulmonary aspergillosis represents the only mycotic infection relevant for thoracic surgery.	2.7195499120404194
From the pathogenetic point of view, it is a colonization of preexisting lung or pleural cavities following other severe pulmonary diseases.	3.1695318705170266
The incidence amounts to 0.4% among patients in a special hospital for pulmonary diseases.	3.4090106448163637
Concerning this review, the diagnosis is based on histologic examination for all 66 patients we operated on between 1961 and 1996.	4.066458709365645
Preoperative proof of the fungal infection remains difficult.	3.2098269987246084
The majority of patients (77%) are male.	3.588408474830256
There is a correlation between cigarette smoking and abuse of alcohol on the one hand and the incidence of the disease on the other hand.	3.807503528484019
A higher incidence of saprophytic pulmonary aspergillosis was found for people working in agriculture, in the building trade, and in paper mills.	3.732550171612992
Pulmonary tuberculosis and pneumonia were present in the past history in 47% of the patients.	4.323647328514147
Usually, the tentative diagnosis is based on chest x-ray, especially if hemoptysis is present.	3.948946960134452
Major hemoptysis is the most severe and most dangerous complication caused by aspergilloma.	3.6092473747954057
Clinical presentation and chest x-ray findings are non-characteristic.	3.3121534675355657
Nowadays, the typical x-ray of pulmonary aspergilloma, almost always localized in the upper lobes, became a rare finding.	3.9999540641242963
If an aspergillus infection is suspected, serologic methods are reliable and sensitive.	3.2020429631638794
A surgical procedure is absolutely indicated in patients with major hemoptysis in their history, in case of disease progression or indeterminate mass and in order to avoid fungal dissemination.	4.092891631558128
If a saprophytic aspergillosis is suspected according to radiologic findings, clinical examination, and patient's social history, an operation is justified.	3.432117833775969

The operative mortality rate is 3%.	3.3799940503138077

Introduction: Postoperative delirium is a common psychic disturbance occurring acutely after various surgical procedures and typically presenting with a fluctuating course.	3.510279181347496
These patients' recovery takes longer.	3.1736835736269384
In this study we analyze the incidence of postoperative delirium in patients undergoing vascular surgery and try to identify risk factors for its development.	3.738207768331734
Methods: Patients undergoing elective arterial operations were included.	3.21351158779858
Their medical history, the specific vascular diagnosis and operation performed, the medication and laboratory data were monitored.	3.7377474554912986
Additionally the patients were preoperatively interviewed by a psychiatrist.	3.830389322794335
Intraoperatively the drugs, infusions, possible transfusions, blood gases and pressures were monitored, as were the times of surgery and anesthesia.	3.5294399895284263
Postoperatively patients were seen daily by the psychiatrist and the surgeon for at least 7 days.	3.287756743871495
Postoperative delirium was diagnosed according to DSM IV criteria, and mild, moderate and severe delirium were distinguished.	3.3572854774264296
Results: Fifty-four patients entered the study.	3.304688672516391
Twenty-one (38.9 %) developed postoperative delirium (11 mild, 2 moderate, 8 severe).	2.967502539738128
Patients with aortic operations developed delirium more frequently than those with non-aortic procedures(55.5 vs 22.2 %, n = 27 each).	3.1914120316739174
Some preexisting diseases (hearing disturbance) increased the probability of postoperative delirium, while age was not identified as a risk factor.	3.6093236334138368
General psychopathological and depressive disturbances increased the likelihood of postoperative delirium.	3.303463289375664
Patients who had a severe intraoperative course developed postoperative delirium more frequently.	3.380522169013239
This was not seen in the absolute time of surgery or anesthesia nor in the intraoperative development of blood pressure or intraarterial gases, which did not differ between patients with and without postoperative delirium.	3.6706286742842735
More reliable parameters were an increased intraoperative need for crystalloid volume, intra - or postoperatively decreased hemoglobin values (Hb < 10 g/dl) and the development of acidosis that had to be treated.	4.129283732759255
Patients with delirium had serious complications more often (8/21 = 38.1 % vs 6/33 = 18.2 %) and needed Intensive Care treatment longer (2.7 vs 2.1 days, only aortic surgery 3.2 vs 2.4 days).	2.7630792029340396
Conclusions: Postoperative delirium after vascular surgery is frequent.	3.432501804819871
Patients undergoing aortic surgery, with specific concomittant medical disease, psychopathological disturbances and a severe intraoperative course, are at risk of developing postoperative delirium.	3.293118069737371

From October 1995 to the present the atrial defibrillator was implanted in 179 patients worldwide.	3.402846534006215
The sensitivity of the system and its algorithms to detect atrial fibrillation is 90%; the specifity to detect sinus rhythm is 100%.	3.4621705593486465
In 121 of 179 patients, 748 episodes of spontaneous atrial fibrillation were treated with 2.4 shocks per episode.	3.308243228214376
No proarrhythmic event or stroke was seen.	3.145317545057049

The somatosensory system of preterms and newborns differs substantially from adults.	2.9559981227076153
These differences are of considerable preclinical and clinical interest.	3.3691510388277086
Maturation of A- and C-fibre synaptic connections in the dorsal horn and development of descending inhibition from the brainstem all take place postnatally in the rat.	3.256516019374803
In early stages of development there is no definite spatial sepraration in the dorsal horn between the nociceptive and the non-nociceptive system.	3.4559438956772617
In preterms but not in adults non-noxious stimuli can induce central sensitization.	3.2018056586245427
Many neurotransmitters and signalling molecules involved in pain pathways are expressed early in the developing nervous system but do not reach adult levels for a considerable period.	3.064801744619083
More important, receptors are frequently transiently overexpressed or expressed in areas during development where they are not seen in the adult and may have a different functional profile.	3.4966394566862986
The descending pain inhibitory system that provides an important protection against central sensitization developes later than the ascending nociceptive system.	3.027444753937957
Thus, during a critical period of time the immature nociceptive system is highly vulnerable.	3.494437768443694
For example, neonatal circumcision in the absence of analgesia results in increased pain responses during subsequent routine vaccination months later.	3.010577711955804

Doctors belong to this group of people.	3.6814051661550256
For this reason we questioned medical students, as future key community leaders, with respect to their attitudes toward the mentally ill within the framework of their first contact with psychiatric patients during their studies.	3.0766252161606658
In order to make a direct comparison possible, we interviewed a sample of the Mannheim population who live in a part of the city where a variety of complementary facilities have been set up.	3.504255088903029
The comparison shows that medical students do not have a more positive attitude toward the mentally ill; in fact, in certain areas they have an even more negative attitude toward the mentally ill than the general population has.	3.1894357882222226
We were not able to establish what effect teaching has with respect to changing attitudes.	3.134783475298066

This requires knowledge of normal lymphatic anatomy and metastatic routes.	3.0395901177673443

Life threatening hemorrhage in patients with malignant tumours of the head and neck area are often, as a result of tumour infiltration, postoperative anatomical changes, infection and radiological necrosis, difficult to control.	3.9523623379647885
One option for prophylaxis and treatment is the ligature of the external (ECA) or common carotid artery (CCA) and superior thyroid artery (STA).	3.5177980116581278
52 patients were examined in a retrospective study to determine both the hazards and the therapeutic use of the procedure.	5.372024373949111
The external carotid artery (ECA) was ligated prophylactically during the operative procedure of tumour resection and neck dissection in 25 patients.	3.7130119399924926
In 27 cases closure of the ECA, CCA or ECA and STA was carried out as an emergency procedure for acute hemorrhage following completed primary treatment (operation, primary or postoperative radiation or radiochemotherapy).	3.0239169921284876
There was no postoperative hemorrhage after prophylactic ligature of the ECA.	2.8640274710687086
One patient with multiple cardiovascular diseases suffered from an ipsilateral cerebral infarction 1 year after operation.	3.147592533131219
In 6 of 9 patients and in all 3 patients, in whom ligature of the CCA or ECA and STA respectively was carried out as an emergency procedure, severe neurological complications up to an apallic syndrome occured.	3.3802208863766423
The number of deaths due to acute hemorrhage was considerably smaller among those patients with prophylactic ligature of the ECA performed during operative procedure of tumor resection and neck dissection.	3.125799550507018
In addition there were much less unfavourable courses in the sequence of prophylactic closure of the ECA than observed after ligating the CCA or ECA and STA in an emergency situation.	2.7456510763729605

During the past decade, the molecular mechanisms in the process of tumor progression, including metastasis and angiogenesis, have become better understood.	3.363436329183142
Cancer metastasis consists of multiple, complex interacting steps.	3.4270317134390744
Each of these steps is crucial and limiting, since a failure to complete any one prevents the tumor cell from producing a metastasis.	2.923450650211881
Detachment from the solid tumor by loosening the intercellular junctions and proteolysis of the extracellular matrix enables tumor cells to enter blood- and lymph vessels.	3.1332526850051443
The intravasation into the circulation is supported by the secretion of angiogenic factors, which induce degradation of the basal membran in blood vessels.	3.405200316512574
Adhesion to endothelial cells, extravasation from the circulation, and induction of angiogenesis are further essential steps for completing the metastatic process.	3.1887523910020636
Furthermore, it is well known that once a tumor cell has entered circulation, it will survive only by evasion of the immune system.	3.2461058556391733
The systematic identification of tumor antigens opens up new possibilities for immunotherapeutic approaches.	2.79455528779462

To date, transdermal testosterone systems appear to be best suited for substitution therapy in the ageing male.	2.943246428584179
Future promising developments are testosterone gels and intramuscular testosterone undecanoate.	2.9816550355782834

rules for evaluating the outcome of every patient and (3.)	5.055455236890194

We report a truck driver with severe soft tissue contusion of both legs who developed atypical heparin-induced thrombocytopenia (HIT) after a thrombosis prophylaxis with unfractionated heparin; despite a thrombosis the patient showed a systemic allergic reaction to heparin in combination with elevation of thrombocytes and positive heparin-dependent antibodies.	3.156267600285366
Six days after the initial trauma deep vein thrombosis of the left lower leg was diagnosed and fasciotomy was performed, preventing an imminent compartment syndrome.	4.26178034612792
Another 5 days later the patient developed exanthema of the trunk and upper extremities and urticaria on his face, as well as severe headache.	4.238654801382464
His platelet count increased from 134 000/µl to 258 000/µl.	3.07126985459165
After exclusion of other causes for these symptoms, a reaction to heparin-dependent antibodies (heparin-platelet-factor 4 complex) was demonstrated 2 days later.	3.395111400503306
Thrombosis prophylaxis was changed to hirudin (Refludan) and elevation of thrombocytes to 445 000/µl was noted.	3.1031117480747494
Shortly after rinsing of an intravenous line with less than 50 IE unfractionated heparin at day 36 after trauma the patient developed an anaphylactic shock, which could be managed with cortisone.	3.2747777997341703
We suggest that in HIT the thrombocytopenia may represent only one form of an allergic reaction to heparin.	3.033228523826502
The cause of the thrombembolic event is an antigen-antibody reaction to heparin taking place on the surface of the thrombocyte.	3.4181600593422004
This is similar in all forms of systemic reaction to heparin application, even though the symptoms may vary.	3.719135407801077
As thrombocytopenia may not be the main symptom of a heparin-induced antibody reaction - in our hospital only 5 of 10 patients with HIT - the disease should rather be named "heparin allergy".	3.845503195827813
We suggest a new classification of different pattern of heparin allergy types I-IV.	3.5655677289080523
The new types I and II are similar to HIT types I and II.	3.1318096569216416
Type III is the reaction of antibodies without decrease of thrombocytes, and type IV the reaction of antibodies associated with systemic allergic symptoms.	3.012849488544387

One patient did not want the laparoscopic technique.	3.069880021186861

Postoperative morbidity is low, duration of hospitalisation short, convalescence fast.	3.54210473610387
Thus, good arguments exist for performing reversal of Hartmann's procedures laparoscopically.	3.0930174524355722

Although treatment with clonidine can influence these symptoms, tachypnea still remains the main problem in weaning patients from mechanical ventilation.	3.3182534530405814
Adding sufentanil, an opioid with greater effects on analgesia than on respiratory depression compared with fentanyl, tachypnea can be reduced to normal frequency.	3.3812118483706
In this way weaning management can be managed more easily for the benefit of both, the patient and physician.	3.9008575918736415
In comparison with a group of 50 patients treated with clonidine alone, 72 patients treated with clonidine/sufentanil showed a shorter period from the start of spontaneous ventilation until extubation (4.8 vs 7.6 days) and until discharge from the ICU (7.7 vs 12.4 days).	3.3680776058441

Many agents have been studied that have the therapeutic potential to interfere with cytokines and other pathways which are activated during sepsis.	3.2842768086871605
Drugs having the properties to neutralize lipopolysaccharides have also been considered.	3.331550683412692
So far all the large clinical trials with immunomodulating agents (HA1A, E5, anti TNF antibodies, ILra) have been shown to be of marginal or of no benefit.	3.4554653595531692
In certain trials results were indecisive, or mortality was increased which led to discontinue the studies.	3.0485947945562435

Recently, two new halogenated volatile anaesthetics, sevoflurane and desflurane, have been approved for clinical use in Germany.	3.5670387628803275
Their low solubility in blood is the most important common property, and this represents the most obvious difference from the inhalational anaesthetics currently used.	3.875135885879868
Extensive clinical and experimental evaluations have confirmed the superior pharmacokinetic properties predicted.	3.288519522561407
Both sevoflurane and desflurane provide more rapid emergence from anaesthesia, permit easier titration of the anaesthetic dose during maintenance and offer more rapid recovery from anaesthesia.	2.957426062390022
For sevoflurane, there are additional advantages: a pleasant odor, negligible airway irritation, and excellent pharmacodynamic characteristics that even provide cardiovascular stability comparable to isoflurane.	3.113594800243682
A certain disadvantage and source of potential nephrotoxicity result from the metabolism of sevoflurane (2-5%) to anorganic fluoride and degradation to compound A in carbon dioxide absorbents.	3.204515922269642
The extensive clinical data reported to date have revealed no evidence that sevoflurane has adverse renal effects.	3.663143139093646
New insight into the pathomechanism of nephrotoxicity associated with either production of fluoride or compound A may well support clinical experience.	2.9888385981970598
Desflurane strongly resists in vivo metabolism and because of this it appears to be devoid of toxicity.	3.50129886606334
Nevertheless, potential side-effects may result from degradation in dry absorbents and subsequent release of CO, from its extreme pungency and irritating airway effects.	3.086969347933326
Thus, desflurane is not recommended for induction of anaesthesia, especially in children.	4.384425125569202
The tendency for desflurane transiently to stimulate sympathetic activity, especially at concentrations above 1.0 MAC, limits its application in patients with cardiac disease.	3.6112517847705816
The doctor in charge, who is generally the medical director, is liable if patients suffer harm through organizational faults within his or her department.	3.000511425364893
Even the suspicion that an error has arisen as the result of defective organization is enough for the person responsible - that is to say the medical director - to be liable.	3.192862470691451
For this reason, the doctor in charge must be in a position to recognize structural defects in organization and to correct these by means of staff training.	3.2533914237507457
Every training measure must guarantee specialist standards; this means that the work of doctors with no specialist training and those still in training and working under supervision is guaranteed to be of the same standard and performed with the same degree of meticulous care as that of a qualified specialist.	3.663486926030294
A legally valid consent from the patient and documentation of the patient information must be accessible at all times.	4.149427624014863
Operations carried out by doctors in training must be supervised by a qualified specialist; otherwise the doctor in charge is guilty of a defect in organization.	3.1137379768363482
Because of staff shortages it often happens that inexperienced beginners - often doctors doing their practical training - are on call very early on.	2.7241730674869653
In the high-risk specialty of obstetrics it is particularly important that doctors still undergoing practical training can call on an experienced colleague for help at all times.	3.2203731126326676
The changeover from day duty to emergency duty must be organized by the doctor in charge in such a way that the medical staff are rested and that adequate free time is guaranteed.	3.096312093985105
Each sector must know its own area of responsibility.	3.1288515172346525
The doctor in charge is resonsible for seeing that his or her staff members are familiar with the use of the medical equipment.	3.2706099043766765

In comparison the recurrence rate and the rate of metatasis of the remaining common 91.8% SCC's (n=550) was low: 2.6% and 3.8%, respectively.	3.3480124388497123
The DSCC is best treated with micrographic surgery and wider safety margins than any other type and should be followed up very frequently.	3.4893623157228304
In the final stage of amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS) the majority of patients develop chronic respiratory failure due to respiratory muscle weakness.	3.1776832245869087
The interaction between the patient with ALS and the physician should be characterized by continuous communication, especially with respect to the prospect of ventilatory failure and for support.	3.9899128690333123
The patient and his family must be informed thoroughly about the natural history and the prognosis of ALS, depending on the individual disease process.	3.791709288499743

However, while the basic principles of spiral CT still apply, we are now challenged to rethink our strategies in planning a CT study to take full advantage of the increased capabilities of MDCT.	3.475209212165845
Extracorporeal photophoresis (ECP), a therapeutic modality that has been under investigation for some years, is based on separation of a leucocyte/lymphocyte-enriched cell fraction from the peripheral blood, extracorporeal treatment of the cells with 8-MOP/UVA and subsequent reinfusion of the cells in the patient.	3.95289449305961
Its main effects seem to consist in changes to the immunologic behaviour of the photoinactivated/modulated cells.	3.045364843355658
The immune response of the host is obviously stimulated by this treatment.	3.5024961827024383
The treatment is well tolerated and causes few side effects.	3.1693537550697455
In our department, 1210 ECP treatments were administered to 41 patients between 1990 and 1994 and a preliminary evaluation was performed.	3.0822970792528253
These patients included 21 with cutaneous T-cell lymphoma (CTCL), 10 with progressive systemic scleroderma, 4 with chronic graft-versus-host disease and 1 each with pemphigus vulgaris, epidermolysis bullosa acquisita, lupus erythematosus and cutaneous mucinosis.	2.7522413234218477
Patients with erythroderma and preserved immunocompetence achieved the best responses of all patients with CTCL.	3.6951507507071493
A treatment combining ECP with rlFN-, PUVA and/or radiation was also successful in patients with tumour-stage CTCL and lymph node involvement.	3.7197822886076954
Progressive systemic scleroderma responded in more than 50% of our cases.	3.4869274510713666
Treatment results were impressive in 4 patients with chronic graft-versus-host disease presenting with sclerodermatous and lichenoid changes of the skin and mucous membranes.	3.6413410168909284
A clear improvement was also observed in the patient with pemphigus vulgaris refractory to standard therapies and in another patient with scleromyxoedema (Arndt-Gottron syndrome).	3.642036180880467
The effectiveness of ECP seems to be quite well established in CTCL, but remains to be examined in autoimmune dermatoses.	3.581078558747717
ECP is an attractive addition to the dermatological therapies available but our experience is still preliminary.	3.6891701327189677

In addition, an increased proliferation and repair activity is observed after UV exposure.	3.158916265289754

Between 1 January 1992 and 31 December 1997 a total of 604 operations at the ACL were performed in the traumatology department of Nuremberg hospital.	3.7645775825133576

Myocardial ischemia results in myocardial dysfunction.	3.5402742214887084
Recovery may be delayed ("stunning"), or persistent if perfusion remains reduced ("hibernation") and ischemia may go on to necrosis, thus, contributing to chronic heart failure.	3.069834886593715
In addition, myocardium not directly affected by ischemia may undergo adaptive processes like hypertrophy and dilatation, which may result in chronic left heart failure.	3.239926295455512
This process is characterized by hemodynamic, neurohumoral, and progressive morphologic changes of the heart which are closely interrelated.	3.83127048122381
Hemodynamic changes basically consist of an increase in left ventricular filling pressure and a decrease in global ejection fraction, and, in most cases years after myocardial infarction, in an increase in systemic vascular resistance and right atrial pressure.	4.644425099956342
Neurohumoral changes consist of an increase in plasma catecholamines, atrial natriuretic factor and vasopressin, and in an activation of the renin-angiotensin-system.	3.651040049507818
Plasma endothelin-1 was recently reported to be increased in patients with heart failure, and prognosis was related to endothelin levels.	4.4488385618759905
Diminished response of vessels to endothelium (EDRF/NO) dependent vasodilatation suggests impairment of vascular endothelium in heart failure.	3.0206491901160484
Local changes of cardiac neurohumoral systems could contribute to structural changes of the heart, e.g., systemic activation to hemodynamic changes.	3.5787517369857174
Structural changes of the heart are characterized by an increase in volume and thickness of surviving myocardium and an expansion of ischemic and necrotic myocardium.	3.955438184246791
Molecular control of these processes which include various cell types, such as cardiomyocytes and cardiofibroblasts, are currently an issue of intense research and could result in specific therapeutic importance.	3.3648111874709867

A total of 261 decrees concerning suspected malpractice after postoperative infection in the locomotor system were retrospectively evaluated.	2.802823506978518
Of these, 43.7 % claims were successful.	2.842156440840315
The most frequent type of negligence was late diagnosis (34.2 %), followed by inconsistant treatment (27.2 %) and insufficient surgical revision (5.3 %).	2.958070225647459
In 33.3 %, combined types of negligence were found.	3.208162385241029
Most frequently, negligence was suspected after infection following hand surgery and internal fixation of long bones.	3.460984262447214
The highest success rate of claims was seen after puncture of joints (69.2 %).	3.1851661945628473
Insufficient documentation was confirmed in 15.3 %.	3.464455180846655
The majority of negligence resulted from diagnostic and therapeutic doubts, which could be avoided, e. g., by a clear definition of infection, consultation of a second opinion, a 2nd-look operation, undelayed and radical surgical revision, painstaking follow-up and disciplined documentation.	3.647810489034334
Abstract   Patient satisfaction plays an increasing part in the analysis of the outcome of medical treatment.	5.053333002698923
The aim of the study was to compare health-related quality of life in patients with abdominal aortic aneurysm after endovascular or conventional surgery.	3.5617921442281486
A total of 40 patients were included (20 treated by endovascular and 20 by conventional surgery).	3.012160391991522
A questionnaire with 28 items similar to the SF-36 was answered during scheduled appointments.	2.9908979729517866
On the third postoperative day, the conventionally treated patients were more frequently confined to bed (80% vs. 32%) and complained of intervention-related pain (90% vs. 42%) and incisional pain (26% vs. 15%); 55% of the patients suffered from obstipation (vs. 5% of the endovascular group).	3.236724662692863
Furthermore, the preoperative psychological stress seemed to be intensified.	3.1386446157485026
In comparable percentage, both the endovascular and conventionally treated patients were limited in social activities perioperatively.	3.135359883109427
In addition, the conventionally treated patients were more limited in their physical activities (25% vs. 40%) and had more fear of ambulation (35% vs. 6%).	2.763107692232273
The patients treated by an endovascular approach complained about frequent examinations (39% vs. 5%) that were often related to X-ray exposure (67% vs. 20%).	3.3497520439118795
All of the conventionally operated patients had a sense of improvement (vs. 89% of the endovascular group); nevertheless only 28% felt completely healthy, compared to 11% of the endovascular treated patients.	3.2391419553727325
Advantages of the endovascular treated patients were "short hospital stay", "decreased pain", "smaller scars", and a "shorter confinement to bed".	3.6889096270190587
After intervention the conventionally treated patients were more limited in almost all quality-of-life aspects.	3.110769364666951
After 3 months, differences between the groups decreased except for sexual dysfunction and limited physical activities.	3.348980937017867
The patients treated by endovascular surgery complained more about frequent X-ray examinations than the conventionally treated group.	3.4608579359580083

However, about 20% of the patients require prolonged mechanical ventilation.	3.8459012900067076

Furthermore, beside compromised respiratory mechanics other causes of difficult weaning are, e.g., left heart failure, inadequate sedation, neuropsychiatric issues, malnutrition and aspiration.	3.1294983991728245

Several historical reports focusing on the heredity of migraine, as well as recent studies on its epidemiology and molecular biology, have revealed evidence for a decisive role of genetic factors in the aetiopathogenesis of familial migraine.	3.7381865912711874
Indeed, family studies, segregation analyses and twin studies have shown that genetic factors play an important role in disposition towards migraine but could not explain the entire aetiopathogenesis.	3.1419434415852074
The influence of extragenetic factors, however, remains mostly unknown.	3.534977707676833
Recent linkage analyses have provided evidence for genetic heterogeneity.	3.363856021689367
A locus for Familial Hemiplegic Migraine (FHM), the only known type of migraine that follows autosomal-dominant transmission, has been linked to chromosome 19p13 but genetic heterogeneity has also been shown, i. e. different types of migraine could be excluded from this locus.	3.647640357940037
Further investigations should concentrate on identifying the FHM gene on chromosome 19p13, on linkage analyses with markers for different susceptibility genes, and on genomic analyses of highly informative pedigrees.	3.015530675764847
This would lead to further clues to the pathogenesis underlying migraine and, thus, to therapeutic developments.	3.66118817420525

The von Willebrand's Disease affects about 1-3 % of the population and it is undiagnosed in most people.	3.7875247397181577
Originally described by the Finish physician Erik von Willebrand in 1926 this disorder is associated with mucous membran bleeding including epistaxis, hypermenorhoea and excessive bleeding from surgery and dental procedures.	3.046949891452456
In von Willebrands disease the patients have a quantitative or qualitative abnormality in the von Willebrand Factor (vWF) which has two major functions: it serves by bridging between platelets and injury site in the blood vessel wall, and it circulates as a complex with factor VIII, protecting it from rapid degradation.	3.2009799991044967
More than 20 different types and subtypes of vWD have been described but almost all patients can be classified as having 1 of the 2 most common types of vWD.	4.025343331708787
About 70 % of patients have type 1 and about 10-20 % present themself with type 2A and 2B vWD type 3 in about 10 %.	3.263005082729664
By taking a clinical history of bleeding it is important to think about vWD and to make the appropriate diagnosis.	3.8060044957757513
If the vWD is suspected diagnostic tests should include an activated partial thromboplastin time, bleeding time, factor VIII:C, Ristocetin cofactor, and vWF antigen.	2.7883003851239057
Additional testing of ristocetin induced plattlet adhesion (RIPA), the multimeric structure and collagen binding test and gen-analysis allow diagnosing the different types of v. Willebrand Disease.	3.1330134574844295
The treatment of choice in mild forms is the synthetic agent desmopressin.	3.167539500857446
In patients with severe type 1, type 2B, 2N and type 3 or in people who do not response to desmopressin, the appropriate treatment is a factor VIII concentrate that is rich of vWF.	3.217703949874508
Until now no recommendations in the orthopaedic literature have been found regarding diagnosis and treatment of vWS patients.	3.4887265637745437
Based on the experience with 43 orthopaedic patients presenting vWD over the last 15 years a contemporary guideline for the successful perioperative management of vWD in orthopaedic surgery is presented.	3.05081751908366
Patients with a prior myocardial infarction (MI) have a high risk of perioperative reinfarction compared with the normal population (5%-8% vs. 0.1%-0.7%) [10].	3.8081852321263687
According to Rao [13], a reduction of this risk is possible when patients are monitored invasively and all haemodynamic parameters are kept within the physiological range.	3.3089411026890128

These autoantibodies are thought to play an important role in the blister formation of CP.	3.2303577719687304
Most patients show binding to the bullous pemphigoid antigen 2 (BPag2), collagen type XVII, with a molecularweight of 180 kD.	3.2516434985826046

The described molecules are part of the hemidesmosomal adhesion complex.	3.665281153716964

Those such as Aceclofenac, Tenidap and Tolmetin which can stimulate matrix synthesis 2.	2.8619710085985557
Those such as Piroxicam, Tiaprofenic Acid and Aspirin which appear to be without significant effect on matrix synthesis and, 3.	3.093495709019768
Those like Naproxen, Ibuprofen, Indomethacin, Nimezulide which significantly inhibit matrix synthesis.	2.746666378081405

During the last few decades, traumatic injuries of the hip joint have significantly increased in number, and traffic accidents have also increased.	3.46567520375877
Depending on the speed, direction of the forces and the position of the femur at the moment of impact, different patterns of injury occur.	3.4367142694672577
Basically, they are classified as hip dislocations, dislocation fractures and acetabular fractures.	3.3614881102893586
These injuries have in common a high rate of concomitant lesions.	3.5257456783207712
Several classification systems have been developed for these injuries.	4.406876339766732
Commonly, Stewart and Milford's or Levin's classification is used for dislocations and dislocation fractures.	3.139649932562882
For acetabular fractures, Judet and Letournel's classification and its newer version developed by Helfet (AO classification) are generally accepted.	3.257459810526769
Fractures of the femoral head, though included in these classifications, are typically described by separate classifications like the one presented in 1957 by Pipkin.	3.1470112042911884
The multitude of injuries occuring in the hip joint requires vast knowledge of various operative approaches.	3.3513145479931423
No single approach exists that would permit the treatment of all injuries in an ideal fashion.	3.9082666861182505
The choice of the best approach for an individual patient depends on the type of injury and also on patient variables like age, preexisting disease, and concomitant injuries.	3.8411222304998773
The decision is further influenced by the timing of surgery, the kind of fracture stabilization intended and by complications typically seen with certain approaches.	3.532378449240931
The indication for extended procedures is only seen in patients with complex injury patterns involving both the anterior and the posterior column or in delayed cases undergoing surgery more than 3 weeks after trauma.	3.6751213422860163
Extended approaches permit excellent visualization of the fracture, but the extent of the soft tissue trauma is reflected in a high rate of postoperative complications.	5.472512056480815
After a phase in which extended procedures were favored, recently a trend towards more limited approaches can be recognized because of their lower complication rate.	2.9675120345166497
This is facilitated by modern fracture-reduction methods using indirect techniques.	2.922876000287888
