Nearly total remission of the tumor resulted; however, a few residual neoplastic islands partly infiltrating the nipple-areola complex could be detected by photodynamic diagnosis (PDD).	3.4522546282196025
These fluorescent areas were marked, excised, and the defect was closed by a rotation advancement flap.	3.8081744717324733
Total excision of the tumor was verified histologically.	5.1573253679647735
By combining PDT and surgery, this large tumor was treated with excellent cosmetic results.	3.3063846721418644
This case demonstrates the efficiency of topical PDT with adjunctive plastic surgery controlled by PDD even in large tumors.	3.1354788856636064
Ninety out of 189 patients (47,6%) with a histologically confirmed diagnosis of malignant melanoma who noted morphological changes in a pigmented lesion reported the mole had been present at least 10 years.	3.7468452338160594
20,7% stated it was present since birth.	3.419309341566233
156 out of 189 patients (82,5%) noticed changes in the lesion over the time.	3.9211124731168145
Growth, discolouration and elevation were the most frequent changes but no significant early sign of disease was found.	3.7106217400819217
Bleeding and crusting were found with tumor thickness >1,5 mm and thus be signs of an advanced stage.	3.599142876181898
Almost 6 months passed until half of the patients visited a physician, either because of changes in the mole or in the lesion was detected during other medical examinations.	4.142378015398525
In the second period of the survey from 1993 to 1995 the physician was frequently consulted earlier.	2.891859786203641
The main reasons for the delay between identification by the patient and seeking medical cedure were lack of symptoms and the notion that the lesion was harmless.	3.585952570951809
Only 72 out of 189 patients (38,1%) visited the physician on their own initiative.	3.334355030131109
The primary evaluation of the "pigmental lesion" was done by a primary care physician in 57%, by a dermatologist in 32% and by others in 11% of our cases.	3.639930464867055
A diagnosis of a non-melanoma was made and no further steps were initiated by 27% of the primary care physicians and 22,7% of the surgeons, gynecologists or internists.	3.932448970848825
Only 5% of the dermatologists misdiagnosed the lesions.	3.69209148979735
In the second trial period from 1993 to 1995 in all physician groups the rate of misdiagnosis increased due to changes in heathcare services in the context of privatisation in our health care system in East Germany.	3.148416140279161
Whereas 83,2% of the patients first evaluated by dermatologists had a surgical removal of the mole within the first 2 months after consultation, the proportion for those diagnosed by non-dermatologists was only 58,5%.	4.038191306276515
The rate of primary treatment by surgeons, often with a small safety margin, also increased.	3.2614348454122633

The goal of this prospective, randomised and double-blind pilot-study was to investigate the analgesic potency and the side-effects of tramadol enantiomers in clinical practice.	3.4203277130113037
One hundred patients recovering from orthopaedic surgery with a postoperative pain intensity of more than 50 on a visual analogue scale 0-100 mm (Table 1) were recruited for the study.	3.832525435649068
They were treated in a randomised, double-blind way with a maximal dose of 150 mg i.v.	3.101147272821718
(+)-, (-)-tramadol, racemate, or 15 mg i.v.	2.6939328152368014
morphine or saline in the placebo group (5 groups, 20 patients each).	3.7107527021215887
The primary criterium of efficacy was the number of responders defined as patients with a pain reduction of at least 20 on VAS after 40 min.	3.982238490513573
In case of pain, responders were allowed to continue with the double-blind drug up to six hours.	3.5242589444868444
The non-responders were treated with morphine as the rescue analgesic.	3.5165197171114326
The secondary criterium was the incidence and severity of side-effects.	3.9480813346651304
Six patients terminated the study prematurely.	3.1560325219504026
One patient was excluded because of an allergic reaction to morphine, one patient could not be treated sufficiently with morphine, four were excluded because of protocol violations.	3.4935701364544522
There were 8 responders in the (+)-tramadol-, 6 in the (-)-tramadol- and 6 in the racemate group, 16* (P<0,05) in the morphine group, and 5 in the placebo group.	3.5733543612820737
Pain intensity after 40 min was reduced by 20 (p<0,05), 17 (p<0,05), 17 (p<0,05), 36 (p<0,01 vs placebo, p<0,05 vs (+)-, (-)-tramadol, and racemate group) and 5 mm on the VAS in the (+)-, (-)-, (+/-)-tramadol-, morphine- and placebo-group, respectively.	2.8683244255541163
Thirty eight adverse events like nausea, vomiting, PCO2-increase, and urinary retention occurred in 20 patients, most frequently in the (+)-tramadol- and morphine group.	3.486272026931642
Sedation was significantly less profound in the (-)-tramadol group 1-4 h postoperatively.	3.523882953660089
There were no side-effect in the tramadol racemate group.	3.315726742867099
The enantiomers were equal to the racemate in analgesic potency, but inferior by far to morphine.	3.285718507524384
They showed more adverse events and, hence, can not be preferred to the racemate in postoperative pain therapy.	3.5885715669588447

Since the man had never shown signs of hyperoxaluria in his life before, a secondary oxalosis was supposed.	3.0266913260726276

Such fuels contain ethylene glycol (glysantin) as antifreeze commonly known to cause in toxic doses acute renal tubular necrosis with hyperoxaluria.	2.952484270436178

Undergoing chronic hemodialysis, the patient died 5 months after the kidney biopsy diagnosis by acute heart failure.	4.012285026394744
At autopsy, progressed chronic renal oxalosis could be confirmed.	3.0891626756452712

Insulinomas are rare tumors and account for 90 % of all endocrine pancreatic tumors.	3.643984659219582
They typically present as a solitary tumor, but may occur in multiple sites (e.g.	3.5792099389957746
multiple endocrine neoplasia type I) or as a malignant disease in 10 % of cases and rarely as nesidioblastosis or islet cell adenomatosis.	3.883361094037943
Neuroglucopenic symptoms lead to the diagnosis; inadequate high insulin and C-peptide secretion with hypoglycemia in the fasting test confirm the diagnosis.	3.4555046773198996
Preoperative localization is not necessary prior to the first operation.	4.643073912044237
The standard operation is enucleation or, depending on size and location, resection.	3.6043660741260046
The treatment of multiple tumors and islet cell hyperplasia with a high risk of recurrence is problematic.	3.6278587571592804
Subtotal resection plus enucleation seems to be better than selective tumor resection.	3.8572844696237354
In malignant insulinomas, mostly presenting with liver metastases, aggressive surgical therapy with hepatectomy and debulking, chemoembolization and systemic chemotherapy are the modalities of choice.	3.097450029723331
MR spectroscopy is the only method for non-invasive detection of various aspects of cardiac metabolism in humans.	4.0843883442812166
While the 1H nucleus of water and fat molecules is the signal source for MR imaging, the MR spectroscopic technique allows for the study of a number of other nuclei, such as 13C, 19F, 23Na, 31P, 39K and 87Rb.	3.2313655806299857
Clinical applications presently are confined to the 31P nucleus.	3.0288132489470603
31P-MR spectroscopy allows the non-invasive study of cardiac high-energy phosphate metabolites ATP and phosphocreatine.	3.573710813609228
The phosphocreatine/ATP ratio is considered an index of the energetic state of the heart.	3.4022692961195444
Possible clinical indications include heart failure, valve disease and coronary artery disease.	3.579081749952395
In heart failure, the phosphocreatine/ATP ratio is reduced and correlates with clinical severity, ejection fraction and prognosis.	3.3353489616063
In mitral and aortic valve disease, a reduced phosphocreatine/ATP ratio may indicate the optimum timing for valve replacement.	3.280621386000728
In coronary artery disease, a regional decrease of phosphocreatine during stress ("biochemical ergometry") may indicate local ischemia.	3.365399463707979
Furthermore, absolute quantification of high-energy phosphates may allow diagnosis of myocardial viability.	3.2720902287952454
Major technical developments, leading to improved spatial and temporal resolution will be necessary to establish MR spectroscopy as a routine clinical tool.	3.634297888187627

The file data of 293 children with fronto-orbital advancement were evaluated over an average period of 4.4 years.	3.027175508679985
In addition, lateral teleradiographies of 117 patients from this group were cephalometrically analysed.	2.8219592989001367
Moreover, late results of 36 children and  8 adults with midface-advancement with an average follow-up period of 4.5 years were assessed.	3.230385247847175
In contrast to linear craniectomy and so-called lateral canthal advancement, in only 8.2% of cases (24 out of 293 patients) were relapses requiring reoperation found in this study after fronto-orbital advancement.	3.3006763926322975
The evaluations indicate that with simple forms of craniosynostosis such as trigonocephaly and plagiocephaly predominantly very good or good growth can be observed.	2.766970541951935
Cephalometric evaluation confirmed the limited potential of growth in the area of the anterior skull base and in the midface in the presence of syndrome-related faciocraniosynostoses.	4.397508343033537
In such cases the cephalometrically confirmed maxillary hypoplasia, which increases in severity in the following order of syndromes `Saethre-Chotzen-Crouzon-Apert-Pfeiffer', could be influenced only to a limited degree by fronto-orbital advancement.	2.7032728202233205
For this reason midface advancement is of secondary importance in children with very severe anomalies.	3.329599834944934
In the present evaluation, a high rate of relapse of midfacial hypoplasia was to be found in children and adolescents after this operation in accordance with other references.	4.172221466693117
Therefore, the indication for Le Fort III osteotomy in the growth period should be limited.	3.044340736151254
The introduction of Perfluorochemicals into medicine and especially into the treatment of severe lung injury is a fascinating scientific task.	3.4371885689761474
Many recall the famous experiments from Clark et al.	2.7864579923003943
in 1966 when he demonstrated "liquidventilation with perfluorocarbons" in the mammal species for the first time.	2.7973498929003497
After this hallmark, perfluorocarbons were subsequently introduced in research of acute lung injury by the techniques of Total- and Partial-Liquid-Ventilation (TLV; PLV).	2.7665894500235955
Perfluorocarbons (saturated organofluorids) have unique chemical and physical properties which made them attractive substances for intraalveolar application.	2.8454670347466267
The strong C-F bindings in the perfluorocarbon molecules are responsible for their chemical stability, biochemical inertness, high capacity to dissolve respiratory gases, low surface tension and high vapor pressures.	2.9416585762588947
Furthermore, the high density of the PFC lead to radio-opacity and their distribution to dependent lung areas.	2.7960146692040735
The efficacy of PFC liquid, applied by TLV/PLV has been demonstrated in numerous animal studies using different models of acute lung injury.	3.0262014659996597
Currently, several mechanisms of action of perfluorocarbon fluids in acute lung injury are discussed: recruitment of atelectatic alveoli, prevention of endexpiratory collapse of alveoli ("liquid PEEP"), redistribution of perfusion, oxygen transport, surfactant like effects and decrease of inflammation.	3.06686168379832
Since total liquid ventilation has been used only in experimental models of lung injury, partial liquid ventilation has been introduced successfully into clinical trials (phase I-II).	3.5399746485571804
However, the results of the first randomised, controlled study of PLV in 90 adult patients suffering from severe respiratory failure (ALI/ARDS) showed no differences between PLV and conventional treatment.	3.8164890916009053
Furthermore, the instillation of relatively large amounts of liquid into the lungs poses several technical challenges and may be associated with complications such as liquithoraces, pneumothoraces and hypoxia.	3.052099241904402
Since mammal lungs are evolutionary specialised to gas exchange using atmospheric oxygen, the application of liquids, even if they transport respiratory gases very well is not physiologic.	3.241756788696369
To overcome these unwanted side effects, we developed a technique of perfluorocarbon vaporisation in analogy to the application of inhalation anaesthetic agents.	3.5416653516409213
After resolving some technical issues, this application technique was used successfully in an animal model of acute lung injury.	3.3007556494577837
Vaporisation of perfluorohexane in a concentration of 18 Vol.% of inspired gas improved significantly oxygenation and lung compliance.	3.0207829261622856
Though these results are promising, mechanisms of action, dose-efficacy relation, surfactant-perfluorocarbon interaction or anti-inflammatory effects of vaporised perfluorohexane are still unclear.	3.1912031750327254
These questions need to be clarified before this technique can be applied clinically.	3.8184058508436443
However, the inhalation of vapor, a technique already familiar to anaesthesiologists should avoid risks of large amounts of fluids in the bronchoalveolar space.	2.6286659726349946
Furthermore, this technique can be administered by established anaesthetic equipment with the advantage of exact dosing, continuous monitoring, and demand application in a way near to clinical routine.	3.4411599353867204
VDD pacing using a single pass lead for complete heart block is well described in adults but there are few reports of its use in children.	3.481224150960132
We have used 6 different standard adult size single pass leads and 5 different pacemaker generators in 21 children and adolescents aged 3.7-17.2 years (mean 9.9 years) and weighing 13.5 to 76 kg (mean 34.3 kg).	2.938523024598689
Congenital complete heart block was present in 14 patients (with associated heart disease in 2 of them), surgical complete heart block in 6 patients and 2:1 AV block of uncertain cause in 1 patient.	3.75287601556715
In 10 patients, the VDD system was their first pacing system.	3.5251382815909293
In 11 of the patients, 1-6 previous systems had been used and simultaneous extraction of ventricular leads (10) and/or atrial leads (5) was performed.	4.450134245768233
All leads were introduced via a subclavian vein puncture (using the extraction sheath when present) and the atrial dipole was placed low in the right atrium to provide slack for further growth while maintaining atrial sensing.	3.3059955674238655
Ventricular thresholds ranged from 0.2 to 0.8 V. The minimal atrial amplitude was 0.7 to 4 mV and the maximum amplitude was 2.5 to 8 mV.	2.909442350110379
There was one early micro-displacement and the lead was repositioned.	2.8079986628531812
Over a follow-up period of 2-64 months (mean 32 months), all but 1 of the patients have maintained low ventricular pacing thresholds and adequate atrial signals for reliable pacing at rest and with exercise.	4.09022864545736
During this time some have undergone considerable growth.	3.1564085445907737
One patient with coexisting congenital heart disease died suddenly at 3 years but the pacing system had no fault at autopsy.	2.8985183971737905
The standard adult size single pass lead provides a simple means to enable reliable atrial synchronous ventricular pacing in growing children with complete heart block.	2.941190606660312

Athletes who need high endurance capacity often use training at moderately high altitude (1500-3000 m) to improve oxygen delivery and utilization because of a hypoxia-induced increase of the red blood cell volume and adaptations at the muscular level.	3.29783910766941
As maximal heart rates decrease at high altitude and plasma lactate levels for a given workload change during prolonged exposure to high altitude, it can be difficult to control and adapt the intensity and duration of the work-outs.	3.549287293442306
Furthermore, maximal performance capacity decreases and therefore training intensity at high altitude is usually reduced compared to training at sea level.	2.912164361461702
A third option using a hypobaric chamber ("live low - train low") is hardly used anymore for training athletes.	2.8246010454210246
Studies on the effects of conventional high-altitude training for the improvement of athletic performance often lack a rigorous controlled design and yield controversial results.	3.0174908944307863
Regarding the new concept of "live high - train low" there is only one controlled study on college athletes and it shows a minor advantage of this new approach compared to conventional high-altitude training.	3.266477398396666
However, training concepts are especially important for elite competitive athletes, and controlled studies with such individuals are very difficult to perform.	3.397531514386015
Therefore, it appears that today we cannot answer the question of whether altitude-specific physiologic factors or non-altitude-related benefits of training camps account for the success of individual athletes.	3.4626551080976817

HIV remains infectious at room temperature for about six to twelve hours under sterile conditions, the time is shorter in the presence of bacteria and when clotting occurs.	3.5778369669783303
HIV infectivity is easily destroyed by disinfectants.	3.147235904358352
The human infectious dose of HIV is around 100 to 1000 particles, dependent on the virus and the site of entry into the host.	3.322321610985251
After inoculation new HIV is produced after 24 hours, and HIV has spread over the whole organism by the end of one or two weeks.	3.79488902163761
HIV infection may be detected after four to twelve weeks by antibody assays, and after eleven days by nucleic acid based assays.	3.3808633047553136

Integrated models of inpatient detoxification and motivation therapy focus on improvement of the motivation of patients towards further treatment of their alcoholism and towards abstinence.	3.2507016229438124
In our study 529 alcoholics underwent such treatment lasting between 2 to 3 weeks.	2.8618602983477803
A total of 469 patients (89%) were followed up after 8  months; 242 alcoholics (52% of the follow-up sample; 46% of the whole sample) achieved the treatment goal and started further treatment, mainly as inpatients.	3.3286525445626864
Fifty-four of these patients relapsed before they started further alcoholism treatment, but achieved abstinence afterwards; 60 (25%) of these 242 patients relapsed after the specific alcoholism therapy; 227 alcoholics did not start further treatment after the initial detoxification and motivation therapy.	3.130865450079445
In this subpopulation, 113 (50%) relapsed during the follow-up period.	3.0130065034570177

As a net effect of ACE-inhibitors and AT1-receptor antagonists on the renin-angiotensin system (RAS) cardioprotection due to vasodilative (reduction of blood pressure, afterload reduction), antiproliferative (reduced cell growth, reduction of "vascular" andor "ventricular remodeling", reduced formation of extracellular matrix), as well as antiadrenergic actions and due to the stimulating effect on natriuresis, reduction of blood pressure, preload reduction can be expected.	3.2271613793748983
These aims of therapy have mostly been confirmed for the action of ACE-inhibitors by experimental and clinical studies but except for the treatment of arterial hypertension and few preliminary reports concerning the treatment of cardiac dysfunction, no comparable data are available for AT1-receptor antagonists.	4.012159884682871
To date, an antithrombotic and profibrinolytic action could only be demonstrated for ACE-inhibitors.	3.2928342693855512
This effect has been discussed to be responsible for the improvement of long-term prognosis in patients with coronary artery disease.	4.247587077818234
Despite the similar spectrum of action there exist important differences between ACE-inhibitors and AT1-receptor antagonists that might underline the need of an individual use of these drugs: the dual action of ACE-inhibitors on the RAS and the kinin system bears many benefits but has been also shown to be accompanied by side-effects, mainly chronic dry cough, in a relatively high percentage of patients thus leading to discontinuation of therapy in 8-14%.	3.3241052785905336
This respective side-effect can be prevented by the use of AT1-receptor antagonists.	3.9914918952135876
It has been discussed whether the incomplete action of ACE-inhibitors on AT1-receptor-mediated effects is at least in part responsible for the efficacy of this drug which is relatively high (75-80%) as compared to other substances.	3.919500359329566

Eleven patients with suspected acute cerebral ischemia were investigated.	3.3414801430258554
The EBT was performed with an acquisition time of 50 ms per slice at eight parallel levels.	3.3851528510927142
To compare signal/noise and contrast/ noise ratios the data from the EBT investigation were compared to a similar examination on a spiral CT.	3.597556325623012
The signal/noise ratio with EBT was about 30%, the contrast/noise ratio 25% of that with spiral CT.	3.423051938595216
The absolute values of CBV were 4.9 +/- 1.2 ml/100 g (EBT); CBF was 50.5 +/- 7.0 ml/100 g/min in normal contralateral brain tissue.	3.0082338897359975

Advantages of EBT are the absolute measurements possible and it's multislice capability.	3.014390606609583
Disadvantages, however, are caused by the high image noise, limiting the demarcation of ischemic tissue.	4.22211066995312

The hemofiltration monitor controls the pumps for filtering and substituting fluid volumes and allows the infusion solutions to be heated up to 40  °C.	2.827441282609448

Instantaneous pressure was measured during a time of 5-s pressure increase and a further 5 s. A force of 280 N was applied to the quadriceps muscle.	3.895963997775061
Before knee arthroplasty, the contact area measured 154.3 mm2, the average pressure was 1.14 MPa, the force 182.13 N. Substantial studies are necessary to further determine the role of preexisting lipids in calcification.	3.9211592439919354
Therapy for hip dysplasia and DDH by means of sonography.	4.123974984771781
Numerous methods are available for treating "congenital" dysplasia of the hip (CDH).	3.9619674314827487
A historical review of the diagnosis of so-called "congenital dysplasia" and dislocation of the hip and different indications for therapeutic maneuvers is given.	4.420636075222578
Generally, a three-step plan of treatment is recommended: dislocated heads must be reduced, after which retention is needed until the hip joint is stable.	3.529406669167223
This is followed by maturation period, until the nonossified hyalin cartilagineous performed acetabular roof is ossified.	2.6857400776442146
All hip joints, regardless of age, can be assigned to one of these phases.	4.187139406810864
In all cases, measures are taken to prevent ischemic necrosis of the femoral head.	3.124565752958464
To prevent the residual dysplasia of the acetabulum roof and femoral head necrosis, the reduction-retention position should be more than 90  ° flexion in the hip joint, but not more than 45-50  ° abduction.	3.956069105352159
In each therapeutic phase there is a different biomechanical situation in the hip joint.	3.596949339912943
The appropriate orthosis for treatment is chosen according to the particular biomechanical situation.	3.559510432588731
Each sonographic type can be set up according to the our classification in the three-phase treatment system.	4.0558841297257056

A case of a patient with malignant acanthosis nigricans in association with carcinoma of the lung is reported, documenting successful palliative treatment of the warty papillomatous thickening of the lips with electrocautery.	3.6488004896715958
Molecular atmospheric oxygen contains two unpaired electrons in the unreactive triplet state and thus has to be activated in order to react with other biological molecules in the singlet ground state.	3.293447444373465
These processes of activation include very reactive intermediates.	3.0672544593110365
Therefore, aerobic cells must cope with - and to some extent also adapt to - oxidative stress provoked for example by infection or intoxication, where reactive intermediates of oxygen activation accumulate.	2.886412970845676
Depending on the strength of these impacts, several symptoms indicate the deviation from normal, steady-state metabolism.	2.8450842856985528
Most of these visible or measurable symptoms are connected with oxygen activation where principally a transition from heterolytic reactions (two-electron transitions) to increased homolytic reactions (one-electron transitions) is observed.	2.6422583139193145
Homolytic reactions produce free radicals, which are generally counteracted by a parallel increase of intrinsic radical scavenging processes or by compounds administered with food, thus warranting metabolic control within certain limits.	3.134997812986008
At advanced states of stress, control may be gradually lost and chaotic radical processes dominate.	2.915699740683266
Finally, cellular decompartmentalizations yield apoptotic, lytic and/or necrotic processes.	3.347364153395644
Every episode during this cascade is characterizable by the balance between pro- and antioxidative capacities.	2.967912340281983
Antioxidants, which in many cases are free radical scavengers or quenchers of activated states, comprise a wealth of classes of organic molecules including phenolics, probably as the most prominent ones.	3.379815821331604
In this article, mechanisms of oxygen activation and protection from oxidative damage are discussed.	2.8648194394649504
Furthermore, examples of antioxidative functions of a few important natural products are reported.	3.067821047234877

Patients were treated with either homeopathic remedies such as Nux vomica D200, Okoubaka D3, Tuberculinum D200, Barium jodatum D4 and Barium jodatum D6 or with placebo.	2.477413380725489
The duration of the study for each patient was 3 months.	4.659130103418737

Out of a total of 97 children studied between the ages of 4 to 10 years 82 could be analyzed.	3.5872179497366976
At the end of the study no operation was required in 70.7% of the placebo-treated children and in 78.1% of the children treated with homeopathic preparations.	3.3722339875218132
These results show no statistical significance.	3.1932392083336008

The dose-volume histograms for target, bladder, intestine and soft tissue were exported.	3.159646960361255
Normal tissue complication probability and tumor control probability, respectively, were calculated for all techniques.	3.4599584644889823
In the region of the matching line the summation of the measured normalized curves resulted in relative dose maxima of 6.0% (caudal) and 4.5% (cranial), respectively.	2.334723167677297
For fields enclosing the whole target volume the dose maxima in the region of the matching line decreased to 2.0% (caudal) and 1.8% (cranial), respectively.	2.5120624536696448
For the dose profiles calculated with Helax TMS© no overdose was found.	2.7757682744719103

Of the physicians 46% believed that the patients were comfortable.	3.6997700552022033
Of the nursing staff 100% were of the opinion that for the deceased patients, organ substitution therapy had continued too long.	3.374245043330141
On the other hand, only 45% of the residents shared this opinion.	2.580634655850004
The medical staff rated the intensive care measures as purposeful, less disturbing for the patients and more effective than did the nursing staff.	3.950175643157296
In many cases, the nursing staff as a group exhibited a contrary and negative opinion.	3.335324368293035
This could possibly be caused by insecurity, lack of information and lack of successful experiences.	3.6731331109787746
Next to patient outcome, the competent explanation and information regarding the disease and prognosis and the recurrent communication within the intensive care team, with respect to diagnostic and therapeutic measures are the deciding factors in the opinion formation regarding intensive care medicine.	3.903706832888876

Shock secondary to sepsis is a serious common disease with a substantial mortality.	3.762994817132539
Coagulation abnormalities, ranging from a rapid fulminant state of disseminated intravascular coagulation (DIC) to a slight elevation in the level of fibrin(ogen) degradation products, are well recognized in patients with bacterial septicemia.	3.2790746965901625

Endotracheal tube cuff pressure was measured and found to be greater than 120 cm H2O (the maximum measurement possible with the manometer).	3.680078995439528
The diagnosis of tracheal rupture was confirmed by fiberoptic bronchoscopy.	3.2950473169329193
The patient immediately underwent a throacotomy and a 3-cm tear of the pars membranacea of the trachea was sutured with a dural patch.	3.3053188212787856

In patients with renal or hepatic failure, the pharmacokinetics of opioids may be affected in several ways, leading to the necessity to correct the dose.	3.4853187888562505
The liver is the major site for biotransformation of most opioids.	3.306202564946253
The major metabolic pathway is oxidation.	3.0790988344261105
Exceptions to this are morphine and buprenorphine, which undergo primarily glucuronidation, and remifentanil which is cleared by esther hydrolysis.	2.9647504769620205
The hydrophilic metabolites are predominantly excreted by the kidneys and may accumulate in patients with renal insufficiency.	4.039481138331519
Some metabolites such as morphine-6-glucuronide (M6G) or normeperidine are active opioid agonists.	2.940049034447115

Even if Ignaz Philipp Semmelweis has not found the true aetiology of puerperal fever - bacteria were identified as pathogens only after his observations - he was the first to consequently use epidemiological methods in order to elucidate connections and influencing factors in the spread of nosocomial infections, to draw the right conclusions from his observations on the transmission of childbed fever and to draw the right consequences by implementing preventive measures, especially the hand disinfection.	3.304864913203269
He has correctly realized that human beings suffering from purulent or putride lesions or having even died from them can act as infectious sources as can hands of health-care personnel act as vehicles.	2.6740555382296014
As a characteristic feature of nosocomial infection, he noticed that generally only the weakend organism of the patient is involved as an infection target.	3.5969486144710126

Our approach is to estimate the spatial position of the tibial and femoral components of the prostheses from their contours in the X-ray image.	4.420707811102281

Aim of the study was to assess the efficacy of pretreatment with amifostine in terms of prevention of renal, hematopoetic and neurologic toxicity.	3.4585363624835734
17 patients (mean age: 62.6 [45-74]) with advanced transitional cell carcinoma of the urinary bladder received inductive or adjuvant cisplatin based chemotherapy (1-6 cycles) with a cisplatin dose of 70 mg/m2.	3.705153278209051
Amifostine (740-910 mg/m2) was administered intravenously 30 minutes prior to chemotherapy.	3.3935234062700257
For all patients creatinine clearance, serum creatinine and electrolytes including magnesium, and blood cell count were determined prior to and after each cycle.	3.091830546036289
A group of 12 patients (mean age: 61.9 [51-67]) did undergo MVEC chemotherapy (1-4 cycles) without receiving amifostine and served as control group.	3.4182362463244154
Amifostine was well tolerated and only 1 patient suffered from gastrointestinal discomfort, blood pressure remained unchanged in all patients.	3.9977413324423914
Amifostine prevented a significant reduction of creatinine clearance even in the 2 patients with known renal insufficiency: mean creatinine clearance was 125  +/-  20 ml/min prior to and 115  +/-  25 ml/min after chemotherapy.	3.726136617502211
In the control group, however, creatinine clearance dropped from 121  +/-  30 ml/min to 85  +/-  20 ml/min after completion of MVEC chemotherapy.	3.6598881703041197
Serum creatinine levels did not increase significantly (1.1 mg/dl prior to and 1.2 mg/dl after chemotherapy), magnesium levels did not decrease significantly and normalized at the end of chemotherapy.	3.808416129536878
Significant neutropenia and thrombocytopenia developed in 29 % and 12 % of the patients in the amifostine group and in 67 % and 33 % of the patients in the control group.	4.41878052127784
Amifostine was shown to have a protective effect against cisplatin induced nephrotoxicity in the elderly patient undergoing systemic chemotherapy.	3.9733499894124416
Based on our data amifostine should be applied in the supportive management to prevent chemotherapy induced complications.	3.169320256725625

The symptoms are itching, burning, dysuria, discharge and rubor of the vulva.	2.8145031415425703

In adults, infectious spondylitis is a rare but severe disease, caused by a bacterial thrombus in tissue of reduced resistance.	3.654068150794535
In conventional radiographs initial findings are a narrowing of the intervertebral space, local osteoporosis and poorly defined erosive borders of the vertebral endplates.	3.5426854465409012
These changings can be found at least three to six weeks after the onset of disease.	4.531438379214199
However, in Szintigraphy and MRT pathologic alterations are evident after ten to twelve days.	2.6669808483430666
Thus, early diagnosis and treatment becomes possible.	3.872920195701153
In early stages of the disease a localized lysis surrounded by a reactive sclerosis appears in predisposed areas of the vertebral body (subchondral, anterobasal, ventral, central).	3.017471277699448
Apparently, a soft tissue tumor is associated.	4.051867259760059
Sclerosis and reduction of the soft tissue tumor are the first signs of repair processes.	4.443631418933006
In addition, MRT as well as CT can be helpful in the detection and localization of complications as abscesses or affection of the vertebral canal.	4.090147244740198
The tuberculous spondylitis can sometimes cause difficulties in differential diagnosis.	2.752842177533069
Clinical findings, affection of several vertebral bodies, large soft tissue tumors with appearance of calcification as well as not typical locations are strongly suggestive of tuberculous spondylitis, but these findings are not specific of the disease.	3.5706045946697254

An essential parameter for the incorporation of drugs and narcotics into head hair is the content of hair pigment (melanins).	2.9956026693475546
Toxicological studies of hair should therefore take the colour of the hair into consideration.	3.8152464949338034
As the available vocabulary for verbal characterisation is small and the description depends on the subjective opinion of the viewer, it was the purpose of this study to investigate if colorimetric measurements allow objectivation of hair colour.	3.6497692680400093
The natural hair colour of 17 subjects was described subjectively in words and by comparing it with a hair colour chart (Wella, Darmstadt, Germany).	2.969470825664925
Subsequently the colours of the hair and the samples of the hair colour chart used for comparison were measured by colorimetric analysis and the CIEL*a*b* values were determined.	3.6137834064398104

blonde, brown, black) could often not be recognised in the colorimetric results.	3.1716574753265965

When the colour measurements were repeated at intervals of several days the results were found to be reproducible.	4.381483005303607
We measured the ventilatory pattern and additional work of breathing (WOBadd) at three different levels of inspiratory pressure support [IPS 5, 10, 15 mbar above positive end-expiratory pressure (PEEP)] and in a new ventilatory mode, automatic tube compensation (ATC), in nine operative patients without lung injury nine patients ventilated for several following acute respiratory insufficiency (ARI).	3.108184981919719
In ATC, endotracheal tube resistance is compensated automatically by means of closed-loop control of the calculated tracheal pressure.	3.826677360307788
Pressure support in this mode, i. e. airway pressure above PEEP, is equal to the actual flow-dependent pressure drop across the endotracheal tube (ETT).	3.532111092183233
Airway pressure rises at the beginning of inspiration and falls towards the end.	3.631612923224365
As the tube resistance of ETT seriously hinders expiration and can cause desynchronization between ventilator and patient, airway pressure is reduced below PEEP during expiration in the same way as it is increased during inspiration.	3.1078496781591864
The result is a near-constant tracheal pressure at PEEP both during inspiration and during expiration.	2.7948078292425667
This mode could be best termed as "electronic extubation".	2.8961803572622276
The most striking difference between the postoperative patients and the ARI patients was their minute ventilation (17.8+/-1.85 l/min in ARI patients vs 7.3+/-3.1 l/min in the postoperative patients).	3.7816819277509475
In the postoperative patients augmentation of IPS from 5 to 15 mbar induced a steady increase in tidal volume (VT) and a consecutive decrease in respiratory rate (rr) compared with ATC (VTATC,postop= 463+/-78 ml; rrATC,postop =16+/-4 min-1; VTIPS5,postop = 505+/-79 ml; rrIPS5,postop = 15+/-4 min-1; VTIPS10,postop = 562+/-86 ml; rrIPS15,postop =14+/-4 min-1; VTIPS15,postop=660+/- 151 ml; rrTPS15, postop = 12+/-4 min-1), whereas the augmentation of IPS of 5 and 10 mbar in the ARI patients could not compensate for the increase in rr and the decrease in VT, after switching from ATC to IPS (VTATC,ARI 724+/-308 ml, rrATC,ARI = 24+/-6 min-1; VTIPS5,ARI = 649+/-315 ml; rrIPS 5,ARI = 27+/-8 min-1; VTIPS10,ARI=653+/-353 ml; rrIPS10,ARI = 25+/-8 min-1: Even IPS 15 was not able to reestablish VT at the values observed during ATC (VTIPS15,ARI =680+/-312 ml).	2.9896493614135395
During ATC WOBadd was small in both postoperative and ARI patients (WOBadd,ATC,postop = 93+/-36 mJ/l, WOBadd,ATC,ARI =116 +/-72 mJ/l).	3.019314003062184
In the postoperative patients, an inspiratory pressure support of 5 mbar was not sufficient to compensate WOBadd compared with ATC.	3.439156570965019
However, IPS 10 and 15 mbar were able to compensate for WOBadd (WOBadd.ATC5,postop WOBadd,IPS5,postop =189+/-77 mJ/l; WOBadd,IPS10,postop = 55+/-30 mJ/l; WOBadd,IPS15,postop = 21+/-11 mJ/l).	2.962306320081643
Under ATC, WOBadd was only 15% of WOBadd under IPS of 15 mbar.	3.0780134403034247
All but two patients were successfully extubated after the investigation.	3.80552326004348
These two patients were not extubated because they were dependent on an FIO2 >0.5.	3.470257495800053
Our results strongly indicate that ventilatory dependence in ARI patients may be caused by the ETT rather than by mechanical dysfunction of the lung.	3.85275376747383
ATC is a very helpful mode to use in distinguishing between ventilatory failure caused by ETT and real ventilatory dependence.	3.562585687345691

In 55 consecutive patients with the same dual chamber pacemaker (Relay, Intermedics) and different pacing leads, the influence of different safety margins for pacing on battery current was investigated.	3.589259684429629
2.8 +/- 0.9 years after implantation, atrial and ventricular pulse-width thresholds (tRS) (ms) were determined at 0.5, 1.0, and 2.0 V, and the charge delivered at threshold was telemetered.	3.7278237373751146
If tRS was <1.50 ms at 0.5 V, an amplitude of 1.0 V was programmed in the atrium and the ventricule; if tRS was <1.50 ms at 1.0 V, then an amplitude of 2.0 V was chosen.	2.820111012679955
Two times the charge threshold (2x QRS), two times the voltage threshold (2x URS), and three times the pulse-width threshold (3x tRS) were programmed as the safety margins for pacing.	3.5980757274075117
With every safety margin, battery current (IRS) (µA) was averaged from 5 telemetric readings in D00 mode with 70 bpm.	2.9596824172632124
IBat was significantly lower with 2x QRS as compared with 2x URS (13.43 +/- 1.0 vs. 14.20 +/- 1.2 µA, p<0.01) and as compared with 3x tRS (13.99 +/- 1.2 µA, p<0.05).	2.823678501331042
Pacemaker longevity derived from these current data was significantly longer with 2x QRS (112 +/- 8 months) as compared with 2x URS (106 +/- 9, p<0.01) and as compared with 3x tRS (108 +/- 8, p<0.05).	3.380409195247916
If current consumption is compared intraindividually in dependance on the programmed amplitude, battery current is significantly lower at 1.0 V as compared with 2.0 V resulting in a mean reduction of 0.63 µA (-4.9%, p<0.05) and an average gain in longevity of 5 months.	3.355653703692735
This applies to every safety margin tested.	3.211337551797392
Differences in battery current caused by the safety margins will translate into a greater gain in longevity in future pacemaker models with reduced internal current consumption.	3.1982498692568697
Any medical procedure must be legally authorized by the patient, giving informed consent.	3.9869793863552263
This prerequisite is based on the right to self determination.	4.941002188424834
Otherwise a medical procedure is considered as physical injury.	3.9116938922301445
Thus, the way, how a specific procedure is performed, predominantly depends on the patient's will.	4.001188526596769
The attending physician's duty is to find out this will, which is especially important when old patients and patients incapable of giving valid consent are involved.	3.562338098606126
Before the procedure the physician has to have a confidential talk with the patient.	3.8975275585863725
He has to point out the best treatment possible considering the individual circumstances of the patient's life.	3.7446350939138653
The physician has to find out, weather the patient is competent to refuse or consent to treatement.	3.7378565254840703
Furthermore the consultation is an opportunity to diminish the patient's fear and to increase his confidence.	3.058082481258818

From February 1991 to May 1998, 340 patients had a cardioverter/defibrillator (ICD) implanted.	3.651789938467121
Mean age was 64  +/-  9 years, 278 male and 62 female.	3.404948174324601
60% of patients had coronary artery disease and 31% dilative cardiomyopathy.	4.4176011985248795
The indication for an implantable cardioverter/defibrillator was in 57% of patients ventricular tachycardia, in 43% ventricular fibrillation.	3.2642195356375243
298 patients had a single-chamber cardioverter/defibrillator implanted, 42 patients a dual-chamber cardioverter/defibrillator.	3.8629626607988694
In 25 patients additional subcutaneous patch or array electrodes and in 2 patients additional epicardial patch electrodes were implanted.	3.1711946808972704
Implantation site was in 92 patients abdominal and in 248 pectoral.	3.275409989072103
Over a period of 7 years 34 lead-related complications occured in 33 patients (9.7%), after a median of 2 months after implantation.	3.3716986067976453
Diagnosis was made by routine chest x-ray in about 55% of lead-related complications, by clinical presentation (inadequate therapy, pain) in 24%, and by electrical parameters in 21%.	3.41310250566032
In patients with an abdominal implantation site, lead-related complications occurred in 20%, in contrast to 6% in patients with a pectoral implantation site.	4.500040037479722
Regarding patients with pectoral implantation site, lead-related complications were observed in 12% of patients with a dual-chamber ICD vs 4% with a single-chamber ICD (p = 0.05), due to dislocation of atrial electrodes with dual-chamber ICD.	4.1831711842867305
There were no differences in clinical parameters between patients with pectoral vs abdominal and between single vs dual-chamber ICD.	2.8765926984953176
Several new approaches are available for early defibrillation.	4.04897384301865
One example is semiautomatic defibrillators used by the first arriving emergency staff.	3.076561045118673
The recommendations for introducing emergency medical technician (EMT) defibrillation in Germany are based either on the results in cities with so called doctor-manned-ambulances or the experiences of the German multi-center-study.	3.331592918997995
This analysis intends to contribute data to an EMT defibrillation program in cities with a so called rendezvous-system.	3.0221289807808773
Methods: In a prospective study a EMT-defibrillation group (= DG) was compared with a standard group (basic life support by EMTs and defibrillation by emergency physicians) (= SG) and a control group (emergency physicians starting resuscitation alone or together with EMTs) (= CG).	3.4431031390516647
In the DG semiautomatic defibrillators from Laerdal (Heartstart 3000) were used.	2.86390239232953
Successfully resuscitated patients were followed up with the Glasgow Coma Scale (GCS), the Pittsburgh Brain Stem Score (PBSS), and Pittsburgh Cerebral (CPC) and Overall Performance Categorie (OPC).	3.405070624629028
Results: Over 13 months 43 patients were included, primarily presenting with ventricular fibrillation (VF).	3.1706745395425413
Depending on the first arriving emergency staff the patients were allocated to the DG (n = 12), to the SG (n = 18) or to the CG (n = 13).	3.6520564903785755
DG and SG did not differ significantly concerning the primary survival rate or the long-term prognosis (primary successful 8.3% vs. 38.9%, definite successful 0% vs. 27.8%).	3.15163869188893
In the long term survival rate there were no significant differences.	3.449645778180453
In the DG significantly less patients received bystander CPR (8.3%) than in the other groups (55.6% and 69.2%).	3.0469559513551796
Neither the variable "witnessed collapes" nor "bystander CPR" had a significant influence for the outcome of the patients in this study.	3.3944306145954775
The average response time for the first arriving rescue team was 5.5 +/- 2.4 min, without a significant difference between the groups.	3.7365080377764786
Conclusions: A comparison of this study with American, European and German recommendations for EMT defibrillation programms revealed some deviations.	3.561700856690047
Bystander CPR seems to be of special importance as well as the time interval between defibrillation and the arrival of the emergency physician.	4.333756961474202
A benefit of EMT defibrillation could not be demonstrated in our "rendezvous-system", possibly because the time interval was less than 4 min (3.5 min).	3.8013712828032866
Since the result is in accordance with the German multi-center-study, a critical consideration of a EMT defibrillation program seems to be necessary in "Rendezvous-systems".	3.5209990790134515
Ninety-two strains of glycopeptide-resistant enterococci (GRE) from 80 patients of 31 hospitals in 11 federal states were analyzed.	2.768398456654532
They were primarily isolated in intensive care units (general, surgical, internistic, pediatric, oncological ones), but also in nephrologic/dialysis or neurologic/orthopaedic wards.	3.1833956047095695
A dominance of VanA type E. faecium strains was observed (n=81; 88.0%).	3.089947064829338
In addition, strains of E. faecalis (VanA; n=4; 4.4%), E. faecium (VanB; n=1; 1.1%), and E. gallinarum (VanC1, n=6; 6.5%) were found.	3.1093179472560397
The 81 VanA strains of E. faecium possessed the following resistances to other antibiotics: erythromycin, ciprofloxacin (both 93.8%), ampicillin, oxytetracycline (both 88.9%), rifampicin (79.0%), trimethoprim/sulfameracin (61.7%), chloramphenicol (18.9%), fusidic acid (12.3%), quinupristin/dalfopristin (7.4%); gentamicin (46.9%) and streptomycin (37.0%), also together with ampicillin resistance (9.9-35.8%).	2.456691976675757
In some of these VanA type strains resistance to teicoplanin cannot be completely expressed in-vitro.	3.186282139736524
Macrorestriction analysis of E. faecium outbreak isolates (VanA type) from hospitals in different federal states indicated an intra- and interhospital spread of a defined strain.	3.197100570054437
However, heterogeneous plasmid and plasmid restriction patterns showed that these strains were not completely identical.	2.8790976066703156

This paper concerns advances in the integration of psychotherapy in psychiatric education and clinical practice and whether they go along with increasing research activities.	3.4321173534690166
To find answers, a survey on psychotherapy research was carried out in all German psychiatric hospitals and departments by means of a questionnaire.	3.4737969611154815
The results indicate that psychotherapy research is done nearly exclusively in university hospitals.	3.0838701408975133
About half of them had already published psychotherapy studies and two thirds of them are presently carrying out studies, mostly including prospective, randomized clinical trials.	3.5097046620677412
These studies cover the whole spectrum of psychiatric disorders: substance abuse, schizophrenic and affective disorders, anxiety, and obsessive compulsive and personality disorders.	3.0373951328308375

Moreover, blood pressure lowering agents fail to improve uteroplacental perfusion but may have adverse effects on fetal growth.	3.328021358471255

Cerebral vessels are particularly sensitive to magnesium, which works by reversing cerebral vasoconstriction with resultant improvement in blood flow.	3.0012601436159794
Controlled trials have shown magnesium to be superior to both placebo and phenytoin for the prevention of eclampsia.	3.55373937798456
Furthermore, magnesium has been found to be more effective than diazepam and phenytoin in preventing recurrence of seizures in women with eclampsia.	3.3199619224040613

It is unclear why KS is so rare in women.	2.9484841987762525

To detect common parameters regarding immunodeficiency, hormonal disturbances, abnormalities in clinical course, or sexual practices, data of eight women with KS (five HIV+, three HIV-) were compared.	3.3717446253296224
In HIV+ women KS is more aggressive than in HIV- women and more aggressive than in HIV+ men.	3.160848052115454
Early and frequent visceral involvement and no preference for the lower extremities are found.	3.663408583331075

All women with KS investigated for sexual hormones (7/8) showed abnormalities: 7/7 had low oestrogens, 4/6 low LH and 3/5 low progesterone.	3.231164644904181
Controls (n=11, HIV+ without KS) showed a clear trend for higher serum levels of sexual hormones, but the difference was not significant.	3.5234894061671747

The aim of the study was the assessment of left ventricular (LV) systolic function and left ventricular mass following aortic valve replacement (AVR) due to aortic valve stenosis as well as the influence of regression of LV hypertrophy in patients with normal and impaired LV systolic function prior to surgery.	3.7746986529384223
74 patients with severe aortic valve stenosis (29 female, 45 male, mean age 66  +/-  18 years) were divided into 2 groups according to LV ejection fraction (EF): Group 1 with EF > 50% (n = 40); Group 2 with EF <= 50% (n = 34).	3.580556130619995
Furthermore, patients were differentiated into a group A without (n = 53) and a group B with aortic regurgitation (<= II °, n = 21).	3.71774270570949
All patients were examined by transthoracic echocardiography before and 1 month after surgery.	3.5934441580828307
There was a significant decrease of LV enddiastolic and endsystolic valume indices following AVR in group 2 and group B.	2.9177513946545255
Patients with preoperatively lower EF (group 2) showed an increase in LV ejection fraction from 39  +/-  10% before AVR to 47  +/-  11% after AVR (p < 0.001), whereas patients with preoperative normal EF (group 1) showed a significant decrease in EF (from 62  +/-  8% to 57  +/-  10%, p < 0.05).	4.024337647665283
Also patients with combined aortic valve disease before AVR had an increase of EF after surgery (from 45 %plusmn; 14% to 56  +/-  14%, p < 0.03).	3.464184288117867
There were significant decreases of interventricular septum thickness and LV posterior wall thickness in group 1 and group A, whereas a significant decrease of LV anddiastolic diameter index was noted only in group B.	3.1622261003471848
Improvement of the NYHA functional class could be demonstrated in group 2 from 2.8  +/-  0.7 before to 2.2  +/-  0.6 after AVR, as well as in group B from 2.9  +/-  0.7 before to 1.9  +/-  0.7 after surgery.	3.6328852204534057
In conclusion, patients with impaired LV function or combined aortic valve disease showed a significant improvement of left ventricular systolic function after AVR, while patients with normal LV function presented a slight decrease of EF.	3.7167839065200905

Cardiomyocytes lose the ability to proliferate after birth.	3.758091826130355
Subsequently, irreversible cellular damage, e.g., during myocardial infarction, causes loss of functional properties and cell replacement by fibrotic tissue.	3.358730170888284
It is, therefore, not surprising that cell replacement strategies such as cardiomyocyte transplantation in damaged myocardium or scar tissue has gained widespread interest.	2.9914242789067016
In other species such as mice, rats, and dogs, the technical feasibility of skeletal myoblast-, satellite cell-, and fetal cardiomyocyte engraftment into normal and diseased myocardium has been demonstrated by simple injection methods.	3.096678534846209
Repeatedly, it has been shown that transplanted cells may survive for weeks within host myocardium and build intercellular connections such as grap junctions and desmosomes.	3.3014226554157404
In contrast, grafthost connections have not, as yet, been convincingly demonstrated.	2.901713907157494
Hypothetically, cell transplants might exhibit the following functional properties: stabilization of diseased tissue to prevent structural remodeling; carrier for recombinant proteins, growth factors or drugs to induce molecular alterations of host myocardium; and improvement of regional and global myocardial function due to active contractility.	2.9052364283974006
However, clear evidence of coordinated contractility of transplanted cells, and, thus, of a clinically relevant therapeutical use of cardiomyocyte transplantation as a replacement strategy for damaged host cardiac cells, remains to be demonstrated.	3.325007871279068

The Medtronic Thera/Thera-i (and Kappa 400) pacemakers utilize a mode switching algorithm that switches from the DDD/R mode to the DDIR mode in the presence on an atrial tachyarrhythmia.	2.9233148653488255
To accomplish this, the pacemaker keeps track of a mean atrial rate (MAR) which is a weighted index of the atrial rate.	3.7571237766900594
Once the MAR is greater than the programmed mode switch rate the pacemaker mode switches to the nontracking mode.	3.0355222330271383
Because the algorithm weights faster atrial rates more heavily than slow atrial rates, the algorithm is sensitive to a wide variety of atrial tachyarrhythmias, including those with varying amplitudes.	3.371603256409261
Additionally, the algorithm provides a long PVARP and a rate adaptive (RA) AV interval.	3.064310805597753
These not only help ensure that a wide range of atrial rates will be detected, but may also limit the time the patient tracks at the upper rate before mode switching.	3.45160064408797
In order to assess the effectiveness of the algorithm, the Thera-i provides detailed diagnostics which provide information on the date, time, duration, and rate of the mode switch episodes.	3.7322209624357696
Additionally, more detailed beat-to-beat information is provided for each episode which can help determine its appropriateness and can assist in making programming changes.	3.2016746610124205

Large B-cell neoplasms represent one of the most frequent groups of non-Hodgkin-lymphomas (30-40%).	4.150080317153402
These lymphomas may evolve either de novo or secondary during the course of a less aggressive lymphoma.	3.365162118727083
In addition to primary nodal, a primary extranodal manifestation is rather common.	3.0604539421272756
The neoplastic cells, even within one given case, show a broad morphological spectrum.	3.255390036860643
Several findings of the last two decades have revealed that the large B-cell lymphomas represent an inhomogeneous group.	3.839118045596531
There are two groups identified, that of the variants and that of the subtypes.	4.000737958367833
The various variants (centroblastic, immunoblastic, anaplastic, T-cell/histiocyte-rich) correspond to lymphomas without reproducible discriminating criteria lacking characteristic clinical, immunophenotypical and genetic findings.	2.8610649094892553
In contrast, the primary mediastinal, the intravascular, the primary effusion and primary central nervous system lymphomas represent distinct disease entities.	3.143528720998623
A number of recently described large cell lymphoma types, i. e. plasmablastic, ALK-positive and primary gastric, are included in the classification, their designation as distinct entities is still under discussion.	3.253743722566934

We tested the proprioceptive capability of the subjects with a passive angle reproduction test.	3.2072465203116005

Atrial fibrillation is the most commonly encountered sustained arrhythmia in men.	3.9746254289642553
It is associated with a two-fold mortality risk and an increased cost for health care providers.	3.8899691864724057
The relative inefficacy and the risks of pharmacologic approaches to atrial fibrillation therapy have contributed to increasing efforts to address atrial fibrillation with curative ablative strategies.	3.0036103873185467
Ablation approaches for atrial fibrillation focus on two alternate strategies: ablation of the substrate for initiation and ablation of the substrate for maintenance of atrial fibrillation.	2.8021713302670985
It has been demonstrated that atrial fibrillation may be initiated by repetitive atrial premature beats originating from a single focus.	3.2091093936371156
Most often, these atrial premature beats arise from the pulmonary veins.	3.658274454717542
A challenge in trying to ablate the trigger is actually having enough spontaneous activity from the said focus throughout the electrophysiologic study.	2.8254595354594616
To sidestep the need of mapping, pure anatomic approaches are currently under investigation to electrically isolate the pulmonary veins from the atrial myocardium by circumferential lesions.	3.396923413834825
In patients without a defined trigger for atrial fibrillation, efforts were made to ablate the substrate for maintenance of atrial fibrillation.	2.810222887088925
Strong evidence exists that atrial fibrillation is the result of multiple coexisting reentrant wavelets requiring a critical myocardial mass to perpetuate.	3.487262540502132
Several working groups demonstrated that intraoperative compartmentalization of the myocardial tissue by surgical incisions or radiofrequency pulses is highly effective in preventing atrial fibrillation.	2.874466215406024
Though our knowledge of ablation techniques and technical prerequisites is continuously increasing, the difficulty to produce complete linear lesions in the left atrium and local thrombus formation at the ablation line are problems that are still not solved.	3.4698405832433066

Controlling these changes for differences in baseline paramters, the dementia-specific reduction was about 1,5 hours compared to a non-psychiatric control group.	3.7721865482068195
These clinically relevant changes in activity levels underscore the importance of these activity domains with regard to the development of diagnostically useful indicators at the early stages of dementia.	3.9172800904839526
Time-budget methods seem to be particularly useful to close the diagnostic gap with regard to the assessment of everyday competence indicators especially at early stages of the dementia illness.	3.81222178048986
Hypertrophic cardiomyopathy (HCM) is a disease with different etiological, morphological, functional, clinical and therapeutic aspects.	3.8376171991067096
Recent investigations indicate that HCM is considerably widespread in the population (1:500).	3.0226363946713284
The causes seem to generate from familial or sporadic abnormalities (mutations).	2.8026520195832996
Depending on the clinical aspect, the complaints, and on the basis of morphologic and hemodynamic investigational results, we mainly have to consider two types of medical and surgical management.	4.055741205873387
Atrial fibrillation is in 20-50% the most frequent dysrhythmia after coronary artery bypass grafting (CABG) and a possible cause for hemodynamical complications and prolongation off the medical treatment in patients.	3.9013093896545823
Therefore, the effect of -blocking with metoprolol for prevention of supraventricular arrhythmias (SVA) was investigated in a prospective and randomized trial.	3.6931206789091267
200 patients after CABG were randomized in a drug and control group (average age 63.2 years, 154 male, 46 female).	3.462836527917345
Patients of the drug group (n=100) were treated with metoprolol (1mg/kg/BW) beginning on day one after operation, whereas patients of the control group (n=100) received therapy only in case of occurrence of atrial fibrillaton.	4.034861882465765
ECG, blood pressure, and electrolyte concentrations were measured regulary until the tenth day after surgery.	3.561995304017119
Reasons for exclusion were an ejection fraction (< 30%, SA- and AV-block or simultaneous application of epinephrine and metoprolol.	3.273115012065785
There were no significant differences between the patients of drug and control group with respect to age, sex ejection fraction, previous medication, number and type of bypass grafts, cardiopulmonary bypass time, and perioperative ischemic events.	3.5406190844914454
However, a statistically significant difference was seen in the occurrence of supraventricular arrhythmias in both groups, 4 patients of the therapy group (4%) in contrast to 37 patients of the control (37%) developed supraventricular arrhythmias during the postoperative observation period (p<0.0001).	4.495459710258122
Both groups differed in total time of hospital stay by 1.5 days (control group: 9.83 +/- 2.88 days; drug group: 8.42 +/- 2.81 days), which was statistically significant (p<0.05).	3.345841431777112
All patients of the drug group could be discharged with a stable sinusrhythm, whereas 7 patients of the control group were discharged with persistent atrial fibrillation.	3.7276100480805727
The difference was statistically significant as well (p<0.01).	3.032442973182156
Neither typical side effects of metoprolol, nor AV-blocks, bradycardia (f<60/min) or symptoms of low blood pressure could be observed.	3.3710087068035817
The conclusion of this trial is a recommendation for a preventive application of 50mg metoprolol/day after coronary artery bypass surgery, which can reduce the incidence of SVA as well as the hospital stay statistically significant.	3.946377330680437

Results: In 55 % (17/31), diagnosis of urinary tract infection was confirmed by single bladder catheterization; in 26 % (8/31), urinary tract infection could be excluded, and in 19 % (6/31), bladder colonization without pyuria was found.	3.7604059634554594
Thus, 45 % of the patients with abnormal voided urine samples did not need antimicrobials.	3.984113139255405

Objectives: Due to its low solubility and negligible metabolism, desflurane is assumed to be especially suitable for application by low-flow anaesthetic techniques.	3.170156689478264
The aim of this clinical investigation was the development of a standardised dosing scheme for low-flow and minimal-flow desflurane anaesthesia.	3.5380951870969954
Methods: One hundred six ASA status I-II patients were assigned to six groups according to the duration of the initial high-flow phase, fresh gas flow, and fresh-gas desflurane concentration.	3.4459833603393526
The median age, height, body weight, and constitution of the groups was comparable.	3.293841061363923
After an initial high-flow phase using 4.4 l/min, the fresh gas flow was reduced to 0.5 l/min (minimal-flow anaesthesia) or 1.0 l/min (low-flow anaesthesia).	3.3270192905544067
Inspired nitrous oxide concentrations were maintained at 60% to 70%.	3.19457156134548
Using different standardised schemes of vaporizer settings, inspired desflurane concentrations were applied in the range from 3.4% to 8.7%, i.e., between 1 and 1.5 MAC.	3.424894865766261
Inspired and expired desflurane concentrations were measured continuously by the side-stream technique and recorded on-line.	3.41995931719547
Venous blood samples were taken immediately prior to induction and 45 min after flow reduction for measurement of carboxyhaemoglobin (COHb) concentration).	3.0737512737308137
Results: In the 10- to 15-min initial phase during which a high fresh gas flow of 4.4 l/min was used, the inspired desflurane concentration reached values in the range of 90%-95% of the fresh gas concentration.	3.5846463495837777
In low-flow anaesthesia this concentration could be maintained without any alteration of the vaporizer setting, whereas in minimal-flow anaesthesia with flow reduction the fresh gas concentration had to be increased by 1% to 2%: The quotient calculated by division of the inspired desflurane concentration by its fresh gas concentration (Q=CI/CF) ranges between 0.65 and 0.75 in minimal-flow and between 0.80 and 0.85 in low-flow anaesthesia.	3.2709428210831333
Compared with its value prior to induction (2.13 +/- 1.05%), the COHb concentration decreased statistically significantly by about 0.7% during the 1st hour of minimal-flow anaesthesia (1.42 +/- 1.01%).	3.079439495192249
Conclusions: The pharmacokinetic properties of desflurane, resulting in especially low individual uptake, and the wide output range of the vaporizer facilitate the use of low-flow anaesthetic techniques in routine clinical practice.	3.890777512046205
Even in minimal-flow anaesthesia, the duration of the initial high-flow phase can be shortened to min.	2.893077200086151
If the flow is reduced to 1 l/min, the inspired desflurane concentration achieved in the initial high-flow phase can be maintained without any alteration of the vaporizer setting.	3.0116203319064576
In minimal-flow anaesthesia, however, with flow reduction to 0.5 l/min, the fresh gas concentration has to be increased to a value 1%-2% higher than the inspired nominal value.	4.070334520065509
Due to the wide dialling range of the desflurane vaporizer, the amount of vapour delivered into the breathing system can be increased to about 110 ml/min even at a flow of 0.5 l/min.	3.56800867252598
The large amount of agent that can be delivered into the system even under low-flow conditions, together with the very low individual uptake, results in a time-constant that is sufficiently short for the clinically required rapid increase in inspired desflurane concentrations.	3.6829839516818668
The short time-constant of low-flow desflurane anaesthesia improves the control of the anaesthetic concentration.	4.122153697175419

However, chronic hypertension without complications has a more favorable prognosis than preeclampsia.	3.250058569561001
Increased lipid oxidation, deported membrane components of syncytiotrophoblasts, and increased invasion of fetal cells in the maternal circulation triggering immunological reactions are discussed as the causes.	3.3550960292839056
The result is an endothelial imbalance between vasoconstrictory-aggregating and vasodilatatory-antiaggregating compounds.	2.587623465225612
The results of studies on the relevance of NO synthase are controversial.	3.153528813169019

The risk for recurrence of the preeclampsia is between 20 and 26 % or when it occurred in the second trimester up to 65 % while that of HELLP syndrome is between 3.5 and 24 %.	3.37807725020882
Acanthosis nigricans is a hyperkeratotic mucocutaneous eruption of heterogenous etiology which is characterized by hyperpigmentation, velvety cutaneous thickening, intensified skin markings and development of verrucous excrescences typically involving the intertriginous areas.	2.974598285498012

The goal of this evaluation study is to analyze the effects of a new gerontopsychiatric institution, the gerontopsychiatric center (GC: a combination of a home-based outpatient service, a day-hospital and a consulting office for elderly with mental disorders) on the reorganization process of the treatment system from intramural toward extramural structures, as experts of the government of the FRG have been demanding for a long time.	3.584621859182898
Based on data of cross-sectional and longitudinal studies two regional catchment areas - the city of Bielefeld (without GC, control region) and the district of Gütersloh (with GC) - are compared and analyzed, whether changes within the gerontopsychiatric system (subsystem A), the system of general medical treatment (subsystem B), or within the elderly care system (subsystem C) occurred.	3.5833106151467162
Concerning subsystem A the results are that the GC has a strong impact on the intended shift from intra- to extramural structures, without selecting patients by diagnosis nor by severity degrees of their mental disorders in extramural treatment facilities.	3.0706207933259786
The home-based outpatient treatment is especially successful for elderly with a functional psychic disorder.	3.3918602239671043
These patients had the highest scores in improvement of psychiatric symptoms as well as in reduction of their self-care deficits within one year Effects of the GC on subsystem B were evident soon after its establishment, for example, by the increasing cooperation between the gerontopsychiatric health services and general hospitals in the region with GC, in which (hospitals) two fifths of all clinical gerontopsychiatric patients with a mental disorder as the main diagnosis (ICD-9) are treated.	3.937485651735267
An effect of the GC on subsystem C is possibly the fact that in its region the rate of direct transfers of patients from the clinical gerontopsychiatric department into homes for the elderly is significantly lower than in the region without GC.	4.123398764971312
One approach to verify these interactions can be seen in stress research.	3.502706820872081
While the phenomenon of stress-induced changes in immunological processes is widely accepted, more recent studies focus on possible moderators and mechanisms of these responses.	3.2342504573374726
Within this research strategy it became evident that catecholamine increases upon stress are of a major importance for the frequently observed mild leukocytosis.	3.2812497442299287
The present study was conducted to investigate whether the often observed stress-induced increases in the number of peripheral lymphocyte subsets depends on the amount of epinephrine or norepinephrine release.	3.906794301853801
Moreover, the question was addressed whether high or low catecholamine release is related to subjective ratings on discomfort.	2.872512982631755
Using a "public speaking paradigm" we were able to replicate previous findings of high increases in the absolute number of CD8+ and CD56+ cells in peripheral blood.	3.203581515418541
Moreover, when dividing subjects into high and low catecholamine responders, the amount of change was significantly larger in catecholamine responders irrespective of whether norepinephrine or epinephrine was used for grouping the subjects.	3.072182393627769
However, high and low catecholamine responders did not differ with respect to subjective ratings on discomfort.	3.294613370328772
The data are discussed with respect to underlying mechanisms in catecholamine-induced lymphocyte migration and possible reasons for the mismatch between objective and subjective indicators of stressor efficacy.	3.262342929648681

A 34-year-old male (190 cm/100 kg) was scheduled for surgery of the nasal septum.	3.4988974317918284
He had had uneventful anaesthesia for appendicectomy 14 years earlier: following 600 mg thiopentone, 180 mg suxamethonium and up to 2 vol.% halothane for 20 min had been used and no symptoms of malignant hyperthermia (MH) were recorded.	2.880218505331505
Endotracheal intubation was accomplished easily [9], and the patient was ventilated manually in a semi-closed circle system until spontaneous ventilation resumed.	3.6388517226727792
Enflurane (1.5% for 5 min, 1.0% for 10 min, and 0.8% until the diagnosis of MH was suspected) was given in 33% O2/66% N2O.	3.807934427638286
Seventy minutes after induction it was noted that the spontaneous respiratory rate and minute volume had risen continuously from 10/min and 6 l/min, respectively, to 20/min and 12 l/min.	3.639628185030707
Attempts at deepening anaesthesia with repeated doses of fentanyl up to a total dose of 0.95 mg failed to reduce the hyperventilation.	3.5642156170293005
In spite of a high fresh gas flow of 6 l/min and assisted manual ventilation, the FIO2 started to fall from 0.34 to 0.28 at 10:20 a.m.	3.0700678182618852
The O2/N2O ratio was changed to 1 : 1, but the FIO2 remained at 0.3.	3.8409118285770614
MH was suspected, enflurane was discontinued, and an arterial blood gas analysis was done (Table 2).	3.835614232334521
When marked acidosis and hypercarbia were found, dantrolene 2.5 mg/kg was given, the operation was terminated, and the patient's trachea was extubated and he was monitored closely in the intensive care unit for 24 h. Vital signs were stable (Table 3) and no further complications were observed.	3.71808438131158
The patient did not mention pain or uneasiness postoperatively.	2.7312986590805934
About 6 months later, a muscle biopsy was done according to the European MH Protocol [5] and the patient was found to be MHEh.	4.318698132838201
In this case five main reasons for the hypercarbia and mixed acidosis must be considered (Table 1).	2.9056571151881783
Firstly, hypoventilation does not seem to be reasonable as the patient was ventilated with 8 to 12 l/min, which is within the range of 80 - 120 mg/kg - min.	4.386679483447307
Secondly, we can exclude shock and hypoperfusion because the patient had a normal blood pressure and heart rate (within 65 - 90 beats/min), his fingertips and skin were well perfused, his body temperature was 37  °C, and there was no sign of muscle rigidity.	3.5559512718044948
Thirdly, a defect of the CO2 adsorber as well as CO2 admixture to the N2O and O2 ventilation gases can cause hypercarbia.	3.634730857490471
We use two absorbers in sequence of which one is changed every day, and found neither a change in colour of the indicator nor an abnormally raised temperature of the absorbers [11].	3.2044324842278655
A postoperative check of the ventilator showed no defect in the O2/N2O supply and a correctly functioning anaesthesia apparatus.	2.9452523748589075
A malfunction of both CO2 absorbers resulting in intraoperative hypercarbia could not explain a postoperative mixed acidosis lasting for more than 6 h. Anaesthesias performed at the same time using soda lime from the same canisters were totally uneventful.	3.5145770393860145
It is concluded that the hypercarbia and mixed acidosis were caused by hypermetabolism.	2.7426427264636875
A thorough postoperative examination by an internist did not reveal any thyroid, pulmonary, endocrine, or circulatory reason for our intra- and postoperative findings.	3.29853902944679
Iatrogenic factors like superficial anaesthesia or systemic side effects of adrenaline admixture to local anaesthetics can cause hypermetabolism without striking clinical signs, but they do not cause mixed acidosis lasting longer than 6 h (Table 2).	3.327734484512954
The most suitable explanation in this case is an abortive form of MH.	3.4131350821758244

Definition of the problem: Is it the brain that makes a human being a person?	3.1968219860502236
This anthropological question has been raised because of the findings of modern human brain research, and there are severe ethical consequences anew: If the appropriate anthropological answer is yes, then all invasive research would be problematic, because one would touch the basis of human essence.	3.5069320195506823
The problem is that the two major philosophical paradigms that offer an answer to the anthropological question, dualism and monism, have opposing concepts.	2.935567827434123
Arguments: This paper argues that the error of these two paradigms is that they understand the human body and the human mind as 'res' - as things.	3.494411269680577
The explanation of the human being as an interactive unit of body and mind is impossible in both paradigms.	3.6058783297329637
A third anthropological view that tries to make that understandable is the anthropology of the Hebrew Bible.	2.6934370638013867
It does assume the category 'thing' while speaking about humans, it presumes the category 'aspect'.	2.7839482016606807
There is no Hebrew word for 'mind' in contrast to 'body' or vice versa.	2.732428490617684
The biblical language only knows terms for the unity of human beings seen under a certain aspect.	3.060526467655318
Conclusion: Here, the body and thus the brain are important and necessary condition for human essence, but this is not a sufficient explanation for the human personality.	3.93732252662441
Invasive research on the human brain is here neither generally forbidden nor tolerated - one has to demonstrate in every single case whether the planned operation touches regions that are crucial for the personality of the human subject.	3.4133610341800034

In 11 children the ureter was not visualized preoperatively.	2.753319497354732

The aim of our study was to evaluate the use of finite-element models (FEM) for the assessment of mandibular deformation under mechanical loading.	3.002733754397011
Explanted human mandibles (n = 5) were investigated by strain gauges to determine the individual strain distribution under mechanical loading.	3.7520187750730636
Our study demonstrates only minor interindividual differences in the strain distribution for each load studied.	3.180533592079588
The mechanical response in terms of deformation was found to depend mainly on gross geometrical properties and to a minor extent on the various other variables.	3.7939428694490824
At all positions the maximum principal strain was tensile, the minimum principal strain was compressive, and the absolute strain values were correlated with the magnitude of the applied force.	3.646168962803532

The efficacy of radiotherapy is dose dependent.	3.084483517776994

Registration of fetal heart beats was generally successful from the 20/21th week of gestation onwards.	3.36339427228906
In a few cases, fetal heart beats could be registered as early as in the 16th week.	3.460594280021046
Cardiac time intervals and amplitudes of fMCG increased concordantly with fetal growth.	2.906188744539162
Mean P wave duration increased from 31 to 49 ms (p < 0.05), PQ interval from 95 to 107 ms (n. s.) and QRS duration from 36 to 52 ms (p < 0.01).	2.9313719603540926
