Joints are innervated by nociceptive nerve fibres (nociceptors), which are only activated by tissue-damaging stimuli.	3.5226873702619463
This activation causes pain in conscious humans.	3.1461237953587298
The sensory terminals of many nociceptors in the tissue are sensitized by inflammatory processes.	3.1787956440302185
Under these conditions, normally innocuous and non-painful stimuli are sufficient to activate nociceptors and to elicit pain.	3.0444299553987118
The effect of inflammatory mediators such as bradykinin and prostaglandins is important for the process of sensitization.	3.352597847893172
In addition to their sensory function, many nociceptors have an efferent function.	3.0390135707790686
They evoke a neurogenic inflammation by the release of neuropeptides such as substance P and calcitonin gene-related peptide into the tissue.	2.945464294211407

Various risk scores have been developed for the assessment of operative risk in cardiac surgery.	4.398743384852902
Although risk stratification has been acknowledged as a useful tool to analyze trends in therapy and changes in patient populations, its relevance in assessing the indication for surgery has been questioned.	3.828738552856223

Between September 1998 and February 1999 all adult patients undergoing heart surgery were prospectively scored according to the following scores: initial Parsonnet, Cleveland Clinic, French, Euro, Pons, and the Ontario Province Risk score.	3.2923044607549032
Early lethality was assessed within 30 days postoperatively.	3.2699764236062445
Follow-up was completed in 504 patients.	2.9545886845692393

Mean scores of surviving and deceased patients showed a broad overlap with high standard deviations.	3.4762823935075082
Preoperative risk scores are effective tools for stratification of patient populations and the analysis of surgical outcome.	3.633155032772235
With the aid of risk scores, operative risk can be sufficiently predicted for patient populations or subpopulations.	3.4724277421679153
The Euro score best predicted the outcome of our patients.	3.973446211558066
However, when the indication for surgery is to be determined in an individual patient, risk scores should be only considered as an orientation in the decision process.	4.368077465404456

Conclusions: Location and hepatic and renal disease are the most important risk factors, while diabetes is probably of less significance than previously suggested.	4.026828188736932
Patients with end-stage liver disease frequently develop combined coagulopathies due to increased procoagulant and fibrinolytic turnover as well as thrombocytopenia.	3.2864721659905376
The onset of clinical symptoms of a haemorrhagic diathesis requires balanced substitution of coagulation factors, since fresh frozen plasma alone does not always maintain a sufficient haemostatic potential in these patients.	3.0248171269456408
This substitution commonly follows standard rules based on the assumption that 0.5 - 1 IU of a coagulation factor or inhibitor concentrate given per kg body weight will increase its endogenous activity by 1%.	3.2336457497270574
We set out to investigate the validity of this standard regime in patients with end-stage liver disease scheduled for orthotopic liver transplantation.	3.8628519529132577
Fifty-one adult patients were prospectively studied.	3.498498665849771
In 37 patients with antithrombin III (AT III) activity <70%, an AT III preparation (Kybernin, Behring, Marburg, Germany) was given preoperatively (mean dose 2616 +/- 207 IU) following standard calculations in order to increase endogenous activity to 80%.	3.0578749605054742
Twenty-seven of the patients had chronic hepatic failure (CHF group) with histologically proven cirrhosis and 10 had acute hepatic failure (AHF group).	3.4747825501156235
Blood samples were drawn prior to a 15-min infusion of AT III concentrate and 30 min thereafter.	3.105565702245346
In 14 patients with prothrombin time (PT) <40%, AT III levels had been corrected earlier during the clinical course to achieve activities >70%.	2.9055468457309055
Prothrombin complex (PPSB, Beriplex, Behring, Marburg, Germany) was substituted (mean dose 2304 +/- 289 IU) to increase procoagulant activity to PT >60%.	2.68163467546081
Blood samples were drawn in the same fashion as in the AT III group.	3.6551882823802164
The amounts of AT III and PPSB concentrates ( AT III, [IU/kg];  PPSB [IU/kg]) required to increase AT III activity and PT, respectively, by 1% were calculated.	3.582164502420498
Standard calculations for AT III substitution indicated AT III recovery in all 37 patients who received AT III concentrate.	3.1649997950887405
However, there was a statistically significant difference between patients with CLF and ALF.	3.7705251926927335
In patients with CLF,  AT III was found to be 0.8 IU/kg ( +/- 0.1 SEM) and in those with ALF it was 1.5 IU/kg ( +/- 0.1 SEM) (P<0.05,  t-test).	3.213489417579077
In patients treated with PPSB concentrate,  PPSB was 1.6 U/kg ( +/- 0.2 SEM) for both CLF and ALF groups.	3.2058914980197906
In patients with end stage liver disease standard rules for substitution with AT III-concentrate are adequate only for patients with CLF.	3.3393731725050992
In patients with ALF higher AT III doses are required to achieve the expected effect on endogenous AT III activity.	3.110679127201248
Procoagulant activity, as reflected by PT, can be increased by 1% when 1.6 IU/kg PPSB concentrate is given.	3.341917195034954
However, this study shows the effects of coagulation concentrates only 30 min after administration.	4.007501985934956
An increased volume of distribution and increased turnover may explain the poor recovery of AT III activity in the ALF group, indicating that the dose of coagulation concentrate should be estimated against the background of the patient's clinical symptoms and diagnosis.	3.669583781200593

Rapid exhaustion and reduced exercise tolerance leads to difficulties in maintaining a normal daily life for many patients.	2.937754490692761
Regular resting and short breaks can help to compensate this to a  certain degree.	3.6107016390113222

Fractures of the proximal radius in children may lead to deformities of the radial head and functional disturbance of pro- and supination.	4.007255620553378
However, traumatization is not only caused by the injury itself, but may also occur secondary to surgical reduction, manipulation of fracture fragments and excessive physiotherapy.	3.696674631801788
In a prospective long-term follow-study (2-20 years after trauma) of 38 children with displaced proximal radius fractures we found functional disturbances in 11 % of children only.	3.4250606448859524
These were not caused by radial head deformities, which were present on 83 % of follow-up radiographs.	3.8766761465093666
Functional impairment was mainly seen after open reduction or secondary growth disturbances.	3.4369520424245024

Purpose: The temporomandibular joint is a place of motion where release of proinflammatory cytokines like interleukin-1 (IL-1) induces cartilage destruction via production of nitric oxide (NO).	2.9641655118667565
The purpose of this study was to evaluate the effects of continuous passive motion in the form of cyclic stretch on the synthesis of inducible nitric oxide synthase (iNOS).	2.8397677362593323
Methods: Articular chondrocytes were harvested from rabbit cartilage slices and cultured in F12 medium supplemented with 10% fetal calf serum.	2.774399805853369
Subsequently, cells (105/ml per well) were transferred to Flexercell plates, grown to 90% confluency, and subjected to one of the following regimens: (1) no mechanical strain (10 Hz, 20% elongation rate); (2) rhIL-1 (1 ng/ml); (3) mechanical strain; (4) mechanical strain and rhIL-1.	3.8037374512467386
The cells were exposed to cyclic stretch for 24 h. Thereafter, cells were trypsinized and centrifuged on microscope slides in a cytospin centrifuge.	2.846988142885145
The presence of iNOS was determined by indirect immunoperoxidase staining using polyclonal rabbit anti-iNOS as primary antibodies, and goat anti-rabbit IgG conjugated with horseradish peroxidase (HRP) as secondary antibodies.	2.688685287746602
Diaminobenzidine was used as substrate for HRP.	3.7056122699653655
Total NO production was spectrophotometrically measured in the supernatants of cultures using Greiss reaction.	2.8876816817221527
All experiments were done in triplicates and the statistical significance was analyzed by Student's t-test.	3.3574141785360703
Results: Cells with treatment 1 and 3 did not exhibit presence of iNOS.	3.54067558228542
IL-1-treated cells in group 2 exhibited intense peroxidase staining.	4.263163602537921
Cells in group 4 exposed to IL-1 and mechanical stress showed staining with considerably less intensity.	3.1104749943221095
Conclusion: Our findings suggest that continuous passive motion exerts anti-inflammatory effects on chondrocytes, downregulating the quantity of iNOS -positive cells.	2.9518842040796853
Since NO acts as an intracellular, transcellular, and cytotoxic molecule, it has a basic importance for proper post-traumatic and postoperative TMJ function as well as the course and therapy of inflammatory TMJ diseases.	3.928897129396494
Recently, we presented an implantable piezoelectrical hearing aid transducer.	2.951863694984873
Its characteristics make it suitable for implantation in patients with sensorineural hearing loss.	3.8062086392496344
The transducer transmits micromechanical vibrations instead of sound into the hearing organ.	2.8506970073612448
After determining preoperative (acoustical) BERA threshold, the middle ear was opened and the piezoelectrical transducer coupled to various ossicles or the perilymph.	3.132081403853412
BERA responses were recorded following stimulation of umbo, long incus process, stapes head, stapes foot plate, and vestibulum.	2.912551293349865

Generalized granuloma annulare is a rare variant of granuloma annulare affecting the trunk and extremities with a multitude of lesions.	3.5178645523939696
In contrast to localized granuloma annulare, generalized granuloma annulare occurs in older patients, shows a stronger association with diabetes, and is characteristically chronic.	3.4250448119222194
Like our 55-year-old patient, most patients present with papules and annular plaques; less often, macular or non-annular lesions may be encountered.	3.2124054493256424
Histology often fails to show necrobiotic or necrotic connective tissue changes demarcated by a palisading granuloma.	2.836537177082988
Instead, there are diffuse dermal, band-like or nodular aggregations of histiocytes intermingled with some multinucleated giant cells and a predominantly lymphocytic infiltrate in the periphery.	3.0365310489617716
Because of its special characteristics, it has been suggested that generalized granuloma annulare might constitute a separate disease entity and that it should be classed among the primary cutaneous histiocytoses as a diffuse dermal histiocytosis.	3.2631760489631083
Using immunohistochemistry to determine the macrophage phenotype of the lesional histiocytes, we have shown that generalized granuloma annulare is not a cutaneous histiocytosis.	4.368538018039718
Neither MS-1 high-molecular-weight protein, a new specific marker for cutaneous non-Langerhans cell histiocytoses, nor CD1a, the well-known marker for Langerhans cells and Langerhans cell histiocytoses, is expressed by the lesional histiocytes of our patient.	3.080282240974998
In contrast, the antigen expression pattern was diagnostic for non-infectious granulomas and was highly similar to that in localized granuloma annulare.	3.1779424246985224
In contrast to the successful treatment of localized granuloma annulare reported with intralesional interferon -1, systemic treatment with interferon -2b (9x106 units three times a week) was ineffective.	3.3397059850130213
The aims of the study were: (1) to predict reversal time from intensive atracurium blockade; and (2) to determine the optimal time of neostigmine administration during recovery from atracurium blockade, i.e., the time at which the administration of neostigmine results in the shortest total recovery time (time from administration of last supplemental dose of atracurium to train-of-four [TOF] ratio 0.70), and at the same time results in the shortest time from administration of neostigmine to TOF ratio 0.70.	3.7255609197021355
The spontaneous and neostigmine-facilitated recovery in 52 healthy women anaesthetised with thiopentone, fentanyl, droperidol, and nitrous oxide was followed.	2.9442312076884223
Post-tetanic count (PTC) of TOF stimulation of the ulnar nerve and mechanomyography were used for monitoring neuromuscular transmission.	3.170276476684032
The neuromuscular blockade was induced with atracurium 0.6 mg/kg and supplemental doses of 0.15 mg/kg were given when the first twitch response in the TOF (TH1) had recovered to 20%.	3.4983489682880347
Neostigmine 0.036 mg/kg body weight was given at different levels of neuromuscular blockade to 37 of the patients.	4.026175871345606
Multiple regression analyses including pre-reversal time (time from administration of the last atracurium dose to neostigmine administration), PTC, weight, and age of the patients suggest that pre-reversal time is the best predictor of reversal time: reversal time=27.3 min-(0.89xpre-reversal time [min]; (SEE=6.0 min).	3.0389764530702585
If pre-reversal time is unknown, PTC can be used: reversal time=24 min-(4.5xln PTC) at time of reversal); (SEE=6.8 min).	3.370833429198676
Total recovery time was 47 min (SEM=2.0 min, n=15) in the patients allowed to recover spontaneously, and 29 min (SEM=1.2 min, n=29) in the patients reversed by neostigmine; the difference of 18 min (SE diff 2.0 min) was significant (P<0.0005).	3.823133151701232
The level of blockade indicated by PTC (1 - 24) at the time of reversal had no influence on the total recovery time.	4.066672555854489
The spontaneous recovery times from reappearance of TH1 and TH1=10% to TOF ratio 0.70 were 29.2 min (SEM=1.7 min) and 24.4 min (SEM=2.6 min), respectively.	3.0900287363126107
The results suggest that pre-reversal time is the strongest predictor of reversal time when neostigmine is administered during intense atracurium blockade.	2.617222934646264
To achieve the optimal time-saving effect, neostigmine must be given 18 min (the time saved by giving neostigmine) plus 7 to 11 min (needed for neostigmine to reach its peak effect), giving a total of 25 to 29 min before TOF ratio 0.70.	3.1304783746856133
As TH1 is between 1% and 10% 25 to 29 min before TOF ratio 0.70 is reached during spontaneous recovery, the optimal level of neuromuscular blockade for neostigmine administration in atracurium blockade is when TH1 is between 1% and 10%.	2.6541217557784647
Reversal time can be predicted as 27.3 min-(0.89xpre-reversal time (min), and the optimal time of neostigmine administration in atracurium blockade appears to be when TH1 is 1% - 10%.	3.4009928496615447

Prerequisite is an accurate evaluation of the indication, including CT and MRI to assess the involvement of the intervertebral disc and the ligamental structures.	4.947905690849964
The operative technique differs in some details from the procedure in moremulti-level instrumentations, especially concerning the application of the pedicle screws.	3.1794254102610098
The instrumentation is always combined with posterior allogenic bone grafting.	3.1507846655191076
Since the beginning of 1993 we also perform anterior autogenic transpedicular bone grafting.	2.96568067532059
Between Januar 1991 and July 1995, 57 one-level stabilizations with the MSF were performed.	3.1268609414765667
Of the 57 patients operated on 39, 27 men and 12 women, with an average age of 41 years, have had a clinical and radiographic follow-up examination so far, on average, 27 months after the accident.	4.034708540967818
Seventeen patients were completely free of pain and 17 patients (were only) sensivite to weather changes or had minor pain during great physical stress.	3.1354333803389056
Five patients had pain even during slight physical stress or at rest.	3.096028493486891
The patients' range of motion was normal.	3.2183444069202993
Only five minor complications have been seen.	3.7831067345938028
No implant fatigue failure has been noted in this series.	3.340768423930498
We derive from these results that, for correct indications, one-level stabilization can be performed successfully and should be firmly established in the operative treatment of unstable fractures of the thoracolumbar spine.	4.017179064980931

Ages of the patients were 9, 36 and 74 years.	4.415588893098828
All patients suffered from a frequent epistaxis and all were extremely sensitive to the slightest nasal touch.	3.247931999361618

In a population-based study of 110 women between 53 and 82 years of age (mean age 64.5 +/- 7.9 years) static posturography data were compared to functional items of gait and balance in common geriatric mobility scales.	3.1424719641512615
Posturographic data of double-stance with eyes open and eyes closed (DSEO; DSEC) did not differ from those of a group of healthy women previously tested for intact nervous system function.	3.2615142977658707
The total neuromuscular score - roughly corresponding to the well-known Tinetti score - did not correlate to the posturographic measures.	3.1932546031994367
DSEC correlated with the items "rapid walking" and "single-stance left leg".	3.600009167120763
Age, vision, and neuropsychologic test results correlated with DSEO, "rapid walking", "single-stance right leg", "single-stance left leg", and "walking a figure eight".	2.9276819707094597
Multiple linear regression confirmed the impact of age, vision, DSEO, and DSEC on "rapid walking" with a 34% variance explanation.	3.3362206083639254
Posturographic parameters did predict other selected gait and balance items.	3.207955800426869
When used in older women living independently in the community, parameters of static posturography reflect to some extent the functional disabilities of gait and balance.	3.1450622030327993

Eighty-five patients with grade 2 or grade 3 sprains of the acromioclavicular (AC) joint were evaluated clinically and radiographically 32 months after injury.	3.388364390715258
Group I included 34 patients with grade 2 sprains (Tossy II) and group II included 51 patients with grade 3 injuries (Tossy III).	3.334135343604334
In group I, 15 patients were treated surgically (group I a) and 19 patients were treated conservatively (group I b), while in group II, 41 patients were treated surgically (group II a) and 10 patients were treated conservatively (group II b).	4.196392297443471
At surgery open reduction and transarticular fixation of the AC joint with Kirschner wires was performed.	3.5515623638291727
Conservative treatment included the initial use of a sling or a knapsack bandage and early performance of range-of-motion exercises.	3.2687460514201385
Shoulder function was assessed according to the score devised by Constant and Murley.	3.810765973786892
In both groups, 97 of 100 possible points (minimum 72, maximum 100) were obtained after conservative and after surgical treatment.	3.1705565123108372
Nine of 10 patients (90%) with grade 3 sprains (group IIb) had more pronounced displacement and increased mobility of the lateral end of the clavicle after conservating treatment.	3.4888303675912207
After surgery, dislocation and increased horizontal, mobility of the lateral end of the clavicle occurred in 18 (44%) of 41 patients with grade 3 sprains (group II a P<0.0001).	3.439643796810274
At follow-up there was a significant increase in degenerative changes seen on radio-graphs (P<0.035) in all patients.	3.201485990789939
Again these findings did not correlate with the functional outcome.	3.457308620834341
More degenerative radiological changes were observed in patients who had undergone surgery (P<0.003).	4.2050391552645925
Patients with grade 2 sprains were more frequently restricted in sporting activity after surgery (P<0.05).	2.9839185113633264
Patients with grade 3 sprains who were treated surgically complained of pain more frequently (P<0.01), and they returned to work later than patients who were treated conservatively after grade 3 sprains.	4.4059742118228575
An additional rehabilitation program guided by a physiotherapist seemed to have no impact on the functional outcome.	3.531530077573336

Macular amyloidosis (MA) and lichen amyloidosus (LA) are the two major variants of the primary cutaneous amyloidoses which present with severe and therapy resistent itching.	3.794712297143525
Recently, in a few case reports authors have observed encouraging beneficial clinical effects by using topical dimethyl sulphoxide (DMSO).	3.0841171545640633
In our study 10 patients with either MA or LA or biphasic amyloidosis were treated with a 50% solution of DMSO in water.	3.5329669210536205
9 of them showed marked clinical improvement at the end of 6-20 weeks of treatment.	3.9255190365341877
Degranulation and depletion of the mast cells by DMSO is the most probable explanation for the rapid improvement of itching beginning within the first week of therapy.	3.9670771544595578
Remarkable flattening of the lichenoid papules which was obtained within 11 weeks of treatment is interpreted as a result of the improvement of itching and the related scratch effect.	4.040314980914336
Histological examination after treatment revealed no disappearance of amyloid deposits in the papillary dermis.	3.147549651559444
In the follow-up period relapses of itching and papules were observed.	3.12786417959449
Therefore further studies are needed to find out the optimal procedure of therapy.	3.8620433389951154
As early as 1974, Brian advocated the prone position for ventilated patients [5].	2.9548088106443333
He suggested that this position might enhance ventilation of the dorsal parts of the lungs, thereby improving oxygenation.	3.9187006388254164
These considerations have been confirmed by several experimental and clinical studies [1, 6, 13, 17].	3.869440617272659
However, the prone position never became very popular in the clinical treatment of the adult respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS).	3.034993782258018
Routine performance of thoracic CT scans in ARDS patients demonstrated preferential distribution of pathological densities in the dependent lung areas.	3.005346677299362
The prone position therefore could possibly benefit these patients, as shown by two recent studies [8, 11].	3.9374257352532003
The aim of our study was to evaluate the influence of repeatedly turning the patient to the prone position on gas exchange and thoracic CT findings in multiple-trauma patients.	2.830887894649201
Seven ventilated intensive care patients with severe ARDS (Murray Score >2.5 [9], Quotient >0.7 [4], mean airway pressure >18 cm H2O, thoracic CT scan showing dorsal atelectases) were included in the study.	3.341589931974474
Patients were turned from the supine to the prone position at 12-h intervals using an air-cushion bed (Mediscus, Austria).	2.929822345203662
Redistribution of dystelectatic or atelectatic dependent lung areas was verified by means of repeated thoracic CT scans (Figs.	3.4925477161533887
The patients were intermittently turned for 6.5  +/-  1.1 days.	2.8230068700895448
The course of gas exchange is shown in Figs.	3.172131910502661
Initially, improvement of the respiratory quotient could only be achieved during prone positioning, from the 2nd day in the supine position as well.	4.145326310356241
Intrapulmonary shunting showed a similar trend (Figs.	3.228540957034154
No significant changes in cardiovascular parameters could be observed.	3.150840104503599
Control thoracic CT scans showed uniform reduction of atelectases in dependent lung areas (Figs.	3.198999681751362
The inspiratory fraction of oxygen could be reduced significantly as of the 2nd day (Fig.	3.4611426335134774
Constant levels of positive end-expiratory pressure and tidal volume were associated with decreasing mean and plateau airway pressures (Fig.	3.093630192546821
Repeatedly turning the patient to the prone position produced long-lasting improvement of arterial oxygenation, which persists up to the end of the weaning process.	3.7137867802710667
This is in good accordance with other studies [1, 2, 6, 8, 11, 13, 17], however, this is the first study to report an observation period of more than 6 days of repeatedly turning the patient.	3.7078817937795843
These positive effects on gas exchange can be attributed to sudden improvement of the ventilation-perfusion ratio within the lung areas that become dependent after turning to the prone position.	3.082408402025897
Due to reduced hydrostatic pressure [11] and relative hyperventilation [7, 16], previously collapsed alveoli are recruited in the lung areas that become non-dependent after turning to the prone position.	2.666910323144204
After a gynecological operation under therapy with unfractionated and low molecular weight heparin, a 63 year old patient developed right-sided ascending pelvic thrombosis with multiple pulmonary embolism and infarction pneumonia, septic-toxic circulatory failure, and thrombocytopenia.	3.219662151346103
Heparin-associated thrombocytopenia (HAT) type II was diagnosed.	3.0763751825513395
Because of contraindications against thrombolysis a cava-filter was implanted, heparin therapy was stopped, and anticoagulation with recombinant hirudin was started.	2.9657462825858656
Inspite of this, an arterial thrombosis of the A. femoralis superficialis developed and had to be treated surgically.	4.180827664898047
From this time on, no further thromboembolic complications were noticed.	3.1584740652722894
Overlapping coumarin therapy was begun.	3.3104712346811302
Due to ubiquitous coumarin-necrosis, rapid progressive toxic circulatory failure with disseminated intravascular coagulation (DIC) developed two days after terminating hirudin therapy necessitating high dose catecholamine therapy.	2.6503854912878215
A second course of hirudin resulted in complete restitution of the coumarin-necrosis without the need for re-operation.	2.9664826300493154
Subsequent coumarin-therapy, which was gradually increased over two weeks, was without further complications.	3.9083131669536524
Thus, hirudin appears to be a new and safe alternative to a therapy with the heparinoid danaparoid in HAT type II with fulminant thromboembolic complications and especially in coumarin-necrosis with critical septic-toxic circulatory failure and DIC.	3.2274257838324583
A prospective process-analysis evaluating organizational, medical and medical-technical alterations and real-time-documentation during out-of-hospital resuscitations (n=71) was performed due to the definitions of the "Utstein-Style".	3.3876773195590095
The gaseous radical nitric oxide (NO) is catalyzed by conversion of L-arginine to L-citrulline by one cytokine inducible form (iNOS), which becomes active only within hours after the inducing event, and by two constitutively expressed forms, endothelial (eNOS) and neuronal (nNOS), which are regulated by the cytosolic concentration of free Ca2+.	3.050695932280612
Brain nNOS is physiologically present in discrete populations of neurons, which are all excited by glutamate via the ionotropic N-methyl-D-aspartate (NMDA) receptor, which controls a Ca2+ channel.	2.726642910619419
After its diffusion into the extraneuronal space, NO may activate in neurons, which as a rule do not stain for NOS, soluble guanylyl cyclase and formation of cGMP as an intracellular messenger.	2.767194492134992
Beyond that, NO is important as a feedback regulator of glutamatergic excitation.	3.2383814089279253
NO as a nitrosylating agent enhances disulfide bonding of vicinal sulfhydryl (thiol) groups of the redox modulatory site of the NMDA receptor complex and thereby down-regulates its Ca2+ channel activity.	2.6370183370834672
Histochemically studies have revealed the presence of large number of NOS containing neurons in the magnocellular and parvocellular subdivisions of hypothalamic nuclei.	3.4970044784116228
Numerous studies conform to the view that NO participates in the control of many different neurosecretory processes, especially of the corticotropin-releasing hormone (CRH) neurosecretory system.	3.10093958584686
The redox-modulatory site of the NMDA receptor appears, therefore, as a critical structure in the control of the hypothalamic-pituitary-adrenocortical (HPA) axis.	2.922828163429314
Moreover, glucocorticoids augment neuronal excitotoxicity by increasing the expression of glutamate receptors and inhibition of glutamate reuptake.	2.993556250378995
In attempting to explain the many conflicting results obtained in studies with NO, it may be worthwhile to consider that the actual redox-environment of distinct loci of the brain may determine the final function of NO, acting either as a transmitter or neuromodulator or, in the worst case, causing neurodestruction.	3.3966587940270125
It seems likely that any kind of stress by altering the ratio of reduced vs oxidized thiols within the central nervous system influences neuronal excitability, with NO working either as an amplifier or as a feedback regulator of neuronal excitation or inhibition, which may alter acutely or chronically, among others, the homeostasis of a given neurosecretory system.	3.0205945955349494

Humeral shaft fractures can be treated either conservatively or operatively.	4.068137750974002
Plating of the humerus is the established operative method, but recently interest has also been focussed on intramedullary nailing.	3.575581199583899
Fifty-nine cases of humeral fractures treated with intramedullary nailing (Seidel/Marchetti-Vicenzi/Prévot) from January 1991 to December 1995 (44 fractures after trauma, 11 pathological fractures, 3 pseudarthroses, 1 re-fracture).	2.896754029744902
Closed reduction in 55/59 cases.	3.3543018682644963
No iatrogenic palsy of the radial nerve.	3.8676339332913168
Functional postoperative treatment in all 44 cases of humeral fractures after adequate trauma.	3.2641163427148996
Treatment of humeral shaft fractures by intramedullary nailing is favoured in our clinic (low complication rates, excellent or good functional results, limited approaches, small scars).	3.4891422298131123
Proximal fractures should be treated by the Seidel nail (stable interlocking of the proximal fragment); very distal fractures need Prévot nailing (reaming of condylar canals).	3.1692107914763903
Pathological fractures are an excellent indication for intramedullary stabilization.	3.5246443003211394
These patients benefit from stable fixation without intense surgical trauma.	3.033796352068141
Pseudarthrosis, according to our limited experience, seems to require plating plus bone grafting.	3.407752765030812
Plating is also recommended if revision of the radial nerve becomes necessary.	3.4931065338625347
2-4 % of vascular injuries need operative reconstruktion.	4.076781194721549
In polytraumatized patients the rate is even 10 %.	3.5163091795675614
Arterial vascular repair should precede venous reconstruction and orthopaedic stabilization due to limb threatening ischemia.	2.8730903149087883
Penetration or blunt vascular trauma result either in acute blood loss, ischemia or compartmental compression.	3.222712354275694
Reperfusion syndrom leads to vital threat of patient.	3.2134113236840007
Clinical assessment, measurement of limb pressures using a Doppler device and use of duplex ultrasonography are reliable adjuncts in the rapid evaluation.	3.219191984632198
Arteriography is rarely indicated and should be spared for patients with abnormal physical examination.	4.302736101318691
Minimizing ischemia (6-8 h) is an important factor in maximizing limb salvage.	4.028298967928917
Vascular repair include direct anastomosis or lateral suture repair mostly combined with primary shortening of the extremity.	3.2427344892852807
In most cases autogenous vein graft is required.	2.8887250131237128
Rethrombosis, arteriovenous fistula and pseudoaneurysms are possible complications.	3.2848180660364865
Stabilisation of the fracture has priority over vascular reconstruction.	3.932896150872101
The initial steps to success are surgical debridement, adequate bony stabilization mostly by external fixation, revascularisation of vascular injury, immediate fascial decompression and early soft-tissue reconstruction.	3.104148857072652
The best results are obtained when a multidiciplinary approach is used combining expertise in orthopedic surgery, vascular surgery and plastic surgery.	3.0707292599300677
In secondary prevention, statins are cost-effective and even more cost-effective than other lipid lowering drugs.	3.327127732442649
Statins are especially favorable in patients with previous myocardial infarction compared to those with angina pectoris.	4.0325785732889745
For secondary prevention of coronary heart disease, statins should be administered generously.	3.309876579614488
In primary prevention, statins are effective but not cost-efficient.	3.1786922665410486
For population based primary prevention, only dietary measures can be advocated; however, apart from a serious lack of compliance their efficiency has not yet been proven.	3.1952936082327
Preventive measures have their own prize; in general they are considered not to prevent coronary heart disease but retard it.	3.311574351200977
Therefore, such therapeutic interventions can be assumed not to reduce but rather to increase the "direct" medical costs.	3.5614408257636194
Furthermore, successful prevention of coronary heart disease leads, due to life-prolongation, to an increase in people out of work and in disabled patients due to age and/or disease.	3.961504997261471

A microphone constructed for implantation in the posterior wall of the auditory canal and a piezoelectric transducer serving as the main components of an implantable hearing aid were temporally implanted in five patients during middle ear surgery under local anesthesia.	3.334507542664422
The microphone was positioned beneath the skin of the auditory canal such that it completely covered the microphone membrane.	3.0890759736798654
The vibratory element of the transducer was coupled to the malleus in four patients with normal ossicular chains and directly to the stapes in one patient with missing incus.	3.646822841764134
The microphone and transducer were electrically connected with an external battery-driven signal amplifier.	2.955606304204857
Speech material and music were presented in the operation room at a sound level of 65 dB SPL under free-field conditions.	3.1990856752113563
The patients had to estimate the quality of speech, music, and their own voice as well as the effects of bone-conducting noises.	4.608743289570704
All patients were able to hear with the system.	2.9751340616852797
An intraoperative talk without vision contact was possible without any problems, as was understanding of numerals ("Freiburger Zahlentest").	2.9735007137776663
Perception of music was judged as "clear and undistorted with all broadband component."	2.9533649877427615
The estimation was also valid for one patient with a sensorineural hearing loss.	3.536817491696846
One patient declared the music to be "a little of unnatural."	3.7203573454271335
Bone-conducted sound was estimated as normal in two patients, better than without an implant in one patient with sensorineural hearing loss, and "somewhat metallic" in another patient.	3.8884695242899614
Hearing the own voice was considered "normal" in two cases "monotonous" in one case, and "a little bit roaring" in another case.	4.5830379783520705
An amplification factor that can be technically realized in an implantable hearing aid was necessary for one of the patients with sensorineural hearing loss to perceive music at a pleasant volume.	4.049914016630025
On the basis of this study, essential requirements for the construction of a fully implantable hearing aid are fulfilled.	3.89187022279391

This makes prognosis and decision-making difficult for conservative or operative treatment.	3.422808682179096
The authors attempt to provide some basis for decision-making by observing the individual course of neural dysfunction, consideration of morphometric data and the use of functional scores.	3.332442966232116
To advise a patient, the outcome of conservative and operative treatment as described in the literature has to be considered, as well as the possible complications.	4.735873274055116
The advantages and disadvantages of surgery from the anterior and posterior approach are discussed.	3.2037881111271287
Operative planning according to the individual condition is suggested.	4.119954500099071
Operative techniques of anterior decompression and fusion are contrasted to laminoplasties.	3.2300634488152613
Subject: In a 7;11 year old boy with trichotillomania (ICD-10 F63.3), attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) (ICD-10 F90.1), and subclinical minimal cerebral dysfunction, Methylphenidate (Ritalin) medication resulted in a remarkable improvement: unexspected interruption of trichotillomania with regrowth of hair.	3.4182087533714003
An essential feature of the known procedures for the analysis of the ECG signal is the splitting of the ECG into individual parameters which are subsequently processed in defined decision trees, neuronal networks or statistical procedures to diagnostic information.	3.3899308053593593
The correctness of the diagnostic statements thus substantially depends on the suitable selection and the exact determination of the individual criteria.	4.115603604540516
The analysis algorithm and the expert knowledge are closely linked due to the procedure.	3.673484508710863
This paper presents a new procedure or the evaluation of signals of medical sensor systems by the example of the ECG.	3.620295482585362
Unlike the methods used up to now, this procedure is not based on an ever more profound splitting of the ECG signal into individual features.	3.8827956969158253
Furthermore, analysis algorithm and knowledge base are separated from each other.	3.2040268940459478
The consideration underlying the procedure is that two ECGs whose leads show identical or very similar signal patterns indicate identical or at least very similar cardiological diagnoses.	3.1571865961676453
As this assumption is the basis of medical experience, it should be possible to compare the signal patterns of the leads of an unknown ECG with those of the leads of the reference ECGs from a database and to draw conclusions for the diagnosis of the unknown ECG.	3.857929283480817
For this purpose, those ECGs are searched in an ECG database whose leads show greatest agreement with the signal pattern of the unknown ECG.	2.7110931868719557
The function of the method was established with the aid of the ECG signal database CARDIODAT with 249 ECGs for the diagnostic groups: infarcts and healthy reference persons from a data inventory of 550 ECGs.	3.344850052979829
It can be seen from the results that the presented procedure which is based on signal pattern recognition is a new approach to deriving diagnostic information from the ECG signal at least for the diagnostic group of myocardial infarcts.	3.9815459330451
Purpose: The technical conditions, the optimized scanning protocols and the facilities of virtual endoscopy (VE) are presented in an overview.	2.997802548002204
During a 4-week ambulatory cardiacc rehabilitation program, 262 patients with coronary artery disease (CAD), 235 men and 27 women, 53.6+/-10.2 years, performed 30.5+/-2,9 exercise units.	2.9785435853653874
Before and after the rehabilitation program exercise, capacity was assessed by bicycle ergometry.	3.644653147025367
There was a significant (p<0.001) increase in the maximum exercise capacity at the end of the program (105.3+/-32.3 vs. 121.9+/-37.3 W).	3.3686460958231703
Physical work capacity on the 2.0 mmol lactate level improved (p<0.001) from 72.2+/-23.5 to 86.4+/-25.8 W, on the 2.5 mmol/l level (p<0.001) from 83.5+/-23.2 to 97.4+/-26.4 W, and on the 3.0 mmol/l level (p<0.001) from 93.1+/-23.0 to 106.6+/-26.1 W. Despite enhanced performance, heart rate remained unaltered on the 2.0, 2.5, and 3.0 mmol/l lactate level.	2.8155674886895823
Furthermore, ergometric performance on predefined heart rate levels was significantly (p<0.001) increased: 85/min: from 56.0+/-24.1 to 65.8+/-24.5 W; 90/min: from 62.0+/-27.3 to 71.2+/-26 W; 95/min: from 67.2+/-26.4 to 77.5+/-27.6 W; 100/min: from 71.1+/-29.6 to 80.6+/-28.1 W; 105/min: from 69.8+/-26.2 to 81.9+/-28.2 W and 110/min: from 73.6+/-28.9 to 90.4+/-29.4 W. The results demonstrate that physical performance in patients with CAD was improved by our novel ambulatory cardiac rehabilitation program.	3.0082388865326872
This improvement included an increase in maximum as well as endurance work capacity; furthermore, this increase was accompanied by a decrease in resting and exercise heart rates.	3.7680098204983756
The results demonstrate an absolute increase of physical performance, more importantly an increase of physical performance at defined lactate levels in the presence of unchanged heart rates mediated by the rehabilitation program.	3.770764491037647
Thus, this increase was independent of motivational factors in the patients and/or the investigators during the re-exercise test.	3.9564597852593986
The effects were independent of pharmacological influences (e.g., -receptor antagonists).	3.6753795538923857
These findings are of clinical importance with respect to reduction of myocardial oxygen consumption in patients with CAD.	4.8539252946072
Newborn screening programs for inborn errors of metabolism are well established in industrialized countries.	3.2131523429331628
Missed cases may be not only due to errors in specimen collection and laboratory errors but also to failures in adequate follow up.	3.218622943617388
We report the case of a now 4-year-old girl whose classical phenylketonuria was diagnostically missed in the course of follow-up procedures of a pathological screening result 1067 µmol/l 17,6 mg% phenylalanine.	3.2539356091535456
The separation of whole blood into components is the state-of-the-art in transfusion of allogeneic blood.	3.3182734702245664
The main reasons are the negative effects of the buffy coat and the need for FFP.	3.250492548574862
Nevertheless, especially in Germany whole blood is being rejected more and more even as autologous blood.	3.758431612858194
However, most of the negative effects of the buffy coat do not apply to autologous blood.	2.877202348573997
Additionally, these patients usually do not develop coagulation disorders and therefore do not need plasma as a hemostatic component.	3.199761810792586
On the other hand, separation into components of autologous blood leads to an increase of costs and to logistic problems that restrict autologous blood predeposit to a few institutions.	3.058416123981742
Therefore, we have reviewed the literature in order to find a scientific basis for this.	4.4799455486379145
In addition, all references were included that contributed relevant information to the topic.	2.9765496576722685
A total of 135 original articles, abstracts, reviews, letters or editorials were analysed that referred to standard preparations and storage media.	2.5804199697529557
In 48 papers the in vivo red cell survival was studied.	3.619717456856987
28 of which fulfilled the prerequisites to be included into a meta-analysis.	3.8480758548682936
The following in vitro parameters were also evaluated: pH, potassium load of the units, ATP and DPG concentration of the red cells.	3.3885360747921873
Whole blood (resuspended in CPDA-1) and red cell units (stabilized in CPDA-1 or additive solutions) with a different buffy coat or leucocyte content have comparable pH values and red cell 2,3-DPG and ATP concentrations at the end of the approved storage time.	3.2404435059666907
The potassium load of a whole blood unit appears to be higher than red cell concentrates, but this is to some extent caused by the higher plasma content of whole blood and is not thought to be a clinically relevant problem for patients receiving only a few units.	4.231495571229436
A number of studies demonstrate that dependent upon the leucocyte content of a red cell unit, leucocyte metabolites and enzymes are released and accumulate during storage.	2.7555077599742095
A detrimental influence on the integrity of the red cell membrane was found in several in vitro studies.	4.508869084308656
Nevertheless, a significant improvement in red cell survival by leucocyte reduction was detected by only one group.	3.8632057539794653
Undoubtedly, non-hemolytic febrile transfusion reactions (NHFTR) are generally caused by an antibody-antigen interaction due to the transfusion of allogeneic buffy coat.	3.7026724992315145
On the other hand, there is some evidence that non-specific immunological mechanisms such as the release of histamine or cytokines are also capable of causing NHFTR.	3.6355300351142015
Thus, these reactions are expected to occur in autologous blood transfusion.	3.5067413802021083
However, so far, there are no data about the frequency and severity of these reactions and whether they are more likely to emerge after transfusion of blood units with a particular preparation.	4.095733896174146
Blood transfusions can cause septic complications due to bacterial contamination of the transfused units.	2.988709950116074
These fatal but rare complications may be reduced by pre-storage filtration of blood, but there is no indication that buffy coat reduction is effective.	3.6024004965296257
Three cases with septic complications have been reported after autologous transfusion, in two of which red cell concentrates (at least one was free of buffy coat) had been used.	4.000574574712826
Thus, there is no justification for the conclusion that the risk of septic complications is increased by transfusion of whole blood.	4.10685308966379
After all, whole blood and red cell concentrates exhibit only minor differences in relevant in vitro parameters.	3.5195286070454017
Hence, a higher incidence of adverse effects following the transfusion of autologous whole blood compared to autologous red cell concentrations is unlikely.	3.3330144014180463
Therefore, the 24 h in vivo recovery is considered to be the most valid criterion to assess the quality of red cell preparations.	3.5954771475199045

The indications for magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) on prosthetic heart valve recipients remain critical.	2.6485389487109985
A generalized contraindication for MRI is doubtful.	3.211517146724879
MRI can directly affect patients with prosthetic valves in three ways by: 1) movement or dislodgment of the prosthesis, 2) heating, and 3) arrhythmias induced by electric currents, and indirectly by distortion of the image and its subsequent misinterpretation.	3.2709469084092735
Present literature that concerns the safety considerations of current values appears to be incomplete.	3.3950034872819894
Therefore, a survey of twenty-five valve manufacturers with regard to compatibility, safety or contraindication for MRI on their respective prosthetic heart valves was performed in 1998.	3.613687654330764
Those manufacturers who distribute most of the valves in Europe confirmed the safety of MRI.	3.7638564653127293
However, some gave their assurances based on inadequate data, or assigned all responsibility to the physician.	2.82821939092764

Two valve manufacturers warned against performing MRI on certain prostheses.	3.022104954528377
Based on our 1998 questionnaire, the technical issues, the clinical circumstances, the prerequisites and criteria for and the definition of safety standards for MRI on prosthetic heart valve recipients are presented in this paper.	3.4399440332471367
Argyrophilic grain disease (AGD) is a frequently occurring degenerative illness of the aging human brain.	3.671737245028866
It is accompanied by progressive pathological alterations of the cytsokeleton which are traceable to an abnormal phosphorylation of the microtubule associated tau protein.	3.0160187813613577
Histologically, it is possible with the help of suitable staining techniques to identify pathognomonic spindle-shaped cellular inclusions (argyrophilic grains).	3.5136535710292214
These cellular inclusions display a typical cortical as well as subcortical distribution pattern.	3.9937346356367547
The goal of the present study is the retrospective evaluation of the clinical findings from 53 individuals with neuropathologically demonstrable AGD-related changes of the brain.	4.102268291189594
Nearly one-half of the cases (49%) was classifiable as demented in accordance with DSM IV-criteria.	3.6968904389624404
Moreover, the frequency of the dementia increased significantly in relation to the growing severity of the AGD-associated pathological cytoskeletal degeneration.	3.4878206939168477
These results confirm the assumption that AGD can cause degenerative changes ranging from cognitive impairment all the way to dementia.	3.166526675994689
They also underscore the necessity of further prospective studies pertaining to the clinical aspects of this still enigmatic disease.	3.565658861357417

An epidural infusion of local anaesthetic combined with an opioid and adrenaline was given for a period of 5-7 days.	4.381779672986549

There was no clinical evidence of hematoma, abscess or permanent neurological damage.	2.873385046679788
Epidural analgesia works well in terms of analgesia, mobilization and patient satisfaction, bearing in mind the potential side effects and complications.	3.6582082558032356

Therefore, thin-section HRCT with bone window setting is the method of choice for the examination of the middle ear structures.	3.569565996432442

An immunohistochemical and morphometric study was performed on bone marrow biopsies in 604 patients with chronic myelogenous leukemia (CML) to compare morphological and clinical features and to evaluate effects of interferon (IFN) and chemotherapy.	3.9382762466932766
The latter was observed in about 28% of patients already at diagnosis.	3.6961948653359955
In a similar way, the frequency of CD68+ macrophages was correlated with the amount of Ret40f+ nucleated erythroid precursors, implicating an involvement of this cell lineage in iron turnover, hemoglobin synthesis, and degradation of the expelled nuclei from normoblasts.	3.2343532456516972
The (-D-galactosyl residue-expressing) Pseudo-Gaucher cells were detectable in 30% of pretreatment specimens.	3.1853173454376016
Moreover, significant associations were calculable between reduction in erythropoiesis or increase in fibers with clinical features such as hemoglobin level, percentages of myelo- and erythroblasts in the peripheral blood, and spleen size.	2.852714670421369
These variables are in keeping with more advanced stages of CML.	3.241101059930998
This simplified staging system was correlated with corresponding sets of hematological data.	3.210189115284616
Sequential biopsies in 173 patients with monotherapy by IFN, hydroxyurea (HU), or busulfan (BU) revealed a fibrogenic effect of IFN in contrast to a fiber-reducing property of HU.	2.966202069495614
The dynamics of myelofibrosis and changes of major cell lineages during treatment were readily demonstrable by calculating corresponding indices.	2.9896646168568095
These included the ratios between quantitative differences of corresponding variables at repeated examinations and time.	3.046776864661463
Thus, in patients with complete hematological remission following IFN administration, regeneration of erythropoiesis was found to be accompanied by an increase in the total number of CD68+ macrophages, including activated subpopulations.	3.7767856333459187
Histological subgroups showed a transition from a (nonfibrotic) granulocytic and megakaryocyte pattern to the myelofibrotic subtype in about 40% of patients.	3.031511399293187
This change was opposed to a numerical reduction in the myelofibrotic subtype which occurred in 17 patients (36%), but predominantly in those under HU therapy.	3.539847059327763
In conclusion, the striking heterogeneity of bone marrow features in CML warrants a careful morphological evaluation of trephine biopsies and appropriate means of processing to achieve relevant correlations with clinical data and, thus, allows a more elaborate insight into the dynamics of the disease process.	3.194488632491138

Long-lasting procedures should be abandoned in the emergency situation; in these severe cases, laparotomy should be aimed towards primary "damage control" and followed by definite surgery after stabilization of the patient.	3.436090357933213
Surgery of the great veins inevitably began with the surgical treatment of injuries, often involving the femoral vein.	3.9872920111734653
Because of the famous case presented by Roux in 1813, the prevailing opinion until almost the end of the nineteenth century was that ligation of the vein made death inevitable, but that the only way to control severe hemorrhaging from a vein was to ligate the femoral artery.	2.925357205622398
Zaufal's principle (1880) consisted in the ligation and resection of great veins of the body and limbs in order to prevent sepsis in suppurative processes.	3.7485919476262586
This surgical method was still being used in the first half of the twentieth century in patients with perforated appendicitis or puerperal fever.	4.798615281753762
In the limb, the congestion induced in the vein had a positve effect on the healing process.	3.334387226873245
The surgical treatment of leg and pelvic deep vein thrombosis was initially (1931) aimed at achieving decompression in compartment syndromas.	3.1133430813983645
The first thrombectomy was performed in 1937, but several operations with a successful outcome were reported at the 61st annual meeting of the German Society of Surgery in the following year.	3.870272304635146
Bilateral glomus jugulare tumors are rare.	3.359269297029582

Most frequently, PNS occur in association with small-cell lung, breast or ovarian carcinomas.	3.0600489938956374

Its histogenesis has been discussed controversially for a long time, including a possible origin in immature reticulum, myogenous, endothelial and undifferentiated mesenchymal cells.	3.4564928508658372
Repeated reports have also suggested a possible neuroectodermal genesis.	3.4384742349828996
Convincing arguments, however, have only been brought forward during recent years, since it was found that Ewing's sarcoma and malignant peripheral neuroectodermal tumor share a common chromosome translocation 11;22.	3.4707988417166384
In the meantime this hypothesis has been strengthened by numerous cell biological analyses.	2.966989658144131

Histological differential diagnosis of Ewing's sarcoma has been improved by immunohistological methods.	3.663510011191485

The diagnostics of Ewing's sarcoma and the malignant peripheral neuroectodermal tumor have considerably been enriched by the fact that the specific chromosome translocation t(11;22) can be proved molecular biologically.	3.3585795116375254

Given the shrinking public resources in Germany, managed care seems attractive for the German health system, too.	3.131849571193909
In this review the development of managed care, the principal elements, forms of organisation and practical tools are outlined.	3.462300791726091
The regulation of the delivery of care by means of controlling and financial incentives threatens the autonomy of physicians: the physician must act as a "double agent", caring for the interest for the individual patient and being restricted by the contract with the managed care organisation.	3.3583347782153146
Cost containment by managed care was achieved by reducing the fees for physicians and hospitals (and partly by restricting care for patients).	3.4245911108182487
Only a fraction of this cost reduction was handed over to the enrollee or employer, and most of the money was returned with profit to the shareholders of the managed care organisations.	2.9895584941787012
The preeminent role of primary care physicians as gatekeepers of the health network led to a reduced demand for specialist services in general and for university hospitals and anesthesiologists in particular.	3.462422486654798
The paradigm of managed care, i.e., to guide the patient and the care giver through the health care system in order to achieve cost-effective and high quality care, seems very attractive.	3.8415976529734657

In the past, most scientific or routine studies on heart rate variability (HRV) were done using commercial Holter ECG devices with traditional magnetic tapes.	2.68543099330813
All methods to calculate parameters of HRV are based on the measurement of time intervals between successive sinus cardiac beats, in practice RR intervals.	3.6542645741271333
Hence, results of HRV calculation depend on the quality of primary data acquisition.	4.0934054695793325
However, technical standards on accuracy of RR interval acquisition in magnetic tape and digital solid state Holter ECG systems do not exist as yet.	2.9953151653975087
Therefore in a laboratory investigation accuracy of HRV parameter calculation after traditional standard tape with and without real-time analysis and digital solid state data acquisition was compared in three commercial Holter ECG systems [Ela medical (E), Oxford Medilog Excel (O) and Medset Cardiolight (M)].	2.860654737570116
A computer-based ECG simulator was used to synthesize a test signal consisting of artificial P-QRS complexes of fixed rate, quartz stabilized "sinus rhythms".	3.0011447836755383
Two channel analog tape and digital 24h recordings of the fixed rate test signal were performed simultaneously.	3.0297637836321
The influence of recording technology on accuracy of RR interval measurement and consequently on time domaine HRV was shown by comparing five standard 24-h time domain parameters.	2.7015055750546084
As expected, in the three Holter systems the analog tape recordings showed a higher, technically induced, artificial RR variability.	3.7514717026894133
The SDNN values (E: 9.38ms vs 2.68ms; p<0.001; O: 3.89ms vs 0.97ms; p<0.001; M: 10.47ms vs 2.89ms; p=0.001), SDNN-Index values (E: 8.22ms vs 0.90ms; p<0.001; O: 3.75ms vs 0.90ms; p<0.001; M: 7.81ms vs 1.49ms, p<0.001) and RMSSD-values (E: 10.39ms vs 2.16ms; p<0.001; O: 10.05ms vs 1.88ms, p<0.001; M: 8.62ms vs 1.69ms; p<0.001) were significantly lower if acquisition was done by digital solid devices in all systems, SDANN (M: 9.83ms vs 5.37ms; p<0.001) in the Medset system too.	3.007963834849706
The used method is a possible way to validate commercial Holter ECG systems for HRV analysis.	3.4513965096203645
Clinical significance of artifical HRV seems to be low.	3.7136048054279263

A less invasive approach with shorter operating time is the replacement of the femoral head only, leaving the acetabular cartilage in situ.	3.812561198400775
Hemiarthroplastic hip replacement using a metallic head prosthesis was not successful in the past, because the majority of patients developed protrusio acetabuli after surgery.	4.2205628962682535

From 1985 to 1990 277 patients were treated with hemiarthroplasty.	3.647630562979666

With the recent developments in computer technology and the improvements in modern neuroimaging, frame-based stereotactic guidance for open microsurgical procedures has been increasingly replaced by neuronavigation, also called frameless stereotaxy.	2.812029629537687
It allows transfer of individual patient's images onto the operative field to assist the neurosurgeon intraoperatively in defining the tumor margins or identifying functionally important brain areas.	2.984871735328958
The different localization techniques employed are articulated position-sensing arms, infrared or ultrasound systems working with the principle of satellite navigation and robotic systems integrated with the operating microscope.	2.922554569625593
In 200 operations performed with different systems (arm-based, robotic and infrared) the method proved to be helpful, enabling fewer invasive procedures to be performed.	3.4066566894246777
With a mean deviation of 2.87 +/- 1.9 mm for intraoperative localization, the accuracy was only slightly worse than in frame-based stereotaxy with deviations below 2 mm.	3.0438060586123132

Severe pain of mucositis induced by cytostatic conditioning therapy in bone marrow transplantation (BMT) patients generally requires continuous parenteral opioid treatment.	3.1854372130184085
Cognitive and psychological disturbances are frequent complications subsequent to BMT and may result from cerebral opioid side effects.	3.5588359905648375
The aim of the study was to evaluate the efficiency of continuous morphine in mucositis pain and the side-effects in BMT patients.	3.077193898010214
Particular emphasis was placed on the question of whether reaction times, which are usually measured to estimate opioid effects upon vigilance, are influenced by pain-induced cognitive impairments in pain patients.	3.644701786834319
Methods While in hospital, 10 BMT patients were examined daily with the aid of a mucositis scale, subjective visual analog scales (VAS) for pain and mood parameters, a German version of the McGill pain questionnaire (MPQ), and a mental performance task battery, and the morphine given was documented.	3.685395272378359
Mental performance tests were simple auditory reaction time and choice reaction time.	3.3453415326595017
Seven patients also performed a Sternberg memory search test in which they had to use 'yes' and 'no' response keys to match visually presented test letters to a previously memorized set of letters.	2.806572330231732
Practice and baseline data were collected within the first week before BMT.	3.999456178565092
Results The intensity and duration of mucositis differed from patient to patient, resulting in different pain intensities and MPQ scores.	3.4350184685139595
Prolongation of the choice reaction time averaged over the period of mucositis treatment correlated significantly with residual pain intensity (Spearman rs = 0.88, p < 0.01) but not with morphine dose (rs = 0.35, p = 0.33).	3.155891002854478
For the Sternberg memory search test greater correlation coefficients resulted between reaction time and morphine dose (rs = 0.86, p = 0.014) than between reaction time and residual pain intensity (rs = 0.61, p = 0.15).	2.604978146204522
In turn, pain intensity, unlike morphine dose, was significantly correlated with high scores in the mood parameters for depression, passivity, and tiredness.	3.304610189947807
Conclusions It is concluded that both pain and morphine can impair cognitive performance, but that these mental stressors seem to differ according to qualitative criteria.	3.1662341351696397
Whereas pain might slow reaction time by distracting a patient's attention, particularly in low mental demand tasks, morphine could interfere with more specific cognitive processes, such as short-term memory operations, that are required in more complex tasks.	3.398625146174221

Brain-stem gliomas occur mainly in childhood and are localized in the mesencephalon, pons and medulla oblongata.	3.3210176206883246
Diagnosis is a domain of MRI, requiring T2, T1 and KM.	3.0735576758183245

Enhancement is seen in 25-60% and does not allow differentiation of tumor vs nontumor or gradings.	3.5225792632410142
Factors influencing poor outcome are high grade, a short history, cranial nerve involvement, severe brain-stem enlargement, pontine site, diffuse growth and recurrency.	3.152259611280426
The 5-year-survival rate is 30% (after radiation: focal tumors 85%, diffuse 20%).	3.1801690326232985
Most frequent are symptoms of brain pressure, cerebellum, cranial nerves and pyramidal tract.	3.220885845653959
There is no agreement on whether biopsy is necessary or not.	2.701334580734089
A diagnosis of tumor is highly suggestive if classical MRI findings fit the clinical history.	2.9500223200339724
Radiobiological and physical examinations suggest clinical advantages of heavy ion irradiation.	3.324335209279068

The study included patients with chordomas (17), chondrosarcomas (10) and other skull base tumors (Table 1).	3.045083150092608
It is the first time that the intensity-controlled rasterscan-technique and the application of positron-emission tomography (PET) for quality assurance was used.	3.6524880714496226
All patients had computed tomography for three-dimensional-treatment planning (Figure 1).	3.301077889701753
Patients with chordomas and chondrosarcomas underwent fractionated carbon ion irradiation in 20 consecutive days (median total dose 60 GyE).	2.8025185512943116
Other histologies were treated with carbon ion boost of 15 to 18 GyE delivered to the macroscopeic tumor after fractionated stereotatic radiotherapy (median total dose 63 GyE).	3.0765768093319448
Mean follow-up was 9 months.	3.778007319194138
Irradiation was well tolerated by all patients.	3.693016273823911
One-year local control rate was 94%.	3.464705413600948
One patient (2,2%) deceased.	4.397307007718767
No severe toxicity and no local recurrence within the treated volume were observed.	3.1189897099076127
Clinical effectiveness and technical feasibility of this modality could clearly be demonstrated in our study.	3.6059484118922236
To evaluate the clinical relevance of the different beam modalities studies with larger patient numbers are necessary.	3.189837544410297
To continue our project a new heavy ion acclerator exclusively for clinical use is planed to be constructed in Heidelberg.	3.079598144397561

Objective: Comparison of low back pain (LBP) patients with and without fibromyalgia syndrome (FMS) with regard to affective distress.	3.609366509417167
Methods: Patients with LBP who had been admitted to various clinics in Germany were examined upon admission.	3.1678589032981836
Comparisons were done by dividing the patients into groups with and without signs of FMS.	3.6842523863824628
Additionally, both groups were compared after being matched according to sex, age, and pain severity.	3.828575547296945
Results: 15 out of 135 LBP patients met the American College of Rheumatology criteria for fibromyalgia.	2.703843301829724
Patients with FMS showed remarkably higher levels of pain severity and affective distress.	2.8280239464945875
After controlling for different levels of pain severity, these pronounced differences disappeared.	3.370637988712664
Conclusion: Affective distress is not a unique feature of FMS, but seem to be caused entirely by higher levels of pain severity.	3.593885802031758
The case definition required the typical clinical picture and a HI positive culture from a physiologically sterile site (or throat swab or tracheal aspirate in case of epiglottitis or pneumonia) in children up to 10 years.	3.3703304033498838
All initial reports were validated with a questionnaire that additionally questioned the vaccination status, type of vaccine, therapy, outcome of the disease and characteristics of the bacteria.	4.182844024999987

Results: 310 confirmed cases of invasive HI infections were reported during the observation period, 199 of these with meningitis, 56 with epiglottitis.	3.153524766448658
The number of cases declined from 71 in the last six months of 1992, 120 in 1993, and 65 in 1994 to 54 cases in 1995.	3.4672757602009048
In 1995 the incidence in up to 5 year old children was 1.1/100 000 for all infection sites and 0.7/100 000 for meningitis.	3.0989365867302263
The reduced rates were mainly due to a decrease in the number of unvaccinated cases, whereas the number of cases in vaccinated children fluctuated between 22 and 36 per year.	4.519389673844583
Most of these were observed in incompletely vaccinated children, who according to the German recommendations could already have received at least one further vaccination at the time of the infection.	3.8229536218009215
The type of vaccine (HbOC, PRP-D or OMP) was not significantly associated with the risk of infection in vaccinated children.	3.6083225146717175
10 % of the bacteria produced betalactamase.	3.840058059942252
In accordance with the German recommendations third generation cephalosporines were used in almost all cases of meningitis.	3.700233085824481

A further decrease, however, would be possible with "on time" completion of the vaccination schedule according to the German recommendations in all children.	3.8850680459742146

Intraoperative lesions of the mesothelial lining by abrasion, ischemia, dissication, and foreign bodies result in complaints, intestinal obstruction, female infertility, and problems during reoperations.	3.152973771215577

As of today, there is no safe and efficient prophylaxis available.	3.8781397528336807

Even today the name of F. D. von Recklinghausen is often mentioned in connection with primary and secondary hyperparathyroidism.	3.1644537176555105
He was one of the first physicians and scientists to render outstanding services to the classification of structural changes of bones, and in many aspects his work remains valid today.	3.9459021161737455
He succeeded through precise and comparative studies in making the disease and symptoms of primary hyperparathyroidism known and thus distinguishing it from other known structural bone diseases.	3.491629118103509
He also described the phenomenon of "bone remodeling" which has become relevant today again.	3.134472035317945
Although his written macroscopic and microscopic observations include meticulously precise differentiations which make it difficult to study them today, they are still of interest in order to follow his basic ideas.	3.3738039548237864
This article does not constitute a comprehensive biography, but it contains a description of F. D. von Recklinghausen's important work on bone pathology against the background of the main stages of his life.	3.1650656627081046
Soft-tissue sarcomas (STS) of the extremities are characterized by a high rate of local recurrences.	4.736594364225429
Limb salvage approaches using multimodality therapy protocols have replaced amputation.	2.928526781180713
In order to evaluate isolated hyperthermic limb perfusion (ILP) in a multimodality therapy concept, we reviewed our patients treated using this method.	3.0938383862117624
Between January 1982 and December 1995, 25 ILPs, using cisplatin, melphalan and adriamycin, were performed in 22 patients with STS.	3.240991145424274
Forty percent were treated for local recurrences; histology was dominated by malignant fibrous histiocytoma (MFH) and synovial sarcoma.	2.8599043061822553
In all, 68 % of the STS were classified as UICC stage IIb or IIIa/b.	3.170948856623025
Most of the cases (14) underwent wide or radical resection, 4 patients received intraoperative radiotherapy, and 5 were treated with external beam radiation.	4.184131698507934
Complications were recorded in 32 % of the cases.	3.5276776328957395
With a median follow-up of 45 months (range 1-143), the 5-year overall survival rate was 81 %.	4.142149610679402
The median recurrence-free time was 19 months and the 5-year disease-free survival rate 34 %.	3.647372355244686
There were 13 local failures, and distant metastases developed in 36 % of the patients.	3.2668984273476034
Concerning high-grade sarcomas (UICC stage IIb, IIIa/b), we found local recurrences in 75 % of all cases.	4.524074329901405
Five of 11 patients with local failures underwent perfusion after they refused amputation, and 7 incompletely resected STS received ILP without reoperation.	2.945570923943722
All of these demonstrated local recurrence.	3.003005440437253
This rate of local recurrence proved to be different from patients with tumor-free resection margins (p = 0.0001, log-rank test).	3.6639725801771363
The amputation rate after isolated limb perfusion was 27 % (mean 11 months after treatment).	3.290606834168952
Long-term results of ILP showed a considerable local recurrence rate and a low disease-free survival.	3.5099307011232943
Perfusion in patients without tumor-free resection margins does not prevent local recurrence.	3.581356428864055
We conclude that ILP with cisplatin, melphalan and adriamycin should be considered carefully and is not an additional treatment strategy of first choice.	3.396221566795399

While continuing CPR, surgery was stopped, the wound was sealed provisionally, and the patient was transferred to the ICU.	3.5322134244515566
Because of suspected massive pulmonary embolism, thrombolytic therapy with rt-PA in a total dosage of 100 mg was begun.	3.127449511883183
2.25 hours after the onset of circultory arrest, and 1.5 hours after the beginning of thrombolysis, the patient's hemodynamic patterns under high-dosage catecholamines were satisfactory.	3.8815338681067857
The bleeding after thrombolysis and coagulopathy required massive blood transfusions.	3.051271219992043
The situation was also complicated by lesions of the liver, spleen and small intestines, which required surgical intervention, and acute renal failure, which had to be treated with transient hemofiltration.	3.897094111893493
Twenty-eight days after receiving CPR, the patient was discharged from the ICU.	3.6965967806048035
A diagnosis of pulmonary embolism was established by clinical signs, capnometry, blood gas analysis, and electrocardiography.	3.7870342971042406
Due to the requirements of the emergency situation (ongoing CPR), further diagnostic tools were not used.	3.5395094824418476
The patient survived without any neurological deficiency, despite the extended 135-min use of CPR, and despite massive bleeding due to surgical trauma, and to performing CPR in the presence of fibrinolytica.	3.514588724706672
With the increasing use of cross-sectional echocardiography in patients with overt or suspected pulmonary thromboembolism in the emergency rooms, more and more right atrial thrombi are detected.	3.700032112693355
These are so-called "transitthrombi" from the venous system on their way to the pulmonary arteries and they are a severe presentation of thromboembolic disease.	3.8014621714901042
They appear as an imminent pulmonary embolism and usually coexists with an already massive embolism.	3.337459365028445
In patients were a right atrial thrombus is associated with a patent foramen ovale, paradoxical arterial embolism has been observed.	3.38761225991087

Three patients had cardiac arrest with a massive pulmonary embolism, seven patients presented with a submassive embolism.	3.3742275407869173

Therapeutic options were thrombectomy, fibrinolysis or anticoagulants.	3.0810546963807637
