With the approval of the Animal Ethics Committee, a total of 16 anaesthetised pigs were used for the animal experiments.	3.4668211741674715
Balloon occlusion of the cardia was performed in 10 pigs.	4.729955567093346
Six further pigs with an unblocked cardia served as controls.	2.9139317147235237

With local Ethics Committee approval and informed written consent, (1) repeated vomiting was provoked in 16 awake, healthy adult volunteers (10 females, 6 males, 29 +/- 4 years) with a fluid-filled stomach in the presence and in the absence of balloon occlusion of the cardia, while intragastric pressure was monitored, and (2) 30 patients (21 - 89 years) with an increased risk of pulmonary aspiration scheduled for abdominal or traumatologic surgery received conventional induction of anesthesia after blocking of the cardia with the balloon.	3.828346749731854
Pigs (n=10) with a blocked cardia showed no gastrooesophageal reflux during a total of 60 manipulations to provoke vomiting and regurgitation, while 28 of the 36 provoking manipulations induced reflux in pigs (n=6) with an unblocked cardia.	3.7918149532467376
Among the healthy volunteers with a blocked cardia (n=16), reflux of gastric contents was not observed during repeated attempts to stimulate vomiting.	3.2175983968059594
After termination of the occlusion of the cardia, reflux was able to be induced by 14 of the 16 volunteers.	3.425581966004274

Under baseline conditions, ptiO2 was 38 +/- 5 mmHg and did not change significantly before DHCA.	3.06473607698247
During DHCA the ptiO2 decreased within 15 minutes to 14 +/- 5 mmHg, after 30 minutes to 5 +/- 1 mmHg and after 40 minutes to zero.	3.4329753122991185

These data demonstrate significantly decreased levels of ptiO2 (brain tissue oxygenation) and CBF (oxygen supply) during and after rewarming from DHCA.	2.9753047534191484
Thus, a direct influence on brain functional recovery by the active cooling and rewarming process about the bloodstream during CPB, resulting in disturbed tissue blood redistribution, mitochondrial dysfunction and/or excessive cerebral oxygen consumption (compensation of an oxygen debt) is a possible explanation.	3.397369878948776

This review summarizes vascular tumours of skin and soft tissues that have been characterised in recent years.	3.2032766585797465
Although most of them are very rare, knowledge about their reproducible clinicopathological features is important to avoid diagnostic pitfalls.	3.8725073185205607
These lesions include: bacillary angiomatosis, a vasoproliferative, pseudoneoplastic infection of immunocompromised patients caused by Rochalimaea henselae; tufted angioma, a variant of lobular capillary haemangioma characterised by a "cannon-ball" distribution of multiple lobules composed of packed capillaries and pericytes; microvenular haemangioma, a cutaneous haemangioma composed of thin-walled and irregularly branching blood vessels which dissect dermal collagen; sinusoidal haemangioma, a distinctive variant of cavernous haemangioma which may be located in the subcutaneous breast tissue and then may be confused with well-differentiated angiosarcoma; "hobnail haemangioma" (targetoid haemosiderotic haemangioma), a benign vascular tumour with a distinctive clinical targetoid appearance and a hobnail cytomorphology of the prominent endothelial tumour cells; retiform haemangioendothelioma, a very recently characterised low-grade angiosarcoma occurring most commonly in the extremities of adolescents which is characterised by arborising blood vessels arranged in a retiform pattern and lined by hobnail-like prominent endothelial cells; Kaposi-like infantile haemangioendothelioma, a borderline malignant tumour of infants mimicking Kaposi's sarcoma histologically; epithelioid angiosarcoma, a highly aggressive tumour in the spectrum of epithelioid vascular lesions which stains positively for endothelial and epithelial immunohistological markers; benign lymph-angioendothelioma (progressive lymphangioma), a benign, slowly growing macule or plaque which has to be distinguished from well-differentiated angiosarcoma and Kaposi's sarcoma; and lymphangiomatosis of the limbs, a poorly recognised angiomatosis occurring in young patients and limited mainly to the limbs with a favourable prognosis.	2.817066969765638

Ventricular arrhythmias associated with ischaemia and infarction often cannot be elucidated by clinical studies on patients because those arrhythmias are potentially lifethreatening and their occurrence is unpredictable.	3.08542955254259
Because of additional experimental procedures and techniques that can be used in the animal laboratory, such as microelectrode recording of transmembrane action potentials and high-density optical and electrical activation mapping, animal models have provided information that cannot be obtained from clinical studies.	3.841057241719788
Studies on animal models have provided new ideas and hypotheses that have been tested in clinical studies and that have been found to be true for clinical arrhythmias.	4.101863410154156

Because of the clinical importance of coronary artery disease this article concentrates on those arrhythmias caused by myocardial ischaemia and infarction.	3.8369590154631315
The authors report a rare, recently diagnosed and atypical mishap during one-lung ventilation (OLV) via a double lumen tube (DLT) and left-sided thoracotomy: an ipsilateral pneumothorax during ventilation of the right lung.	3.135490227900921
This occurred in a 63-year-old patient with chronic obstructive airway disease who was scheduled for urgent repair of a descending thoracic aortic aneurysm.	3.268045391074058
The common presentation of increased intrathoracic extrapleural pressure owing to a pneumothorax in patients with mechanically ventilated lungs is a rapid decrease in oxygen saturation, followed or paralleled by haemodynamic deterioration.	3.218175122907912
Although the above presentation could be seen in this case, the diagnosis of a tension pneumothorax was delayed twice.	4.556126890662285
First, symptoms were initially obscured by haemodynamic changes resulting from a head-down tilt and aortic declamping.	3.0791767304823314
In particular, since breathing sounds were detectable initially, malposition or torsion of the DLT had to be excluded by fibre-optic bronchoscopy, which involved a further delay.	3.076978321522477
Finally, two observations led to the diagnosis of a right-sided tension pneumothorax: (1) bullae of the contralateral lung, detected during thoracotomy; (2) the finding that ventilation of both lungs and the left lung subsequently increased arterial (SaO2) and mixed venous oxygen saturation (SvO2) and the circulatory status, but ventilation of the right lung caused a deterioration.	3.8256404389676284
Chest radiography and insertion of a chest tube with drainage of air, thereafter, validated our hypothesis.	3.034789735025232
The time course of oxygen desaturation during OLV and tension pneumothorax was as severe as expected; the time course of haemodynamic deterioration, however, appeared quicker and had more impact than expected.	3.5415198021359653
Assuming that mediastinal deviation was not hindered by contralateral intrathoracic pressure during thoracotomy, we believed that circulation should be depressed later or to a lesser extent in patients with an intraoperative pneumothorax.	3.399066287826032
Yet, during thoracotomy, decrease in cardiac filling and output during tension pneumothorax in OLV obviously results primarily from the immovability of the mediastinum owing to mediastinal fixation and is at least as decisive as the contralateral intrathoracic pressure in closed-chest patients.	3.0245058473825894
In summary, a tension pneumothorax during one-lung ventilation and thoracotomy is a rare, but disastrous complication during the use of a DLT, which has not, to our knowledge, been reported previously.	3.5328831515048087
We recommend that tension pneumothorax be added to the list of complications and problems during OLV by the use of a DLT, especially in patients with structural lung diseases.	3.7605564761996755

The principle of this method is a three point load carrying(entry point, height of fracture and cancellous bone of the metaphysis of the opposite fracture part).	3.3427664863088378

The fractures affected the humerus to 3.5 %, the fore-arm to 65.1 % and the femoral shaft to 31.4 %.	2.9809442700015585

96 % of the patients showed very good and good results after operation.	4.626702285138717
The average stay in hospital for patients with femoral shaft fractures was 14.4 days.	3.490964121694104
17 weeks after operation the intramedullary nails were removed.	3.690243993024291
At the time of first full weight bearing the legs showed an average shortening of 1.2 cm.	3.2308848644620007
The fractures of the humerus healed without any restriction of movements.	3.759476964883286
Internal fixation is a minimal invasive operation technique with low risks and small operating trauma.	3.5588513586094934
Due to the stability a early mobilisation is possible.	2.9719294078804612
The reported results in the literature are all good.	5.3146089961906195

Introduction: The goal of this study was to compare contrast-enhanced T1-weighted Flash and Turbo-Flash sequences with conventional spin-echo sequences as a basis for planning high-precision radiotherapy.	2.814884100772527
Methods: A total of 25 consecutive patients with different intracranial tumors and a disrupted blood-brain barrier were studied.	3.7880487241450673
T1-weighted Flash, Turbo-Flash and conventional spin-echo images were evaluated after controlled 30-s infusion of 0.1 mmol/kg body weight of Gd-DTPA.	3.081364478305872
Results: The signal- and contrast-to-noise ratios were significantly (P < 0.05-0.01) lower for Flash and Turbo-Flash than for conventional spin-echo sequences.	3.2243000452933135
Flash and Turbo-Flash sequences were more prone to susceptibility artifacts, conventional spin-echo sequences more to pulsation artifacts in the posterior fossa.	2.8262325860033406
Tumor sizes were comparable in all three techniques.	3.857887622026887
Conclusion: At present, conventional spin-echo images are superior to fast Flash and ultrafast Turbo-Flash sequences as a basis for accurate target volume definition in high-precision radiotherapy.	2.8107349957766083
However, fast Flash and Turbo-Flash images may be a practicable alternative to conventional spin-echo images for tumors in the posterior fossa or in patients unable to tolerate a stereotactic fixation device.	3.064885713141572
Despite some limitations, Turbo-Flash sequences enable fast dynamic MR imaging combined with an acceptable morphology, which may be sufficient for target volume planning in high-precision radiotherapy.	3.0734637029389185
Cystic tumors of the neck are usually cysts, inflamatory masses, lymph nodes, benign and malignant tumors or metastases.	4.2587794054533
Ectopic salivary tissue is a rather rare but clinically important malformation.	3.662516981062546
Accessory and aberrant tissue can be identified histologically.	3.708830440036259
There may be an association with lymphatic tissue.	3.779355166370408

Nucleotides are low molecular weight biological compounds that play major roles in almost all-biological processes.	3.1897078881844103
Cell nucleic acids and nucleotides are continuously synthesised, degraded and salvaged.	2.8449311673500213
The body's pools derive from three potential sources: synthesis de novo, salvage (recycling of preformed bases) and the diet.	2.9882603016705755
It is generally accepted that de novo synthesis of both purines and pyrimidines from amino acid precursors is capable of supporting the cellular needs for nucleic acid synthesis.	2.5292773205364827
When protein intake is decreased or in situations in which there are a high demand of nucleotides synthesis (after gut injury, after surgical trauma, sepsis, rapid growth: pregnancy or newborn infants, etc.)	3.303095541818439
some tissues with a rapid turnover (gut and immune system) may increase the salvage of exogenous nucleotides coming from the diet.	3.214901292383191
Therefore, nucleotides may become conditionally essential nutrients.	2.962545981093138
This article discusses the possible beneficial effects of dietary nucleotides on small intestine (maturation and recovery) and gut microflora, lipid and hepatic metabolism and on the immune system.	3.225196265324395
Human milk is the best source of nucleotides for young infants and the nucleotide/nucleoside profile of it shows a substantial predominance for pyrimidines as compared to purines.	3.411934290683992
Moreover, pyrimidine nucleotides seem to be better preserved in breast milk during storage in the breast and during digestion in the small intestine and they are more absorbed and incorporated into tissue RNA, as compared to purine ones.	3.3607888815473506
Additional research should be done to improve the design of nucleotides supplemented infant formulas.	4.008259661982597
This includes: 1) to investigate in vivo if the incorporation of dietary nucleotides in tissue RNA is enhanced in situations of stress or rapid growth and 2) to study the biological effects of individually administered purine and pyrimidine nucleotides.	3.383713167595724

Anaesthetic delivery was discontinued simultaneously with termination of surgery and recovery times were recorded.	3.510149729845615
Results: A total of 40 patients were studied at random in two groups of 20 each with comparable demographic data and anaesthetic technique (Tables 1 and 2).	3.187904123541601
In both groups emergence was very rapid.	2.931381663575143
Recovery times were significantly shorter for remifentanil-isoflurane than for remifentanil-propofol (Table 3): spontaneous ventilation 5.1 vs 8.1 min (P<0.05), extubation 5.5 vs. 8.6 min (P<0.02), post-anaesthesia recovery score >=9 of 10 points 6.2 vs 11.3 min (P<0.01), and arrival at PACU 16.2 vs 19.2 min (P<0.01).	3.186072614003607
Mild to moderate shivering was noted in 40% of all patients (9 cases following isoflurane, 7 following propofol).	3.5986912311757067
Conclusions: Using the manufacturer's recommended dosages, emergence after remifentanil anaesthesia is more rapid with 0.5 MAC isoflurane than with 0.1 mg/kg/min propofol.	3.1069350609252746
These results are most probably due to the different pharmacological properties of both co-anaesthetics, especially the applied dosages, and to different interactions with remifentanil.	3.9147660324005864
Present clinical experience suggests that a further dose reduction, especially for propofol, is possible.	3.8092435734801224
For both remifentanil groups emergence was remarkably rapid between return of consciousness and the awake state (on-off phenomenon), which might contribute to post-anaesthesia safety.	3.370434474185891

The aim of this prospective and randomized study was to evaluate the safety and efficacy of a reduced shock strength in transvenous implantable defibrillator therapy.	3.145195095068067
So far clinical data concerning the safety margin of the shock energy in ICD therapy do not exist.	3.057524410330952
The shock energy tested during long-term follow-up in this study was twice the intraoperatively measured defibrillation threshold (DFT).	3.7654077885172588
A total number of 176 consecutive patients representing a typical cohort of ICD patients were evaluated.	3.254208567120041
All patients received a non-thoracotomy lead system (CPI, Endotak 0070, 0090) and a biphasic cardioverter-defibrillator with the ability to store episodes (Cardiac Pacemakers Inc., Ventac TM PRx II, PRx III).	3.0180719275510466
The intraoperative defibrillation threshold (DFT) was evaluated in a step-down protocol (15, 10, 8, 5 J) and hat to be <=15 J for inclusion into the study.	3.5896164026812536
The lowest effective energy terminating induced ventricular fibrillation had to be confirmed and was defined as DFT+ augmented defibrillation threshold.	3.849549739370399
The DFT+ value was tested immediately after successful implantation, at discharge, and after a follow-up period of one year.	3.811224771693113
Prior to implantation the patients were randomized into two groups.	3.7830736948970083
The energy of the first shock in the study group was programmed at twice DFT+ and in the control group at the maximum energy output (34 J).	4.260674806558227
The efficacy of the first shock and its reproducibility in DFT testings and in spontaneous episodes during long-term follow-up of the study group were compared to those in the control group.	3.877847061024218
A DFT+ value was found to be <=15 J in 166 of 176 patients (94%).	3.5629784986641995
The DFT+ in the study group was 9.6+/-3.2; in control group 10.1+/-.35 J.	3.205061656094287
The prohability of successful defibrillation at DFT+ level after one year was 84%.	3.1321290893090223
The success rate of the first shock meant to terminate induced ventricular fibrillation (VF) was 99.5% in the study group (217 of 218 episodes) and 99% in the control group (201 of 203 episodes).	3.3889071869301644
During follow-up of 24+/-9 months spontaneous episodes in the study group, 83/86 (96.5) monomorphic ventricular tachycardias (MVT) and 38/40 (95%) VF-episodes were converted successfully by the 2x DFT+ shock.	3.206837896373245
In the control group the first shock was successful in 151/156 (96.8%) spontaneous MVTs and in 30/33 (91%) VF episodes.	3.2528974353829945
The efficacy of the first shock was not influenced by clinical data such as the underlying cardiac disease, left ventricular function, ongoing antiarrhythmic therapy with amiodarone, or the number of spontaneous episodes per day or by the DFT itself.	4.0022937951080495
At a mean follow-up of two years there was no significant difference between the two groups concerning the incidence of sudden cardiac death (2.4% in the study group vs. 3.8% in the control group).	4.20967521830725
In conclusion programming the first shock with the ICD lead system used in this study at 2x DFT+ is as efficient as a shock energy of 34 J in order to terminate induced and spontaneous episodes of VT/VF.	3.633963705669674
Thus, the safety of ICD-therapy is not impaired when programming the shock energy at the 2x DFT+ value.	3.4183184226910117

Acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) is rare but beset with a high mortality rate.	3.363390901848614
In recent years, however, a trend towards higher survival rates has been observed.	3.07521113920991
High inspiratory oxygen concentrations, large tidal volumes, and high peak inspiratory airway pressures applied during mechanical ventilation have been identified as harmful to the lung and can contribute to the progression of ARDS.	3.4590646564840593
This had led to reconsideration of the sequelae of ventilatory therapy.	3.1331055951220743
Mechanical ventilation and other adjunctive strategies in ARDS have changed from the conventional approach aiming at normalisation of physiological ventilatory parameters to an elaborated approach that intends to protect the ventilated lung, prevent oxygen toxicity, recruit the infiltrated atelectatic and consolidated lung and reduce the anatomical and alveolar dead space.	2.798840914976956

Procalcitonin is a propeptide of calcitonin.	3.4592234258922345
It is usually not detectable in healthy volunteers but appears in high concentrations in the serum of patients with severe bacterial, parasitic or fungal infection.	3.6602605977368246
In contrast, procalcitonin levels do not or only moderately increase during viral infections or during non-infectious systemic inflammatory states.	3.177089672653036
Because of these properties, procalcitonin has been proposed to serve as a marker of severe infections and sepsis.	3.378906739157801

Normally, procalcitonin is produced in the C-cells of the thyroid gland.	2.124396490648786

Pathophysiological changes can be attributed both to the severity of hypothermia and to co-morbid factors such as trauma, submersion, intoxication and underlying diseases.	3.39267510056618

Patients with perfusing cardiac rhythms and systolic pressures over 80 mmHg will receive continuous arteriovenous rewarming (CAVR).	2.6684558067433084
Arrested and hemodynamically instable patients are treated with cardiopulmonary bypass (CPB).	3.000325813417269

This correlated with diclofenac concentrations between 1 and 10 ml found in our experiments.	3.1747600855971214
The detected values were correlated to the control group (0 µg/ml diclofenac).	3.749761123453668
Results: The drug effect upon osteoblasts was higher than on progenitor cells.	3.0325637122966023
The proliferation of in vitro stromal bone marrow cells, compared to untreated cells, was found to be decreased.	3.711132746568097

For this purpose the entire septal cartilage is removed, and the severely deviated part is divided into straight sections that are reconnected to each other to form a straight and solid plate.	3.2087992995410333
As connecting material we use a polydioxanon (PDS) foil.	2.934245826504845
The sections of cartilage are sutured to the foil with PDS suture material.	3.019384836900799
The compound graft thus constructed consists of the septal cartilage and resorbable alloplastic material and is reimplanted into the nose.	3.1806291156263025
The PDS and suture material are usually resorbed within 8 months, excluding long-term complications.	3.3251418745976706
During the past 2 years this method was used in treating 38 patients.	3.5357172288801126
The surgical goal was attained in every case, and no immediate or long-term complications occurred.	3.9393287353939055
This method of combining septal cartilage with a resorbable implant leads to a better, significant correction of even severe septal deviations.	3.375882770198483

The following study investigated the effects of this intervention on aortic input impedance.	3.437310023999169
This approach was chosen to minimize additional influence of extended operative procedures on the ascending aorta, like extracorporal circulation, cardioplegia or blood loss.	3.2330137259942315
Flow and pressure were recorded before and after the intervention, and following Fourier Transformation, the aortic input impedance was calculated.	3.6205333205241095

Microcallus formations are demonstrable in nearly all cancellous bones by means of suitable preparation techniques.	3.494522010692925
Histologically, these structures are immature fibrous bone formed in local overloaded parts of the trabeculae.	2.958173913196747

Microcallus formations occur frequently in people over 45 years of age.	2.8434355374484377
They are mainly localized in the lower thoracic and lumbar spine and occur significantly more frequent in females than in males.	3.562538842325852
The number of microcallus formations depends more on the microarchitecture of the cancellous bone than on individual trabecular parameters.	2.639387320351953
In about 33 % of cases microfractures are demonstrable in the centre of the microcallus formation.	3.0765959266947713
In noninvasive studies the bone mass could be misinterpreted due to microcallus.	3.0068631096518694
Although it indicates instability of the bone structure, microcallus formation is not a purely negative mechanism.	4.156933502417083
It stabilizes and regenerates the bone tissue.	3.1755100927338327
Furthermore, complete new trabeculae can be formed due to bridges of microcallus between residual trabeculae.	2.671300546134392
Osteoporosis is not the result of an inability to form microcallus.	3.852159974812703

This acute septic cardiomyopathy is often underestimated in degree and relevance, although about 10% of all sepsis fatalities are due to intractable heart failure.	3.378415762760215
This potentially reversible cardiomyopathy is characterized by a considerable pump failure, not primarily ischemic, with coronary blood flow being normal or even enhanced; the left and right ventricle is enlarged as a consequence of an increased ventricular compliance.	3.354618939141693

Fractures of the distal metaphysis of the tibia often include an extension into the ankle.	3.477726196569855
Intramedullary nailing combined with covered screw osteosynthesis should reduce the high incidence of soft tissue and ankle problems and should be an alternative to open plate fixation, with good ultimate functional outcome.	4.066546917793365
Between January 1993 and December 1995, a prospective study on 49 patients with distal metaphyseal tibia fracture and involvement of the ankle was performed.	3.9544786412522845
All the fractures were treated with intramedullary nailing combined with covered screw osteosynthesis, and plate fixation in cases of fibula fractures.	3.736762784196129
There were 27 men and 22 women with an average age of 46.4  +/-  12.7 years (range 21-90).	3.1043791482933947
In most studies of the use of intramedullary nailing in distal tibial fractures the classification has been inadequate.	3.6714614117346027
Therefore a new classification according to Robinson et al.	2.9619838811270895
(1995) was used: 10 fractures were type II B (20.4 %), 13 were type II C (26.5 %), and 26 patients suffered a combination of type II B and type II C (53.1 %).	3.851577626550889
This fracture type was defined as type II D for use in this study.	3.6735779274685063
The severity of soft tissue injury was recorded using the Gustilo system in case of open (n = 19) and the Tscherne system in case of closed fractures (n = 30).	3.8846246992041165
In 31 patients distal tibia fracture was accompanied by a fracture of the fibula, which was first stablized using a plate.	3.998962188641389
For reconstruction of the distal articular surface, covered screw osteosynthesis was done.	4.3424526313513585
At the next step intramedullary nails were inserted and were statically locked proximally and distally.	3.033089385620463
From January 1993 to February 1994, the reamed AO standard nail was used.	2.994038669734259
After introduction of the unreamed tibial nail (UTN) all fractures were treated by this implant.	3.5835265872060322
Full load on the operated leg was allowed after 8 weeks.	3.6162805693983655
Union of the fracture was assessed by standard radiological and clinical criteria.	4.96103029827749
Misalignment was defined as more than 5  ° of angular rotation.	4.257997773735445
Further surgery due to a valgus deformity in the ankle joint had to be done in three cases.	4.5222586353624905
There were no deep infections.	3.0435047726170583
Three patients had a superficial infection in the ankle area, but surgical debridement was not necessary.	3.900739228032533
A leg shortening was found in 4 cases, but it was less than 1 cm in every case.	4.9685805219448715
Therefore, surgical correction was not done.	3.4375775578919967
Patients were reviewed at intervals of 2, 6, and 12 weeks, and after 6, and at least 12 months.	4.779280638457551
Bone fusion was reached 12.8 weeks (range 9-21) after the operative treatment.	3.5606245364928535
A specific assessment of the ankle symptoms was made using the score of Olerud and Molander (1984).	3.666993702965185
In 29 patients excellent results were recorded.	3.259183282271627
A satisfactory result was attained with 17 patients and just 3 patients were found to be unsatisfactory.	3.4494504133775843
Although proximity of distal tibia fracture to the ankle makes the treatment more complicated than for fractures of the tibial diaphysis, closed intramedullary nailing combined with covered screw fixation is a good alternative to open reduction and plate fixation.	3.091773560416657
Therefore, closed intramedullary nailing combined with covered screw fixation is a safe and effective method of managing this type of fracture.	2.952597197593349

It is also possible to reach contralateral sites.	3.460476923810524

Lactic Acid Bacteria (LAB) are a group of Gram-positive organism, which have in common a fermentative metabolism with lactic acid as the major end-product.	3.3137524330591317
Except for bifidobacteria, the LAB are phylogenetically closely related.	2.829926515669233
They directly contribute to human well-being as they are the most important germs in the production process of fermented foods which constitute one fourth of our diet.	3.681401299460659
They are, furthermore, an essential component of the mucosal flora and especially of the intestinal flora.	4.013179051128405
The genus Streptococcus contains highly pathogenic species which can be clearly differentiated from the useful germs.	3.5540472613840572
The intestinal flora contains such species of the genus Lactobacillus that are also important in food fermentation and species which are strongly adapted to the intestines and therefore, can be found exclusively in this ecological niche.	3.430292221223083
A special status characterises bifidobacteria and enterococci.	2.9834230326957822
The former are located in a separate phylogenetic branch and also occur virtually exclusively in the intestines.	3.217425065478061
Enterococci are rather ubiquitous, participate in indigenous food fermentations, are found in the mucosal flora and are counted as opportunistic pathogens.	3.059800921164358
To influence the intestinal flora and to achieve health promoting effects LAB are isolated from the intestinal flora, grown and employed either as pharmaceutical preparations or additions to food (usually fermented milk).	2.973904928406689
These bacteria are termed "probiotics".	3.4429977658939697
The exposition of consumers to high numbers of germs belonging to one or a few species needs an evaluation of their safety for human health.	3.0233020731450053
In this process the traditional experience with the safe nature of the species can serve as an important criterion.	3.522778754903219
In front of this background, LAB in probiotics can be considered to be especially safe, nevertheless some restrictions have to be made.	3.6338521677612285
Generally, the germs used should not contain genes encoding transmissible resistance to antibiotics.	2.7070338033749444
In addition they should not produce biogenic amines (e.g.	2.597275195104622
histamine, tyrosine or phenylethylamine) and should not degrade mucine.	3.1159170372896545
The assessment may also include the following: absence of a potential for deconjugation of bile salts, induction of platelet aggregation and binding to fibrinogen and fibronectine.	3.031630919703565
These examinations may be required as certain LAB have been identified in clinical isolates.	3.607738759621917
The isolates were, however, obtained in the most majority of cases from debilitated patients.	4.344191576684525
The germs were components of the body flora as well as of the environment, organisms deliberately employed in food fermentations or probiotics have never been isolated.	3.8331052186132233

The risk to health posed by a sedentary lifestyle is a problem of our times.	3.0287138818041797
In contrast to the previous assumption that only fairly high-intensity sporting exercise undertaken over a minimum period of 20 min produces health-related benefits, recent studies have shown that even everyday activitites (climbing stairs, brisk walking and cycling) can have a benedicial effects on health, particularly in those who take little exercise.	3.050250363474253
So now the recommendation is: exercise of moderate intensity lasting 30 min at least 5 times a week, corresponding to an energy consumption of about 150 kacl/day or 1000 kcal/week.	2.8697804232062585
The results of experimental studies on sport and arthritis and sport and osteoporosis point to the advisability of taking up or maintaining an active sporting lifestyle.	2.788467608235475
For one thing, it can be assumed that a moderate amount of movement does not increase the risk of developing arthritis: for another, sporting activity during early and late childhood produces a high maximum bone mass, therby delaying the development of osteoporosis in later life.	3.3523137286945515
More difficult, however, is deciding on a suitable method for motivating inactive individuals to increase their level of physical acitivity.	3.34693595373407

Depending on whether an individual is inactive, or sporadically or regularly active, each one employs his or her own strategies primarily to maintain this lifestyle.	2.896926401675504
Assuming that the counselling is adapted to the level of activity, the patient's attitude and behaviour can be influenced both more effectively and more economically.	3.702366502505261

Beginning in the 1920s Wilhelm Reich developed the fundamental concepts of a body-oriented psychotherapy out of psychoanalysis.	2.9072124565938204
He started from considerations of egopathology, sexuality and the analysis of resistance and character patterns.	3.3770161277201938
Characterological and bodily attitudes were understood as defence-patterns against emotions, which function not only psychologically but also bodily.	2.8880618620118166
Thus he began to mobilize repressed affects through working on muscular tensions and bodily expressions.	2.8010602764053125
That way their meaning in the person's history could be understood and a self-healing process restarted.	3.305498836931843
This approach to release constrained energy is still valid for neoreichian schools such as bioenergetics, biodynamics, biosynthesis and others whose understanding of human nature and of healing processes is similar to those of other schools of humanistic psychotherapy.	2.952488356675885
Bodily processes are used as indicators for the processes and successes of therapies.	3.595787615449367

Recurrent phlebothromboses in young patients with subsequent severe postthrombotic syndrome and chronic venous leg ulcers may be caused by underlying hereditary disorders of hemostasis or may occur as part of other congenital syndromes.	3.175196166884852
The most common hereditary disorders of hemostasis in this respect appear to be deficiencies of antithrombin III, protein C, and protein S, and activated protein C resistance (mutations of factor V).	2.9850425871895827
Less frequently, dysfibrinogenemia, increased plasminogen activator inhibitor levels, or deficiencies of tissue plasminogen activator or heparin cofactor II may be found.	2.7528960320302014
Klinefelter's syndrome and homocystinuria are prime examples of those rare congenital disorders indirectly associated with an elevated risk of thrombosis in young individuals.	3.566029925514459
Early diagnosis of these disorders will allow timely treatment, preventive care and counselling of patients as well as family members.	3.868682808745702
There is great variability in the distribution of contrast medium according to the individual morphology of the epidural space and the way it is injected.	3.694858434418323
Results of investigations of the anatomy of the spinal canal and epidural space performed with anatomic specimens, epiduroscopy, and conventional and computed tomographic (CT) epidurography are sometimes contradictory.	3.3923505564220187
We have performed CT epidurography in approximately 30 patients to date.	3.1012525073098964
Insights regarding the distribution of contrast medium in the epidural space can help to interpret conventional epidurographies and to explain special features, such as the "rail-road-track phenomenon" or the plica mediana dorsalis.	3.363921853340006
Catheters were introduced into the thoracic epidural space on the day before the operation.	3.400880769568871
Conventional epidurographies were performed routinely after insertion of the catheters with a mobile X-ray apparatus, usually in the recovery room, using 5 ml iopamidol (Solutrast 250 M).	3.21273408649372
Selected patients (good mental state and stable psychic condition), after written consent and with approval of the local ethical committee, were investigated with CT epidurography using the same contrast medium (partly diluted).	3.3070080700341076
From among the CT scans performed until now, five characteristic images are presented and compared to conventional epidurographies.	4.386410605170147
When small volumes (5 mL) of iopamidol were injected slowly, we regularly observed a railroad-track phenomenon in the AP images of conventional epidurographies.	2.939005256623993
After rapid injection of larger volumes (10 - 15 ml), the spread was more homogeneous and sometimes outline a lighter zone of contrast distribution in the midline.	3.866097424260077
CT epidurography in these cases (5 out of 30 patients) revealed a plica mediana dorsalis.	3.5125825232062815
In the majority of the CT scans of the thoracic epidural space its anterior (ventral) compartment was unfilled by contrast medium.	3.26606650166519
According to the findings of several investigators, dura mater and ligamentum longitudinale posterius have grown together, so that an epidural space does not exist in ventral thoracic segments of the spinal canal.	3.1728069028893313
In lower thoracic and lumbar segments both structures are separate, and a wide anterior epidural space was present and filled with contrast medium.	3.371202004441513
In other cases the dorsal and dorsolateral epidural space was completely filled, but the contrast medium stopped behind the spinal nerves and surrounding dural sheaths, as if these structures, together with the connective tissue strands between them, formed a membrane that spread in a frontal plane.	3.2457310614428225
A railroad-track phenomenon is interpreted in the literature as the X-ray correlate of contrast medium spread in the subdural space, indicating an incorrect catheter position.	3.4987187687165804
According to conventional epidurographies and confirmed by CT scans, this feature is also seen regulary in cases with correct catheter position.	3.647402607279547
Small volumes of iopamidol spread preferentially into the wider parts of the epidural space between the gaps of the vertebral arcs, whereas the dura mater and periosteal layers touch at the inner side of the pedicules and laminae, allowing the existence of only a potential epidural space.	3.4918135114893523
This rhythmic widening and narrowing of the epidural space is the explanation of the "railroad track" in AP contrast epidurographies.	3.189781095664308
CT epidurography is a valuable tool to provide better insight into the morphology of the epidural space when filled with fluid (contrast medium, local anaesthetics), complementing findings using epiduroscopy and anatomic specimens.	3.1453490820006307
It stands to reason that this time- and cost-expensive method can never replace conventional epidurographies, but can help to interpret them properly.	3.4499200574816453
A 71-year-old woman suffered from pronounced erosion of her nose after soft X-ray therapy (total dose 28 Gy, half dose depth 10.5-11.5 mm).	3.0966660309262646
5 weeks after the end of the irradiation no healing tendency was observed.	3.896496172072301
This unusual clinical course was caused by a simultaneously existing pemphigus vulgaris that worsened after radiotherapy, presumably as a consequence of the release of epidermal antigens.	3.5545460908034303
In this case it is improbable that the pemphigus was induced by the radiotherapy, as has been reported on several occasions in the literature.	3.2204121469131515
However, this possibility cannot be entirely excluded.	2.727262964563968
A vascular etiology of Parkinson's disease (PD) has been long debated.	3.3110394972155217
In order to search for an ischemic basis of PD we assessed the clinical symptomatology of a consecutive group of 60 PD patients and compaired their frequency of cerebrovascular risk factors, carotid atherosclerosis and ischemic brain lesions with age-matched groups of stroke patients and normals.	3.1787455048450526
There were 16 (27%) subjects with PD who also had symptoms of cerebrovascular disease.	3.1459301464569447
The frequencies of carotid stenoses, ischemic brain lesions and most of cerebrovascular risk factors seen in the latter group was comparable with those of stroke patients and significantly higher than in the investigational subsets of patients with "pure" PD and normals.	3.839025833203669
Only one (1.6%) individual with PD presented signs suggestive of an ischemic etiology of parkinsonism.	2.882693888869417
These findings suggest that cerebrovascular disease occurs in approximately one fourth of patients with PD, but seldomly is causally related.	3.6205464255991386

The aim of this study was to evaluate the role of magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) in the diagnosis of patients with neurosarcoidosis.	3.4684288380078416

All patients had signs and symptoms referable to the head and were examined with gadolinium enhancement.	3.5556619592155316
A wide spectrum of MR findings was noted: periventricular and white matter lesions on T2 W spin echo images, mimicking multiple sclerosis (46%); multiple supratentorial and infratentorial brain lesions, mimicking metastases (36%); solitary intraaxial mass, mimicking high-grade astrocytoma (9%); solitary extraaxial mass, mimicking meningioma (5%); leptomeningeal enhancement (36%).	3.144243143598084
The diagnosis of neurosarcoidosis is often difficult, particularly so in patients who lack either pulmonary or systemic manifestations of sarcoidosis.	3.2079213102817024
MRI shows a wide spectrum of brain abnormalities associated with neurosarcoidosis.	3.2322561956142546
These findings, however, are not specific for sarcoidosis and one must consider appropriate clinical circumstances in arriving at the correct diagnosis.	3.4531858487392966
In selected cases with isolated brain involvement, meningeal or cerebral biopsy may be required.	3.1471461008450197

The tendency towards sphincter-preserving resection for distal rectal cancers has led to a revival of the technique of coloanal anastomosis (CAA) in recent years.	3.205009624576235
In order to improve functional results, creation of a colonic J-pouch in conjunction with a coloanal anastomosis (CPA) was proposed.	2.9378271186827956
Two different operation techniques exist: i) Double-stapling with the anastomosis close to the dentate line and ii) intersphincteric resection with the anastomosis located immediately at the dentate line.	2.9779327541564533
A long rectal remnant after double-stapling leads to urgency in 15 % of the patients due to stool retention in the atonic remnant.	3.308309797351838
No propulsive motility patterns were recorded from the pouch which is emptyed passively by upper colonic peristalsis.	2.8842270457602526
Therefore colonic pouches should be fashionned of descending colon and should not exceed a length of 6 cm in order to prevent stool fragmentation.	3.504897460476612
Under these conditions the average stool frequency is reduced from 2-6 /d after CAA to 1-3 /d after CPA.	3.484360862304831
This effect is maximal during the first postoperative months, but is still significant after 3 years.	3.73465029999198
Colonic pouch construction also leads, due to better blood supply and prevention of pelvic hematomas, to a significant decrease of the anastomotic insufficiency rate from 10,0 % after CAA to 5,4 % after CPA.	3.5957474732674304
Therefore creation of a colonic J-pouch should be combined with coloanal reconstruction if the oncologic situation allows a sphincter-preserving procedure.	2.707357135034518

After birth, they developed a withdrawal syndrome (neonatal abstinence syndrome).	3.1649160542364907
Fifty control infants and their mothers were selected from neonatal wards.	3.26515169393816

The methadone infants had a significantly higher mean birth weight (2822 g) than children in the group without methadone (2471 g).	3.6303037609919664
The abstinence syndrome was much more intense in the methadone group (convulsions 47.1%) than in heroin-exposed babies without methadone treatment (convulsions 27.1%).	3.0625067123731475
Women in methadone maintenance programs lived in more stable socioeconomic conditions than opiate-addicted women without methadone substitution.	2.9729829411634037
Moreover, they cared significantly better for their babies: 81.3% of the methadone mothers visited their children on a regular basis and 90.9% cared adequately.	2.8135010098682107

A diagnostic scoring system, recently published by Ohmann et al.	3.008959057181706
in this journal, was validated by analyzing the clinicopathological data of a consecutive series of 2,359 patients, admitted for suspicion of acute appendicitis.	3.372131822474034
The results of the scoring system were compared to the results of clinical evaluation by junior (provisional) and senior surgeons (final clinical diagnosis).	3.2475711517340704
To assess the diagnostic ability of the score, the accuracy and positive predictive value were defined as the major diagnostic performance parameters; the rate of theoretical negative laparotomies and that of diagnostic errors served as the major procedural performance parameters.	3.958685095134187
Of 2,359 patients admitted for suspected acute appendicitis, 662 were proven to have acute appendicitis by histology, for a prevalence of 28 %.	3.5410766645893026
The overall sensitivity, specificity, positive predictive value, negative predictive value, and accuracy of the provisional clinical diagnosis were 0.50, 0.94, 0.77, 0.83, and 0.82; 0.93, for the score 0.63, 0.93, 0.77, 0.86 and 0.84, and for the final clinical diagnosis 0.90, 0.94, 0.85, 0.96, and 0.93, respectively.	3.162866657034982
Of the main diagnostic performance parameter, the accuracy of the score was signifianctly better than that of provisional clinical diagnosis (P < 0.05, 2 test).	3.469750424202226
The score yielded a rate of negative appendecomies and laparotomies of 14.3 and 12.3 %.	3.0019182617327878
With respect to the rate of overlooked cases of acute apendicitis, the score demonstrated a superior performance, with only 6 cases missed (0.9 %).	3.3627969388577035
However, the number of patients with acute appendicitis, including those with perforated disease, who were not identified by the score, was almost four times that of the final clinical diagnosis (245 vs 63).	3.97297391659621
With regard to the main procedural performance parameter, the score resulted in a significantly smaller number of diagnostic errors than the provisional clinical investigator (P < 0.05, 2 test).	3.1203236562108305
The results of this study indicate that the diagnostic scoring system might be helpful when experienced investigators or additional diagnostic modalities such as ultrasonography are not available.	3.4588703268220247

We studied the levels of D-dimer, thrombin-antithrombin III complex (TAT), prothrombin fragments 1 and 2 (PTF), and global tests of coagulation like prothrombin time (PT), activated partial thromboplastin time (PTT), thrombin time (TT) and platelet count, plasminogen activation (PA) and fibrinogen concentration to estimate the success of heparin therapy in the two groups.	3.172734434448416
TT and fibrinogen concentration were not suitable to follow the course of the coagulation disorder.	4.244994921621763
PT, PTT, platelet count progressively PA, D-dimer, TAT, and PTF normalised progressively after heparinisation.	2.6753119913478463
However, only the last three parameters were sensitive enough to show different effects of variable dosages of lmw-heparin.	2.971960625757774
D-dimer, TAT, and PTF levels declined in proportion with heparin concentrations, and thus appear to be the most useful parameters for monitoring the therapeutic effect of heparin in septic coagulopathies.	3.3679571926674
In patients with acute or chronic myocarditis, arrhythmias are a common and often the only clinical symptom in the natural course of the disease.	3.4132189728476874
The potentially malignant tachy- and bradyarrhythmias are of particular significance in the differential diagnosis of sudden cardiac death in myocarditis.	3.446907298482346
Factors responsible for the increased incidence of cardiac arrhythmias are structural changes, parameters of ventricular dynamics and vascular changes.	3.413352636618117
Fibrosis and scarring of the myocardial tissue and secondary hypertrophy and atrophy of the myocytes favor the development of ectopic pacemakers, late potentials and reentry as a result of inhomogeneous stimulus conduction.	3.5985795719406735
Furthermore, parameters of ventricular dynamics such as increased wall tension, increased myocardial oxygen consumption and diminished coronary reserve in the case of disturbed systolic or diastolic left ventricular function also contribute to the increased incidence of arrhythmias.	3.2495216340464967
Lastly, vascular factors can further increase the arrhythmogenicity of the inflamed myocardium through the disturbance of micro- and macrovascular perfusion and the resulting myocardial ischemia.	3.258605063165053
Non-invasive rhythmological evaluation by 24 h Holter ECG, measurement of ventricular late potentials and heart rate variability can be used for orienting risk stratification of the at-risk patient with myocarditis.	3.6253498187806747
Programmed atrial and ventricular electrophysiological stimulation also has a relatively high predictive value for spontaneous ventricular tachyarrhythmias.	3.861262064375293
It should be emphasized that, at the present time, optimal electrophysiological parameters with a high predictive value do not exist.	3.209829552380302
In a selected patient population, immunosuppressive therapy in addition to conventional antiarrhythmic therapy can lead to the reduction or complete suppression of spontaneous and inducible arrhythmias.	3.5743567537865713
Nevertheless, in the interim, further precautionary antiarrhythmic measures such as serial antiarrhythmic treatment, VT ablation and AICD implantation are necessary in patients with malignant cardiac arrhythmias.	3.4803743112125174
Right ventricular myocardial biopsy for demonstration or exclusion of myocarditis is an important additional examination which can improve the differential diagnosis and treatment of patients with cardiac arrhythmias of unclear etiology.	4.182914476853274
Material and methods: Autografts (4 mm) of the left common carotid artery in 20 Wistar rats were harvested up to 4 weeks after surgery.	3.6184707312155355

The media had in its axis direction the lowest reparative potential for regenerating the continuity break.	2.927205602028557

Patients with a prospectively defined clinical endpoint differed significantly from those with an uneventful course with respect to age, left ventricular ejection fraction, mean RR interval from Holter recording ( 753  +/-  153 vs 921  +/-  132 ms), mean RR from short term recording (783  +/-  153 vs 914  +/-  163 ms), and SDNN from the Holter recording (71  +/-  27 vs 97  +/-  29 ms; p < 0.001) However, patients with and without clinical event could not be seperated by means of SDNN measured from short term ECG registrations (35  +/-  22 vs 41  +/-  19 ms; P = NS).	3.3158756935758915

Some of these techniques have been adapted for use in intensive care patients whilst being mechanically ventilated.	4.090657183218885
However, most measurement setups are bulky, cumbersome to use and their running costs are high.	2.839406352954317
Hence FRC measurement has not become a routine method in intensive care although it offers considerable advantages in the management of ventilated  patients such as the determination of "best PEEP", the detection of progressive alveolar collapse in the course of acute lung injury and during weaning from mechanical ventilation.	3.8377054829692283
Up to now most efforts to improve and simplify FRC measurement were made at the expense of accuracy.	2.8040152689065385
An ideal method ought to be accurate, easy to handle and cost-effective.	3.330147375739642

These demands can be met using modern data acquisition software.	3.1652122312306945

Blisters had never developed and did not occur during follow up.	4.26957291454021

Evaluating the length of the first metatarsal and the amount of variation, the results were less satisfying.	4.901538078438219
The metatarsophalangeal angles could be corrected by 14  ° and the intermetatarsal angles by 7  ° on average.	3.024588559969253
The sophisticated operative procedure limits the use of this technique as a standard procedure.	4.625570394274739
The contribution of Rudolf Virchow to dermatology seems to have been forgotten, or present-day dermatologists are not aware of it.	3.0693370271424776
The present historical review is intended to show that Virchow's thoughts and the terminology created by him are still alive.	3.1177607713400937
The report encompasses a short biography, including Virchow's nonmedical activities.	2.865580632807741
It starts with early experimental publications, which laid to the foundation for his fame, and with dermatological studies of his early period.	3.087223282355947
This is followed by a detailed description of his contributions pertaining to dermatology in his largest work, "Cellularpathologie".	2.77512302087617
Special mention is made of Virchow's lasting contributions to medical, and particularly dermatological, terminology.	3.2009598681103846
Finally, his historical studies, his latter small publications on topics in dermatology, his pupils and scientific friends, and the social-political and anthropological activities of later years are discussed.	3.0270108059729695
Thus, a multifaceted picture is painted of a still modern pathologist who has influenced dermatology in multiple ways.	2.71732806732395
Starter's pistols are often bought for self-defense, but can also be used for criminal activities (e.g.	3.3365307073421975
assaults, etc.).	3.1009574187948172
When a starter's pistol is loaded with blank cartridges and is fired, a powerful shooting noise results.	2.6938475665620985
The level of the noise produced is high enough to cause acoustic trauma.	3.3201083923218477
For legal examinations and giving an expert opinion further information is needed about the power of such noise.	3.2227726428752925
We examined how high peak sound pressure levels were of the gunshots of blank cartridges and whether there existed any directional characteristics from the noise emissions.	2.8576560408663547
In all, 15 different models of starter's pistols of 8 different calibres were examined.	2.6884726180757617
Four transducers were situated in the horizontal plane around the muzzle: 0 ° (shooting direction), 45 °, 90 °, and 180 ° (towards the firer).	3.0550717362221773
The distances between the transducers and the muzzle were 25 cm, 50 cm, 100 cm, and 200 cm.	3.1933024334482205
At a distance of 1 m and in the 0 ° shooting direction the peak sound pressure levels of nearly all weapons tested exceeded 160 dB.	3.21746354201115
At a shooting distance of 25 cm the peak sound pressure levels reached 181 dB.	2.9282464116667706
In addition, we observed a directional characteristic concerning the emission of noise: pistols produced higher peak sound pressure levels to the front than backwards towards the firer.	2.6992102825920785
Owing to their rare incidence, foreign body injuries in the region of the orbit, skull base and skull have up to now mostly been treated in  the literature by means of case reports.	4.377498385427835
Here we present our experience and treatment regimen for ten patients we have treated during the last 3 years.	3.9986098094969025
In seven cases the foreign body was located in the orbit alone, whereas in three others the orbit and the frontal base were equally involved.	3.332763993238539
Except for one case, the foreign material could be removed completely.	3.8933190491333356
Three patients suffered from partial or complete loss of vision and one patient developed a psychosyndrome during the follow-up period, but no late effects were registered in the remaining six cases.	3.973852966367873
Before removing the foreign body and carefully reconstructing the accident, however, we strongly recommend the documentation of possible functional deficits, preferably by means of photography.	4.143475100793161
CT is the method of choice for localising the foreign body, except for the depiction of wood particles.	3.5732314983534144
Here, sonography and MR should be performed.	3.241460354299533
As the therapeutic approach, the cooperation of an interdisciplinary team of ophthalmogists, neuro- and maxillofacial surgeons seems mandatory.	3.343204436480703
To avoid inflammation, the immediate removal of the foreign material is recommended in cases with considerable intracranial lesions: post-operative neurologic and intensive care monitoring should be provided.	4.0194098096141335
Treatment is completed by high-dose antibiotics, using CSF-soluble substances and, if necessary, anti-convulsives.	3.7905758335892856

The goal of this study was to examine whether the characteristics of rocuronium could make it an appropriate relaxant for the anaesthetic management of operations of intermediate duration such as endoscopic upper airway surgery.	2.7354260542981996

Treatment of tachycardic atrial fibrillation (AF) is difficult in patients with congestive heart failure because many drugs which exert negative dromotropic effects (beta-blockers, calcium channel antagonists) may depress ventricular contractility and/or decrease arterial blood pressure.	3.3103006235566537
We have identified 2 intravascular sites in the superior (SVC) and inferior vena cava (IVC) where parasympathetic nerves, which innervate the atrioventricular node, can be stimulated electrically.	3.134633682830179
In 8 dogs, a 7-F catheter with an expandable electrode basket at its tip was non-fluoroscopically positioned in the SVC and in the proximal IVC (time for positioning: 3-5 minutes).	3.452956845990866
High-frequency electrical parasympathetic stimulation (PS) with 20 Hz at an impulse duration of 0.1 ms was performed during pacing induced AF.	2.797394052922423
Results: With increasing stimulus strength, a graded ventricular rate slowing was observed during PS in the SVC and IVC (P<0.01, ANOVA).	2.997183772013283
The negative dromotropic effect started instantaneously after onset of PS and ceased immediately after termination of PS.	3.0308828917047776
During ventricular pacing at a constant rate, no decrease of the arterial blood pressure was observed during PS.	4.208104583911238
PS in the IVC yielded significantly lower stimulation thresholds than in the SVC.	3.9989535203909217
Conclusions: Transvenous parasympathetic stimulation for ventricular rate control during AF can easily be achieved in the SVC and IVC in dogs.	3.305790900921552
If the results translate to patients, PS may be very beneficial in the treatment of AF in patients with congestive heart failure.	3.5118749468351713
A total of 86 patients suffering from fractures of the thoracolumbar spine were followed up after an average time period of 57 months (12-98).	3.7472604893922186
Of these patients, 56 were treated operatively and 30 conservatively.	3.4275510428094536
According to the AO/ASIF classification, 66% of the operated group were fractures of type A, 29% of type B, and 5% of type C. Charcot foot in its original sense is equivalent to stage 4 of hereditary motor and sensory neuropathy (HMSN) which is known as Charcot-Marie-Tooth disease since 1886.	3.062249963912202
This entity, which can be subdivided into 3 groups including subgroups, predominantly begins during childhood and progresses slowly.	3.3552404829819586
The first symptom, often unnoticed by the patient for a long period, is weakness of the intrinsic foot muscles with consecutive hammer-toe formation and mobile pes cavus.	3.5820422813623845
Progredient atrophy of the peroneal, extensor, tibialis posterior and finally triceps surae muscles leads to fixed pes cavus varus excavatus with severe varus deformity of the hindfoot, secondary varus position of the talus at the ankle level and subsequent arthrosis of the medial compartment.	3.3903257289237425
Permanent varus deformity of the ankle almost invariably leads to stress fractures of the malleoli because of repetitive microtrauma (stage 5 of HMSN).	3.6277181282497235
The alveolar adenoma of the lung is a rare benign tumor in which the normal parenchymal architectur is imitated by a proliferation of both the alveolar epithelial cells and the mesenchymal septal cells.	3.8544449811027626
The first description, based on six cases, was published in 1986 by Yousem and Hochholzer.	3.192213689406074
We investigated an alveolar adenoma of the lung immunhistochemical by means of antibodies against apoprotein B and C of human surfactant.	3.586566299656962
Both the lining cells and the macrophages in the alveolar-like spaces were stained.	3.541140457570996
The septal connection tissue cells did not react.	3.0490446904791404
These findings confirm the expression of surfactant constituants and, hence, the differentiation into type II pneumocytes of the epithelial cells of the alveolar adenoma.	3.610701890949239
Breast cancer is the most frequent malignant tumor in women, whereas it is rare in men.	4.314784929611425
In our own case series the ratio is 175 : 1.	3.260449965440297

The rapid development of recombinant DNA technology and our enhanced understanding of the genetic basis of human disease has facilitated the development of new molecular therapeutic modalities, termed gene therapy.	3.4216801583590435
Gene therapy involves the transfer of functional genes into somatic cells and their expression in target tissues in order to replace absent genes, correct defective genes, or induce antitumoral activity in the tumor-bearing host.	3.477530689440975
Currently, an increasing number of gene therapy strategies are being investigated in experimental and clinical trials.	3.636594758794207
Despite substantial progress, a number of technical and logistical hurdles must still be overcome before gene therapy can be safely and effectively applied in the human patient.	3.604512799649918
Since gene therapy involves complex cell processing and can be time consuming and costly, simplifications or even alternative approaches will be necessary in order to establish this therapy as suitable for clinical use.	3.47068843768244

Using the PTB simulator, which emits real signals from patients, we examined the precision of the oscillometric blood pressure measurement with the Dinamap 1846 (Critikon) and the HP M-1008B (Hewlett Packard).	2.5678960764548697
For this purpose we simultaneously registered invasive arterial pulsewave, cuff pressure and cuff pressure oscillations of 20 patients from our intensive care unit and stored them in the database of the simulator.	2.9546490936026006
The invasive reference blood pressure values were determined following the recommendations given by the Association for the Advancement of Medical Instrumentation.	3.1976741794363828
The invasive system showed a cut-off frequency of 35 Hz; the damping constant was 0.21.	3.0668534799310123
With 49 record signals from patients we carried out 15 simulated measurements each.	3.1671441713537565
From a total of 49 bio-signals from patients the Dinamap 1846 was able to process 41 signals and the HP M-1008B 47 signals.	2.9388244205718217
The mean error of the oscillometric blood pressure measurement of the systolic, diastolic and mean arterial pressure amounted to -2.50 mmHg, 3.35 mmHg (P<0.05) and 1.51 mmHg with the Dinamap 1846 and to -8.5 mmHg (P<0.001), -5.15 mmHg (P<0.001) and -5.58 mmHg (P<0.001) for the HP M-1008B.	3.151188881245238
The 95% confidence limit for the systolic, diastolic and the mean arterial pressure amounts to 56 mmHg, 30 mmHg and 35 mmHg for the Dinamap 1846 and 50 mmHg, 38 mmHg and 35 mmHg for the HP M-1008B.	2.7237249258663625
The differences between that two instruments could be caused by the different algorithms for the calculation of blood pressure values and different artefact detection and elimination techniques.	3.474363619697886
The results of the performance tests we achieved with the PTB simulator correspond to the results of other clinical examinations.	3.4610543280306842
The American Association for the Advanecement of Medical Instrumentation recommends a maximum mean error of 5 +/- 8 mmHg.	3.440776793835392
None of the examined instruments lay within these limits.	3.0657158604208385
Due to the systematic and stochastic errors, we think that the Dinamap 1846 (Critikon) and the HP M-1008B (Hewlett Packard) do not achieve performance levels that are adequate for measuring critically ill patients.	2.4185776944002426
Many patients consulting medical emergency services make the initial contact because of psychiatric emergency situations.	2.892071296020533
However, emergency physicians and their assistants are usually not sufficiently experienced in psychiatry.	3.251347795782061

3 different types of complex spinal trauma are defined: Type I means a multilevel contiguous or non contiguous unstable injury, type II is described as a spinal injury with concommitant thoracic or abdominal lesion, typ III stands for the coincidence of spinal injury and polytrauma.	3.2346524027218417
Overlapping of different types occurs.	3.9570751255979157
Type I: The incidence amounts according a german multicenter study to about 2,5 %.	3.397262109070106
Multilevel injuries need to be stabilized for a long distance from posterior.	4.338471448424169
With a thoroughful analysis the segments to be fused are determined.	3.175345123223041
Typ II: The leading thoracic injury is a lung contusion which occurs in up to 50 % of the cases.	3.478385074622809
A CT scan of the thorax during the first diagnostic screening is recommended.	3.8580488693458808
Early reduction and stabilization from posterior should be aimed at.	3.2530410001876904
During the first two weeks anterior procedures are contraindicated.	3.229192173200213
Abdominal injuries are to be found in 3-4 % of all spinal injuries.	4.823135592738842
All organs could be affected.	3.4518985696894466
A typical constallation is the "seat-belt syndrome" with lesions of the upper abdominal organs and a flexiondistraction injury of the upper lumbar spine.	3.9295408231928013
The main problem is to make the diagnosis of both components initially.	3.9712331427613137
Most of the patients may be treated in one operation by first taking care of the abdominal injury and than stabilazing the spine.	4.276409846075644
The prognosis of this combination is favorable.	3.0847722259661703
Typ III: In 17-18 % of all polytraumatized patients lesions of the spine are to be diagnosed.	4.004862765832074
From these only one third need surgical care.	3.0836994754771454
From 680 patients with operatively treated fractures of the thoracolumbar junction 6,2 % were polytraumatized according to the multicenter study mentioned above.	3.6541898311257968
Surgical stabilization should be performed in the primary phase (day-1-surgery).	4.681274772749814
Additional injuries, potentially time consuming operations with a high blood loss sometimes necessitate a different approach.	3.6776600674532562
Non stabilized spinal injuries apparently do not have the same negative effect on the whole organism as long bone fractures.	3.429101729909876
In the early phase of treatment on the C-spine only anterior procedures and on the thoraco-lumbar spine only posterior techniques should be applied.	3.5627337008722533
Experimental studies have shown that in traffic accidents with frontal impact the new airbag system can significantly reduce the incidence of severe injuries and fatal outcome.	3.522210528017188
The question of whether the airbag itself induces specific patterns of injury needs further investigation.	2.6707757388014137
Two cases of traffic accidents with airbag protection are presented here.	2.909922773530758
The first case report clearly shows the life-saving and injury-reducing effect of the airbag system in a traffic accident with frontal impact at 100 km/h.	3.1114043449909103
In the second case only minor injuries of the face were diagnosed initially.	3.3730696222473617
Hemodynamic instability occurred after 3 h of hospitalization due to rupture of the azygos vein.	3.4987374299514657
Analysis of the presented cases shows that, besides the well-known benefits, there are certain injury patterns that seem to be related to the use of airbags.	4.076381164626944
These have not been described before.	3.565594632224525
It is concluded that patients who were involved in traffic accidents with airbag deployment have to be hospitalized and followed up carefully over time, even though they are initially stable, as potentially fatal sequelae of deceleration trauma can occur later.	3.2566663821406725
In our opinion it is not possible to estimate the severity of airbag-associated injuries with conventional methods.	3.67565334766401

In 10 patients the ISS was > 25 pts.	2.9874991100160093

Since the 1970 s, various methods such as mechanical percutaneous nucleotomy, automated percutaneous nucleotomy, intradiscal laser procedures and, in part, endoscopic intradiscal procedures have been developed and also used clinically.	3.424806787494744

Aortic dissection with no entry or false lumen flow was recently identified as intramural hemorrhage of the aortic wall (IMH).	3.1745473534214894
Analysis of the literature revealed 209 cases of in vivo diagnosed IMH reflecting 17% of all dissections, whereas in autoptic studies this condition is found in 4-13%.	3.7302623269186244
Transesophageal echocardiography, computed tomography, magnetic resonance imaging and aortography (to rule out dissection) have been applied for diagnosing IMH in 57, 49, 43 and 38% of the cases, respectively.	3.6207765670343157
However, diagnostic accuracy of each modality is not available to date.	3.3819845981185894
In 34%, IMH involves the ascending aorta (type A).	3.01110003226131
The average age of patients with IMH ranges between 55 and 65 years; 65% are males.	3.495823018188741
In 12%, IMH was associated with abdominal aortic aneurysm.	3.3684140112797305
With 87%, arterial hypertension is the predominant risk factor for IMH irrespective of its location.	3.614433128563077
As suggested by the term "mediastinal apoplexy" IMH may - similar to cerebral apoplexy - result from hypertensive rupture of the vasa vasorum in the aortic media.	3.0990599075762373
With 97%, the majority of patients present with acute chest or back pain similar to classic dissection.	3.6062658258586247
Mediastinal widening is found in 83%; signs of hemothorax/pleural effusion are present in 38%, acute aortic regurgitation in 26%, pericardial effusion in 23%, acute neurologic deficits in 12%, and pulse deficits in 5%.	3.244927857092258
In 18%, IMH progresses to dissection and in another 15% to rupture.	3.4426616308731437
In 25% and 28%, respectively, dissection and rupture occur in the ascending aorta and in 12% and 9%, respectively, in the descending thoracic aorta.	4.478361273282289
With surgical repair, mortality of type A IMH is lowered to 18% compared to 60% with medical treatment (p<0.01).	3.4677451337454985
In contrast, with 8% mortality associated with medical treatment, prognosis of type B IMH is more favorable without surgical intervention, the latter associated with a 30-day mortality of 33% (p<0.05).	3.7155307826676163
Thus, IMH is a potential precursor of dissection and should be managed like dissection with undelayed surgical intervention in patients with type A IMH and with medical treatment in type B IMH.	4.172585291446396

After approval by our institutional review board, 62 patients (ASA I-II) were randomly assigned to three groups to either receive 3xED95 or 5xED95 of cisatracurium or 3xED90 of vecuronium prior to intubation as a bolus.	2.213880727051562
After oral premedication with 2 mg lormetazepam anaesthesia was induced with thiopental (4-12 mg/kg) and maintained with O2/N2O and isoflurane (1.5%-2%).	3.4527928134718957

Heart rate (HR) and blood pressure (BP) were monitored every minute.	2.1747056104515066

After application of the study drug, median values of blood pressure and heart rate were stable.	4.277405002692316

Autolyzed, antigen-extracted, allogenic (AAA) bone is an osteoinductive preparation of completely demineralized bone matrix.	2.6042193140157663
It has been clinically applied for years.	2.895637139970935
In an experimental study in rabbits, we evaluated the influence of cortical bone and periosteum on the amount of bone formation following augmentation with AAA bone.	3.7406082903907234
Two implants of standardized size were placed on the femoral bone of rabbits.	3.572590039507165
A cell-excluding PTFE membrane was wrapped circularly around the femur as well as the anterior implant shielding the implant from the surrounding periosteum.	3.4431803699248467
The posterior implant was exposed directly to the periosteum while being shielded from the cortical bone by the membrane.	3.1015371168088195
Thus, two compartments were created selectively, preventing contact between the periosteum or cortical bone and the implants.	3.1977501706365965
For each compartment the area and volume of the induced new bone were evaluated by computerized radiograph analysis and quantitative CT (pQCT) scans.	3.175646498246413
Implantation of AAA bone led to new bone formation in both compartments.	3.353486599788452
Contact of the periosteum and the implant led to an almost fourfold increase in bone volume.	3.584392294798535
Although bone formation showed interindividual variations, the difference of both compartments was highly significant using the Student's t-test for paired samples (P < 0.0001).	3.2055364141810543
The data show that periosteum is the primary source of new bone formation in augmentations with osteoinductive materials as it is rich in inducible progenitor cells and is well vascularized.	3.1571325311799217
In osseous augmentations with AAA bone, the periosteum should be preserved in order to achieve a close contact of the osteoinductive implant.	3.7414464570832893
Shielding from the periosteum, e.g., by cell-excluding membranes, leads to significantly less bone formation following implantation of AAA bone and should therefore be avoided.	3.409208776239619

The antipyretic analgesics still comprise the most widely used group of analgesic compounds.	3.1662869907323907

A 38-year-old man presented with an intracranial extra-axial tumour at the base of the left posterior fossa which proved to be a meningeal melanocytoma.	3.311920649854805
Meningeal melanocytoma is a rare, benign melanotic tumour of the leptomeninges occuring predominantly in the posterior fossa or the upper spinal cord in adults.	3.781211050561745
It shows characteristic cytologic features with isomorphic epitheloid or spindle-shaped cells, often with prominent nucleoli and a variable content of intracytoplasmic melanin.	3.0374294971756695
It usually lacks signs of malignancy such as high mitotic rate, necroses or infiltrative growth and shows a low labeling index in proliferation marker studies.	2.8193066093040393
Its immunohistological profile with S-100 protein-, vimentin- and HMB-45-positive tumour cells is similar to that of (primary or metastatic) malignant melanoma.	3.3557132561563767
This differential diagnosis is crucial because of the totally different therapeutic and prognostic implications.	4.122020364439964
Therefore, everyone dealing with surgical neuropathology should be familiar with the rare, but clinically important diagnosis of meningeal melanocytoma.	2.976609588110834

Neither laboratory findings nor imaging procedures provided any firm evidence of an underlying cardiac, renal or endocrinological disease.	2.9930505533893377
There was no suggestion of a storage disease.	2.915913325978266
Skin biopsy showed foam cells and granulomatous inflammation, so the patient was tentatively diagnosed as having a monosymptomatic Melkersson-Rosenthal Syndrome.	3.196807312407935
Treatment with clofazimine 100 mg daily was initiated.	3.092370867109532
Regular follow-up visits over 7 months revealed no evidence of recurrence.	3.741724552923485
The patient died a sudden cardiac death a few months later.	3.5864485483016857
The relatives refused an autopsy.	3.3700622086149026
The definite cause of her facial swelling remains unclear as we discuss the differential diagnostic possibilities.	3.5308591323993204
An 81-year-old patient had prolonged competitive neuromuscular blockade with train-of-four ratios of 0.1 and 0.5, respectively, after two successive anaesthesia procedures (enflurane-N2O/O2; vecuronium-succinylcholine-sequence) for transurethral prostate resection.	3.0866353916179543
Although antagonism with neostigmine was promptly successful after the first, 65-min period of anaesthesia (1.5 mg vecuronium for precurarization, 100 mg succinylcholine for intubation, 3 mg vecuronium), repetitive and chronologically staggered administration of neostigmine after the second, 30-min period of anaesthesia (1 mg vecuronium for precurarization, 100 mg succinylcholine for intubation) had hardly any effect, so that the patient had to be ventilated mechanically for a total of 4.5 h. Laboratory analysis revealed homozygous, atypical, plasma cholinesterase (790 U/l; dibucaine number 23; genotype E<![CDATA[|lefbop|a<![CDATA[|clobop||opnbop|1<![CDATA[|clobop|E<![CDATA[|lefbop|a<![CDATA[|clobop||opnbop|1<![CDATA[|clobop|).	2.707282670656557
This retrospectively confirmed a succinylcholine-induced phase II block in both instances, as had already been suspected following the second anaesthetic procedure.	3.106086163707546
The degree of block transformation, and thus the available time, are decisive in explaining the diverse effects of antagonism here.	3.1850506196647945
It must be assumed that a complete phase II block developed after the first succinylcholine exposure owing to the longer duration of anaesthesia; the purely competitive component (train-of-four ratio 0.1) was easily antagonized by neostigmine.	3.115351345898152
At the time of the attempted antagonism after the second, shorter period of anaesthesia, however, block transformation was still incomplete (train-of-four ratio 0.5).	3.3317068981640365
The administration of neostigmine therefore rather intensified the depolarization segment of the mixed block, so that repeated attempts at antagonism then inhibited any further block transformation.	3.052372628702527
The Ph1-negative groups of chronic myeloproliferative diseases (CMPD) are described, and histopathological criteria that distinguish them from each other are given.	3.2963861113051074
These are based upon observations in primary biopsies from 2,331 patients with CMPDs among a total of 34,160 patients referred between 1 January 1989 and 30 June 1994 to the Bone Marrow Registry.	3.2870645167574035

Histological progress in each group is characterized by (1) increasing number and pleomorphy of megakaryocytes, (2) increasing fibrosis, and (3) excess of blasts.	4.0078291977678
These three features can be observed in diagnostic biopsies before any therapy.	3.7284552738778243
Therefore, it is recommended that such alterations be reported semiquantitatively.	2.8770919919656817
