Objective: Patients in a surgical intensive care unit (ICU) have a high incidence of nosocomial infections which often lead to septic shock and death.	3.4110101714804935
Since calculated antibiotic treatment is often difficult, it was recommended to obtain routine nose/throat swabs in order to have a better idea of the causative agent when a systemic inflammatory response occurs in a given patient.	4.157417459566431
Methods: In 1435 patients of our cardio-surgical ICU, routine nose/throat swabs were taken three times a week and tested for micro-organisms and resistance to antibiotics.	2.7882057515346634
Of these 86 patients developed clinical signs of systemic inflammation, and additional blood cultures were obtained.	3.236482395176508
Antibiotic treatment was achieved to cover the microbes from the nose/throat swabs, or a calculated dosage was given to patients whose swabs had tested negative.	3.3028247955095744
Results: Of the 86 patients with systemic inflammation, 29 had blood cultures positive for microbes.	3.2338887574362176
Of these 29 patients, 18 received a calculated antibiotic coverage based on their positive nose/throat cultures prior to the return of the blood cultures from the lab.	3.4368177852840724
However, in only 11 of the 18 patients were routine swabs and blood cultures positive with the same microbes.	3.3247772193798815
While positive routine swabs are quite specific for sepsis when there is a systemic inflammatory response, routine swabs are not a suitable screening tool due to their low sensitivity.	3.7471906831137436
Conclusions: Routine nose/throat swabs led to earlier specific antibiotic treatment in only 22% of our patients with clinical signs of systemic inflammation.	3.372126975911316
In addition, in almost 40% of the cases organisms detected in the routine swabs and blood cultures were not identical.	3.5836401436948933
As a result, we feel that routine swabs are only of limited value in instituting earlier, specific antibiotic treatment in septic patients.	2.7334261710335634

Problem There is a great need to expand current knowledge of the various functional capacity measurements used in the rehabilitation of chronic low back pain (CLBP) patients.	4.3495574747998145
The literature on these patients reports that mobility, endurance, trunk strength and lifting capacity decrease during the process of chronicity.	3.209860047123574
Chronically disabled patients appear to have lower functional capacity than asymptomatic persons.	3.3077657681598707
Methods Our study group consisted of 90 disabled CLBP patients (44 female, 46 male; average age 42 years) who underwent a multidisciplinary 8-week daily treatment program of functional restoration with behavioral support (instruction, endurance training, strength exercises, behavioral and treatment to facilitate return to work therapy).	3.112893928939885
Initially these patients where compared with 107 asymptomatic persons (44 female, 63 male, average age 41 years).	3.0164947260674753
The patients were investigated before and after treatment, and at intervals of 6 and 12 months.	4.422629498929785
The reliability of the functional measurements was evaluated by interrater comparison.	3.4732705665424635
Physical assessment included a medical examination (mainly diagnosis of radicular or nonradicular pain), changes in the lumbar spine revealed by X-ray studies according to Herron and Turner [50], rating of physical impairment according to Waddell [117], flexibility, length of hamstrings muscles (SLR), test of power and endurance of trunk movement by standardized exercises according to the Swiss group of Spring [102] and isokinetic measurements (LIDO Back), tests of lifting capacity (LIDO Lift), and (in part) of general endurance on a cycle ergometer (CASE 15 Marquette).	3.101562404263967
Results Physical findings showed that mobility was reduced substantially in patients suffering from back pain due to reduced SLR (shortened hamstrings) and decreased spinal mobility.	3.355843988197277
Patients also demonstrated significant reductions in their ability to perform lifting tasks in comparison to healthy individuals.	3.5747590081736265
The results of trunk flexion showed no significant differences between patients and the control group, whereas the ability to perform trunk extension was much better in the control group.	3.7869839688806213
In principle we found the same results with isokinetic measurements as in the exercises without machines.	3.7251844600815014
Cardiovascular endurance was also much better in the control group than it was in the back pain patients.	3.52869013242964
At the end of the treatment program all physical deficits were improved significantly.	3.3013990122576833
In many cases performance was comparable with that of the control group.	3.2900818124389537
With time, however, training effects gradually decreased.	3.9038791924743212
The success of treatment (return to work, absence from work, pain reduction, use of medical care) was independent of the functional status of the patients before and after treatment.	4.5622761575801
Conclusion Study results showed that physical capacity in disabled patients with low back pain is substantially reduced in comparison to persons who do not suffer from back pain.	4.283818274757171
The only exception was in trunk flexor strength and endurance, in which measurements did not differ between the patients and the control group.	3.753868352769385
However, even CLBP- patients with long-term pain and severe physical illness can successfully improve their physical condition by participating in an active treatment program.	3.290162931169298
Back extensor muscle training has to be included in physical therapy.	3.721353068800935
Because of loss of condition during the time after treatment, regular monitoring of patients and their home training programs is necessary.	3.5830184950895294
The dynamic behavior of the ossicular chain is very complex and is frequency-dependent.	3.4771217033643502
To date, this has still not been fully investigated or understood.	2.9248447631956247
There remains a lack of measurement procedures to pick up the motion of the ossicles and ear drum simultaneously with sufficient resolution.	3.629563178429859

Reactive oxygen species (ROS) are probably not only unintended, toxic side-products of oxygen metabolism in mammalian cells, they also have several important physiologic functions including antimicrobial killing, regulation of cellular proliferation and growth, and regulation of vascular tone.	2.9948393070908215
ROS are generated within the vessel wall by several mechanisms, including a vascular type of a NAD(P)H oxidase.	3.561116616284889
ROS formation can be stimulated by mechanical stress, environmental factors, the peptide angiotensin II, cytokines, native low-density lipoproteins (LDL), and in the presence of catalytic metal ions.	3.9817290054760313
Their ability to modify LDL, react with endothelial-derived nitric oxide subsequently forming peroxynitrite, and amplify the expression of various genes important for leukocyte recruitment within the arterial wall are the basis of the oxidant injury theory of atherosclerosis.	2.9101836838917836
In animal studies, antioxidant therapy (probucol, butylated hydroxytoluene, N',N'-diphenylendiamide, vitamin E, superoxide dismutase) have been successfully used to prevent fatty streak formation, and to restore impaired nitric oxide-dependent vasorelaxation.	2.9611176648147115
In man, antioxidant therapy (e.g., supplementation with vitamin E) clearly increased the resistance of LDL to oxidative modification.	2.9231819396792127
Case-controlled and prospective clinical studies suggest a relation between baseline antioxidant plasma levels and/or antioxidant supplementation and risk of cardiovascular events.	3.489033397800898
In one secondary prevention trial (randomized, blinded, placebo-controlled), vitamin E supplementation reduced significantly the risk for non-fatal myocardial infarctions.	3.412939770579043
Before general recommendations can be made, results of further large-scale trials should be awaited.	3.6053316091681062

X-rays and CT-scanning revealed severe heterotopic ossification (HO) of both hips with ancylosis (Brooker type IV).	2.8525303320097586

The prophylaxis for recurrence of HO included preoperative single-dose radiation (8 Gy) and postoperative treatment with indomethacin (150 mg per day).	3.476192243565792

No recurrence of HO was observed in x-ray.	4.002350137194476
The patient is able to work in his profession as farmer.	3.773989922441281

A retrospective study of 86 motorcycle accidents that occurred in the year 1992 is reported.	3.097638872159832
Examination of the case histories supplemented by telephone conversations yielded the following results: 90.7% of our patients were male and their average age was 28.8 years; the age group between 25 and 30 years was the most frequently involved (27.9%).	3.42749865452438
Most motorcycle accidents happened during weekend trips out in the summertime.	3.011971612936563
Special injury patterns were found for injuries of the upper and the lower extremity.	4.6316197235199645
Injuries of the upper extremity most frequently took the form of fracture of the distal radius (18.8%).	3.804880800013738
The average stay in our hospital was 35.4 days.	3.184664297003678
In 23.4% of cases the patients had to change their job after the accident.	4.0338900938140325
More than half the crashes happened with motorcycles with between 500 and 750 cc stroke volume.	2.582033761304636
Over a third (34.5%) of the patients had held their driving licences for more than 8 years.	3.6659879740812458
A plea is made for more preventive measures, such as better driving instruction, better road conditions and legislative changes, against motorcycle crashes.	3.2333901785322383
From the aspects of cost and the rate of complications it is reasonable to strive for a surgical treatment as soon as possible after the crash.	3.49442504396499
At the moment there is no consensus about the pathogenesis of RSD.	4.445421548785323
In 1942 Paul Sudeck suggested that the signs and symptoms of RSD may be provoked by an exaggerated inflammatory response to injury or operation of an extremity.	3.2727984368403664
His theory found no disciples, as most physicians believe that RSD is initiated by an hyperactive sympathetic system.	3.017750129834124
We performed various clinical and experimental investigations, including the effects of antiinflammatory treatment.	4.046647286989572
The results of these studies support the theory of Paul Sudeck.	2.914254157865341
Erectile failure after radical prostatectomy is a common postoperative disorder.	4.14775434682503

Pregnancy causes substantial changes in the cardiovascular system: cardiac output (40%-50%) and blood volume (40%) increase whereas systemic peripheral resistance and arterial pressure decrease.	3.9047999392523263
The rise in progesterone and estrogen levels accompanying pregnancy stimulates the renin-angiotension-aldosterone system.	2.894215370496051
Increased prostaglandin production follows renin activation; simultaneously, the arterial vessels show diminished angiotension sensitivity.	2.9226535930671598
The result is pronounced vasodilatation.	2.8399474455678333
Heart disease remains the most important nonobstetric cause of maternal death.	3.9243103173610967
The physiological changes in the cardiovascular system during pregnancy influence cardiac diseases in different ways.	2.9833409177156436
Pregnancy, labor, and delivery appear to be well tolerated in gravidae with an atrial septal defect, ventricular septal defect, and patents ductus arteriosus.	3.1529113034214045
Sometimes congestive heart failure occurs and appropriate medical therapy is necessary.	3.5143056328836533

The consequences for anaesthesia in parturients with congenital heart disease are discussed.	3.325919698117823
The symptoms of acquired mitral or aortic stenosis are aggravated by the physiological changes in the cardiovascular system during pregnancy; the clinical symptoms of valve insufficiency are ameliorated by vasodilatation.	3.0160124013942986
Peripartum cardiomyopathy clinically shows similar features to idiopathic dilated cardiomyopathy.	2.9669794512760235
The basis of treatment is the same as that of congestive heart failure, with the therapeutic spectrum ranging from diet to heart transplantation.	4.02193044741186
Women with hypertrophic cardiomyopathy tolerate pregnancy, labor, and delivery surprisingly well.	2.9995704827148115
Vaginal delivery is possible, but epidural anaesthesia is contraindicated.	3.8246460171766667
Hypertensive disorders associated with pregnancy are classified into three groups: chronic, treatment, and preeclamptic hypertension.	3.4414016766034665
Whereas chronic and transient hypertension do not affect the outcome of pregnancy appreciably, pre-eclampsia presents a potential danger to mother and fetus.	3.15518232259323
Pre-eclamptic hypertension is accompanied by low cardiac output and plasma volume.	3.830788196582799
An upregulation of angiotension receptors enhances vascular reactivity, with the consequence of high peripheral resistance.	3.3984550029628116
For antihypertensive therapy hydralazine, -methyldopa, and magnesium sulfate are the drugs of choice.	3.029972838222459
A generalised recommendation of anaesthesia for the pre-eclamptic gravida cannot be made because both general and epidural anaesthesia have risks of severe side effects.	3.2355620719389715

Cell sizes, expressed as cell capacitance, were identical in both groups.	2.797545240162874

The botryoid odontogenic cyst (BOC) is considered a rare multilocular variant of the lateral periodontal cyst.	3.6058325235554105
The origin of the BOC can be seen in aberrant odontogenic tissue.	3.3584236324685817
The BOC is found especially in the premolar region of the mandible, as well as in the frontal region of the maxilla of patients aged between 60 and 70 years.	4.866715127465944
Most of the 11 published articles of BOC have shown high rates of recurrence.	2.891893158408368
Histopathologically the BOC is marked by multilocular cysts lined by a thin, nonkeratinized epithelium.	2.966261490518731
Clusters of glycogen-rich epithelial cells may be noted in nodular thickenings of the cyst lining.	3.3291635367484864
For the clinician, the differentiation of the BOC from the keratocyst and ameloblastoma is relevant.	3.1692702720432027

The immunohistochemically determined expression of cytokeratin (CK) 13 implicates the histogenetic origin of the BOC from the squamous epithelium of the oral cavity and excludes the origin from the small salivary glands.	3.0000260759141857
The expression of CK 19 and the lack of expression of p53, as well as the higher proliferation rate of the basal epithelial cell layer by the BOC, may be useful for distinction between the keratocyst.	4.104389315022632

Laser-induced thermotherapy is an in situ ablation method for the local treatment of liver tumors.	3.628979488868818
The basic prerequisite for induction of adequate treatment volumes for clinical use was the development of a thermostable application system.	3.6966798104589236
In an ex vivo test series, the specially developed application system (diffuser tip) with 5760 J had a higher thermic loading capacity than the Ringmode applicator with 4200 J, thus enabling the induction of significantly larger lesions with a volume of 7.6 cm3.	2.8217680780462677
The results of a further in vivo test series demonstrated that the lesions were subject to a four-phase connective-tissue organization within a 6-month period.	3.4803116637887763
Furthermore, the same laser energy (4200 J) was associated with a significantly lower lesion volume of 2.5 cm3 in the in vivo than in the ex vivo test series.	3.4766620586723436
The influence of liver perfusion on the inducible lesion volume was examined in a further animal experimental study.	3.2473833629345354
By temporarily interrupting hepatic blood perfusion (Pringle's maneuver) during laser application, the effective volume could be increased to 50.3 cm3 (P < 0.01) using an optical beam splitter.	3.027953582320002
These results show that the technical prerequisites for reliable clinical application of laser-induced thermotherapy have been fulfilled.	3.5437403170115123

Using cell culture a urogenital C. trachomatis infection could be detected in 72 of 222 patients.	3.6464682672716524
The Amplicor test yielded a positive result in 83.	3.2813655102020447
The specificity of both techniques was 100% when the specimens for which neither both nor either one of the tests gave positive results were considered.	3.3459391982432765

The clinical picture is characterised by progressive ataxia and macular degeneration.	2.765484093840828
Other common signs are slow saccades, external ophthalmoplegia, and pyramidal tract signs.	3.0147527918095536

SCA7 is a rare disorder.	4.906119251285538
The first case in Germany was described only recently.	3.386976719857685

The father carries a trinucleotide expansion of 42 CAG repeats, the son 51.	2.948430095172882
Normal alleles range from 7 to 35 CAG repeats.	3.2296082200183833
Both patients show the typical picture with progressive ataxia and macular degeneration.	2.933218507979193
We found a pronounced anticipation (earlier disease onset in subsequent generations), which is highly characteristic of CAG repeat disorders.	3.1662347267026405

Although they are chemically different, there are many similarities in their mechanism of action.	3.4615050799594567
In provocation tests they have equal efficacy on some tests (allergen, exercise), but nedocromil sodium has greater effect on neuronal mechanisms such as So2 challenge.	2.9566284790397632
Very few studies compared the two drugs.	3.5492268261491464

Thus twice daily administration is one advantage of nedocromil, the other being proven effect of steroid- sparing, which has not been shown with cromolyn sodium.	3.2320147733845435
Both drugs are recommended as first-line agents in mild persistent asthma.	3.4410021778415287

The definition of endocrine disrupters is not very sharp.	3.1171740327362634
At present all non-physiologic substances which bind to steroid receptors, are defined as endocrine disrupters of which the best studied are estrogenic in nature.	2.942562963202687
Many pesticides or insecticides or their metabolites have estrogenic activity and pollute our surface water.	2.8177474931682087
Here they may cause severe estrogenization of aquatic life.	3.3827006767849355
Only traces of these substances are demonstrable in drinking water.	3.545266930076561
On the other hand, weak estrogens present in plastic ware may be ingested by men and therefore be potentially harmful for human health.	2.496337944344987
On the other hand, many plants produce socalled'hyto-estrogens', particularly soy products are rich in phyto-estrogens but their high consumption in Asian populations are most likely the reason for reduced occurrence of breast cancer.	2.6883159246307162
Many plant extracts used for human medication also contain phyto-estrogens and are beneficial in the treatment of climacteric complaints.	3.2576895601840583

The effect of a locally applied peppermint oil preparation on tension-type headache was examined in the design of a randomized, placebo-controlled double-blind crossover study for the first time.	3.188354867725538
The preparation was tested against both the reference substance acetaminophen and to the corresponding placebo.	3.7501596222589644
The liquid test preparation contained 10 g of peppermint oil and ethanol (90 %) ad 100 (test preparation LI 170, Lichtwer Pharma, Berlin); the placebo was a 90 % ethanol solution to which traces of peppermint oil were added for blinding purposes.	2.710484910245544
The reference preparation contained 500 mg acetaminophen; the placebo tablet was identical to the verum in size and appearance.	2.9910019349944394
The study included the analysis of 164 headache attacks of 41 patients of both sexes ranging between 18 and 65 years of age, suffering from tension-type headache in accordance with the IHS classification.	3.3930621412134894
Four headache episodes per patient were treated in a double-blind, randomized crossover design.	3.1840459450426124
Each headache attack was treated by the application of 2 capsules of the oral medication (1000 mg of acetaminophen or placebo) and the cutaneous application of the oil preparation (peppermint oil or placebo solution).	4.00109978443019
The oil was spread largely across forehead and temples which was repeated after 15 and 30 minutes.	3.044783061313804
Using a headache diary, the headache parameters were assessed after 15, 30, 45 and 60 minutes.	3.312652679206013
Compared to the application of placebo, a 10 % peppermint oil in ethanol solution significantly reduced the clinical headache intensity already after 15 minutes (p < 0.01).	2.942202639402887
This significant clinical reduction of the pain intensity continued over the one hour observation period.	3.839548480106449
Acetaminophen, too, proved to be efficient compared to placebo (p < 0.01).	3.480415467464699
There was no significant difference between the efficacy of 1000 mg of acetaminophen and 10 % peppermint oil in ethanol solution.	2.3367794588900748
Simultaneous application of 1000 mg of acetaminophen and 10 % peppermint oil in ethanol solution leads to an additive effect which remains below the significance threshold, however.	2.660421676780169
The patients reported no adverse events.	3.0829333414088684
This controlled study showed for the first time that a 10 % peppermint oil in ethanol solution efficiently alleviates tension-type headache.	2.9840557305129685
Peppermint oil thus proves to be a well-tolerated and cost-effective alternative to usual therapies.	4.166040855224349
The positive results of several multi-center studies significantly improved the immunomodulatory treatment of multiple sclerosis over the last few years.	3.3536004980243095
It was demonstrated that different compounds are capable to reduce the number of relapses and to modulate the progression of disease.	3.2966539644924326

The aim of this paper is to summarize the current knowledge, compare the results of recent clinical trials with the experience from other  therapeutic options and assess their clinical evidence.	3.475559215933782
Dislocated metacarpal V fractures, fixed by percutaneous Kirschner wires or other implants near the metacarpophalangeal joint, often show impaired movement despite excellent radiologic findings.	2.8613863015769083
We therefore chose an alternative method using intramedullary Kirschner wire osteosynthesis according to Foucher.	2.800031964310927
Twenty-five patients were operated on in a 3-year period and movement of the fingers and complications were examined.	3.842632638232843

One patient suffering from an early stage of Sudeck's dystrophy was healed, and no other complications appeared.	3.7397095777086093
Three months after treatment all patients achieved free movement of the fingers with anatomical alignment.	3.635774802883197
We therefore recommend intramedullary Kirschner wire osteosynthesis in distal metacarpal V fractures.	2.841303202639579
Aspiration of toxic substances, foreign material, bacterially contaminated secretions, or water (near-drowning) either immediately leads to cessation of respiration or to impaired ventilation due to airway obstruction, it causes hypoxia due to surfactant dysfunction, and pulmonary infection might develop.	2.858847516347955
Respiratory insufficiency is the resulting consequence which needs immediate and appropriate therapy and intervention.	3.163599722057269
The knowledge of risk factors that promote aspiration injury is important for its prevention and limitation.	3.4815218977101425
Mortality varies between 3 and 70% depending on patients studied, and on the nature and amount of aspirated material.	3.564116350622492
The major cause of death is acute respiratory failure.	3.0633329739669053
The onset of injury to the lung after aspiration is very rapid.	3.232502777970165
Therefore, therapeutic interventions like bronchoscopy are often too late.	3.070485159914318
More importantly, oxygenation should be monitored continuously for timely institution of mechanical ventilation.	3.2816137255910554
Antibiotics should not be given routinely but a calculated regime is neccessary when signs of infection develop.	3.225822620077908
Prognosis in near-drowning considerably depends on early rescue and successful resuscitation.	3.161879129558451
A rapid onset of cerebral hypothermia during the accident can help to increase the ischemic tolerance of the brain and makes it neccessary to continue advanced life support until rewarming of the near-drowning victim.	3.397789495474522
Anticipation of individual outcome in unconscious patients is difficult.	3.669693352817033
The overall mortality of near-drowning is about 11%.	3.102356790484793
Pathophysiological aspects, diagnostic procedures, pratical management and possible prophylaxis of aspiration injuries will be discussed.	3.274952708081872

Pulse oximetry is certainly highly recommended, but also has some deficiencies which are not sufficiently well known considering the popularity of this technique.	3.8060545288073997
Transcutaneous PO2 is considered mainly for historical reasons.	3.277109814406196

The increasing frequency of stent implantation into coronary arteries is based mainly on assumptions.	3.380281604622372
One of these assumptions is that stents may prevent restenosis.	2.8548216916260185

Despite the very tight selection of patients suitable for stent implantation in these two studies, the advantage for stents remained small (about 10% less restenosis) and appeared to decrease with time following intervention.	3.3221816239628006
There is increasing concern about the extension of stenting in an "unrestricted strategy".	2.8684464808537014

Immediately after PTCA, the Angio-SealTM device was deployed utilizing standard technique.	2.7453676354229533
No difficulties were encountered during device deployment, however, immediately following device placement active arterial bleeding occurred.	3.448381744935743
Due to the inadequacy of hemostasis, heparin was reversed with protamine to avoid further hemorrhagic complications.	2.607253104495783
Following this, the desired hemostasis quickly occurred, but the patient soon complained about symptoms suggestive of an acute occlusion of the right femoral artery.	4.4374847626522005
Unsatisfactory attempts as lysis resulted in the patient being transferred to vascular surgery.	3.6074974108731652
The complete Angio-SealTM system (anchor including collagen) was located intravasculary, and removed during surgery.	2.9439457237631697

Prehospital diagnosis and first line therapy of acute chest pain are among the most frequently encountered challenges for general practitioners and emergency physicians.	4.004279613067245
Acute myocardial infarction or acute coronary syndromes in general are present in about a third of patients complaining of acute chest pain.	3.7454823387152922

With 30% of patients dying within the first hour of ischemia mostly due to ventricular arrhyhtmias every effort needs to be made to shorten the delay between symptom onset and start of reperfusion therapy.	3.6362563690730796

Abstract   Mitoxantrone is an anthracenedione antineoplastic agent that has recently been shown to be effective in ameliorating disease activity in multiple sclerosis (MS) as indicated by clinical and MRI data.	3.1362638263674656
However, the role of mitoxantrone in escalating treatment of patients with frequent and severe relapses and with rapid progression of disability is less clear.	3.4497423829161824
In this retrospective analysis we report on 15 patients with severe relapsing-remitting (9 patients) and secondary progressive MS with superimposed exacerbations (6 patients) treated openlabeled with mitoxantrone in our Clinical Research Group from July 1994 to October 1998.	3.3008271089880528
Eleven of these patients (73%) were treated with azathioprine, interferon-beta-1b or cyclophosphamide before.	4.374415137825637
The patients received mitoxantrone over a period of at least 12 months (19 +/- 6 months) with a single dose of 10 mg/m2 monthly for the first three months.	4.7779296613534905
Thereafter, infusions were repeated every 3 months (total dose 141 mg +/- 45 mg).	3.267689783113594
The annual relapse rate could be significantly reduced from 3,0 +/- 1,5 in the year before therapy to 0,5 +/- 0,5 during therapy.	4.003725397225099
Nine patients (60%) were stabilised, while four patients (27%) showed an improvement of disability.	3.7883950367266963
The treatment was well tolerated with only minor side effects.	2.8760372993230576
These results although retrospectively obtained confirm previous trials showing that mitoxantrone may be useful in MS patients with frequent and severe exacerbations and/or a rapidly progressive course of the disease who have had other immunomodulatory medication.	3.482803343487105
Interstitial cystitis (IC) represents a rare and complex inflammatory bladder condition in which diagnostics can be challenging.	3.2364551142689764
Strict NIH criteria for its diagnosis were designed for research purposes.	3.4585947154933407
Their routine application would miss large proportions of IC patients.	3.0868443249453623
When IC is suspected, history and physical exam are followed by an evaluation of long-term voiding diaries.	4.109134432313207
Large voided volumes (functional capacity >250 cc) or longer micturition intervals (>2 h.), absence of nocturia or symptom-free periods reduce the likelihood of IC.	3.1311453443669492
Further exclusion diagnostics include urine tests (infection), cytology (in-situ carcinoma), ultrasound (calculi, bulks, anomalies) and urodynamics in selected cases.	2.7922523224108255
Bladder capacity measurements under sedoanalgesia are of limited value, since functional low-volume bladders can be mechanically extendable.	2.9417324415278037
Cystoscopy under general anesthesia represents the diagnostic standard procedure for IC during which 90% of IC-patients present with characteristic mucosal glomerulations after bladder distension.	3.13716787616592
Biopsies are recommended for exclusion of malignancy.	3.8582387263682096
Potassium-leak testing plays no relevant role in routine diagnostics due to its poor sensitivity.	3.294140417334621
Similarly, complex determinations of novel IC markers (histamine, tryptase, cytokines, growth factors, substance P, nitric oxide) are of no relevance in clinical settings and should be restricted to research projects.	3.3598112752979605
According to semiotics, which may be defined as the doctrine of the essential nature and fundamental varieties of signs, objects, and interpretants, pain is considered to be a sign (significant) with very different meanings (significance) either as a naturalistic symptom (of disease) or as a symbol used in a metaphorical context.	3.340970275111582
When following this methodological perspective it is possible to interpret medical as well as poetic writings on equal terms.	3.705964079563061
In Graeco-Roman medical texts pain was mostly understood as a result and an indicator of disease, but nonetheless as a symptom which seemed to be actively produced by the affected body.	3.478829237136242
Especially in the Corpus Hippocraticum dating from the 5th and 4th century B. C. this materialistic and at the same time psychosomatic attitude can be noticed.	2.6240643153787477
Aristotle (4th century B. C.), Celsus (1st century A. D.), and the famous experimental physiologist Galen (2nd century A. D.) agreed that pain was a sign of evil which should be fought without exception.	3.0106054372888678
It was Galen who added the disturbance of function (functio laesa) as the fifth cardinal sign of inflammation to the four well-known cardinal signs of Celsus (rubor, calor, tumor, dolor).	3.0278013437843416
He also coined the term µK to characterize an attack of migraine.	2.917437977412359
On the other hand, pain was designed as a multi-dimensional symbol by the famous Graeco-Roman epic poets.	2.783296014082155
In Homer's Odyssey (8th century B. C.), pain appears transformed into the shape of a scar which is visible and palpable on the hero's leg like an identification tag, whereas in Virgil's Aeneids (1st century B. C.) pain symbolizes weakness and defencelessness which can only be alleviated by the goddess Venus.	2.686201377849393
In this article current indications and limitations of neuromuscular monitoring are reviewed.	3.1810276361525758
Attention is mainly focused on detection of residual curarisation.	3.120470882718836
New insights in the pathophysiological consequences of residual neuromuscular blockade and the actual criteria of complete recovery are discussed.	3.3551804858169993
Surprisingly in this context, despite the benefit of neuromuscular monitoring, its utilisation in clinical practice is rather an exception than the routine.	4.176277403260188
A lack of standardisation of neuromuscular monitoring is probably the major problem on the way to a widespread utilisation of the monitoring.	3.5956773405177103

Frequency of these signs was determined for both modalities, and observer agreement was assessed using the kappa statistic.	3.1457898211463733
Sixteen of 24 patients had signs of tears of the anterior cruciate ligament on the 1.0-T unit; the 0.2-T unit detected primary signs in 15/16 (93 %) patients and secondary signs in 7/12 (43 %) patients.	3.142480554265349
In 8 patients the 1.0 T unit showed neither primary nor secondary signs for tears of the anterior cruciate ligament; in these patients the 0.2-T unit detected primary signs in 1/8 cases (12 %), and secondary signs in 3/8 cases (37 %).	3.498662586879037
Observer agreement was very good for the 1.0-T unit and fair for the 0.2-T unit.	3.1849581006835517
There is no substantial difference between 1.0-T units and 0.2-T MRI units in the visualisation of primary signs of tears of the anterior cruciate ligament.	2.8629249875247234
In the visualisation of secondary signs, 1.0-T units are superior to 0.2-T units, and there is a surprisingly high rate of false-positive results with the 0.2-T unit.	3.9771121586184504
As to the reproducibility of the results, the 1.0-T unit is far superior to the 0.2-T unit.	3.675603498425768

Scintigraphic imaging identifies pathophysiological processes; in other words it assesses regional perfusion, permeability, leukocytic accumulation and bone turnover.	3.0388287994596266
These processes precede morphological changes and this accounts for the high sensitivity of nuclear medicine procedures as well as the low specificity for the differential diagnosis of different diseases with similar pathophysiological characteristics.	3.904882099915567

In summary, we advise dynamic bone scanning as a primary scintigraphic investigation.	2.9703900766983917
A negative scan excludes osteomyelitis in most cases.	3.196696714406844
The comparison is made with conventional radiology and clinical history.	3.3237367169409904

Cardiopulmonary exercise testing (CPX) is a non-invasive method of recording quantitative data from gas exchange and ventilation for the evaluation of oxidative metabolism at rest and during exercise.	3.6549441669791607
An incremental exercise test measuring gas exchange, ventilation and lactate release was performed in healthy volunteers and in patients suffering from mitochondrial disorders.	4.197356260073635
At rest as well as during exercise patients with mitochondrial disorders differ from healthy subjects with regard to gas exchange and ventilation parameters.	4.019591161708432
During exercise, the decreased oxygen utilization of skeletal muscle and early activation of anaerobic metabolism in these patients are mirrored by a reduced anaerobic threshold, reduced maximal oxygen uptake and reduced oxygen pulse.	3.332863816688767
Our study shows that CPX is a sensitive and practical clinical screening method of investigating mitochondrial disorders.	2.937892855154439

These both indicate an infectious cause.	3.256221742884927

Apart from our case, only one further case is described in the literature in which a completed hepatitis A infection could be demonstrated serologically.	4.35141743094362
In addition, the titer of antinuclear antibodies was raised in our patient.	2.987740260234694
This autoimmune phenomenon is probably of crucial pathogenetic significance in our patient, especially since a hepatitis A infection on its own does not afford an adequate etiological explanation for the form of chronic and active hepatitis with consecutive cirrhotic transformation observed here.	3.394060969472995
In patients with a significant elongation of the ACL we propose a new therapeutic regimen.	3.936052516361371
After mobilisation of the tibial insertion of the ACL we pull the bone block with the attached ACL distally.	3.0552156633378567
Thus the ACL is easily tightened.	3.2287784477683914
In accordance with this method, we describe the treatment of a case of a strictly proximal rupture of the ACL: the tibial insertion is mobilised, the bone block with the attached ACL removed from the joint.	4.4888624530946455
Ex vivo sutures are placed into the ACL, the ligament is pulled back into the joint, and the shortening of the ligament caused by the sutures is compensated by slight proximal dislocation of the bone block.	4.204064972499751

Mammography is an established diagnostic procedure for breast cancer.	3.8936793726973495
Data concerning screening mammography are available from nine prospectively controlled trials, the largest series being presented from Sweden.	3.1367850077744333
Mammographic screening leads to a significant reduction of breast cancer of 30 % in women ages 50-59 years.	3.919124955892799
In younger women (40-49 years) the benefit accounts to only 20 % and has not proven to be statistically significant.	3.609937862560386
Nevertheless, the major advantage of mammographic screening is detection of the non-palpable tumor <= 10 mm in size.	3.7602493958511714
The treatment of these small breast carcinomas leads to long-term survival rates of >= 90 %.	3.8552535961086547
Mammographic screening programs have been introduced in the USA, Canada, Iceland and Sweden for women in their 5th decade of life.	3.112822644039845
Starting yearly lifelong mammography-screening at the age of 40, the theoretical cancer induction by radiation exposure does not exceed 0.1 %.	3.0587189843587574
Under highly qualified conditions, it should be possible to minimize false-positive and false-negative screening results.	3.3873675433703174
In Germany, screening-mammography is only introduced in patients at high risk for breast cancer.	3.3533829395029437
Based on medical data, mammography must be a part of screening for women with an average risk - starting at the age of 40, although there are still open questions needing further clinical research.	3.4131381976689963

Mesenchymal neoplasms of lipogenic differentiation are the most common soft-tissue neoplasms in adults.	3.9106274633567075
In recent years a number of "new" entities and variants have been described.	3.4902257266806656
Their recognition is important to avoid diagnostic pitfalls and inappropriate therapy.	3.2251065743078624

The intracranial space is divided into two large compartments by the tentorium.	3.568383564518836
The hydrostatic pressure of spinal fluid is responsible for buoyancy of the brain within these compartments.	3.6204206852544227
In patients with craniectomy this equilibrium is exposed to atmospheric pressure.	2.8591358307581216
We report on four cases of reversible herniation after either bilateral or unilateral decompressive craniectomy performed for increased intracranial pressure (ICP) and failure of conservative ICP treatment.	2.7452048579170594
All four patients had survived a severe neurological disease (encephalitis, subdural haematoma, stroke) which required craniectomy to control raised ICP.	2.867778506860818
All were successfully weaned from the ventilator and awake and CT scans showed no space-occupying lesion anymore.	3.14737361223825
The patients showed a typical "sunken pattern" at the trepanation site.	3.1182265427432023
All patients developed clinical signs of transtentorial herniation (i.e.	2.77646839688407
unilateral dilated pupils, deteriorated alertness, and extensor posturing) shortly after either diagnostic or presumed therapeutic lumbar puncture.	2.8035215684750736
One patient developed herniation a second time while in the typical 30 ° upright position.	2.99245116055386
After craniectomy, transtentorial herniation is possible even in the absence of increased ICP.	3.8723550290850324
It is related to a negative gradient between atmospheric and intracranial pressure, which is enhanced by changes in the CSF compartment following lumbar puncture.	3.755563285503206
Acute therapy in these cases is quite simple; it requires flat or even head-down positioning and early cranioplasty.	3.357916755167831
Diseases of the oral cavity, floor of the mouth, and nervous system can be accompanied by disturbances in tongue movement during swallowing.	2.891204722226702
These disturbances can be diagnosed by videosonography whereby the examiner has to evaluate extensive video documentation of lingual motion.	3.3026555382629055
It was the aim of this study to facilitate this evaluation by the application of a reproducible computer-assisted quantitative analysis procedure.	3.4213189750497497
Video sequences of 56 healthy adults and 19 patients with dysphagias of different etiologies were analysed.	3.5494010842522874
A numerical estimation of swallowing movements was carried out in abstraction from the structures imaged (bolus, air, muscles of the tongue, floor of the mouth, hyoid, etc.).	2.8811498775003725
Intensity changes of the pixels within previously defined radial image sectors were quantified in relationship to time and depicted as sector curves.	3.084094597210466
The healthy adults demonstrated a characteristic pattern of two motion maxima that appeared within almost all sector curves.	2.879476715944586
These maxima represented bolus transport movements and the reset movement of the tongue.	3.251602242473282
Patients with diseases of the tongue or neuromuscular changes caused by disturbances of the central nervous system showed pathological deviations on videosonography.	3.6760290489542244
These appeared as local or general reductions in movement, slow speed motions, repetitive swallowing or unsorted additional movements of the tongue during swallowing.	3.0313617868860216
Clinically-used ketamine is a racemic mixture of two isomers, S-(+)- and R-(-)-ketamine.	2.873057832519767
Previous investigations showed the anaesthetic potency of S-(+)-ketamine to be three times higher than that of R-(-)-ketamine.	3.0101044487139013
It was the aim of this study to compare the effects of S-(+)-ketamine and racemic ketamine on endocrine and cardiovascular parameters, recovery, and side effects in geriatric patients during total intravenous anaesthesia (TIVA) for orthopaedic surgery.	3.083676148227011
Forty patients over 60 years of age scheduled for elective hip or knee replacement were investigated in a double-blind, randomised design.	3.6221938682040995
For induction of TIVA, patients received 0.1 mg midazolam, 0.5 mg atropine, 1 mg/kg S(+)-ketamine or 2 mg/kg racemic ketamine, respectively, 2 mg vecuronium, and 1.5 mg/kg suxamethonium.	3.823680340208839
After intubation and relaxation with a total dose of 0.1 mg/kg vecuronium, a continuous infusion of 2 mg/kg per hour S-(+)- or 4 mg/kg per hour racemic ketamine was administered throughout surgery.	3.6626431997018685
In addition, systolic arterial pressure (SAP), heart rate (HR), and arterial oxygen saturation were measured, and the time intervals between the end of ketamine infusion and the return of consciousness and orientation were protocolled.	3.791641371585451
The incidence and assessment of dreams and other side effects were reported by the patients.	3.5455910416264147
Biometric data of the groups were comparable, the mean age of both groups being 68 years.	4.488833920316444
Plasma adrenaline, noradrenaline, ADH, ACTH, cortisol, and glucose as well as SAP and HR increased significantly (P<0.05) during the course of anaesthesia.	3.8264110203577557
The influence on lactate levels was not significant.	3.2825688930352754
There were no differences between S-(+)- and racemic ketamine with respect to these parameters.	3.2282791297699194
Three patients in the ketamine-racemate group showed severe arterial hypertension and were withdrawn from the study.	3.4800234294594787
Recovery clearly improved after administration of S-(+)-ketamine compared to the racemate.	3.851221967962769
Simple orders were followed after 2.0 +/- 3.4 versus 4.9 +/- 6.8 min (P=0.07), orientation with respect to person returned after 5.7 +/- 4.0 versus 14.6 +/- 10.0 min (P<0.001) and spatial orientation after 8.2 +/- 5.4 versus 17.4 +/- 9.7 min (P<0.001).	3.027978651205967
After racemic ketamine, 1 patient remembered a negative dream and 1 patient a positive dream.	3.555516636990493
In the S-(+)-group, 1 positive dream was reported.	3.4259232821559196
No intraoperative awareness was reported, and all patients would accept the same anaesthesia again.	3.282634219059271
With regard to endocrine and cardiovascular parameters, the pharmacodynamic effects of racemic and S-(+)-ketamine were comparable.	2.8427817378792097
Because of the significant improvement in recovery and the reduced quantitative drug load, S-(+)-ketamine offers a clinical advantage compared with currently used racemic ketamine.	3.0320881266185298
The closure of large circular defects on the scalp is technically difficult and cosmetically often not satisfying, if a free transplant is necessary.	3.18456969391433
Following the technique of Tillmann described first in 1908, several flaps shaped like a windmill can be combined.	3.016826059309784
We report on 14 patients (ages 41-88 years) where large defects resulting from the excision of various tumors (5 melanomas, 5 basal cell carcinomas, 1 keratoacanthoma, 1 trichilemmal cyst, 1 squamous cell carcinoma, 1 skin metastasis) were successfully closed by this method.	3.0518975659183503
The diameter of the defect ranged between 4 and 8 cm (mean 5,7 cm).	3.862432548184167
Size and number of the rotating flaps (3 or 4) was varied according to the size of the defect and the mobility of the surrounding tissue.	4.144424901499688
The procedure was performed with local anesthesia in all cases.	4.043669616577732
Wound healing occurred without complications except in 3 cases.	3.570597150689647
2 patients (63 years, 70 years) developed small necrotic areas on the tips of the flaps.	2.977801291889981
In a 74 year old man with a very large defect of 8 cm diameter, one flap of four underwent total necrosis.	3.1928136126631457
The cosmetic result was rated "very good" in 71,4% and "good" in 14,3%.	3.458369563022182
The "windmill procedure" is an important addition to the surgical approaches for closure of large defects on the scalp, particularly in young patients.	4.156699587906908

Hearing aids have fundamental disadvantages: (1) stigmatization of the patient; (2) the sound is often found to be unsatisfactory due to the limited frequency range and undesired distortion; (3) in many patients, the ear canal fitting device generally necessary leads to an occlusion effect; (4) acoustic feedback when amplification is high.	4.27895512911017
Conventional hearing aids transmit sound into the ear canal via a small microphone.	3.365303775934662
Sound has the disadvantage of requiring high output sound pressure levels for its transmission.	3.3118436079140254
This along with the necessary miniaturization of the loudspeaker as well as the resonances and reflections in the closed ear canal contribute to the disadvantages mentioned.	3.4544177600364394
In contrast, implantable hearing aids do not make sound signals but micromechanical vibrations.	2.812517031789271
The hearing signal does not leave the transducer as sound but as a mechanical vibration which is directly coupled to the auditory system bypassing the air.	2.8885919491247867
This implantable hearing aid is either coupled to the tympanic membrane, the ossicular chain, the perilymph of the inner ear, or the skull.	3.8762151355381422
Corneal cells are known to participate in the regulation of local inflammatory processes by secretion of cytokines.	3.8152573530669236
For the majority of patients with sensorineural hearing loss (SNHL) many available hearing aids often do not achieve satisfactory results.	2.994360685477217
For these patients partially implantable hearing devices have been developed, allowing distortion-free hearing and speech intelligibility that may be superior to conventional hearing aids.	3.2991831562694105
The external parts of partial implants, however, may result in a patient's stigmatization.	3.7956048332066876
Furthermore, they do not use the acoustic properties of the external auditory canal.	3.818110715354852
Recently, we published the successful development of the first totally implantable hearing device for the treatment of SNHL (HNO 46 [1998] 853-863).	3.710780848707389
Here we report the first implantations of this unique, totally implantable electronic hearing system in patients with SNHL: Implex TICA LZ 3001.	3.2317880991372516
The implant microphone is implanted subcutaneously in the outer ear canal near the ear drum.	3.0327632710111962
The signal is processed by a digitally programmable multichannel audioprocessor located subcutaneously on the bony skull behind the ear.	2.720186557893536
A piezoelectric transducer is coupled to the body of the incus and drives the ossicular chain by vibratory actions.	3.1451202920433783
Energy is provided by an implantable battery.	3.8635449177985186
Implanted patients describe hearing as being distortion-free and transparent.	3.513389123639423
Speech intelligibility and the hearing of music are improved.	3.2550700296233446
Patients may achieve better speech discrimination, especially in the presence of background noise.	4.1161568551289145
The aid can be used during sports, including swimming.	4.237241530223813
To our knowledge, this is the first report of the implantation of a totally implantable electronic hearing system in patients.	2.5164438082492038
These results encourage further implantations of the totally implantable hearing system in the course of an ongoing clinical study.	3.5993001313944744

Resection of a stenosing colon tumor in an 89-year-old male patient led to the diagnosis, unusual at this age, of an inflammatory pseudotumor (synonym: plasma cell granuloma) of the retroperitoneum and mesentery, which invaded the large bowel and showed infiltration of one regional lymph node.	3.3815440577228055

The recently published conjecture that such lesions of the retroperitoneum represent a separate entity with features of a malignant neoplasm is discussed.	3.4884981524572747
An example of a plexiform fibrohistiocytic tumour (PFT) is presented for the first time in the German-language literature.	3.7064973648727535
The diagnostic criteria for this rare soft-tissue neoplasm of childhood and young adulthood, which is mostly subcutaneous in location and has a tendency to recur, include the plexiform structure which gives it its name, extensive siderin deposits and numerous osteoclast-like giant cells.	3.258431107650449

The current increase in the cost of health care must be considered as a severe threat to the prehospital emergency services system.	3.9340428084386567
Two examples have been selected - the patient with polytrauma and the patient in cardiac arrest - to demonstrate the dilemma between a need for objective data and the requirements of emergency patients.	4.437014303619953
Study results obtained in trauma patients indicating that total prehospital time, including scene time, is correlated to patient outcome have led to the conclusion that at the scene treatment by emergency physicians may be dispensable.	3.7217201527818795
It has, however also been demonstrated that the time required for medical treatment at the scene is equivalent to 20% of the total scene time, thus representing only a fraction of the total prehospital time.	4.237076158601111
Correlating the total prehospital time or scene time to outcome therefore appears absurd.	3.283102022847944
The treatment principle of aggressive shock treatment in polytrauma needs critical reevaluation on the basis of results obtained by recent preclinical studies in patients with penetrating torso injuries.	3.719285113930605
Small volume resuscitation could not be demonstrated to improve outcome in polytrauma patients, although a slight improvement in patients with brain injury may be assumed.	4.154776826934286
Unfortunately, for ethical reasons randomised carefully controlled comparative studies can not be performed in polytrauma patients unless the patient is fully conscious.	3.7372807452757613
The importance of endotracheal intubation and artificial ventilation in unconscious trauma patients becomes apparent under conditions of anaesthesia where the application of the endotracheal tube averts regurgitation, aspiration and concomitant morbidity and mortality.	3.192910409155515
The common causes of cardiovascular collapse and their pathomechanisms, as well as the mechanisms of cardiopulmonary resuscitation, have been widely investigated.	3.95612100675313
Nevertheless, various aspects of their application are still controversial.	3.2914943932876595
The most recent study results have recommended initial ventilation prior to thoracic compression.	2.793160386007874
New methods of assisting mechanical cardiopulmonary resuscitation, such as ACD CPR or vest CPR, have shown promising results in animal experiments.	3.1925892892399834
However, the importance of results obtained by preclinical randomised controlled investigations in humans need to be confirmed by further studies as to outcome.	3.6913240272328136
The efficacy of defibrillation in cases of ventricular fibrillation has been clearly demonstrated, particularly with a view to the interval between ventricular fibrillation and defibrillation.	3.954941694265683
It has further been demonstrated that basic cardiopulmonary resuscitation preserves ventricular fibrillation and thus improves the chance of survival.	3.0507319366793744
The present generation of defibrillators has been further improved, particularly by the introduction of biphasic defibrillator wave forms, which may reduce the required energy, as well as possible complications, while offering an increase in the efficacy of defibrillation and a reduction in defibrillator size.	4.084447785327066
Scientific emergency medicine is responsible not only for the development and validation of new methods and concepts, but in particular for their application under quality control conditions.	3.845218571870021
Politicians require an improvement in the quality of the validation of emergency measures, although the instruments available for the investigation of these measures are known to be obsolete (experimental models, experimental design).	4.0266613341626165
Additionally, the financial support of research in emergency medicine suffers from being accourded low priority by public research funds such as the German Research Fund.	3.0961816445987256
However, in view of the rapid application of experimental results to daily practice it should be emphasized that patients also support research in emergency medicine via their direct financial contributions to the health insurance companies.	3.239289468190679

In only 1.7% of cases SEP examination was inadequate.	3.035037074365986
During 406 operations SEP were altered minimally or not at all.	2.782201902679568

Pseudoarthrosis and cubitus valgus as main complications following displaced fractures of the radial condyle in children can be prevented by open reduction and fixation by K wires.	3.3557752184198506
However, delayed union and stimulation of the radial physis with condylar overgrowth and varisation of the elbow as well as fishtail deformities of the distal end of the humerus are reported nevertheless.	4.019700202789971
To prevent those growth disturbances all primary and secondary (4-day X-ray control) displaced fractures of the radial condyle, i. e. those with a central gap of more than 2 mm, were prospectively treated by open reduction and osteosynthesis with a metaphyseal lag screw beginning 1974.	3.5748610961862894
Sixty-six patients (41 boys, 25 girls) with an average follow-up of 10 years (2-22 years) sustained 28 primary and 6 secondary displaced fractures.	3.708484170524226
In 5 cases a K wire fixation was performed in view of the smallness of the fragment.	3.64069959611768
Two children with conservative treatment following overlooked displaced fractures showed condylar overgrowth and varisation of the elbow.	2.750102995162541
Screw osteosynthesis led to symmetric elbow angles and function in all cases, whereas fishtail deformities could be observed in 8 of 27 children, probably as a consequence of the remaining central fracture instability.	3.8879041180359417
Conclusion: Open reduction and osteosynthesis with a metaphyseal lag screw prevents condylar overgrowth in displaced fractures of the radial condyle by guaranteeing fracture healing in anatomic position within 3-4 weeks.	3.0602041650529084
However, fishtail deformity can not be prevented by metaphyseal compression only.	3.404292530845695

Over the years the patients underwent several operations in regional and general anaesthesia, with mask ventilation or intubation.	3.5253896649477863
The C1-INH plasma concentrations measured preoperatively were always very low (0.02-0.06 g/l, normal range 0.15-0.35 g/l), despite the oral long-term prophylaxis.	3.4354568358018
Substitution treatment with 500-1000 U C1-INH was performed 1 h before surgery.	3.3714800858777583
No side effects were seen following the concentrate infusions.	3.056742335840539
With this substitution treatment no specific symptoms of hereditary angioneurotic oedema were recognized in either case.	2.9442634275101462
We suggest that infusion of C1 concentrate is an appropriate form of preoperative substitution treatment in patients with hereditary angioneurotic oedema, in view of the lower risk of infection than with infusion of fresh-frozen plasma and the observed effectiveness.	3.78739111516205

Nociception is a protective system of the body which prevents it from injury and tissue damage.	3.874228904903179
Human beings respond to noxious stimuli by moving away.	3.1382109933995923
They learn by pain to avoid these situations in future.	3.3669337662477066
Shortly after major injury, there is a limited analgesic period allowing the body to flee the area of danger, later on, emerging pain compels the body to rest and supports recuperation.	3.4265953689337705
While acute pain has a certain meaning, chronic pain does not.	3.4257563530410144
It induces a comprehensive suffering including loss of initiative, appetite and vigilance.	2.8552732227942257
It reduces life-quality, often accompanied by depressive moods.	3.3973870415227485
Acute pain causes changes in the central nervous system leading to an increased sensitivity of nociception (hyperalgesia).	3.991723888706566
During healing, the central processing of noxious stimuli is normalised taking minutes to weeks.	3.163666315283359
Sometimes, unknown factors initiate chronification of pain.	2.874607206033959
Changes on a molecular level in peripheral tissue as well as in the central nervous system induce "cellular early genes" [24], a synthesis of c-fos, c-jun and other proteins favouring the chronification of pain.	3.1554458084592034
All efforts have to be made to depress or interrupt such a development.	3.5648976051333428
One of the first steps to pain prophylaxis in a hospital is an optimal surgical technique: incision, extension, limited tissue damage and minimal invasive surgery should guarantee the smallest impairment of the nociceptive system possible.	3.3109485931067457
However, nociceptive input is intense and of long duration and leads to central sensibilisation.	3.1721128658874567
Postoperative pain has lost its function as surgery anticipates healing.	3.122160432525741
Pain induces a reduction of ventilation, circulation, digestion and increases the risk of other disorders.	4.025841271456477
There is need of aggressive pain treatment for humanitarian reasons and for reasons of late sequelae like permanent pain and increased reduction of function [10].	3.0987907649590016
This is of pivotal importance in patients with amputations or sympathetic reflex dystrophy (SRD).	3.507627726757122
Antinociception is best provided by regional anaesthesia technique with a combination of local anaesthetics and opioids which results in better outcome [2, 12].	3.7913939557271545
Hence, regional anaesthesia techniques are strongly indicated in those patients.	3.4848445144591067

The objective of the present study was to show if continuous infusion of the opioid tramadol could produce better analgesia than repetitive administration of boluses.	3.202699509992642
In a study under double-blind conditions 135 ASA I and II patients were assigned at random to group I (infusion group) or group B (bolus group) when they first requested pain treatment after abdominal surgery.	3.247019403547263
The patients in group I received an initial intravenous loading dose of 100 mg tramadol, followed by an infusion of 12 mg/h tramadol for 24 h; if necessary, repeated boluses of 50 mg tramadol were given.	3.6770750654980224
In group B the patients received a placebo infusion instead of the tramadol infusion; otherwise, the procedure was the same.	3.823939729007524
Pain relief was monitored by means of a VAS (visual analogue scale) up to 6 h after surgery.	3.6553614730854895
We investigated the retrograde assessment of analgesia by the patients after 6 h, how often repetitive boluses were required, and the amount of analgesics administered in 6 and 24 h. Results.	4.053963355159962
The pain relief was assessed as excellent or good by 76.5% of group I and 65.6% of group B; 19.1% of group I and 26.9% of group B assessed the analgesic effect as satisfactory; 4.4% of group I and 7.5% of group B complained of insufficient analgesia.	3.2944371473826193
In group I 69.2% requested only one or no repetitive bolus, compared with 40.3% in group B, while two or more boluses were demanded by 30.8% in group I and 59.7% in group B.	3.246869053135365
The average analgesic consumption after 6 h was 223.5 +/- 53.7 mg tramadol in group I and 176.6 +/- 63.1 mg tramadol in group B, respectively.	3.0125848092160257
After 24 h it was 449.5 +/- 66.0 mg tramadol in group I and 201.6 +/- 83.9 mg tramadol in group B.	2.842957972545233
While the consumption during the first 6 h was comparable, from then on the consumption in group I increased significantly.	4.041858328560297
Side effects were reported by 25% in both groups.	3.0629271746160485
They were clinically irrelevant and did not necessitate termination of the clinical trial in any case.	3.648383619293308
During the study period pulse and blood pressure remained within the normal range and did not show any significant changes.	3.14659812941879
The fact that the patients in group I requested far fewer repetitive boluses than those in group B and the assessment by the patients led to the conclusion that treatment in the infusion group is better than that in the bolus group.	4.5516233892063624
Concerns that a significantly higher consumption of analgesics would cause unwanted side-effects have proven unfounded.	3.7546876081619667
Six hours after surgery, when analgesia was evaluated by the patients, there was no significant difference between the two groups.	4.095339089522115
Not until the maintenance infusion had been administered for a further 18 h, was the tramadol consumption within the infusion group significantly higher.	3.5583225633823807
Thus, we should consider continuing unreduced administration of the maintenance infusion 6 h after operation.	3.399834413119024
The concept of tuberculid was introduced by Darier in 1896.	2.772730570400834
In contrast to "true" cutaneous tuberculosis, properties of the tuberculids were explained by an hyperergic response to myobacteria or their fragments released from a different site of manifest or passed tuberculous infection.	2.861956526361221
Key features include a strongly positive tuberculin skin test, evidence of concomitant manifest or past tuberculosis, and prompt response to antituberculous therapy The inability to culture M. tuberculosis or to demonstrate it microscopically from lesional biopsies, together with reports on tuberculid-like eruptions after BCG vaccination, supports this concept.	2.8038897691742366
Clinical manifestations are lichen scrophulosorum, papulo-necrotic tuberculids and erythema induratum of Bazin.	2.7901889488609424
The existence of tuberculids has been questioned, however, because the clinical and histological appearances are not always specific.	4.913298852506102
An increasing number of case reports on tuberculids, new immunological tests and molecular biology-based techniques for the detection of mycobacteria have shed new light on the tuberculid concept.	3.128493043588912
Case Report: A 20-year-old female patient was admitted to the hospital because of a pneumothorax.	4.374218493394471
A secondary amenorrhea was coexisting.	3.255142431289782
On the abdominal wall and in the anogenital area a maculopapular exanthema was visible.	3.7418883226281916
Chest X-ray and HR-CT showed a interstitial lung disease with high probability of histiocytosis X which was confirmed by biopsies of lung and skin tissue.	3.561554469078124
The cause of amenorrhea was a histiocytic infiltration of the pituitary stalk.	2.9862197267335397
Conventional "consensus-treatment" for adults with vinblastine, prednisone and etoposide did not prevent relapsing bilateral pneumothoraces.	2.8276545089161886
Treatment was successful with the protocol as proposed by the international study for children.	3.2769575193075586
This treatment is characterized by higher dosage and combination with 6-mercaptopurine.	3.968989163124794
The prognosis of patients with malignant diseases requiring treatment on intensive care units is poor.	3.8578188973296443
The hospital mortality for mechanically ventilated patients ranges from 70-90% in patients with solid tumors to 75-90% in patients with hematological malignancy and up to 95% in patients after bone marrow transplantation.	3.7487614911155904
The number of patients referred to intensive care units is however increasing, due to improvements in the general treatment of malignant diseases.	3.8792154099910108
This results in controversies about the utilization of intensive care treatment in these patients.	3.0850750985347597
Since the individual outcome can not be predicted prior to initiation of intensive care therapy a general refusal of intensive care treatment seems not justified.	3.371108915501144
A reevaluation of the patients status after initiation of intensive care treatment based on predefined criteria may however be useful in the decision about continuing intensive care measures.	3.938636214285708
Patients requiring mechanical ventilation after bone marrow transplantation will not survive if prolonged treatment with vasopressors is necessary and/or sustained hepatic and renal failure is present.	3.466799466866191
For these patients a withdrawal of further life support may be considered.	3.3197739899195757
Intensive care treatment should be continued in patients not fulfilling these criteria and treatment results are comparable to those in patients without malignant diseases.	3.8252418879956056
For other patients with malignant diseases the use of a new score system developed for patients with cancer can be helpful in the clinical decision making.	4.600191319867092
On the basis of a solution-oriented marital therapy, the different within-session effects of four different types of questions in systemic therapy (lineal, strategic, circular, and reflexive), as described by Tomm (1989), were tested.	3.1704560716989216
In this single case study, the method of plan analysis (Caspar 1989) was used to categorize the client's reactions to the four types of therapeutic questions.	3.8590399872163497
Lineal and strategic questions were expected to have a stabilizing and restraining effect on the system (i.e.	3.5165994914644627
the client, the clients' interaction, and the therapeutic interaction), whereas circular and reflexive questions were expected to open the system for change.	3.992692486092706
Interestingly this hypothesis was only supported for the wife, who had the role of the identified client in the therapy and demonstrated a much stronger motivation for change.	3.6771222453224413
Some of his reactions were even opposite to the expected therapeutic effects.	3.31513641913284
Therefore, it is suggested that an interaction effect between questions and the motivation for change can be assumed.	3.570504723152797
Prerequisites for experimental study designs are extremely difficult to realise under prehospital emergency conditions.	3.1393612953474985
Results obtained in animal experiments always need validation with prehospital or inhospital patient studies.	3.016204101218373
Investigations related to emergency medicine are, however, an ethical obligation on behalf of the patient.	3.7184685834767452
A retrospective analysis of the available literature should be considered a prerequisite for prospective randomised and controlled studies.	4.726484250164118
Frequently, a pilot study or feasibility trial needs to precede the actual study.	3.269241622498079
Informed consent must be obtained for all patient studies.	3.3275026298144414
However, under emergency conditions informed consent cannot always be obtained due to unconsciousness, etc.	2.8621410220931134
Nevertheless, the following principles should be observed: (a) randomised studies are essential, even in emergency medicine; (b) they are ethically acceptable if the treatment provided for the study group is at least equivalent to the therapy for the control group; ( c) only these preconditions guarantee that the patient always receives treatment in accordance with the standard of treatment.	3.988322910421241
If the patient is unconscious or otherwise unable to give informed consent, the principle of deferred consent is acceptable.	3.1260969161523606
The deferred consent principle should be carefully documented.	3.296840087200681
A prospective randomized study represents the gold standard for an investigation, even under emergency conditions.	3.2788270268787083
There are different principles of randomization: telephone or telefax randomisation, etc.	2.784123356707638
Emergency medicine investigations need to be completed within a reasonable time frame which should, as a rule, not exceed 2 years.	3.7249931602384074
Otherwise, too many items might change without being noted.	3.0884223240586457
Curative treatment and the intention to treat are terms employed by ethics committees.	3.4559658242725053
If an investigation does not bear in itself additional risk factors, it does not necessarily have to be brought before the ethics committee.	3.8161412388225786
If, however, for example, the effect of obtaining blood samples is investigated separately for research purposes, the patient needs to be informed and sign the respective agreement.	4.514096480233182
In Germany the ethics committees have agreed to accept their respective decisions.	2.946563054329994
For multicentre and multinational studies, however, the ethics committees also need to accept decisions made by non-German ethics committees.	3.441381099971058
Not all therapeutic principles can serve as the basis of prospective randomized studies because they need to be considered the present standard of care (e.g., endotracheal intubation, etc.).	4.1538101473521225
In principle, the overall emergency physician protocol does not fulfill scientific requirements.	3.014750950537293
For all studies, particularly in the prehospital setting, an independent observer should be involved for documentation purposes.	3.278652717425381
Biases in emergency medicine studies focus on the variability of EMS, personnel qualifications, etc.	3.6183465388999596
This is in part why it is extremely difficult to prove efficacy and efficiency in emergency medicine.	3.164465250441203
New antifungals for oral therapy have improved the chances of healing onychomycoses.	3.2596838700190096
Nevertheless, in daily practice the failure rate is 20-30% both with itraconazole and terbinafine.	3.2856447837546523
In our investigations for the fungicidal effects of terbinafine, we could show that the same strain of Trichophyton rubrum or T. mentagrophytes in the rest period needs 1000 times higher concentration of terbinafine (2,0 to 0,002 µg/ml) for complete fungal killing as in the growth phase.	3.295928517843173
Thus resting fungi in the nail are not harmed, and if the concentration of terbinafine is lower than the MIC for the fungi, they can cause a relapse.	3.598755146808914
Itraconazole is a fungistatic agent.	3.4875156423376015
Its concentration in the nail plate must be higher than the MIC for the causative fungi for a long time - 10 to 12 months.	3.7245022872080935
The usual short-term treatment of onychomycosis over 3 months can be insufficient in individual cases such as patients with disorders, e.g.	3.113129318614945
circulatory disorders or slowed nail growth.	3.5179585518644525
This paper presents an algorithm for automatic switching between atrial tracking and nontracking pacing mode based on a "4 out of 7" concept: if 4 out of 7 atrial intervals are sensed below a critical value, mode switching (MS) is automatically performed.	2.885142615604684
The technical solution in Medtronic Kappa 700 dual chamber devices is explained together with an evaluation of advantages and possible limitations.	3.066362981542866
The "4 out of 7" algorithm offers a quick MS; by the addition of a "blanked flutter search" algorithm integrated into this concept, the detection of atrial flutter is facilitated in a wider range of programmed AV intervals.	3.202186770989172
With the increased rapidity of MS and sensitivity towards atrial flutter detection, there is also an increased propensity to switch to the nontracking mode in case of short atrial runs and frequent premature atrial beats.	3.355762728440385
Therefore, to optimize the MS function, programming of the device (e.g., activation of a time delay before MS) should be carried out individually with respect to the intrinsic rhythm and arrhythmia of the patient.	3.5796009204454267
Possible interactions between different programmable parameters should also be taken into consideration.	2.916002665128056
Some guidelines are presented in this paper.	3.2623007618191835

The results of ankle arthroplasty have generally been disappointing compared to other forms of arthroplasty.	3.083666270442658
The present survey of results of ankle arthroplasty deals with the anatomical, the kinemasiological the biomechanical and the biological features of the ankle joint.	3.254320889430312
These features all seem important prerequisites for a successful total ankle prosthesis design.	3.289029160239955
From the study of the results displayed in the literature and those of my own series it can be stated that a modern ankle arthroplasty should respect the normal anatomy and kinemasiology.	3.712548257392575
Biomechanically it should work as a normal ankle joint i. e. cylindrical mobility, congruency and a possibility for normal torque within the ankle mortise.	3.2065970444502665
The prosthesis components should only be fixed in solid subchondral bone, and preferably without cement.	3.4463653335784854
Only compressible forces should act at the bone-prosthesis interface.	3.268437469375299
The axis of the ankle joint as well as of that of the hindfoot should be aligned to normal.	4.837440854976556
Meticulous surgery and special guide instruments are absolute necessities.	3.3923475555369804
Restoration of muscle power and gait postoperatively are essential for a good and lasting result.	3.431877060925458
The indication for ankle arthroplasty is mainly cases of osteoarthritis (primary or traumatic) and rheumatoid arthritis.	2.947207597750843
Contraindications are talus necrosis, Charcot joints, extreme osteoporosis, severe arteriosclerosis, and very aggressive arthritis.	2.9182703389320976
Mental disorders and neurological disorders may also be contraindications.	3.943781179572283
Furthermore, the patients should agree not to perform sports involving jumping and running or other ankle demanding activities.	3.115813845867729
The average annual failure rate should not exceed 1 % if these recommendations are followed.	3.181101345112654

The acute liver failure (ALF) is a complex syndrome resulting from loss of synthetic and metabolic functions of the liver.	3.612499329854627
Despite recent advances in intensive care medicine patients with severe ALF have a very high mortality and the orthotopic liver transplantation still remains the only proven effective treatment of ALF.	3.9440987349296908
Numerous attempts have been made to improve survival by using various extracorporeal support techniques, but none of these therapeutic approaches was able to increase the survival rate.	3.825766118827598
Liver support systems based on detoxification procedures only could not influence the deleterious course of the disease.	2.7878908795306314
It is certain that an ideal liver support system should be capable to fulfil the liver's essential synthetic and metabolic functions as well as detoxification and excretion.	3.162229603554578
Over the last years the development of hybrid liver assist devices has aimed at replacing these liver functions and therefore might give an advantage over earlier systems based on detoxification techniques only.	3.048613916317122
This article gives a short review of the various liver support systems and focuses then on the hybrid liver support systems, their construction and the remaining problems after the first clinical applications.	3.595243915307483
After a latency period of 20 years, in a 39-year-old Austrian citizen of Chinese origin, a surgically removed rectal carcinoma, as well as the neighboring chronic inflammatory rectal mucosa with various degrees of dysplasia and one positive neighboring lymph node, showed helminthiasis in the histopathological examination, convincing us of a link between carcinoma and chronic helminthiasis.	3.157939618086565
Whereas the etiological context between chronic infection by Schistosoma haematobium and endemic frequent urinary bladder carcinoma is considered a matter of fact, whether of not the incidence of intestinal carcinoma is increased in connection with chronic intestinal schistosomiasis is controversial.	3.3507937074271847
The etiological and pathogenetic link between helminthiasis and carcinoma should be considered in the same way as for other related inflammatory large-bowel diseases.	3.216446505220609
In the sequence chronic inflammation - severe dysplasia, the formation of carcinoma could possibly occur.	3.1715942717077916

Mainly ruptures of vein patches are described in the literature.	3.1381378354670884
