Postoperatively the patient showed paresis of the left recurrent nerve but fortunately did not suffer any other neurological deficit.	3.622606583276449
Myocardial stunning (contractile dysfunction in the presence of normalized perfusion) and myocardial hibernation (contractile dysfunction matching reduced perfusion) have represented separate concepts of viable, but dyssynergic myocardium in the past.	3.2766919489072146
However, in vivo experimental and clinical work suggests that repetitive ischemia due to coronary artery disease may induce a gradual transition between stunned and hibernating myocardium.	3.065445611127887
Myocardial hibernation itself can result from a spectrum of ischemic conditions ranging from impaired myocardial blood flow reserve to frank hypoperfusion.	3.0639862919911054
With increasing severity and duration of ischemia, degeneration of cardiac myocytes, accumulation of glycogen and cell death ensue.	3.20500583185652
Additonally, there is an increase of extracellular matrix protein content leading to reparative fibrosis, which in turn limits functional recovery.	3.777409071012174
In the light of these structural features, the available methods for detection of viable myocardium, in particular dobutamine echocardiography and nuclear imaging techniques, offer complementary rather than contradictory information.	3.237344277338628
Dobutamine echo has satisfactory sensitivity, excellent specificity, and high diagnostic accuracy for the detection of viable dyssynergic myocardium.	3.7312712866745703
While in the past only its predictive accuracy for segmental recovery has been validated, newer data show an improved survival after revascularization if at least four viable dyssynergic left ventricular segments in a 16 segment model can be identified by dobutamine echocardiography.	2.879953197115567
The complete (low and high dose) dobutamine protocol can elicit several types of contractile responses (sustained improvement in contraction or monophasic response, biphasic response, new wall motion abnormality) which should be interpreted in view of other clinical data including a previous infarction.	3.085638561136443
The test protocol can be used safely at the end of the first week after myocardial infarction.	4.200310499176993
If ischemia or viability is documented, revascularization should be performed promptly.	3.658567453761924
A similar strategy should be followed in the setting of chronic coronary heart disease with left ventricular dysfunction.	3.5611040324245677
Since the structural changes of hibernating myocardium are progressive, time to revascularization is critical.	3.2165120598252614
On the other hand, responsible therapeutic planning requires proof of ischemia or viability before initiating a potentially hazardous revascularization procedure.	2.525698359625086
The coarctation of the aorta is a congenital narrowing of the aorta in the transitional area between the distal aortic arch and the proximal descending aorta.	3.416371003152447
The coarctation causes an arterial hypertension of the upper half and an arterial hypotension of the lower half of the body.	4.231020126776392
The indication for operative repair is given because of the hypertension with strain and possible insufficiency of the heart.	3.4447606123854877
The resection of the narrowed part of the aorta with end-to-end anastomosis or interposition of a prosthesis brings on the risk of a recoarctation.	4.1628958391354445
After a Vosschulte-aortoplasty a recurrent coarctation is rarely seen.	3.0678225465571547
This method, however, brings on a higher risk of the development of an aneurysm.	5.027110815782724
In the following it is reported about a patient who underwent an operation due to an aneurysm 22 years after a Vosschulte-aortoplasty.	3.733154564154936

In 2025 Italy is expected to have the highest world median age with nearly half of the population over 50 years old.	3.981683244815106
To avoid an unbearable burden of disease and disability on future generations, we must identify areas for intensive disease and disability prevention programs.	3.302686763995536
A 14 year old macedonic girl was admitted with recurrent colicky abdominal pain that had lasted for several weeks.	3.075683741381941
Laboratory check, plain abdominal film and abdominal sonography did not show abnormalitities immediately.	3.292341019541481
Endoscopic retrograde choledocho-pancreaticography (ERCP) was performed after abdominal sonography showed a dilatation of the choledochus.	3.478749204376865

Papillotomy and stone-extraction could not remove abdominal pain.	3.180831447088803
Laparatomy and choledocho-jejunostomy could finally remove the symptoms.	2.9830042394662337
Successful transplantation of autologous chondrocytes for repair of articular cartilage defects requires an undisturbed matrix-synthesis of the transplanted cells.	3.5317617196263775
This, in turn, is dependent on the composition of the synovial fluid (SF) of the respective joint.	3.865294116250018
We addressed the question whether analysis of a patient's SF can predict the rate of matrix-synthesis of articular cartilage exposed to this SF in vitro.	4.010055502275813
In the SF, the following parameters were determined: Interleukin-1, IL-6, IL-8, IL-1-RA, TNF, Insulin-like growth-factor I (IGF-I), IGF-II, IGF-binding protein-2 (IGFBP-2), IGFBP-3 as well as total proteinase activity and total collagenase activity.	4.322294548114778
To assess the effect of SF on the matrix synthesis of articular chondrocytes, bovine cartilage was incubated in the presence of SF, and the rate of proteoglycan synthesis subsequently determined.	3.887296633610236
In some cases, a monoclonal antibody directed against IGF-I was added.	3.3449862378588273
SF from patients with OA or trauma, respectively, stimulated PG-synthesis of bovine cartilage more markedly than did SF from patients with rheumatic arthritides.	3.280665455790317
On the average, 60 percent of the SF-induced increase of cartilage matrix synthesis could be titrated out by an anti-IGF-I-AB.	3.2493410035248345
The best predictor for the SF-effects on PG-synthesis of exposed cartilage was the proportion of free IGF-I (r = 0.573, p < 0.001, Spearman rank correlation) followed by the SF-concentrations of IGF-I (with a positive sign), IGFBP-3, IL-1, and TNF (all with a negative sign).	3.437329051718424
According to our data, IGF-I is the most important anabolic factor in human SF with respect to cartilage PG-synthesis.	4.054575869120258
The proportion of free IGF-I seems to be of special importance in this regard.	3.4340500290205123
Low SF-levels of free IGF-I could be identified as a possible risk-factor for a sub-optimal protoeglycan synthesis of chondrocytes exposed to this synovial milieu.	3.6071216986378
The coincidence between panic disorder and depression is a well known phenomenon.	3.5558359002168154
However, only few studies investigated the coincidence of panic disorder with schizophrenia.	3.154458531152426
This may in part be explained by the fact that both positive and negative symptoms of schizophrenia may mask the clinical symptoms of a panic disorder.	3.4208010615519555
We report on a female patient suffering both from agoraphobia with panic disorder and paranoid schizophrenia according to ICD-10.	2.930871114274728
The productive psychotic symptoms responded well to treatment with a low dose of zotepine, whereas the panic disorder was effectively treated with a combined therapy with imipramine and cognitive behavioral therapy.	3.8963527632853525
Although it has to be questioned whether the coincidence between panic disorder and schizophrenia reflects two different diagnostic entities, the occurence of symptoms of a panic disorder in schizophrenia deserve further attention because these may be treated efficiently by a specific pharmacotherapy and psychotherapy.	3.2180007968560886

The aim of this retrospective study was to evaluate the incidence, etiology and prognosis of severe connatal anemia in preterm and term children.	3.077574601688861
In 18 of 18 367 (0.98 permil) liveborn neonates (birth weight 680-4050 g; 26-41 weeks of gestation), the initial hemoglobin level was below 10 g/dl.	3.2053071443197485
In those children with birth weight below 2500 g the incidence was 6.8 permil.	3.086071274918277
In 17 of 18 cases the cause of anemia could be clarified.	3.2528614263096043
In five preterm babies (28%) an acute fetofetal transfusion and in three newborns a fetomaternal transfusion was responsible for the onset of anemia.	3.4716115740461246
In two cases there was Rh incompatibility, in two cases placental bleeding, and in another two cases fetal tumour bleeding caused the anemia.	3.5446709833844174
In one fully developed newborn there was severe disseminated intestinal bleeding of unknown cause.	2.904190711931036
Another child suffered from EBV infection, and one had trisomy 13 with multiple malformations.	3.6738046703888165
Ten children (55%) had to be resuscitated due to hypovolemic shock.	3.5135619298496787
Fifteen children were intubated and ventilated mechanically.	3.336695567750003
Seven children (39%); (six preterm babies and the newborn with trisomy 13) died between days 1 and 6.	3.332474124376708
Five of these seven children had to be resuscitated at birth.	3.35629012778841
Five children (28%) including three full-term babies were developed normally.	3.407123893649207
In conclusion, severe anemia with hemoglobin below 10 g/dl is very rare but serious.	3.1440628060585314
It seems necessary to optimize primary resuscitation by immediate transfusion and monitoring of central venous pressure by umbilical vein catheter.	3.173007170740698
The prognosis can be influenced in a positive way.	3.613555578532855

White blood count, C-reactive protein (CRP), and the erythrocyte sedimentation rate (ESR) are often used in the differential diagnosis of infection versus SIRS (systemic inflammatory response syndrome) due to noninfectious causes.	3.682084637003636
There is a number of non-infectious stimuli to cause leucocytosis and CRP elevation.	3.7704908352731605

The ACL injury was initially documented by examination under anesthesia and arthroscopy.	3.241366393730354
Treatment in all cases consisted of a standard protocol of early rehabilitation and bracing.	3.944397814700152
Twenty-nine (65%) patients showed signs of meniscal pathology at an average of 3 years after the ACL injury during the follow-up period.	3.5532113354031365
Rearthroscopy was performed and showed a higher incidence of medial meniscus tears.	4.286954987252658
The most common tear of the medial meniscus was the bucket-handle type, followed by the flap tear and the single longitudinal split of the posterior horn.	3.522547024766663
Secondary reconstruction of the ACL was necessary in 24 patients complaining of the meniscus giving way.	4.297133687154281
The remaining five patients had rearthroscopy 4 years after the ACL injury and a partial meniscectomy and ACL reconstruction was performed.	3.4227696309485047
Sixteen patients (35% of the overall sample) had no instability complaints or meniscal pathology during the follow-up period, but discontinued their sporting activities.	3.40233571525697
Results indicate the increasing incidence of meniscal tears during ACL insufficiency.	3.305246288579779
We recommend that patients with ruptures of the ACL should be investigated for meniscal tears and that early ligament reconstruction of the knee and mensical repair or partial meniscectomy should be considered simultaneously.	3.8540312126412974

The primary outcome measure was the pain dimension of the WOMAC Osteoarthritis Index.	3.2243363793995177
Secondary outcome measures included the stiffness and physical function dimensions of the WOMAC, daily visual analogue scales (VAS) on pain and physical function, and final overall assessment by both patients and investigators.	3.361639685861411
Results: 78 patients (39 willow bark extract, 39 placebo) participated in the trial.	3.272708328696521
A statistically significant difference between active treatment and placebo group was observed in the WOMAC pain dimension (d=6.5mm, 95%C.I.=0.2-12.7mm, p=0.047); the WOMAC pain score was reduced by 14% from baseline level after two weeks of active treatment, compared to an increase of 2% in the placebo group.	3.611497695703276
Patient diary VAS confirmed this result, and likewise the final overall assessments showed superiority of willow bark extract over placebo (patients assessment, p=0.0002; investigators assessment, p=0.0073).	2.9077514049775686
Conclusion: Willow bark extract shows a moderate analgesic effect in osteoarthritis.	3.161499771797753

Confusion between syncope and epileptic seizures is a common problem in clinical practice.	3.4873132866503864
Recently, new insights into the phenomenology of transient cerebral hypoxia have been gained from video analysis of experimentally induced syncope.	2.864271658474613
Common elements of syncope include multifocal and generalized myoclonus, tonic body extension, automatisms, vocalizations, eye deviations and hallucinations.	2.660809195278105
Thus, it is not the presence or absence of these features but their specific character that distinguishes syncope from epileptic seizures.	3.00663878866684
Other clues for differential diagnosis include precipitating factors, premonitory symptoms and postictal events, such as tongue bites and postictal confusion, which has been identified as the single most powerful factor discriminating syncope from epileptic seizures.	3.1803046260945527
In contrast, incontinence and head injury are common in both conditions.	3.0649114045806742
Investigations such as electroencephalogram, tilt testing and postictal prolactin or creatine kinase levels may aid diagnosis but are never diagnostic in isolation.	2.7430635465438074
In rare cases, hypoxic and epileptic mechanisms may interact within one attack.	2.870995582104218

In frequent users, THC glucuronide and 11-OH-THC glucuronide could be found up to 1 and 3 days after abstinence, respectively.	3.2627479525538905
In light users, neither THC glucuronide nor 11-OH-THC glucuronide was detectable.	2.7139568674782324
The determination of conjugated THC and 11-OH-THC in addition to free and bound THCCOOH is suggested as an aid in assessing the frequency of cannabis use, but is limited to samples obtained within a few days after the last consumption.	3.546239010294156
The participation of social work in inpatient psychiatric care is generally considered necessary, but there is a lack of empirical studies in this field.	3.7723116890373647
The analyses presented of a systematic documentation of social work interventions in 2038 cases during an 11-year period demonstrate that social workers are mostly involved in the treatment of chronic and previously treated patients.	3.6386533523277933
Interventions in younger patients, most of whom are suffering from psychoses, aim at rehabilitation through activity; in elderly patients with organic or depressive disorders, the major concern is to improve posthospital care; patients with neurotic or personality disorders comprise another group with a chronic course and a relatively poor outcome.	3.4231740034105584
As far as their goals are comparable, social workers and doctors agree on their objectives.	2.9540034352927527
Social workers usually see their own interventions as successful, but patient groups who benefit greatly can be differentiated from groups with poor outcome.	3.0667888121774873
Stiff-man syndrome is a rare disorder of the central nervous system characterized by muscular rigidity and superimposed spasms.	3.9172628269603798
The etiology is still unknown and an autoimmune cause is discussed.	3.5194179157466827
Many differential diagnoses of muscular rigidity and of induration of the skin have to be considered.	3.7307710897395276
A 22 year old patient was admitted under suspicion of a stiff-man syndrome.	3.5863057372033498
He has had developed a painful rigidity of the trunk, starting in the neck.	3.6582206699611626
Massive stiffness of the trunk with pale appearance of the skin and a beginning disorder of swallowing and respiration were observed.	3.8081634398435784
Clinical investigation, EMG, cerebrospinal fluid and laboratory findings were all normal, thus excluding a stiff-man syndrome and other neuromuscular diseases.	3.1358039342497213
Skin biopsy showed typical changes of Buschke's scleredema adultorum, a rare connective tissue disorder of unknown etiology.	2.8874625839751302
Therapy with corticosteroide and ciclosporin led to a mild improvement of symptoms.	3.1251375361352363
Although rare, Buschke's scleredema adultorum should be regarded as a differential diagnosis of the stiff man syndrome.	3.461949031539728

An Ivalon-plug (PDA-plug) has been developed for transvenous closure of patent ductus arteriosus.	3.1585389380670725
It can be introduced into the ductus through standard venous sheaths with a diameter von 8-16 French.	3.187068394577638
The plug is fixed in its target position by means of four distal (aortal) and two proximal (pulmonary) nitinol struts.	3.311836589637789
In case of malpositioning the system can be pulled back into and retrieved through the sheath.	2.9443121165531028
In animal experiments endothelialization of the implanted material was demonstrated.	3.1624467228028106
PDA-closure was attempted in 58 patients; the procedure was successful in 57 cases; a residual ductal flow was present in eight patients.	3.802449611482145
During a follow-up of up to 24 months there were no complications.	4.331411127314497
Using 8 different monoclonal antibodies, immunohistology was performed on 36 follicular adenomas and on 28 follicular, 34 papillary, 27 medullary and 29 anaplastic carcinomas of the thyroid.	3.3241839417614387
The panel of antibodies was directed against broad-spectrum cytokeratins (pan-CK, antibody lu-5), against basic and acid high-molecular-weight CK of types  1, 5, 10 and 14, against basic ( 5 and 6) and acid high-molecular-weight CK ( 13) and against basic ( 7 and  8) and acid low-molecular-weight CK ( 19 and  20).	3.094304325511933
With the exception of a large number of anaplastic carcinomas, nearly all other tumours exhibited strong immunoreactivity with antibodies against pan-CK, CK 8 and CK 19.	2.846979065940596
CK 20 expression was exclusively shown for 2 medullary carcinomas.	3.3123149379134613
Reactivity for high-molecular-weight CK could only, each time focally, be demonstrated for 14 papillary and 2 follicular carcinomas and for 2 anaplastic carcinomas with partial squamous differentiation.	3.156081237579236
Thirteen anaplastic carcinomas were not decorated by any of the CK antibodies applied.	3.323836063839052
CK 7 staining exceeding the staining of individual cells was observed in 26 papillary cancers.	3.6346377156721044
In contrast, such a finding could only be obtained with each one follicular adenoma, medullary carcinoma and anaplastic carcinoma and with 5 follicular carcinomas.	3.3213463843287716
These results confirm earlier studies in that CK 20 expression among thyroid tumours is restricted to the neuroendocrine medullary carcinomas and that in a larger percentage of anaplastic thyroid carcinomas an epithelial phenotype can not be demonstrated even upon using broad-spectrum CK antibodies.	3.0729890418819443
New is the finding that there exist considerable differences between papillary carcinomas and all other non-papillary thyroid tumours regarding CK 7 expression.	3.1447742829871594
This result might be of differential diagnostic value for the distinction of follicular and papillary thyroid neoplasias which sometimes have an overlapping histological pattern.	3.034866405982903

Tumor invasion of the portal vein by ductal adenocarcinoma of the pancreatic head is classically known as a criterion for inoperability.	3.176248542990487
Despite improvement in operation techniques for portal vein resection during Whipple's procedure and acceptable mortality and morbidity, in the case of uncertain tumor infiltration vascular resection cannot be recommended in general.	3.415437233333133
The problem is the preoperative detection of tumor infiltration of the portal vein.	3.4685281790231106
Often the surgeon is confronted with unsuspected macroscopic portal vein infiltration or tumor adhesion during the operation.	2.9091416201877673
Between 1986 and 1995 105 patients underwent Whipple's procedure for ductal adenocarcinoma of the pancreatic head in our department.	2.766218632449277
In eight of these cases partial portal vein resection was performed because of macroscopic tumor infiltration or tumor adhesion.	3.4386450901872005
In all eight cases the preoperative diagnostic procedures with CT and portography did not show any suspicion of tumor infiltration.	3.3924635086708026
In four of the eight cases histological tumor infiltration of all vascular layers was found.	3.2253217428759138
In the others we found no or only adventitial tumor invasion.	3.1194001341803657
The patients without tumor infiltration of the portal vein showed a survival time after surgery of 27.78 months in contrast to 6.67 months in the group with histologically proven tumor infiltration.	3.611891855168996
Endovascular, intraportal ultrasound (IPEUS), a new diagnostic procedure, can give helpful information regarding portal vein involvement.	3.76255959454628
Although the IPEUS is not a standard diagnostic procedure it was shown to detect portal vein infiltration with high sensitivity and specificity.	3.750850197993742
Our results indicate that in such cases where portal vein infiltration has been excluded by IPEUS, patients with macroscopic tumor adhesion do benefit from partial portal vein resection.	3.187648323684774

Timing is of utmost importance.	3.300107309313498

PVE is classified as "early" or "late" (occurence within or after 60 days following heart valve replacement).	3.321227242981078

This indicated the excellent reliability of this treatment planning method.	3.616630273493523
Olfactory dysfunction seems to be one of the most frequent symptoms in idiopathic parkinsonian syndrome (IPS).	3.783630272876779
In contrast to the increasing number of studies providing evidence of the usefulness of olfactory tests in the diagnosis of IPS, clinical assessment of olfactory function is rarely performed.	3.440992224133971
This may be due to the lack of an easy-to-use,  inexpensive, standardized, and reliable test.	3.720295079270748
In this study, we administered the newly developed "sniffin' sticks" test to a group of 40 nondemented IPS patients and compared the results with 40 healthy controls matched for age, gender, and smoking habits.	3.2394102168338246
In all three subtests including odor identification, odor detection threshold, and odor discrimination, the control group scored significantly better than the IPS group, yielding a specificity and sensitivity of 90% each.	3.0439598172781483
Our results indicate that olfactory disturbances in IPS can be found at early stages of the disease, appear bilaterally, and do not correlate with the dominant side of parkinsonism.	3.1950673228815987
Therefore, we emphasize that olfactory testing may be a useful tool in the diagnosis of IPS.	3.8375177360798243

Primary defects of skeletal growth and development can be subdivided into hypoplasias, dysostoses and dysplasias.	3.0407139509882457
Hypoplastic bones are small but otherwise normal.	3.438620092097998
Generalized skeletal hypoplasias comprise various forms of primordial dwarfism and syndromal disorders including trisomy 21 and Ullrich-Turner syndrome.	2.699282573686904
Dysostoses are defects of bones as organs resulting from errors of morphogenesis.	3.171089370276617
Many of them are caused by mutations of single genes in the cascade of morphogenetic gene sequences.	3.2605806911234434
Dysplasias are defects of bone as tissue.	3.5508259281494214
Some of them (e. g. achondroplasia, Jansen type of metaphyseal chondrodysplasia) are caused by defects of signal genes influencing cell division or differentiation.	2.801730048324991
Others result from gene mutations affecting the cellular production of matrix components.	2.9916693772546
Examples are collagenopathies such as osteogenesis imperfecta and some spondyloepiphyseal dysplasias.	2.724778169782287
Finally, disorders such as pycnodysostosis, result from defects of chondro-osseous homeostasis.	2.947694389846439
The study of skeletal defects helps to unravel the complexity of normal skeletal development.	2.9972150882601594
Human parvovirus B19 causes erythema infectiosum (fifth disease) and aplastic crisis.	2.8829843264401562
In pregnancy, B19 may be transmitted on to the fetus resulting in hydrops fetalis.	3.1850351156594043
B19 is sometimes associated with thrombocytopenia and vasculitis.	3.21554962120761
In immunocompromised patients, B19 may persist causing chronic infection.	3.3158641892374345
Several methods for detecting B19 virus or specific antibodies are now available.	3.0965714564807603
B19 infection does not usually require therapy.	3.357697085917861
Efficacy of immunoglobulins in chronic B19 infection has been demonstrated.	3.9273325677084667
In absence of significant symptoms and signs, the diagnosis of pulmonary embolism (PE) remains difficult.	4.14021909327216
Sensitivity and specifity of laboratory tests, chest X-ray, and ECG on their own is low.	3.63502546508441
Echocardiography is particularly useful in critically ill patients suspected of having pulmonary emboli and can help identify right ventricular pressure overload.	3.417589274880706
Venous ultrasonography is useful in patients with suspected PE, but normal results do not rule out PE.	3.843109418148398
Helical CT with contrast medium can identify pulmonary emboli.	3.5499869105153223
The diagnosis of pulmonary embolism should be made by combining clinical assessment, several diagnostic techniques, and finally pulmonary angiography in doubtful cases.	3.531103503356926
Heparin remains the standard therapy for patients with stable hemodynamics.	4.6773151351392706
Thrombolytic therapy is recommended in hemodynamically compromised patients.	3.5982266686706117
In short-term dose regimes, the thrombolytic agents urokinase, streptokinase, and rt-PA seem to be equally efficient.	3.5838276492418695
So far, however, no study has proven that thrombolytic therapy significantly reduces mortality in pulmonary embolism.	3.3904057616638132

Renal tubular dysgenesis is a rarely recognized condition characterized by oligohydramnios, Potter's sequence and congenital anuria leading to stillbirth or neonatal death from respiratory failure.	2.6705554786107504
It is thought to be inherited in an autosomal recessive manner.	3.032617219942308
Definitive diagnosis is based on renal histology, revealing the lack of proximal tubule differentiation.	4.026441152475863
Two additional cases of affected sibs in a family with parental consanguinity are reported.	3.24305004552488
Lectin and immunohistochemical studies confirmed structural and functional immaturity of the proximal tubule.	3.9133196817425366
Further findings include bilateral renal vein thrombosis.	3.250262798401865

Articular cartilage has only a small capacity for regneration.	3.6315887690538675
This makes the repair of articular surfaces difficult.	3.5364755305970976
In 1959 Pridie described his method of resurfacing osteoarthritic knee joints.	2.9501971758099694
This operation is still in widespread use today.	3.480478867872444
Pridie introduced the principle of drilling exposed subchondral bone with the objective of encouraging a fibro-cartilaginous repair.	3.2537031165898678
The newly formed fibrocartilaginous layer that develops over the lesion in osteoarthritis may be enough to decrease patients symptoms.	3.068901726535138
Bone drilling into the subchondral layer is also effective in promoting healing of osteochondrosis dissecans.	3.1161536904006075
The choice of the treatment should be based on factors such as age of the patient, serverity of symptoms, activity level and functional demands on the joint, site and stage of the lesion.	4.44442329848383
The drilling operation remains useful in osteoathritis and osteochondrosis dissecans.	2.8490972897566165
Recent immunobiological findings together with advances in biotechnology, ameliorations in clinical trial design, and MRI developments have led to a variety of therapeutical approaches in multiple sclerosis (MS).	3.2446477981841815
However, in contrast to successfully introduced new treatments, a number of therapeutical failures exist as well: despite impressive data from animal models, convincing concepts, and promising phase I/II studies, some investigated drugs and strategies showed no positive effects in clinical trials, or trials had to be terminated because of unexpected side effects.	3.2195608312315023
This article provides an overview of clinical studies that have failed or been abandoned for other reasons.	3.3262556897225313
Tumor necrosis factor (TNF) -antagonists which have led to negative effects in two studies (Lenercept, Infliximab) are discussed in detail.	3.4105201632381275
These results raise critical questions concerning the hypothetical pathogenesis of MS lesions and the value of MRI in the assessment of clinically relevant therapeutic drug effects.	3.4797523489002584
In addition to a description of the immunobiological background, studies on the immunosuppressive agents linomide, deoxyspergualin, sulfasalazine and cladribine, trials for the cytokines interleukin-10 and TGF-2, the studies on remyelination by intravenous immunoglobulins (IVIg), oral tolerance, and extracorporeal photopheresis are discussed.	2.8985748593000547
Isolated pancreatic metastases from renal-cell carcinomas (RCC) are extremely rare.	3.2362880810483357
Only 96 cases of clinically diagnosed renal-cell carcinoma metastatic to the pancreas have been reported in the world literature, and 70 of the patients (including ours) underwent a definitive surgical resection.	4.022764100431076
In many cases the time between the nephrectomy and diagnosis of metachronous metastases is reported to exceed 10 years.	3.1275985720945014
Therefore, the initial diagnosis may be overlooked when there is a prolonged disease-free interval.	3.9547486075770815
When it does occur simultaneously or metachronously, aggressive surgical resection, when possible, seems to be the most effective treatment for this metastatic lesion.	3.5704469973680606
Surgical resection can provide long-term survival in selected cases.	3.440589582166357
The patient simultaneously presented with both a mass in the body of the pancreas and a right-sided colon cancer.	3.5380508234868953
Thus, the diagnosis of pancreatic metastasis of colon cancer was suspected initially.	3.9253678809842567
Both tumors were radically resected, and histological examination revealed two pancreatic metastases from the previous RCC.	3.5570883752993327
It illustrates a rare indication of pancreatic resection because of pancreatic metastasis.	3.3445583185819574
The need for prolonged follow-up of patients is emphasized.	3.63520708651109
The few reports on surgically treated pancreatic metastases from RCC are reviewed after the presentation of this case.	3.471724003512143
Delusion is understood to mean intersubjectively disconcerting convictions with a tendency toward subjective certainty that lose their disconcerting character when made the object of psychiatric analysis in the knowledge of their independence from mental disorder.	3.0015017870452576
The perceptions from which delusions arise are dynamically charged according to their role in the structural context.	3.559863255835861
The realisation pressure that burdens the perceptions and is intensified in psychotic constitutions is a precondition for the delusion.	2.7377239836415406
The failure of derealisation brought about by the psychotic disorganisation of the structure is also a requirement.	3.3432521474090753
Based on a case study, considerations arising out of the initial stages of schizophrenic delusion are extended to other forms of delusion and to the conditions for chronification.	3.7322604641463255

The selection of patients who may profit from this intervention is challenging for the urologist, as the indication has to be carefully established.	3.8532656588785095

After HDCT, haematologic monitoring and maximal supportive care are essential.	3.066956754444424
It is therefore recommended that HDCT only be administered at specialized centres.	2.8281003967661498
Pyoderma gangrenosum develops in most patients between the age of 25 and 54 years.	3.7778265324819347
It usually occurs in otherwise healthy persons or in association with a systemic desease.	3.6878158568670703
Several clinical variants of pyoderma gangrenosum have been described.	2.9805449627869454
Extremely painful ulcerations are characteristic and evolve rapidly.	3.20771184102042
Malignant pyoderma, the variant described in our case report, is an aggressive variant of ulcerative pyoderma gangrenosum, rapidly progressive and a potentially lethal ulcerative disease.	3.413536836758854
The diagnosis of pyoderma gangrenosum depends on recognition of the evolving clinical features because histopathologic changes are not specific and characteristically serological or hematological markers of the disease do not exist.	3.302302678455803
We report on a 36-year-old male patient, who underwent surgery for repair of an aneurysm of the aortic arch.	3.8049304240419173

Background and purpose: To test the association of cardiac sources of embolism with territorial type brain infarcts.	3.0175553807264226
Defects of the dorsal and ventral ligament complexes of the lumbar spine results to an instability of the functional spinal unit.	3.4931519157837325
For the prognosis of secondary instability due to disko-ligamentous injuries the functional insufficiency of the lasting scars is a larger problem than the primar loss of osseous stability with fast healing tendency.	2.9683575199268057
The main goal of the present biomechanical study in vitro was to demonstrate the different grades of instability in the correlation to progressive disko-ligamentous defects as well as stabilisation through dynamic and static procedures.	3.576146210093806
With a transpedicular screw-ringband-system the segmental function was preserved and instability was abolished.	2.901890145702007

In 3 patients an intracerebral abscess was aspirated and drained.	3.0027634220317214

The accuracy of stereotactic tumour biopsies was 88.7 % in our series, in accordance to other authors.	3.261541833993178

With stereotactic guidance small, deep-seated intraaxial lesions can be well localized and removed.	3.143954646157405
Radiotherapy of patients with prostate cancer offers an alternative to radical prostatectomy in early stages (T1-T2).	4.122061124113476
In locally advanced prostate cancer a high dose or combined radiotherapy is more effective than radical surgery with concurrent lower morbidity and mortality.	3.2284256758732046
Recent developments in linear accellerator technique, the progress in dose calculation and planning techniques provide the means to apply higher doses to a given tumor volume while effectively protecting the surrounding normal tissue at the same time.	2.921118371491699

Skin is the second most common site of extranodal lymphoma.	3.2698128919549876
The significance of cutaneous B-cell lymphomas has been underestimated due to the lack of monoclonal antibodies and molecular genetics in former years.	3.371804105885773
Cutaneous B-cell lymphomas represent a heterogenous group of entities which show variation in histology, immunophenotype and in prognosis.	2.9619660942861765
The most common entities presenting in skin are follicular lymphomas, marginal zone B-cell lymphomas, and diffuse large B-cell lymphomas.	2.871052440930995
The majority of primary cutaneous B-cell lymphomas have an excellent prognosis.	3.165914149291308
Whereas in B-cell lymphomas with secondary spread to the skin the clinical course is dependant on the prognosis of the primary lymphoma.	3.948179476449654
It is evident that primary cutaneous lymphomas are distinct from nodal lymphomas and not extranodal manifestations of their lymph-node-based counterparts.	3.03402699347487
In the current review the morphologic spectrum of cutaneous B-cell lymphomas comprising primary and secondary cutaneous B-cell lymphomas is discussed according to the WHO classification sheme.	3.129012490865491
The phencyclidine derivative ketamine is a non-competitive N-methyl-D-aspartate (NMDA) receptor antagonist with the thalamo-neocortical projection system as the primary site of action.	2.9386428534659124
Racemic ketamine consists of the enantiomers S(+)-ketamine and R(-)-ketamine.	2.9683625271090577
Racemic ketamine has never been considered an adequate anaesthetic agent in neurosurgical patients since  it produces regionally specific stimulation of cerebral metabolism (CMRO2) and increases cerebral blood flow (CBF) and intracranial pressure (ICP).	2.7972759853986418
However, recent experiments suggest that both tracemic ketamine and S(+)-ketamine may reduce infarct size in animal models of incomplete cerebral ischaemia and brain injury.	3.1194885031750985
This experimental protective effect appears to be related to decreases in Ca++ influx and maintenance of brain tissue magnesium levels due to NMDA and quisqualate receptor blockade by ketamine.	3.1223353487085395
Studies in dogs have shown that racemic ketamine (2.0 mg/kg) increases CBF in the presence of the cerebral vasodilator N2O.	3.073009542153099
In contrast, studies in rats without background anaesthesia showed increases in CBF after racemic ketamine (100 mg/kg i.p.).	2.6934208001510256
This suggests that the cerebrovascular effects of racemic ketamine are related to the pre-existing cerebrovascular tone induced by background anaesthetics.	2.2598964136840967
Cerebrovascular CO2 reactivity was maintained regardless of the baseline cerebrovascular resistance.	3.380168194595315
There are several mechanisms by which racemic ketamine may increase CBF.	2.93091651930861
It induces dose-dependent respiratory depression with consequent mild hypercapnia in spontaneously ventilating subjects.	2.9958772783380234
This produces vasodilation due to the intact cerebrovascular CO2 reactivity.	3.882028661222633
Racemic ketamine also induces regional neuroexcitation, which leads to stimulation of cerebral glucose consumption in the limbic, extrapyramidal, auditory, and sensory-motor systems.	2.9876251512369767
This regional neuroexcitation with increased CMRO2 produces increases in CBF that can be blocked by infusion of barbiturates or benzodiazepines.	3.2998641307501786
However, increases in CBF with racemic ketamine (1 mg/kg) may also occur during normocapnia and without changes in CMRO2.	3.768826803763088
However, studies in rats have shown that CBF autoregulation was maintained with low- and high-dose S(+)-ketamine.	3.729830598192286
Infusion of racemic ketamine alters intracranial volume and ICP.	3.5378199064662983
Studies in spontaneously ventilating pigs with and without intracranial hypertension have shown that racemic ketamine (0.5-5.0 mg/kg) produces increases in PaCO2 and ICP.	3.2860146165955006
In contrast, identical experiments with mechanical ventilation and controlled PaCO2 showed no changes in ICP following racemic ketamine infusion.	2.876644708823103
This implies that increases in ICP are related to inadequate ventilation with consecutive hypercapnia and increases in intracranial blood volume.	3.159268445779094
Experiments in mechanically ventilated dogs indicate that racemic ketamine (2 mg/kg) increases cerebral blood volume and ICP even in the presence of normoventilation, a response that is reversible by hyperventilation or the administration of diazepam.	3.490981008126941
Studies in patients have shown that racemic ketamine (2.0 mg/kg) reduces CBF in the presence of cerebral vasodilators like halothane or N2O.	3.066928634436191
In contrast, studies in unanaesthetised humans showed increases in CBF after racemic ketamine (2-3 mg/kg).	3.0545095737118495
This observation is consistent with animal studies and suggests that the cerebrovascular effects of racemic ketamine are related to the pre-existing cerebrovascular tone induced by background anaesthetics.	2.368796657947126

It is endemic mainly in South-East Asia and Afrika.	2.834710760706859
The clinical manifestation is divided into different stages.	3.278147722165063

Furthermore, we discuss the epidemiological and forensic aspects.	3.552316919572602
In this period 1469 drug deaths were registered with a prevalence for HBV of 35% (1997: 39%), for HCV 51% (1997: 58%), and for HIV 7% (1997: 15%).	3.5817327145614115
Co-infections were common (28%) and 19% of all cases were infected with HBV and HCV.	3.8233679738196007

Only 9% showed a normal liverhistology.	3.385337466146432

Our clinical investigation was aimed at assessing noninvasively the integrative coronary flow response to dipyridamole stress in 18 consecutive patients with microvascular angina, only moderately elevated LDL-cholesterol levels (168 +/- 33 mg/dl), and reduced vasodilator capacity despite normal (n=9) or slightly abnormal (n=9) coronary arteriograms (minimal disease with luminal irregularities and/or diameter reduction <=30%) before and after 6-month lipid-lowering therapy (simvastatin).	3.442658229804288
Methods: Regional and averaged myocardial blood flow were measured at rest and after dipyridamole induced vasodilation (0.56 mg/kg) using dynamic positron emission tomography (PET) and N-13 ammonia as flow tracer related to a 3-compartment kinetic model.	3.14289594732013
Baseline data (mean +/- SD): 13 males, 5 females; mean age: 56 +/- 8 years; basal coronary flow: 90 +/- 22 ml/minx100 g; after lipid intervention: 93 +/- 18 ml/minx100 g (n.s.).	3.040806432479182
Total cholesterol decreased to 170 +/- 36 mg/dl (p<0.001); mean LDL level: 97 +/- 26 mg/dl (p<0.001).	3.264505197216433
Coronary dilator capacity increased, assessed in terms of minimal coronary resistance: 0.38 +/- 0.08 vs 0.49 +/- 0.09 units at baseline (p<0.01), myocardial blood flow under dipyridamole: 232 +/- 43 vs 186 +/- 37 ml/minx100 g at baseline (p<0.01), and instantaneous flow ratio: 2.6 +/- 0.7 vs 2.2 +/- 0.6 (p=0.06).	3.0115774536324973
Concomitantly, a considerable regression of angina was noticed in the majority of patients.	3.8043238807740107
Conclusions: An improvement of the non-invasively determined integrative dipyridamole induced coronary vasodilator capacity may be achieved after 6 months by intensive lipid lowering at a very early stage of coronary atherosclerosis.	3.6031142471762725
Consequently, aggressive cholesterol-lowering therapy represents an antiischemic and antianginal approach suggesting, at least in part, functional reversal and probably prevention of further disease progression.	2.8530347991900222

Initially the contact dermatitis was limited to the hands; later on it became generalized.	3.291393536264012
The patient had been working on a drug filling line in a pharmaceutical plant for more than 20 years.	3.1507057804226974
Eight years after starting this job he had developed allergic hand dermatitis to 2,6-diaminopyridine (patch test positive); this healed upon cessation of exposure.	2.805371135306674
Ten years later he again developed hand dermatitis which progressed to generalized dermatitis and conjunctivitis.	3.0011709691074695
Under systemic and local therapy with corticosteroids and cessation of work, it healed nearly completly.	3.202586900426598
Four months after returning to work, the patient experienced a first episode of severe asthma and generalized dermatitis with conjunctivitis following exposure to hydroxychloroquine the day before.	3.554571656322534
His condition continued to fluctuate, when though the patient was transferred at work and now wore rubber gloves.	3.2451725324081813
Eight months later he again developed a generalized dermatitis.	3.4343941786144563
Patch testing revealed delayed-type sensitizations to hydroxychloroquine (tested in concentrations of 0.1%, 0.5%, 1% and 2%).	3.0595510727827357
Equivalent tests in five healthy volunteers were negative.	3.393351728268389
The patch test reactions were pustular, while a biopsy was interpreted as a multiform contact dermatitis reaction.	3.1755081242448977

However, skin prick tests with latex and patch tests with rubber additiva were negative.	2.8830686306960103
Hydroxychloroquine is well known to cause drug reactions.	4.337111770577491
To our knowledge, contact dermatitis to this substance has not yet been reported.	2.9804140800169328
It is noteworthy that the patch test reactions were pustular and of multiform morphology and that bronchial exposure to the allergen resulted in asthma and a generalized drug reaction.	2.7128062161136826
Pathogenetically the asthmatic reaction seems to be on a delayed-type mechanism as is also seen with ampicillin, cobalt and nickel induced asthma.	3.345303915783958

Hyperbaric Oxygen (HBO) therapy is a kind of medical treatment in which a patient breathes 100% of oxygen inside a pressure chamber while the pressure of the chamber is increased to a point higher than sea level pressure.	3.6190017016445006
It is strongly based on clearly defined physical laws and physiological regularities.	2.8895149709666
Among potential adverse effects, barotrauma of the lungs and especially oxygen toxicity to the central nervous system have to be mentioned.	4.097250751214829
Clinical use of HBO therefore requires special knowledge of its effects, risks, and adverse effects, a clear and distinct indication, and the ability and skills to keep complications under control by means of intensive care or emergency medical measures.	3.9387886734680424

Background: The microbial colonization of the intestinal tract in newborns begins during delivery.	2.8988919421092794
Streptococci and Escherichia coli pave the way for the bifidobacterial dominance typical in breast-fed newborns.	2.942570065563179
They provide optimal living conditions for anaerobic bifidobacteria by withdrawal of intraluminal oxygen.	2.9249576933515176
A mixed intestinal flora is established on infant formula feeding in the infant.	3.0469804012900497
Bifidobacteria, Bacteroides, Enterobacteriaceae, streptococci and lactobacilli are the main genera of this mixed intestinal flora.	3.1049635428357654
This represents an intermediate stage of the microflora in adults.	3.463818824829962
The bifidogenic effect of mothers' milk is based on the active substances it contains, which selectively enhance the growth of bifidobacteria, whereas other active substances suppress the growth of the accompanying flora.	3.53413938652511
Bifidus-enhancing factors in breast-feeding are lactose, oligosaccharides, glycoproteins such as glycomacropeptide and the inoculation with bifidobacteria deriving from the skin surface of the mother.	3.2733912195780874
Factors directed to the suppression of the accompanying microflora are antibodies, lactoferrin, lysozyme, fatty acids and monoglycerides that act as antimicrobial substances and the comparatively low protein and iron content in mothers' milk.	2.8732961398747405
A bifidus-inhibiting colonization of the intestinal tract with pathogenic germs is caused by maternal birth-canal infections, which are now known to be the most frequent reason for premature births.	3.721825705892744
An increasing number of surgical deliveries, the separation of the newborn infant from its mother, and the generous use of antibiotics contribute to the delayed colonization of bifidobacteria and to the development of life-threatening nosocomial infections.	4.482636339169621
Counteractive measures against this disastrous situation are the preferential use of bifidobacteria-preserving antibiotics and the inoculation of lyophilized bifidobacteria.	3.061048588312966
Between January 1983 and December 1987, metatarsal head-resections were performed on 203 patients, comprising a total of 370 feet, using the Hueter/Mayo and Hoffmann procedure.	3.071717802557647
Seventy-two patients, comprising a total of 126 feet, were available for post-operative review after an average of 11.4 years from the date of the original operations.	3.9246502476957885
The information obtained from standardized questionnaires was compared to the information found in each patient's file.	3.8396885675551906
In addition, every available pre- and post-operative x-ray taken from 1983 to 1987 was analyzed.	2.9723381276978387
Thus, with an average follow-up period of 5.6 years, the changes found in the pre- and post-operative x-rays from a total of 183 feet could be compared.	3.960435509574666
Before the operations, nearly 100% of the examined feet suffered from painful synovial hypertrophy and erosion of the metatarsophalangeal joints with dislocation and subluxation, causing approximately 70% of all patients to have great difficulties in walking.	3.11333985799259
After the operations, however, 90.2% of the patients reported that this condition had noticeably improved or had completely disappeared.	4.092175148623921
In fact, 87.5% of all patients reported a lasting improvement in their ability to walk longer distances.	3.3019587882758397
As the main criteria in determining the success of an operation (namely, the noticeable reduction of pain and increased mobility) were achieved in 87.5% of the patients, we consider the metatarsal head-resection a reliable method of correcting forefoot deformities in rheumatoid arthritis.	3.9325049976577793
Bone metabolism is influenced by systemic and local acting hormons.	3.6259903897297745
Bone morphogenetic proteins (BMPs) as representatives of the latter substances are known to have the ability for ectopic bone formation.	3.570441629529796
Within this study, we investigated the influence of different growth factors on the proliferation- and differentiation rate of osteoblast-like cells.	3.5600409912261473
For that purpose, human osteoblast-like cells (HPOC) were incubated in the presence of either recombinant BMP-4 of the genome of xenopus laevis (rxBMP-4), recombinant human BMP 2 (rhBMP-2), transforming growth factor-ß (TGF-ß) or basic fibroblast growth factor (rh-bFGF) in two different concentrations each (10 ng/ml and 50 ng/ml).	3.0733134797218655
Cell proliferation was measured within a MTT [3-(4,5-Dimethylthiazol-2-yl)-2,5-Diphenyltetrazolium Bromid] assay, the amount of cell differentiation by the activity of alcaline phosphatase.	4.2007063889256155
Rx-BMP-4 induced a differentiation of HPOC to almost the same extent as rhBMP-2, whereas the addition of rh-bFGF, applied at the same concentration, failed to have any influence on cell differentiation.	3.584785936002801
However, rh-bFGF provoked an increase in cell proliferation when compared with unstimulated HPOC, while rhBMP-2 and rxBMP-4 showed no effect on proliferation.	3.3665211128792523
TGF-ß influenced bone proliferation as well as differenciation significantly.	4.02100430621516
The equipotent effect of recombinant human BMP-2 and recombinant BMP-4 obtained from Xenopus laevis with regard to differentiation and proliferation of human primary osteoblast-like cells originates either in the fact that target cells have receptors for BMP 2 as well as BMP 4, or that both BMP's link to the same receptor with almost the same affinity.	3.472720880902137

The prognosis for patients in whom metastatic renal cell carcinoma (RCC) is not treated is unfavorable, with a reported 5-year survival of 0-18 %.	3.8019538288582777
Before the era of immunotherapy and in the absence of effective nonsurgical therapy, resection of metastases was the accepted way to prolong survival, giving a 5-year survival of 7-69 %.	3.627882315416283
Retrospective studies have shown that several clinical factors are associated with a relatively good prognosis.	3.809826920619522
Some patients will benefit from resection of metastases, but most patients with metastatic RCC are not candidates for such aggressive surgery.	3.4672922000096253
The use of interleukin-2 has demonstrated that immunotherapy can produce durable remissions.	2.978180017997378

The unreamed femoral nail (UFN) system, with its numerous proximal interlocking options, allows a minimal invasive surgical procedure for the treatment of nearly all femoral fracture patterns.	3.6877041666864576
Sixty-six fractures, 5 cases of osteolysis or pathologic fractures, 2 limb shortenings and 1 lengthening (monorail technique) and 3 cases of pseudarthrosis were stabilised with the UFN from July 1994 to December 1996.	2.9281847452150815
The fractures were analysed according to the AO classification.	3.5156199296700956
We found 31 polytrauma patients with an mean ISS of 21.8 and a mean PTS of 25.4.	3.517986535716928
Most of the multiply injured patients (n = 26) were stabilised with the UFN primarily.	3.2943144418009846
Follow-up of 44 patients ranged from 4 to 18 months postoperatively.	3.383260004379338
According to our clinical and radiological score the results were excellent in 34 % of cases, good in 36.3 %, poor in 20.4 % and bad in 9 %.	3.968800886343868
Average fracture healing time was about 9.8 weeks.	3.405252224475057
Fractures of the atlas account for 1-2 % of all vertebral fractures.	3.6759431434756586
We divide atlas fractures into 5 groups: isolated fractures of the anterior arch of the atlas, isolated fractures of the posterior arch, combined fractures of the anterior and posterior arch (so-called Jefferson fractures), isolated fractures of the lateral mass and fractures of the transverse process.	4.080448054620896
Isolated fractures of the anterior or posterior arch are benign and are treated conservatively with a soft collar until the neck pain has disappeared.	3.5532950913466306
Jefferson fractures are divided into stable and unstable fracture depending on the integrity of the transverse ligament.	3.8294294737955012
Stable Jefferson fractures are treated conservatively with good outcome while unstable Jefferson fractures are probably best treated operatively with a posterior atlanto-axial or occipito-axial stabilization and fusion.	3.180916955201716
The authors preferred treatment modality is the immediate open reduction of the dislocated lateral masses combined with a stabilization in the reduced position using a transarticular screw fixation C1/C2 according to Magerl.	3.2245210911746574
This has the advantage of saving the atlanto-occipital joints and offering an immediate stability which makes immobilization in an halo or Minerva cast superfluous.	2.8626215846269565
Isolated fractures of the lateral masses are very rare and may, if the lateral mass is totally destroyed, be a reason for an occipito-cervical fusion.	3.5886703870942473
Fractures of the transverse processes may be the cause for a thrombosis of the vertebral artery.	4.310091617377857
No treatment is necessary for the fracture itself.	4.085264789204755

(2) Lyophilized bFGF was reconstituted in phosphate buffer, mixed with PLA granules, and relyophilized.	2.6705122310500498
In vitro assessment of bFGF release from the PLA implants by immunoassay showed that loading of PLA with crushed lyophilized bFGF resulted in a rapid and high release, while loading by solubilized bFGF and relyophilization led to a low and more regular release of the polypeptide growth factor.	3.0066113753075885
Intestinal neuronal dysplasia (IND) was initially described as a developmental abnormality of the submucous plexus in children.	3.3177688718945215
In recent years this abnormality has also been observed in adults with chronic constipation.	3.3624888208698733
The aim of this study was a morphometric characterization of this disease.	2.4740598520342445
The investigation was performed with 10 adults with IND, compared with 10 healthy control probands.	3.330094866499764

Some patients showed small subcutaneous hematomas and erosion of the skin when energies about 20 mJ were used.	3.24299994822934

Management of laryngeal carcinoma located at the anterior commissure remains controversial.	3.389042383391295
Local control rates with radiotherapy or surgery are not as good as those seen after treatment of midcord lesions.	3.203795006073384
The vertical partial laryngectomy with epiglottic reconstruction (VPLER) may be a more successful approach to such lesions.	3.561387043737637

Indications for performing surgery and outcome data of patients were collected and analyzed according to the indications for surgery, surgical technique, perioperative complications, oncological outcomes and functional results.	3.7552817027844365
Twelve patients were identified that had been treated with VPLER.	4.267106399179774
Indications for surgery included five patients with local recurrences following endoscopic laser partial laryngectomies, four cases with previously untreated primary tumors at the anterior commissure (T2 N0-2 M0), two with local recurrences following radiotherapy, and one with recurrence following frontolateral partial laryngectomy.	3.246579087679419
There were no postoperative complications except for one laryngocutaneous fistula that required secondary repair.	2.8020923857725664
All patients were able to swallow at the tenth postoperative day.	2.94887099203311
All had their tracheostomies closed after completion of wound healing, (a mean of 17 days after surgery).	3.8083857770936476
Phonatory results were usually poor.	3.687988915916942
Two local recurrences occurred during the follow-up period.	3.4534421155469124
However, both patients were salvaged with total laryngectomies and have since been free from disease.	2.9914053248669634
All other patients are alive and well.	2.9468504166113485
Our findings show that VPLER is an effective surgical approach for carcinoma at the anterior commissure of the larynx that cannot be adequately managed with transoral laser surgery or simple frontolateral partial laryngectomy.	3.0458819865871285
This study demonstrates that the procedure can be successfully applied to the treatment of local recurrences following initial raditherapy or surgery.	4.264952522705886
No major complications occurred in our study.	3.76412332525627

The relationship between depression and the outcome of low back surgery was investigated.	3.9248756933269076
Data analysis was based on two assumptions: (1) Presurgical assessments of depression are correlated with the outcome of surgery, and, therefore, depression can be interpreted as a risk factor for surgical failure.	3.7805751202777946
(2) Postsurgical assessments of depression are correlated with the outcome of surgery, and therefore, depression can be interpreted as a response to treatment failure.	3.1858823236581784
The sample was made up of 78 patients who had undergone lumbar nucleotomy and 132 patients with lumbar spondylodesis.	3.200546561753817
Treatment outcome was evaluated 6 months after surgery in the nucleotomy group and 9 months after surgery in the spondylodesis group.	3.730027133960795
Depression was assessed with the Beck Depression Inventory (BDI).	3.0357556203967633
Measures of treatment outcome were an objective rating system for the surgical result, functional impairment, return to work, subjective estimations of the patient, and pain intensity.	3.9426988532675953
Presurgical depression scores showed no significant relationship with surgical outcome in nucleotomy patients.	3.5886142091245095
In spondylodesis patients, however, there was a significant negative correlation with the patients' subjective outcome ratings.	4.857865323155147
Postsurgical depression scores, on the other hand, were significantly related to almost all of the outcome variables in both treatment groups.	4.115907992150232
Patients with clinically relevant postsurgical depression scores were significantly more likely not to benefit sufficiently from surgery than those with clinically not relevant depression scores.	3.133261149871955
Our findings favour assumption 2 over assumption.	2.9935541495705795
In the light of our findings, depressiveness is interpreted as a response to a non-beneficial outcome of surgery.	3.312653263231971

Using electron-beam computed tomography (EBCT) with short exposure times of 100 or 50 ms and the capability of acquiring up to 2 x 17 images/s it is possible to study most of the important morphological and functional determinants of the heart.	3.4463443369452307
Various examples of studies in acute and chronic cardiac diseases are shown to demonstrate the use of EBCT to determine quantitatively left ventricular volumes (ml), myocardial mass (g), wall thickness changes over the cardiac cycle (mm/s), myocardial perfusion (ml/100 g/min) and the extent of coronary calcification (calcium score) and qualitatively the state of the proximal 4-6 cm of the subepicardial coronary arteries.	4.151921393798012
The knowledge of these determinants seems very useful in excluding cardiac dysfunction, in the early recognition of cardiac disease and in the evaluation of the haemodynamic severity of coronary artery stenotic lesions.	4.650261670719806

Fractures and dislocations of the elbow are some of the most common injuries in childhood and adolescence.	4.57099994543813
The majority occur in sport and play activities, e. g., a fall from gymnastics apparatus or a bike, or from popular sports items, such as skateboards or in-line skates.	3.0866324968008256
The injuries can be divided into pure dislocations of the joint and fractures of the distal humerus, proximal radius and ulna, or combinations of both.	3.8904527742829424
In addition, extra- and intraarticular fracture types are defined, with the latter as partial or complete joint lesions.	3.51895924418862
Dislocations of the elbow joint or the radial head can occur as single injuries or in combination with a fracture.	4.1352154154593075
Supracondylar fractures and avulsion fractures of the medial epicondyle are the most frequent extraarticular lesions of the distal humerus.	5.340453167466544
Fractures of the lateral condyle prevail is incomplete intraarticular lesions.	3.1136279431242757
In the forearm, radial head and neck fractures are predominant while typical and atypical Monteggia injuries have a special status.	3.4280648300492618
The complex joint construction and the age-dependent appearance of the epiphyseal ossification centers sometimes make a correct radiological diagnosis difficult.	3.4453621151702714
The trauma history and an exact, clinical examination help to verify the injury, as do comparative X-ray studies of the uninjured side when necessary (but not routinely).	3.485714556470302
Unlike other anatomical areas, most elbow injuries - even in the growing skeleton - are treated operatively.	3.310266493725748
Hereby, the growth plates have to be respected using minimal amounts of small implants.	3.7708572566883465
Additional immobilization in a cast for 2 - 4 weeks is necessary in most cases but does not lead to a functional deficit - in contrast to adults.	4.276057385485111
The implants should be removed as early as possible.	2.8020012445391553
Despite all therapeutic efforts, a significant number of late sequelae, such as malunions and functional impairment, can be seen.	4.214771194369963
The rate of long-term complications increases in cases of untreated displacement of fragments or joint instability.	3.590103657511028
Corrective measures are performed only in selected cases and after the growth plates are closed.	4.277546720239879
Our own treatment regime is demonstrated using exemplary clinical cases of the different injuries and the results of a long-term follow-up study on sports injuries of the elbow in children.	4.406755520351224
Errors in diagnosis and therapy, as well as possible complications, are pointed out.	4.2010347151719
2-adrenergic agonists, mimicking the action of the inhibitory transmitter norepinephrine, cause antinociception due to postsynaptic inhibition of spinothalamic projection neurons, presynaptic inhibition at the central nervous system termination of primary sensory nerves, presynaptic inhibition of brainstem noradrenergic neurons and a generalized decrease in central nervous system sympathetic efferent activity.	2.953836603925056
There is a mutual potentiation of antinociceptive effects of clonidine and morphine.	2.845273927106797
Clonidine is used in chronic pain states for treatment of neuropathic, neuralgic and deafferentiating pain.	4.07506874547981
Based on a meta-analysis of the studies published in the years 1996-1996, the therapeutic efficacy of systematically administered clonidine was evaluated in chronic pain states.	4.028692401874002
Out of 403 screened published studies, only 9 fulfilled the selection criteria.	3.0038559707226344
Besides three case reports with successful clonidine treatment, four placebo-controlled studies could be analyzed treating the following chronic pain states: chest pain despite normal coronary angiograms; painful diabetic neuropathy; postherpetic neuralgia; hyperalgia in patients with sympathetically maintained pain and chronic low back pain.	3.3906966897504063
Although three studies demonstrated statistically significant improvement in pain scores, the improvement in pain relief in these cases was slight.	4.273703000442864
Long-term treatment was successful in a few responders over a period of 17 months.	3.7372563317751473
Hyperalgesia caused by sympathetically maintained pain was relieved by topical (transdermal) application of clonidine.	3.013247982436377
Based on this evaluation a grade C recommendation is derived, which relates to responders.	2.801244833515495
Successful treatment is expected only in pain states with increased sympathetic nervous system activity.	3.3714528812777576
Therefore, in chronic pain, treatment with systemic clonidine is of no significant value.	3.4751254206242814

It has become evident that endothelins are involved in many regulatory mechanisms of the circulation role both in short and in long term.	3.315049870296576
However, in many cases it remains unclear whether the alteration of the endothelin metabolism is a primary pathology or a secondary phenomenon.	3.3281447309311893
The synthesis of endothelin receptor antagonists and animal models with altered endothelin metabolism have opened a new era of endothelin research that will allow insight into the mechanisms of endothelin-action and eventually might lead to new therapeutic concepts.	2.943719457048171

We examined the disturbed joint motion as exclusive criterion for a somatic dysfunction, because through an anesthesia with endotracheal intubation including complete neuromuscular blockade segmental influences on the inspected joint were eleminated.	2.8472792749163633

Somatic dysfunctions were found most frequent for side-inclination and retroflexion in segment O/C1.	2.958719127458301
Both before as well as during complete neuromuscular blockade could be found in the majority of examinations (89,1 %) similar restraints of joint motions.	4.228280374294948

Different theoretical models are presented for the interpretation of our results.	4.088148422801907
We assume, that the disturbance of one component of the metamer organized segment is the basic phänomenon of somatic dysfunction.	3.3449258532521453
This disturbance break through the spinal segmental inhibition and expand into the segment.	3.0900782976670733
Subsequently we discuss to replace the term "somatic dysfunction" through "segmental dysfunction" and to define it as increasing of nozizeptive afference in the segment over a determined period of time with breakthrough of the spinal segmental inhibition threshold.	3.226857311082699
Postoperative intestinal atonia is a complication which is likely to occur in patients predisposed for constipation and in patients after intra-abdominal operations.	3.8268175982766053
The postoperative delay of bowel movement, however, is often also related to the type of anaesthesia being used.	3.7384769212689943
In order to evaluate the magnitude of an anaesthetic-induced postoperative delay of bowel movement, two types of intravenous-based anaesthesia using fentanyl/midazolam (1 mg/25 mg; dosage 0.1 ml/kg/h), and ketamine/midazolam (250 mg/25 mg; dosage 0.1 ml/kg/h) respectively were compared with a volatile anaesthetic technique (enflurane; mean concentration 1.5 vol%).	2.9879165071095035
In three groups of patients (each n=15) undergoing elective surgery of the lower extremities, induction of anaesthesia was accomplished with methohexital (1 - 1.5 mg) followed by succinylcholine (1.5 mg/kg) to facilitate intubation.	3.946367743708108
For the maintenance of muscle relaxation vecuronium bromide was used.	3.2816107144216464
All patients were given droperidol to prevent postoperative emesis, and they were artifically ventilated with N2O/O2 (60: 40) to normal end-expiratory CO2 concentrations.	3.163528746434479
No anticholinergic agents were used at the end of operation since they are known to interfere with bowel motility.	3.8899235680027
For this purpose 40 g lactulose in 100 ml of water was given to all patients via a gastral tube shortly before extubation.	2.9317546021962673
Lactulose is broken down by bacteria once it enters the colon, and H2 is released, taken up by the vascular system and exhaled.	3.1145167665990448
Postoperatively, patients were asked to exhale into a 20-ml syringe every 10 min.	3.073970523878395
The content was analysed for hydrogen (ppm), using an electrochemical sensor (GMI exhaled hydrogen monitor).	2.9148251765577173
From the time of lactulose instillation to a threefold increase in endexpiratory hydrogen concentration (compared to the preoperative value), gastro-coecal transit time was computed.	3.1934963657036626
All three groups of patients were comparable in age, height and body weight.	4.068814141097173
Also, the duration of operation was comparable in all three groups.	4.089694988409695
Mean gastro-coecal transit time was 204 ( +/- 19.6 SD) min following enflurane, 302 ( +/- 32.8 SD) min following fentanyl/-midazolam and 210 ( +/- 28.8 SD) min following ketamine/midazolam anaesthesia.	2.9359988340582666
The gastro-intestinal inhibition after the opioid-based anaesthetic technique was significantly prolonged (p<0.001, Kruskal-Wallis test).	3.23457331387086
There was no significance between patients after ketamine-based anaesthesia and those who had the volatile anaesthetic.	3.291862435015718
When using intravenous anaesthesia with an opioid, gastro-intestinal inhibition, especially in patients prone to have constipation, is likely to develop postoperatively.	3.535874435678634
In classical neuroleptanaesthesia and in analgosedation in the ICU, the simultaneous use of the butyrophenone droperidol seems to counteract the inhibition of opioid-related gastrointestinal motility.	3.3858757689999615

Radiographical signs of beginning mineralization were seen an average of 48.3 days after the start of the distraction.	4.120186755006744
Exact measurement of the distraction gap was possible in all patients during lengthening.	4.594176878616093
Bone healing complications and hematoma could be detected by ultrasound.	3.5831744130768532
A rapid increase of bone mineralization was seen after the distraction was stopped.	3.2987565457833865
With increasing cortication of the regenerate bone, sonograms showed a hyper-reflecting solid line so that further mineralization and the time of removal of the fixator could not be assessed by ultrasound.	3.58585360095344
Ultrasound is more sensitive than radiography in identifying new bone formation during distraction, measuring the length of the distraction gap, and detecting early bone-healing complications and can therefore reduce the need for radiographs.	3.458300964279042
During a 1-year period, patients were interviewed to determine the duration of any delays from the onset of complaints until the first visit to a doctor.	4.4465291597786525
Also asked was how long it took to be referred to an ENT specialist and actual referral to our department.	3.0653857606999924
We then determined the interval from diagnosis to the introduction of therapy.	3.624525262543249
It was found that the delay of patients who went directly to an otorhinolaryngologist was shorter (median, 8 weeks) than that of patients who first went to their family doctors (median, 13 weeks) (P<0.02).	3.7378271820849585
The latter then took an additional 4 weeks before sending patients to an otorhinolaryngologist.	3.072240946568217
Referral from the ENT specialist to our department took another 2 weeks, as well as our staging and pre-therapeutic management.	4.1210244575282
Our findings show that the patient himself is the critical factor in delaying diagnosis and therapy.	3.3955166592180888

The present study deals with long-term dimensional changes in cemented Müller-type total hip endoprostheses.	3.3750496757467046
Creep and wear contribute to different extents to the dimensional changes in polyethylene.	3.077505575093838
The total amount of polyethylene wear is represented by the displacement of the femoral head into the socket.	3.4136787883844733
Within the first postoperative years, the head shifts up to a relatively high rate of about 0.5 mm per year.	4.561857719595091
This rate diminishes after 5 years to an average of about 0.1 mm (ceramics) and 0.2 mm (metal) per year.	3.3444109293987467
Values exceeding 0.2 mm per year for the shift of the femoral head are considered to be unfavourable with regard to a probable loosening of the prosthesis.	3.8435911543606918

The combination ceramics-polyethylene produces half of the total amount of wear produced by metal-polyethylene.	3.2787201714695473
Younger patients should preferably be treated with a ceramic ballhead.	3.7745143978983036
The so-called amyopathic dermatomyositis is a rare variant of dermatomyositis which has attracted increasing interest during the last years.	3.6255260189336567
One finds the classical signs of dermatomyositis such as periorbital edema and erythema, erythematous macular and papular lesions localized at bony prominences (so-called Gottron's papules), generalized pruritus, photosensitivity, and a cutaneous histopathologic picture compatible with skin lesions of dermatomyositis.	3.062763167560299
Crucial for the diagnosis is the exclusion of myositis by clinical examination, EMG and histology.	4.371186649761925
Furthermore, longterm supervision of patients is advisable in order not to miss the appearance of early signs of myositis.	3.4487832223655137
The longest reported follow-up of amyopathic dermatomyositis patient is 4 years; however, it cannot be excluded that these cases will eventually culminate in classical dermatomyositis.	3.4259878445039544
In this paper we describe two cases and discuss the differential diagnosis and therapy; also, the term "Premyopathic dermatomyositis" is proposed, to indicate that the full picture is to be expected in most cases.	3.5919483630775484
