The major problems to the anaesthesiologist in these patients are induction of anaesthesia in infants with HLHS and treatment of pulmonary hypertension in the early post-bypass period.	4.446494275667669
Objective: Thirty years ago, cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) was primarily developed for otherwise healthy individuals who experienced sudden cardiac arrest.	3.0975658325259285
Today, CPR is widely viewed as an emergency procedure that can be attempted on any person who undergoes a cessation of cardiorespiratory function.	3.285733067417834
Therefore, the appropriateness of CPR has been questioned as a matter of the outcome, the patient's preferences, and the cost.	4.5336026401280645
The objective of this article is to analyse ethical issues in prehospital resuscitation.	2.8502431931974144
Arguments: CPR is bound by moral considerations that surround the use of any medical treatment.	3.347999607888877
According to Beauchamp and Childress, the hierarchy of justification in biomedical ethics consists of ethical theories, principles, rules, and particular judgements and actions.	2.6031049568765083
The decision to start CPR is based on the medical judgement that a person is suffering from circulatory arrest.	3.3014974156871197
Moral rules are more specific to contexts and are based on ethical principles.	3.8960325847127453
The principle of beneficence means the provision of benefits for the promotion of welfare.	2.6847067743494546
Talking about beneficence in resuscitation means once again reporting stories of success, as many victims of pre- and in-hospital sudden death have been saved in the past.	3.4183468978840326
Nevertheless, resuscitative efforts still remain unsuccessful in the majority of cases, involving the principle of nonmaleficence.	3.665986878954062
There is potential harm in CPR.	3.0821128949784002
Survivors may recover cardiac function, but sustain severe hypoxic brain damage, at worst surviving without awakening for months or years.	2.9397064196109155
In particular, post-traumatic CPR is associated with an extremely poor outcome, leading to the issue of futility.	3.9255243993938294
However, futility should be defined in a strict fashion, as there might be an individual chance of survival.	3.07036166053634
The principle of respect for autonomy means the right of a patient to accept or reject medical treatment, which continues in emergency conditions and after the patient has lost consciousness.	3.658497350127418
If the patient's wish's can be ascertained later on, life-sustaining therapies might be withdrawn at that time.	3.0390744399995406
Terminally ill but still competent patients should be encouraged to write a no-CPR document, which does not deny patients relief from severe symptoms, but might facilitate withholding resuscitative efforts at the scene.	3.1667251630951685
The principle of justice affects priorities in the allocation of health care resources.	2.862912556890815
The decision made for a particular patient might delay or prevent emergency treatment in other patients who could receive greater benefit.	3.2333578593169827
Conclusions: The standard of care remains the prompt initiation of CPR.	3.237245047138925
However, ethical principles such as beneficene, nonmaleficence, autonomy, and justice have to be applied in the unique setting of emergency medicine.	3.5005263494279957
Physicians have to consider the therapeutic efficacy of CPR, the potential risks, and the patient's preferences.	5.4486028635290715
Acting within the context of the therapeutic process is often equated with acting-out.	3.6253232463337515
Subtile behaviour, too, as a part of the "complex system of sending and receiving unconscious signals" (Sandler) which serve for the patient to induce behavior of the transference object in the analyst or fulfilling his unconscious wishes is seen as acting-out or microacting-out (Treuniet).	3.447954545910144
However, this delicate acting has no meaning, it is not symbolic or communicative action.	3.22454012636171
It is aimed at inducing effects and interactions.	3.185971007358206
It appears both on the side of the analyst and of the patient and is part of the unconscious communication in the therapeutic process.	5.017552844844989
Diverse interactive means and ways will be demonstrated, how the analyst is moved to unnoticed acting and to handling the patient in an unnoticed manner in a certain way.	3.2441018251487628
The acting-reactions of the analyst may have the character of interpretations, by which he unintentionally demonstrates, in what a way he understands the patient.	3.1458983916417744

This leads to psychological problems which are likely to influence the patient's life satisfaction, long-term rehabilitation outcome, and quality of life as much as the physical consequences caused by the stroke.	3.8901617845190315

Therefore, being the easiest body fluid to handle for drug screening urine is very often manipulated to test clean.	2.883321690949903
Methods available to cause a negative result range from substitution of urine, adulteration of the collected specimen by various chemical agents and in-vivo manipulations.	3.2043974500974386
Among these, the preferred strategy is to increase fluid intake and urine flow so as to dilute the concentration of drugs below the threshold of detection.	3.252181837032739

Risk factors for development of malignant melanoma have been investigated in several case control studies during the last decade, with some variation in results, partly with geographical region.	3.518154643989565
Four studies have been conducted under the auspices of the Central Malignant Melanoma Registry of the German Dermatological Society; these have yielded consistent results allowing the identification of risk factors for melanoma development.	3.230278926761742
The numbers of common melanocytic naevi, of atypical melanocytic naevi and the frequency of actinic lentigines were found by multivariate regression analysis to be the most important independent risk factors for melanoma development.	3.7232981889272683
Additional factors were hair colour, skin type and a history of naevus growth.	3.5479628674160906
A classification of relative risks was established by considering the first three risk factors mentioned, without any clear improvement of classification when further additional significant factors were taken into accout.	3.2425383215395835
For example, in individuals with more than 50 common melanocytic naevi, 5 or more atypical melanocytic naevi and simultaneous presence of actinic lentigines the risk of developing melanoma was found to be 100-fold that in persons with 10 common melanocytic naevi or fewer and without atypical melanocytic naevi or actinic lentigines.	3.4481193237995087
Early recognition of melanomas may be substantially improved if these risk factors are considered.	3.31455820210766

This way, contiguous chest images of superior and HRCT sections of equal image quality compared to conventional CT scanning can be obtained.	3.1754512276356874

Abstract   Basis of the modern shoulder implants is the Neer II-system, a non constrained total shoulder prosthesis with conforming radii of curvature and improved protection against dislocation.	3.3698504620908913
The second generation of shoulder prosthesis is based on the geometric shaft design of the Neer II prosthesis and offers not only a variety of modular head- and shaft-sizes but also through different radii a physiologic rotation-translation-mechanism.	3.380516757416072
The third generation of humeral head prosthesis carries the concept of an anatomic reconstruction one step further and enables the surgeon to adjust the inclination and the eccentric offset of the humeral head to restore the centre of rotation.	3.2385710436282356
The latest development in shoulder arthroplasty are humeral head prosthesis with a fully variable 3-dimensional modularity to independently adjust the prosthestic head position regardless of the individual shaft geometry.	3.2256550258850765
This achieves a 3-dimensional adaptability of the prosthetic head about the stem axis in the coronary and in the sagittal plane.	3.955331917616357
Besides of the humeral shaft prosthesis an alternative concept of shoulder joint replacement is established - the replacement of the humeral head articular surface.	3.737038923184701
A hemispheric surface prosthesis - cup arthroplasty - is cemented onto the residual humeral head, which eliminates the obligatory humeral head resection and the reaming of the medullary canal.	2.8070377007418155
Bipolar shoulder prosthesis are humeral shaft prosthesis with a bi-rotational head system.	3.2568906383400518
Their indication is limited to pre-existing lesions of the rotator cuff and/or the glenoid surface.	4.427244677264248
The inverse total shoulder prosthesis reverses the articular surface morphology of the humeral head and the glenoid.	3.7916108837482554
The hemispheric glenoid component serves as the centre of rotation for the concave epiphyseal proximal humerus component.	2.956836386675642
This implant is especially used in cases of massive rotator cuff deficiences.	3.8050525652602154
The role of shoulder prosthesis in treating acute humeral head fractures needs special consideration.	2.911078763906361
A fracture prosthesis has to restore the exact length of the humerus, the centre of rotation, and the anatomical retroversion.	4.2740923934025155

The shoulder joint replacement can be sufficiently fixated in cemented, cementless or hybrid techniques.	3.0030655576421146
Today several component design variations of cemented glenoid implants exist.	2.992984102021393
Their main distinction is the fixation system which can be divided into two main groups - the keel - and the peg-shaped glenoid components.	3.513326770687572
The peg-shaped anchorage system shall guarantee a greater stability against shear-forces.	2.8793160759832
Cementless glenoid components consist of a polyethylen inlay and a surface treated metal-back with an integrated fixation system.	3.067617816045871
These fixation systems are object of intensive biomechanical research and range from conventional screw fixation to specialised cone systems and self-cutting cage-screw-systems.	3.098209512050803
The critical area of cementless glenoid components is the transition zone of the PE-inlay and the metal-back because of high force development.	3.1020673593138377

Looking at the loosening and survival rate of the implant the results are related to the type of prosthesis and the preoperative diagnosis.	4.571103326059203

Median survival after first liver resection was 20 months; after R0 resection a median survival of 28 months and after R1/2 resection of 8 months was achieved.	3.2063170122688383
The 5-year survival rate was 16 % for the total group, 24 % in patients with R0 resection and 0 % for R1/2 resections.	3.501451662207373
After a second liver resection (n = 14) there was a median survival of 28 months (5-year-survival-rate of 21 %) for all patients and of 41 months (5-year survival rate 38 %) after R0 resection.	3.7194603502177777
Morbidity and mortality after the first liver resection were 32.5 % and 5.8 %, respectively.	3.158485887971374
In patients without extrahepatic tumor at the time of the first liver resection a median survival of 32 months (5-year survival rate 25 %) and 7 months was achieved after R0 resection and R1/2 resection, respectively.	3.410218480538946
In case of extrahepatic tumor the median survival was 24 months (5-year survival rate 23 %) for R0 resection compared to 8 months after R1/2 resection.	3.0050585587343557
These data suggest that not the presence of extrahepatic tumor but rather the possibility of a R0 resection is most decisive for the prognosis after liver resection.	3.8448300460506855
We conclude that patients with liver metastases of non-colorectal, non-neuroendocrine tumors may benefit from liver resection.	3.6137291614535427
Similar to colorectal metastases, a second or third liver resection can be worthwhile in selected cases.	3.011685660551037
Even in more unfavorable tumor entities, several cases of long-term survival were observed after surgical therapy.	3.8276992639097256
Therefore, the indication for liver resection should be considered carefully in every single case.	3.3413416897265003
Generalizations about the outcomes of psychotherapy are essentially based on research on brief therapies with quite short follow-up.	2.946118978310911
The present paper is a survey of some of the findings in an effectiveness study of psychoanalysis and long-term psychotherapy, typically psychoanalytically oriented, in private practice.	3.8523196789517717
The design was a three-wave panel comprising more than 700 patients.	3.2675467211067546
At the end of the third wave, 418 patients in different phases of treatment remained in the sample.	3.002130686123326
Across a reconstructed time scale covering roughly seven years, before, during, and after treatment, the 74 psychoanalysis cases described a very positive development, whereas the development among the 331 psychotherapy cases was moderately positive.	3.5029264156013267
The findings emphasize the importance of extended follow-up.	3.4622218023827736
When therapist variables are considered, therapeutic experience had complex or mixed associations with patients outcome.	3.095580420279409
Especially positive were high age and many years, in private practice, after licensing.	3.473400792301632
Therapeutic ideals and attitudes divided the therapist group in three subgroups, one of which was characterized by purely classical psychoanalytic views on the values of support, friendliness etc.	3.099404717497907
Therapists in the classically psychoanalytic cluster were found to do poorly with patients in psychotherapy, in contrast to patients in psychoanalysis.	3.756992830990447
Experimental studies and open clinical trials have suggested intravenous immunoglobulin (IVIg) as a potentially effective treatment of multiple sclerosis (MS).	3.4541280897333833
The Austrian Immunoglobulin in Multiple Sclerosis (AIMS) study tested this assumption by examining 148 patients with relapsing-remitting MS in a randomized, double-blind, placebo controlled fashion (75 IVIg, 73 placebo).	2.7847736446021467
Monthly administration of IVIg in a dosage of 0.15-0.20 g/kg over a period of 2 years slowed the progression of or even reversed disability as evident in a total of 24% of patients and almost halved the number of relapses in comparison to placebo treatment.	4.0147526634131685
Therapeutic efficacy was noted within the first 6 months of treatment and was not correlated to the severity of disability (mild neurological sins without disability to ambulatory with assistance) at study entry.	3.775945983548827
Overall the magnitude of treatment effects of IVIg was comparable to that reported for beta-interferon and copolymer 1.	3.467089289690445
Further ongoing studies will have to clarify the future role of IVIg in the treatment of MS, in particular in the progressive forms of the disease.	3.9682199244962155
Spontaneous coronary artery dissection is a rare cause of ischemic heart disease.	3.732049298309824
Incidence, etiology and optimal treatment are ill-defined.	3.4621130833954026
Between July 1995 and December 1997, we prospectively identified 42 patients (36 men, six women, mean age 59 +/- 12 years) with spontaneous coronary artery dissection among 3803 consecutive angiographic examinations in which the diagnosis of coronary artery disease was established for the first time (incidence 1.1%).	3.6974454511060832
In comparison to the remaining study population with stable angina pectoris (8 cases of spontaneous coronary artery dissection among 2852 patients; incidence: 0.3%), the incidence of spontaneous coronary artery dissection was significantly higher in the patient subgroups with acute myocardial infarction (13/450; 2.9%) and with unstable angina pectoris or postinfarction angina (21/501; 4.2%).	3.4849705573485488
Dissection was most frequently located in the left anterior descending coronary artery (19 cases), followed by the right coronary artery (15 cases) and the left circumflex coronary artery (8 cases).	4.787274382463872
The presumed etiology of spontaneous coronary artery dissection was atherosclerotic plaque rupture in 35 cases, heavy physical exercise in four cases and hormonal influences related to pregnancy and contraception in one case.	3.0303707426228557
In two cases, no obvious risk factor could be identified.	3.1258008154762167

We operated on 460 hernias in 390 patients in a period of 5 years.	3.3480546226661345
Results: Complication rates and recurrence rates were similar to those after TEP.	3.780987280344419
There was a marked learning curve with decrease of both rates during the evaluated years.	2.8761009400735307
There were no complications related to the transabdominal approach other than trocar hernias, the rate of which could be reduced by eliminating the learning curve and by using smaller trocar diameter.	3.5324886288142627

The most frequently used devices were ATMs in Chemnitz and ticket machines and telephone cards in Mannheim.	2.57937471937719

Education was a more important variable than gender.	3.8747224170408128

This replicative life span, also known as "hayflick limit", is probably defined by a "critical" length of the telomeres.	3.4489112382351537
Telomeres are special DNA-sequences located at the four ends of the chromosomes which are shortened with each cell cycle.	3.2354539286770025
Cells of most, but not all malignant tumours have been shown to reactivate the enzyme telomerase so that telomeres can be reconstructed, "Hayflick limit" can be overcome, and unlimited cell division can be established.	3.1504867257509694

SCT and MR studies were reviewed independently by two radiologists, without knowing the results of the surgical exploration.	3.9520147865733635
Standardized image analysis was correlated with findings at laparatomy.	3.441175344390579
Results: Laparotomy identified 10 patients to be suitable for surgical resection and 18 pancreatic carcinomas to be unresectable.	3.6030991630450706

8 (SCT) carcinomas were correctly considered to be resectable (sensitivity 70 % for MRI and 80 % for SCT).	3.5144872372884564
The presence of vascular involvement was depicted by SCT with a sensitivity of 82-100 % and 62-100 % by MRI.	3.12741715558937
The specificity varied between 85-100 % for SCT and 77-100 % for MRI.	3.3970034467122

The study group consisted of 12 males and 8 females.	3.2684350518160206

The stimulation intensity required for supramaximal stimulation was 14.6 mA on average.	2.852116665938606

The hypothesis of symmetrical evoked facial compound potentials was not supported by our data.	2.952205085720117
As with previous investigators we found significant side-to-side differences in healthy subjects.	3.3916028001077563
Furthermore, we could also show for the first time that the amplitude ratio was not constant in every individual at repeated measurements.	3.2212266053769127

Simulation of the unstable Colles' fracture was realized by dorsal wedge osteotomy of the distal end of the radius using cadaveric material.	3.42916677996649

In order to restore function and esthetics in mandibular hypoplasia, transplantation of osteochondral grafts and the distraction osteogenesis technique are used alternatively.	3.0647552358816474

In total, 12 patients (4-14 years old; 7 female, 5 male) with different grades of mandibular hypoplasia received osteochondral grafts (7 costochondral, 5 iliac crest; observation period 4-9 years).	3.300860219911855
In 5 patients (10-12 years old; 1 female, 4 male), distraction osteogenesis was performed (observation period 10 months to 3 1/2 years).	3.502830547370969
In the results, according to the literature, the range of growth after osteochondral grafting varied considerably, approximate normal growth was noticed in only two cases.	3.7022194923036476
On the other hand, all patients treated by distraction osteogenesis showed a stable increase of bone length as expected.	3.397969342674778
After osteochondral grafts, adequate growth is to be expected in the minority of cases and it does not seem predictable in individual cases.	3.507583486050702
Therefore, the indication for osteochondral grafts should be restricted to severe hypoplasia, where the local amount of bone does not allow the use of a distraction device, and to cases where support of the mandibula at the skull base is necessary.	3.5286710266524275
In all other cases of mandibular hypoplasia in children, distraction osteogenesis should be discussed as the primary option, even if in the long term a second surgical procedure should be necesssary.	3.8828617523473103

Apart from easy handling, in the majority of cases it also ensures adequate fracture stability.	3.493848244435471

Titanium mesh has proved successful for the treatment of such fractures.	4.497003575756324
Compared with conventional miniplates this mesh is outstanding for its considerably higher stability due to its given geometry.	3.0580846049104755

Myocardial scintigraphy using thallium-201 and positron emission tomography with metabolic imaging of myocardial glucose metabolism, using fluorine-18 fluoro-deoxyglucose, are today the most widely used nuclear methods for the assessment of myocardial viability.	3.005705458448681

In the ankle (talocrural) joint, the lower end of the tibia and fibula embrace the trochlea tali.	3.6273377528089776
Thus, an approximately uniaxial joint is formed which permits dorsiflexion and plantarflexion of the foot against the leg.	3.0283843277519122
Due to the geometry of the trochlea tali, conjunct lateral rotation of the fibula against the tibia occurs at the tibiofibular articulations synchronously with active dorsiflexion at the ankle joint.	2.8043074292678156
Movements at the talocrural joints are mainly limited by the opposing muscles as well as by strong collateral ligaments.	3.5802908969082727
Talus and calcaneus form a functional unit connected by posterior and anterior articulations.	3.363806567666544
The posterior articulation is the subtalar (talocalcaneal) joint; in the anterior articulation, talar facets of the calcaneus together with the posterior surface of the navicular and the superior fibrocartilaginous surface of the plantar calcaneonavicular ligament form a concavity for the talar head.	3.1605214326442588
Thus, the talocalcaneonavicular joint is a compound and - like the subtalar joint - a multiaxial articulation.	3.079241552043417
On the weight-bearing foot, the distal tarsus and metatarsus are pronated and supinated against the talus in order to maintain plantigrade contact.	3.310291057273806
When the foot is off the ground, these movements are modified to eversion and inversion, also involving the calcaneocuboid joint.	2.8530377712191064
In addition, movements between the calcaneus and cuboid also occur during pronative or supinative changes between the fore- and hindfoot.	2.88510304660698
Limitation of movements is due to leg muscles as well as strong ligaments.	4.322508723227067

Despite major advances in knowledge and development of efficient techniques for pain control, many patients on surgical wards suffer from modest to severe pain following surgery or trauma.	3.2567695518444975
Therefore, in the University Hospital of Kiel, Germany, an anaesthesiology-based acute pain service (APS) was started in 1985 to improve this situation.	3.134477957583318
The anaesthesiologist in training who manages the recovery unit serves as an APS for surgical wards and is supervised by a consultant.	3.061552288768164
The anaesthesists on call are responsible after regular working hours.	3.037415680102761
The activities of the APS are as follows: 1.	3.482439955536209
Induction of sufficient postoperative analgesia in the recovery unit for all surgical patients.	3.606770540473892
Clinical rounds on all patients receiving epidural analgesia (EA), other forms of regional analgesia, or patient-controlled analgesia (PCA) every morning and throughout the day if necessary.	2.9895640737234457
Additional consultations for postoperative pain management for other patients on request.	3.6824862237089997
Assessment and documentation of the clinical status of the patient, quality of analgesia, and side effects.	5.001760945893354
Writing orders for further treatment.	3.800680162136152
Continuing consultations and informal education for ward nurses, physiotherapists, and surgical staff; formal medical training for ward nurses in postoperative pain management.	3.226405185210933
From 1985 to 1992, 1947 patients on normal wards were treated (EA: 1736, PCA: 183).	2.749886502986298
Epidural analgesia was performed using a standard protocol with bupivacaine 0.175% - 0.25% infused continuously with top-ups if needed (mean 240 mg/day, range 75 - 600 mg; median duration 7 days, range 1 - 53, Table 1).	2.8525223521913508
Demand for further treatment was proved by day-to-day withdrawal.	3.9316525832576605
Since the introduction of an APS, complications of EA such as hypotension (1985/1986: 5.1%; 1987/1992: 0.5%, Table 3) and insufficient analgesia due to dislocation or other technical complications could be reduced significantly (Table 3).	2.9784361939321107
Dermal infections were seen in 2.6% of patients, with a significantly higher incidence in patients with arteriosclerotic diseases (4.1%).	5.383975263020128
Epidural opioids were used in only 46 selected cases on surgical wards.	3.4127206002318387
Nevertheless, 2 cases of marked respiratory depression occurred.	3.354606777776323
The overall risk of complications during postoperative EA could be reduced from 1 : 11 cases in the first 2 years to 1 : 20 in the last 6 years since introducing the APS.	3.6103237624704634
For other regional procedures (e.g., interpleural analgesia) no complications were recorded.	3.047582455431056
PCA was performed using a standard protocol with tramadol or piritramide without background infusion (Table 6).	3.066571401496544
The loading dose was titrated in the recovery unit.	3.4641183282989236
The median duration of PCA was 4 days (range 1 - 23); the median dose of piritramide was 45 mg/day (range 3 - 226 mg).	3.231663530505438
Two cases of somnolence and respiratory depression occurred.	2.8112725202782376
In this period there were 8 potential life-threatening complications due to postoperative pain therapy; 4 occurred during standard surgical pain management (3 cases of severe respiratory depression after i.m.	3.3433571032527496
piritramide (unsuccessfull resuscitation), tramadol, and buprenorphine; 1 small child with multiorgan failure after paracetamol intoxication).	2.9188748673984755

There are insufficient data for comparison of the incidence of complications following standard management of postoperative pain relief without an APS, i.e., i.m.	4.159816889662133
injections of opioids on request, but severe and sometimes lethal complications have been reported.	3.332523979134548
Since the majority of patients used EA or PCA for several days, it is again emphasised that these techniques should not be restricted to high-dependency areas such as intensive care or recovery units.	3.673127824025279
The introduction of an APS is an adequate approach to more efficient and safer pain management on surgical wards.	2.878439881868314

In the guidelines for determination of the blood alcohol level for forensic purposes, a correction factor of 1.2 has been established for the conversion of serum alcohol into blood alcohol based on the relationship of the water content between serum and whole blood.	3.780959992587043
The reliability of the determination of the blood alcohol level is dependent on the possible minimum and maximum values of this correction factor.	3.0929808899594526
In a comprehensive multicenter study consisting of 833 samples, which can be considered representative of persons involved in offences under the drinking and driving act, an average quotient of 1.16 was found with minimum and maximum values of 1.08 and 1.21 respectively.	2.944819620657671
In 96% of the cases the quotient was between 1.13 and 1.19 and the deviation of the quotient from the average value was less than 3%.	3.617085262265268
From these results it can be assumed that the determination of blood alcohol is obviously more reliable than previously presumed.	3.6418446455166382

The patient's consent is not required for this mandatory form, which has to be submitted even if the patient is opposed.	4.207917424122527
On the other hand, if there is only a possible connection between the occupation and the skin disorder, or if the skin disease is neither severe nor chronic nor threatening pursuit of the occupation, then the dermatologist needs only write a Hautarztbericht (dermatologist's report).	2.9518033132563093
The patient's permission is required for this less formal document.	3.369427003573527
Bone marrow involvement is often observed in patients with hematological malignancies and solid tumors.	3.7674764903982805
Sensitive immunological and molecular biological methods allow the detection of isolated transformed cells in bone marrow samples.	3.665184937515368
Like normal hematopoietic cells, tumor cells interact with bone marrow stroma through adhesion molecules.	3.180834143382564
Since adhesion mulecules play an essential role in the invasion and proliferation of malignant cells, new therapeutic approaches involving the inhibition of cell-cell and cell-matrix interactions are conceivable.	3.2891061578607603

The multiple functions of the hand are based on vitality, sensibility, motor function and stability.	3.7385737076463346
In severe hand injuries the functional results of the repair are often very poor.	4.599148472035062
In a complex injury of the hand we are faced with the damage of the soft tissue and bone and the loss of vitality and function of the hand.	4.379678784337566
The cause of hand injuries are mainly a crush trauma or the rotating saw.	2.995525471560704
Basically, we recommend an extended primary repair.	3.9082753809214363
After the radical debridement we have to reconstruct the damaged structures.	3.458090858931296

Thereafter, suturing of extensor and flexor tendons.	2.935724176076427
Then, we do the microsurgical reconstructions of vessels and nerves.	3.3775159618858384
In case tendons and bones are exposed we have to cover the defect with a pedicled or a free flap.	3.4736418173080077
In a long ischemic time we have to change our concept and do the reconstruction of the vessels first.	3.5987422212667606
Our results in vitality and sensibility are listed.	2.884481817693366
In the result of a complex hand injury each single functional restoration is very important.	3.49208946881105

Paclitaxel and docetaxel are potent drugs that are effective in the treatment of malignant tumors.	3.9754182498152093
The cytotoxic action of these drugs is not fully understood, but it appears to be mediated mainly through mitotic arrest and subsequent apoptosis.	3.8091183882117834
Because no information is available on the antiangiogenesis action of docetaxel, the investigations were performed to determine whether inhibition of neoangiogenesis plays a role in docetaxel's antitumor efficacy.	3.5146807724430906
Four different mouse tumors, two squamous cell carcinomas (SCC-IV; SCC-VII) and two adenocarcinomas (MCA-4; MCA-29) were assayed for angiogenic activity using the in vivo i.c.	2.9988535599774173
Tumor cells (5 x 105) were injected i.c.	3.36644894187834
into the skin flap over the abdominal wall, and the number of new blood vessels at the tumor cell injection site was determined 2, 4, 6, 8, 10 and 12 days later.	4.487982341005281
The mice were treated with docetaxel (Taxotere - 31.3 mg/kg i.v.)	3.4074521415779864
1 or 4 days after tumor cell injection.	3.937818511431413
The number of new blood vessels increased with time.	2.9649174724996104
Docetaxel reduced the number of newly formed blood vessels in MCAs, but not in SCCs.	4.141901725555778
The reduction was associated with slower tumor growth.	3.4338753256615844
In a separate set of experiments we observed that docetaxel's inhibitory effect on the two MCAs was histologically associated with massive tumor cell destruction by means of both apoptosis and necrosis.	3.2344048228549642
This was not observed for the two SCCs.	3.5997600862214374
Since no reduction in blood vessels occurred in tumors unresponsive to docetaxel, the inhibition of neoangiogenesis in docetaxel-responsive tumors was likely the result of a decrease in angiogenic stimuli due to docetaxel's destruction of tumor cells.	3.285555359909634

The implants are fitted into a mechanical middle ear model which approximates the impedances of the eardrum and the inner ear.	2.740149539535835
A defined signal within the frequency range of 0-5 kHz is provided by a miniaturized loudspeaker at the input to the model and is  measured by a probe microphone.	3.241924137574793
Displacement of an artificial stapes footplate at the output of the model is measured by a fiberoptic probe with a sensitivity of 5 nm.	3.236586644149423
The transmission function is calculated as the quotient of the output and the input signal.	3.4164836463769213
This work details the measurement system and demonstrates basic influences on the sound-transmission of middle ear implants.	3.0090237717197854

Intubation and Positive End Expiratory Pressure Ventilation (PEEP) is a well established therapeutic strategy for impaired lung function, particularly following blunt chest trauma.	3.5822158359550826
Complications of this regime are however also well known and pose the question why non-invasive forms of respiratory assistance such as Continuous Positive Airway Pressure (CPAP) have only gained minor popularity.	2.983627012981834
In a prospective study, 30 patients who had suffered blunt chest trauma were treated with CPAP administered by mask.	3.7632600865017496
The regime consisted of continuous administration of CPAP by a face-mask, with gradually increasing periods of spontaneous breathing.	2.987987461556555
Initially a FiO2 of 0.33 (range 0,28-0,38) proved necessary.	3.4336593476652117
The initial CPAP level was 7 mbar (range 5-8) with an (Assisted Spontaneous Breathing) ASB of 15 mbar (range 13-18).	3.312801507191922
FiO2 and CPAP/ASB levels were subsequently gradually reduced until no longer necessary.	3.0645081625089055
In all patients intubation and ventilation was avoided by this regimen.	3.0159923676460783
The treatment was well accepted by all patients and common ventilation associated complications such as pneumonia did not occur.	3.1598020345293545
In comparison with the former standard method of treatment the average ICU stay was dramatically reduced, principally due to not having to gradually wean patients from ventilation and sedation.	3.0809734830117113
Other positive benefits include normal communication and feeding with active early mobilisation leading to faster recovery, both physical and psychological.	3.046387966178095
We conclude that non-invasive respiratory techniques should be used more frequently and recommend further studies are undertaken to define the indications.	3.8160883711156384

Current methods for articular cartilage repair are unpredictable with respect to clinical success.	3.584909509114728
In the present study, we investigated the ability of cells from articular cartilage, perichondrium, and costochondral resting zone to form new cartilage when loaded onto biodegradable scaffolds and implanted into calf muscle pouches of nu/nu mice.	2.8602390349444393
Prior in vitro studies showed that platelet derived growth factor-BB (PDGF-BB), but not transforming growth factor beta-1 (TGF-1), basic fibroblast growth factor, or bone morphogenetic protein-2 promoted proliferation and extracellular matrix sulfation of resting zone chondrocytes without causing the cells to exhibit a hypertrophic chondrocyte phenotype.	3.4140248636280552
TGF-1 has also been shown to stimulate chondrogenesis by multipotent chondroprogenitor cells like those in the perichondrium.	3.4927785903076756
In addition, PDGF-BB has been shown to modulate chondrogensis by resting zone cells implanted in poly(D,L-lactide-co-glycolide) (PLG) scaffolds.	2.8963956634802797
In the present study we examined whether the cartilage formation is dependent on state of chondrocyte maturation and whether the pretreatment of chondrocytes with growth factors has an influence on the cartilage formation.	3.2983941988512293
Scaffolds were manufactured from 80 % PLG with a 75:25 lactide:glycolide ratio and 20 % modified PLG with a 50:50 lactide:glycolide ratio (PLG-H scaffolds).	2.901031256073468
For each experimental group, four nude mice received two identical implants, one in each calf muscle resulting in an N = 8 implants: PLG-H scaffolds alone; PLG-H scaffolds with cells derived from either the femoral articular cartilage, costochondral periochondrium, or costochondral resting zone cartilage of 125 g male Sprague-Dawley rats; PLG-H scaffolds with either articular chondrocytes or resting zone chondrocytes that were pretreated with 37,5 ng/ml rhPDGF-BB for 4 h or 24 h before implantation, or with perichondrial cells treated with PDGF-BB plus 0,22 ng/ml rhTGF-1 for 4 h and 24 h. At 4 or 8 weeks after implantation, samples were harvested and analyzed histomorphometrically for new cartilage formed, area of residual implant and area of fibrous connective tissue.	2.847235318754309
Only resting zone cells showed the ability to form new cartilage at a heterotopic site in this study.	3.507650158315825
There was no neocartilage found in nude mice with implants loaded with either articular chondrocytes or perichondrial cells.	2.4490469419350127
Pretreatment of resting zone chondrocytes for 4 h prior to implantation significantly increased the amount of newly formed cartilage after 8 weeks and suppressed chondrocyte hypertrophy.	3.7823388003115332
The amount of fibrous connective tissue around implants containing either articular chondrocytes or perichondrial cells decreased with time, whereas the amount of fibrous connective tissue around implants containing resting zone chondrocytes pretreated with PDGF-BB was increased.	2.696825261388488
The results showed that resting zone cells can be successfully incorporated into biodegradable porous PLG scaffolds and can induce new cartilage formation in a non-weight-bearing site.	3.339403273895783
Articular chondrocytes as well as perichondrial cells did not have the capacity for neochondrogenesis when implanted heterotopically in this model.	3.8134763946858885
Bone tumors represent a group of tumors of various dignity.	4.075811475696696
In spite of this single tumor entities may display strong morphological resemblance to each other which can in turn result in profound difficulties in differential diagnosis.	2.5695576919391088
The biological behaviour of a tumor is mainly determined by its rate of proliferation.	4.042922918116607
In this study the rate of proliferation of 64 bone tumors (30 high-grade central osteosarcomas, 6 low-grade osteosarcomas, 8 giant cell tumors, 8 aneurysmatic bone cysts, 5 osteoidosteomas/osteoblastomas, 7 fibrous dysplasias and 5 cases of a myositis ossificans) were analysed.	3.3473919829112644
Immunohistochemistry was performed on paraffin-embedded tissue sections using the MIB-1 monoclonal antibody.	3.442519085418879
MIB-1 recognizes the proliferation-associated Ki-67 protein which is expressed during the active phases of the cell cycle but cannot be detected in senescent cells.	3.3496720577981587
Among high-grade central osteosarcomas a significantly higher rate of proliferation (average value 30 %) was found in comparison with low-grade osteosarcomas and other benign intraosseous bone tumors.	4.117410972096744
However distinguishing low-grade osteosarcomas from benign bone tumors by determining only the rate of proliferation was not possible, although interestingly, the proliferative rate of myositis ossificans, a purely reactive lesion, was in the range of the values determined for high-grade osteosarcoma.	3.9126285369472837

Myasthenic crisis is a lifethreatening complication of myasthenia gravis due to respiratory failure and inability to swallow and cough up secretions.	3.1413263812151686
Frequent causes are intercurrent infections, fluctuations due to the natural history of the disease and insufficient immunosuppressive treatment prior to the crisis.	3.9844327970526714
Early referral to an experienced neurologist is essential.	3.2495914279454405
Specific therapy consists of symptomatic treatment with cholinesterase inhibitors, crisis management with plasmapheresis or immunoglobulins and immunosuppression with clucocorticoids.	2.926776812114837
Infections must be treated vigorously.	3.4274451220823745
Thymectomy in patients with previously unrecognized myasthenia gravis is never urgently indicated and should be postponed until the patient is stabilized.	4.341710890494892
In cases of impending respiratory failure and severe swallowing difficulties, early and elective admission to a specialized neurological intensive care unit and elective intubation should be performed.	3.0333610209693593
Adequate nursing care of intubated patients and a set of prophylactic measures are essential to avoid complications adversely affecting prognosis.	3.415647420346604
Whenever it can be achieved, the best therapy of myasthenic crisis is its prevention by appropriate long-term management and follow-up of patients with myasthenia gravis.	4.4428024413982286

Subjective cognitive complaints did not correlate with results obtained from neuropsychological tests.	3.410671510816389

The test battery had been applied short time before, during and after the treatment with 10 ECT applied unilateral over the nondominant hemisphere.	3.4746580338227733
Comparing the test performances before and 1-2 days after the end of the series there were only few remarkable changes: a significant decrease was diagnosed exclusively in 30 min delayed recall of verbal items, while visual short-term memory and visual-constructive performance showed a significant improvement (in spite of unilateral stimulation on the right side).	3.712136714868451

After orthopedic surgery, skeletal muscle will enter the rehabilitation process in weakened condition due to the following characteristics.	3.82745148855952
After use of a tourniquet during surgery, the muscle suffers ischemia/reperfusion damage due to oxidative stress, resulting in structural impairment.	3.876685366145202
The resulting immobilization leads to muscular atrophy, with a loss of calcium homeostasis and oxidative stress being of etiological significance.	3.224708744293443
Degeneration of muscle fibers as well as regeneration occurs in muscle while still immobilized.	3.9258875770569324
After remobilization, the muscle has impaired functional capacity and frequently shows disturbances in its innervation pattern.	3.1221725044277227
High mechanical loading should therefore be avoided, and electrical stimulation may be applied to facilitate recovery.	3.7787301942600386
Considering the role of oxygen radicals, supplementation with vitamin E appears generally recommendable.	2.9814145635977223
The timing of surgery and postoperative radiotherapy - especially if combined with chemotherapy - has been a subject of interest over the past years.	4.261791605397675
This analysis was based on a literature review of mostly retrospective publications.	3.75035996204179
Data concerning the interval between surgery and radiotherapy were correlated with the locoregional control, incidence of distant metastases and prognosis of breast cancer, lung carcinoma, and head and neck carcinomas.	3.9816033972922242
The reviewed data did not show a clear relationship of the time interval between surgery and start of radiotherapy and locoregional control.	3.699678560710634
However, evaluation of the data was difficult, because in most publications, retrospective analyses were performed and other prognostically more relevant parameters may influence locoregional control stronger than the time interval.	3.6695419635963815

In patients with breast cancer who do not receive chemotherapy, there are inconsistent reports in the literature.	3.3187993387344537

Methods: After approval by our institutional review board, 62 patients (ASA I-II) were randomly assigned to three groups to receive either 3xED95 or 5xED95 cisatracurium, or 3xED90 vecuronium as a rapid bolus.	2.2989764734661424
A prick test was done the day before by scarification of the skin in the forearm.	3.7011802979241213
Six minutes after thiopentone, the patients received the relaxant, and after further 6 min 0.1-0.2 mg fentanyl was given and the trachea was intubated.	2.9185538933479704
Heart rate (HR) and blood pressure (BP) were monitored every minute.	2.1747056104515066
Plasma histamine was measured by radioimmunoassay (RIA) with a sensitivity of approximately 10 pg/ml.	3.6600302137784797
Additionally, serum tryptase was measured by RIA at baseline (-10 and  -1 min) and 15 and 60 min after the relaxant administration.	3.908999141090326
Levels for histamine >1000 pg/ml and for tryptase >2 µg/ml were considered significant.	3.427949091168199
Cutaneous signs of histamine release were documented.	3.276756015193094
Results: Ten patients showed a positive prick-test reaction.	4.067319005062498
Only after thiopentone some cutaneous signs (4 flush, 1 erythema) of histamine release were observed.	2.921241799940973
There were no cutaneous signs of histamine release correlating with cardiovascular changes.	2.910464863821424
Analysis of the blood samples demonstrated no significant increase in the histamine level in all three groups.	4.281776593163315
Only in 1 patient was a significant higher histamine level (1133 pg/ml) measured 5 min after 5xED95 cisatracurium.	3.9504148588116523
All measurements of serum tryptase were within the physiological limits.	3.6237811689166595
Discussion: In this study, with the particular time course of drug administration, neither cisatracurium nor vecuronium increased plasma histamine levels.	3.77615901420972
Only after 5xED95 cisatracurium was 1 elevated histamine level documented after 5 min.	3.004178758990269
In several studies increased histamine levels have been described, but without clinical manifestations.	3.542555278482183

The cutaneous reactions in this study were caused by thiopentone.	4.250431420351196

There were no statistically significant differences between patients treated with radiochemotherapy vs radiotherapy in terms of 5-year survival (63% after radiochemotherapy vs 53% after radiotherapy, p = 0.16), relapse-free survival (52% vs 50%) and locoregional control (69% vs 67%).	3.555208617203199
UICC Stage III disease was associated with high failure rates (40% pelvic recurrences and 53% distant metastases).	3.4871141459203665
There was a statistically significant difference in terms of the incidence of distant metastases between the 2 treatment modalities for patients with Stage III disease (49% 5-year probability for developing distant metastases after radiochemotherapy vs 66% after radiotherapy, p = 0.047).	3.813158925969789
In a multivariate analysis, the addition of chemotherapy, lymph node stage and grading were independent prognostic factors for survival.	3.348841050315457
Severe late toxicity was documented in 5% of treated patients.	3.603090611189136

Apnea, bradycardia and oxygen desaturation in infants with very low birth weight are common findings in neonatal intensive care.	3.214400058372991
The prognostic significance of their intensity and frequency and the principles of treatment, however, are controversial.	3.7672004961939054
The universal aim, in order to prevent traumatization of the lung, is to ventilate infants with very low birth weight for as short a time as possible.	3.4713472962045118
Therefore drugs such as theophylline, aminophylline and doxapram and techniques such as nasal CPAP have been studied in our neonatal intensive care unit.	3.062501435651648
In these studies we developed a treatment algorithm.	3.4786219048133358
In two clinically controlled studies performed successively we first proved that sodium acetate theophylline given intravenously has the same efficacy as aminophylline.	2.817004206576605
As aminophylline has more side effects, sodium acetate theophylline is preferable.	3.4857094998260094
Bradycardia, apnea and desaturation were registered from the print-out of the monitoring system's trend analysis and in a polysomnographic study during steady-state conditions.	3.4622644802551457
In a historical study we were able to prove that intravenous injection of aminophylline is superior to oral administration.	3.6578550222431288
We demonstrated equal efficacy of doxapram and theophylline; however, doxapram reduced the rate of apnea significantly more during the first 3 days of treatment.	3.5578819457319506
In a retrospective study we analyzed the efficacy of nasal CPAP as the third level of treatment.	3.6440585534606895
The rate of bradycardia, apnea and desaturation was significantly reduced during CPAP and respiratory rate and oxygenation improved.	3.05831323087307
Only if a quick therapeutic response was desirable was doxapram the first drug of choice (indication >=4 bradycardias below 80/min, 4 desaturations below 80% or 2 apneas of >=20 s over 2 h).	3.1545184612680175
After 48 h an additional second drug was added if we could still observe >=3 apneas, 15 bradycardias or 15 desaturations over this period.	2.8123626988223522
Nasal CPAP was introduced as the third line of treatment.	3.6575160861666274
With this treatment algorithm we were able to reduce the time on a respirator of infants with very low birth weight from 4.9 to 3.4 days (P<0.01).	3.146975159586182
An evaluation of similar treatment algorithms in multi-institutional studies is indicated.	3.0200273872845886

private vs. professional reason for the stay) as well as personal (e.g.	3.7375678560851076
previous experience with low back and sleep complaints) characteristics of the guests.	3.7506091850780465

Mortality was 0 in groups 1 and 2, but 35.3% in group 3.	3.406413278174259
The most frequent complication in groups 1 and 2 was pneumonia (13.9%) followed by cardiac complications (4.6%), and renal insufficiency (3.7%).	3.4587491806262465

APC resistance was first discovered in 1993.	3.779252535842515
It is the most frequent cause of thrombophilia in Europe and North America.	3.3368542709617888
In more than 90% of cases, the underlying cause of APC resistance is a single point mutation in the factor V gene.	3.767362606893518
Heterozygous patients have a between five- and ten-fold higher risk of developing venous thrombosis, while in homozygous patients the risk is increased up to between 50- and 100-fold.	3.903296094186836
Where there is a previous history of thrombosis, a careful investigation of the coagulation system, in particular a determination of the APC ratio, is recommended prior to surgery.	4.264564420133597
In patients with APC resistance, a body-weight-specific thrombosis prophylaxis with heparin is recommended.	3.2807256423922913
Heterozygous patients only need anticoagulation when additional risk conditions are present, while homozygous patients with thromboembolic disease should be anticoagulated over a long period of time.	2.9343103542116022

Pyomyositis is an acute bacterial infection with abscess formation in the skeletal muscles mostly due to Staphylococcus aureus.	3.411881264915965
The disease is found more often in males.	3.1023967775626726
Since the patients symptoms and the clinical and laboratory findings are relatively unspecific, the clinical diagnosis of pyomyositis can present difficulties.	4.531044767111217
Furthermore, cases of pyomyositis are rare in non-tropical countries and some physicians may not be familiar with it.	3.647925387831997
If not diagnosed and treated properly, pyomyositis can lead to sepsis and death.	3.408851978383269
Although the pathogenesis of the disease has not yet been clarified, some predisposing factors of forensic interest are well known: (trivial) trauma or vigorous exercise of the affected skeletal muscles, small potentially "septic" foci in other tissues or internal organs and a preexisting immunodeficiency, e. g. in diabetes mellitus, intravenous drug abusers or individuals suffering from HIV.	3.4180171955629

Interfragmentary movement and size of the fracture gap influence fracture healing.	3.898680267831561
Limited movements promote callus formation and may result in increased mechanical stability.	3.6076450077342326
Although larger movements still promote callus formation, the bony consolidation of the fracture is hampered.	3.8377815491109115
Fracture healing is also hampered if the size of the fracture gap is too large.	3.500806626551372
A combination of large movement and large gap bears the risk of non-union.	4.23215797188395
Therefore, having in mind a minimally invasive surgical approach, one should strive for good reduction of the fracture ends and flexible yet stable osteosynthesis.	3.6801189828499266

In recent years, however, new experimental approaches to its effects on the cellular and molecular level and the availability of pure ketamine enantiomers contributed substantially to the understanding of its complex neuropharmacology.	3.480728981816769
This article reviews the current knowledge of ketamine effects on ligand-operated and voltage-operated transmembrane ion channels, G-protein-coupled receptors, transmitter uptake, and the NO-cGMP system in neurons.	3.006839817879861

In contrast to the uncertainty surrounding the potential role of opioid receptors, there is now considerable evidence that NMDA antagonism is a central mechanism that contributes to the amnesic, analgesic, anaesthetic, and psychotomimetic as well as the neuroprotective actions of ketamine.	3.234046484470898

White piedra is a rare hair infection of man and certain animals, caused by the widespread Trichosporon fungi.	4.130639660206748
The infection is characterized clinically by whitish, soft and easily removable coating of the hair shafts; however, the shafts may be destroyed by the pathogens invading at localized points.	3.0754109816968604
While all body hair may be affected, the pubic hair is most frequently affected.	3.3751278104590834

In all, 22 cases have been described world-wide in young men ranging in age from 20 to 40 years.	3.5218600307760446
Only 2 men, aged 42 and 53 years, do not fall in this range.	3.013414454064867
Recently, a major African study disclosed this disease in women for the first time.	3.078901301972419
In moderate latitudes, however, this infection appears to occur almost exclusively in young men.	3.689979693082052

Exercise testing offers the advantage that both pulmonary and cardiac risk can be evaluated simultaneously.	3.3527060343960673
The calculation of predicted postoperative lung function (ppo) is of importance.	3.2462487087793614
The postoperative values for the forced expiratory volume in one second (FEV1-ppo), the transfer factor (TL,CO-ppo), and VO2max-ppo can be predicted by using the same formula.	3.5953115460509455
Patients with nearly normal lung function (FEV1, TL,CO > 75 % predicted) and no concomitant cardiac disease can undergo lung resection right up to pneumonectomy without further diagnostic procedures.	3.058618755572242
In the others, FEV1-ppo and TL,CO-ppo should be estimated first by taking into account the number of segments to be resected.	3.1092458013288646
Patients with values < 30 % predicted are usually regarded as being inoperable, whereas values > 40 % predicted qualify for resection without the need for further diagnostics.	3.090425209727522
VO2max < 10 ml/kg/min or < 40 % predicted are prohibitive for surgery.	3.1449809208311623
If VO2max is > 20 ml/kg/min or > 75 % predicted, functional operability without limitation is given.	3.072860365613702
For those cases where diagnostic uncertainty still remains, FEV1-ppo, TL,CO-ppo, and VO2max-ppo can be calculated by means of quantitative lung scans.	2.974069589432077

A 39 year old male patient with a body mass index of 34,22 kg/m2 and receiving continuous-positive-airway-pressure- (CPAP) therapy for known SAS was scheduled for elective plastic surgery.	3.316972132268588
After induction of anaesthesia and direct laryngoscopy no adequate airway could be established and the patient became hypoxic, hypercapnic and developed hypotension and bradycardia.	3.361044645321852
With the use of a laryngeal mask airway the patient was stabilized and did not show neurologic sequale after immediate awakening.	4.074955540308478
The following fiberoptic intubation of the awake patient, still showing tendency of upper airway obstruction, confirmed the difficult anatomical structures.	3.1131027712165356
The subsequent general anesthesia was uneventful.	3.4052690173586657
The patient received CPAP therapy and was monitored during the first postoperative night in the Intensive Care Unit.	3.276353613541724
He made an uneventful recovery.	3.439695994369368
He was advised to have regional anaesthesia or planned fiberoptic intubation, where possible, in the case of further anesthetic intervention.	3.4979783025000835
SAS has major implications for the anaesthesiologist and whenever patients exhibiting the high risk factors (obesity, male sex, history of intense snoring, impaired daytime performance, nonrefreshing daytime naps) are presented for surgery this condition should be considered.	3.333341370367863
Elective surgery should be postponed until after adequate examination and treatment when necessary.	3.672609196845906
Patients with SAS should always be suspected of having cardiopulmonary dysfunctions such as hypertension, cardiac dysrhythmia or cor pulmonale.	2.892112636181517
It is most important to avoid sedative premedication, to initiate CPAP therapy preoperatively, to encourage regional anaesthesia if possible and to ensure close monitoring over the complete perioperative period.	3.020403677726582
Planned fiberoptic intubation, preferably with surgical personnel available for an emergency airway, is a safe method for the induction of anaesthesia.	3.991949561145787
Postoperatively, patients are at high risk from respiratory depression, even in the awake state.	4.598259974104582

The absorption of large volumes of irrigation fluid is a major problem in transurethral prostatic surgery (TUR-P).	3.282304322299971
Various indicators have been tested to monitor fluid absorption with regard to continuous registration and sufficient accuracy.	3.587792465025164
The volumetric fluid balance is not suitable as a routine method because of its inaccuracy.	3.8223400349529135
Easily accessible parameters are unspecific because of surgical bleeding (haematocrit [Hct]), or are interfered with by physiological counter-regulatory actions (serum sodium [Na] concentration).	2.813550680550195
In 1986 Hulten et al.	2.7607708077904403
In a prospective clinical study of 17 patients undergoing TUR-P under spinal anaesthesia, expiratory concentrations of alcohol that was added to the irrigation fluid (2% ethanol in Purisole, Fresenius, Bad Homburg) were monitored.	3.0598827871165026
Gas was continuously sampled from the nasopharynx through a nasal cannula and the ethanol concentration was measured using a modified diverting anaesthetic gas monitor (Normac, Datex, Helsinki) that allows continuous as well as early detection of the absorbed irrigation fluid with reliable accuracy for clinical use.	3.289944386306082
In addition, at intervals of 10 minutes we measured blood alcohol, endtidal alcohol (Alcotest 7110, Drauml;ger, Lübeck), haematocrit, serum Na concentration, and blood gases.	2.9095463943728164
Sixty-eight measurements were obtained from the 17 patients.	3.529408871623337
As shown in other studies, serum Na (r2 = 0.68) and Hct (r2 = 0.39) correlated poorly with the irrigation fluid as determined by serum alcohol levels.	3.065568692423118
In contrast, the expiratory alcohol measurements with the alcotest 7110 (r2 = 0.93) and Normac devices (r2 = 0.85) were closely related.	2.6559417992078864
Continuous monitoring of the expiratory alcohol concentration with a Normac monitor closely reflects blood alcohol concentrations, and may hence serve as a useful semiquantitative monitor of irrigation fluid absorption during TUR-P.	3.1345387390028754

Schatzker classification), 20 patients with avulsion fracture of the tibial insertion of the anterior cruciate ligament (intercondylar eminence) type II, III and IV (according to Meyers, McKeever and Zariczny classification), two patients with completely dislocated osteochondral flake fractures of the femoral condyle, and one patient with a minimally displaced fracture of the patella.	3.7053742005961503

With the institution of the Protection against infection Act, case definitions will be officially introduced for the routine transmission of notifiable infectious diseases from local health departments to state and national health institutions in Germany for the first time.	2.7106182349223493
Case definitions link the disease entity with a defined description of the disease.	3.5741526654655567
The abstraction thereby required leads to the creation of nosological entities.	3.2114932905993196
The case definitions, which were developed by the Robert Koch Institute (RKI) according to the Protection against infection Act, enable the local health departments to assess and categorise reported cases, deaths and laboratory reports of pathogens according to uniform criteria prior to transmission to the RKI via the state health institutions.The quality of surveillance data will be significantly improved, as each reported case/infection will fulfil defined criteria, thereby enabling unclear cases/diagnoses to be separated from those that are confirmed.	2.9267002328752816

In the case of recurrent perianal fistulas and cystic masses between the rectum and os sacrum or os coccygeum, a tail-gut cyst should be taken into consideration, the goal being its complete removal.	2.928993793510544

The purpose of the Transfusion Law, which came into force on 7 July 1998, is to ensure the supply with safe blood products, to reinforce the confidence in the blood transfusion system, and to support self sufficiency with blood and plasma.	3.0627530650666617
In order to reach this goal, the law regulates the essential reqirements for the adequate collection of blood and blood constituents, as well for safe usage of blood products.	3.4708519610612076

In the last decades back pain has reached dramatic proportions in industrialized countries.	2.7632182886819034
Disorders of the back are nowadays the leading cause of direct and indirect health care costs.	2.6349667972842363
Accurate prevalence estimates are needed to serve as a basis for health care evaluations.	3.7718024764981712
A review of epidemiologic studies in the general population reveals that back pain has reached a prevalence of 40 % for current pain.	3.2689029524883124
7 to 18 % are "frequently", "often", "daily" or "constantly" affected.	3.4832133241020014
75 % of the adult population suffers from back pain during the last year.	3.755481014947359
80 to 90 % of the adult population in industrialized countries experience back pain ever.	3.8811311381393776
Gender specific differences are only present in severe, chronic forms which are more often experienced by women.	3.4802115460729657
Back pain has a prevalence maximum at 50 to 64 years.	3.2049320484131467
Older persons display lower prevalence estimates.	3.3178184484492776
The prevalence maximum in men is one decade earlier than in women.	3.085898900913946
There are several potential explanations for this prevalence pattern that are discussed in the article.	3.1033588568906123
Back pain can be classified by location, temporal characteristics, pain intensity and pain history.	3.354625219405576
Currently, for none of these dimensions generally accepted, uniformly employed and validated definitions are available.	3.018955161858415
In most of the industrialized countries back pain is one of the most expensive symptoms.	3.596009954918872
75-90 % of the direct and indirect health care costs were caused by those 5-10 % of patients who are disabled.	4.104429526157688
As predictors of back pain a history of back pain and job satisfaction play by far a more important role than the extensively studied mechanical factors.	3.3799123877529107
For a first episode of back pain the prognosis is favorable.	3.4792098517974313
If the pain persist for more than three months the prognosis is unfavorable.	3.851258962543069
After six months of absenteeism because of back pain more than half of the afflicted never return to work.	3.5486015740612014
Rarely back pain is present as a single symptom.	4.017952840571773
In more than 80 % back pain is associated with pain in at least one joint.	4.613853587159692
It remains to be studied if back pain may be viewed as an entity or as part of a more complex pain syndrome.	3.5831924109097906
Chronic low back pain can be considered to be one of the most frequently treated and most costly diseases in modern industrial societies.	3.7543732970804222
Dysfunctions and imbalances of the spine-supporting muscles increase the risk of low back pain.	3.6387317382856277
Consequently preventive treatment and rehabilitation have to aim at preserving and restoring the full capacity of the spine-supporting muscles as well as training coordination and spine-friendly behaviour.	3.313637758688478
In addition to various measures of pain therapy, physiotherapeutic treatment including neuro-physiotherapy, physical treatment (eg electrotherapy), balneotherapy and supportive behavioural training, medical rehabilitation therapy (MRT) ranks among the most effective ways of treating low back pain.	3.088429969320288
MRT applies guidelines and methods of exercise methodology within medically indicated programmes of preventive treatment and rehabilitation.	3.0196647789748834
Various objectives of MRT are outlined with special regard to the stages of MRT treatment, emphasizing positive adaptation of the neuro-muscular system in the course of rehabilitation.	3.429837694131223
Physicians are responsible for MRT diagnosis and control.	3.7160480802579263
Taking into account the base disorder and the progress of therapy physiotherapists and the physicians in charge determine MRT objectives and treatment strategies.	3.154408685224777

We treated 51 patients with 54 periprosthetic fractures between 1985 and 1995.	3.055125257516773

Sleep deprivation led to significantly reduced number of arousals, reduced arousal index, significantly prolonged arousal duration and more stage shifts from all sleep stages (nonsignificant).	2.87213562606064
Complex behavior during sleep increased under sleep deprivation, whereas sleepwalking did not increase.	3.2775925288786114
The majority of complex behavior during sleep is triggered by stage shifts and not by arousal in the sense of the arousal definition of the American Sleep Disorder Society.	3.236506424235205
Complex behavior in sleep is stereotypical and nonviolent.	3.0537041609364337
Its complexity seems to depend on the duration and intensity of arousals.	3.789064460606929

The hepatorenal syndrome is defined as the development of renal failure in patients with severe liver disease in the absence of any other identifiable cause of renal functional impairment.	4.909585176162079
The pathogenesis of this obviously functional renal failure is complex and not completely understood.	2.834580185706155

The mortality is still high exceeding 90%.	3.3867116822070042

The only effective and permanent treatment is orthotopic liver transplantation.	2.941522357342845

An adequate increase of uterine blood flow throughout gestation is essential for uterine, placental and fetal growth.	3.115303705892736
Maternal cardiovascular adaptation has to provide the uterine perfusion that is necessary to meet the requirements of the developing and growing fetus by providing transport of nutrients and oxygen to the placenta and the fetus.	3.554893520924382
Thus uterine blood flow is inextricably linked to fetal growth and survival.	3.441855964720836
Reductions of uterine blood flow can occur under acute or chronic conditions or in a combination of both.	3.94692173313528
Chronic restrictions in uterine blood flow will elicit a placental and fetal response in the form of growth adaptation to the reduced supply of oxygen and nutrients to the conceptus.	3.253219324982247
If compensatory growth restriction reaches its limits intrauterine fetal distress can ensue.	2.9220674310938057
In view of a possible Stent implantation, 20 infrarenal abdominal aneurysms obtained consecutively during postmortem examinations were investigated.	2.9823430126096007
Measurements were performed according to toporegional criteria on the proximal and distal necks of the aneurysms as well as on their lengths and diameters.	3.2642382900553875
Then we correlated the extent of the proximal and distal necks to the aneurysmal lengths and diameters, respectively.	3.3528482480614072
The following results were obtained: 1.	3.255623369283302
Depending on the increase in length of the infrarenal abdominal aneurysm, there is an inproportional shortening of the proximal and distal neck.	4.272627328717224
Up to an aneurysmal length of 4 cm both proximal and distant necks are suitable for stent fixation in all cases.	2.883797821868282
With lengths of more than 4 cm according to the morphological results, the distal neck is almost always unsuitable for fixation of a simple Tube-Stent.	3.8375149036645206
The proximal neck is suitable for stent fixation in all cases up to an aneurysmal length of 10 cm.	3.3387728076116856
For longer aneurysms, only a quarter of all cases is suitable for stent implantation.	4.159452785883574
In all cases investigated there were severe arteriosclerotic changes with atheromatous ulcerations and secondary wall-adherent thrombi of up to three centimeter thickness in the aneurysmal and para-aneurysmal regions.	2.913713473029927
These findings have to be considered, with respect to the transluminal transport of the prosthesis as well as in the regions of the supposed implantation in the proximal and distal necks of the aneurysm with individually variable arteriosclerotic changes of the aorta.	4.339345151007899
We report on a case of paraganglioma of the cauda equina in a 48-year-old man.	2.9219830859184786
These slow-growing, mostly benign and encapsulated intradural-extramedullar tumours are clinically characterized by lumbago, paraesthesia and motor deficits as well as occasi-onally by incontinence.	3.134435159158899
Paragangliomas of the cauda equina show monomorphous (main) cells arranged in a typical cell cluster pattern, demonstrating a lobular architecture and a fine net of connective tissue formed by so-called sustentacular cells; some tumours show focal ganglionic differentiation.	2.693538394431542
Because of their morphological similarity to the more common ependymomas, paragangliomas of the cauda equina are sometimes misdiagnosed so that their incidence is likely to be higher than previously estimated.	3.1823366347922466
Immunohistochemistry findings are positive for neuron-specific enolase, chromogranin and other neuronal markers as well as neuropeptides (main cells) and S-100 protein (sustentacular cells) while widely lacking reactivity for GFAP.	3.172146313818025
Paragangliomas of the cauda equina represent a rare entity, of which only 80 cases have been described in the literature.	3.2465492685970245
Because they only occur sporadically, they are often not included in the differential diagnosis of mass lesions of the region of the cauda equina.	4.087105482937318

The treatment of such relapses is dependent on the site and extension of the recurrence, the type of primary therapy administered and the patient's general condition.	3.712951052357687
The limit conditions for the application of the established forms of therapy available - surgical operation, radiotherapy, chemotherapy - are complex and seldom documented by randomized studies.	3.7064345271495656
In general, empiric observations and historical analyses determine the backdrop against which therapy is planned.	2.77825041741246

To compare the different scores, receiver-operating characteristics (ROC) - analyses were applied.	3.0355720205666006
The study demonstrated a clear correlation between an elevated SOFA score and the mortality of the patients during their ICU stay (score 0 -> mortality 0 %, 1 -> 3.6 %, 2 -> 22.5 %, 3 -> 86,7 %, respectively r = 0.445; P = 0,01).	3.828862538541142
The ROC analyses of the APACHE II, the MOD and the SOFA scores were comparable (area under the curve: APACHE II 0.73, MOD 0.77, SOFA 0.71).	2.8406102841433576
In conclusion, the SOFA score is reliable and might be useful in the daily routine of an intensive care unit.	2.957068356668642
In individual patients with head and neck squamous cell carcinomas (HNSCC), established prognostic factors do not satisfactorily predict clinical outcome.	3.1342073825398025
For the first time we investigated a total of 100 HNSCC by Comparative Genomic Hybridization (CGH) to define chromosomal alterations that are associated with the patients prognosis.	3.5518978999118125
Patients were followed for at latest 4 but at least 2 years after surgery or until death.	3.754092008163179
During this observation period twenty-nine of them died because of cancer disease.	3.539959507618496
The Kaplan-Meier method was used plotting survival curves for every single chromosomal alteration as well as every clinico-pathological parameter.	3.382002656063386
The curves were tested for significance by the log rank as well as the Breslow test.	3.686432459373017
Significance of particular prognostic parameters was then evaluated by the Cox regression model.	3.3653341487472823
The overall survival time as well as the recurrence free survival time were significantly lower in patients who's tumors showed amplifications of the chromosomal region 11q13 (p=0.0008 for LR and p=0.0024 for B).	3.044659286050105
The survival time of the patients was also lower if the carcinomas carried overrepresentations of chromosome 3q (p=0.0299 for LR and p=0.0546 for B).	3.2202168358190453
Multivariate analysis (Cox's proportional hazards model) revealed both alterations as most important independent prognostic factors in HNSCC.	3.0391817069928093
None of the conventional clinico-pathological parameters (pT-, pN-status, UICC stage, grading) achieved statistical significance in the multivariate model.	2.9207535490918994

This form of treatment is scientifically validated (Grawe 1997).	3.1738512739800986
Its theory of function and dysfunction has been updated via contributions from contemporary psychological theory.	2.0551094743438485
It incorporates a set of key therapeutic tasks, each of which is characterized by specific client marker and resolution state, series of steps clients pass through on their way to resolution, and therapist interventions used to facilitate client progress through those steps.	1.6916840258662025

Abdominal compartment syndrome is defined by increased intraabdominal pressure above 20 mmHg with increased pulmonary peak pressure and oliguria.	3.5278645393391255
In primary abdominal compartment syndrome the increased intraabdominal pressure is caused directly by peritonitis, ileus or abdominal and pelvic trauma.	2.9934812075030752
Secondary compartment syndrome is a result of forced closure of the abdominal wall after abdominal surgery.	4.095979164950576
The effects are decreased cardiac output, pulmonary atelectasis, oliguria to anuria and hepatic as well as intestinal reduction of perfusion.	3.4889784159507866
Effective monitoring is done by standardised measuring of urinary bladder pressure.	3.4821159066154443
Normal values are between 0 and 7 cm H2O, after elective laparotomies 5-12 cm H20.	3.512508719052505
Above 25 cm H20 they are definitely pathological.	3.42927342313233
For the prevention and therapy of manifested abdominal compartment syndrome the application of a laparostomy using a resorbable mesh is recommended.	3.7309684759513413
Between 1988 and 1999 we applied a laparostomy to lower the intraabdominal pressure in 377 patients.	2.8517769457590783
In 16 % of the cases it was indicated by primary abdominal compartment syndrome with a bladder pressure of 31  +/-  4 cm H20 preoperatively, which could be lowered to 17  +/-  4 cm H20 by laparostomy.	3.9233524716891766
An early reconstruction of the abdominal wall could be performed in 18 % of the cases.	4.9790551260349565
Conclusions: The abdominal compartment syndrome is an often underestimated problem in abdominal surgery involving multiple organ systems.	3.207171694281146
The temporary laparostomy lowering intraabdominal pressure rather than a forced closure of the abdominal wall should be used in all circumstances.	3.592756587876488

Actually there is no generally accepted guideline for the different new indications, conservative versus invasive treatment schedule.	3.5859496413665655
It is difficult for the patient to get appropriate information before his decision between mechanical procedures and conservative methods; authentic informed consent actually seems to be in a very bad position.	3.607101363879121
In 1992 the working group called "Arbeitsgemeinschaft leitender kardiologischer Krankenhausärzte (ALKK)" decided to start a registry of all PTCA procedures, in order to gain knowledge about the present status of PTCA in Germany.	3.061054064173249

A large meta-analysis by Lechat combining 18 studies with 3023 patients showed a 32% reduction in mortality in patients treated with <beta>-blockers.	3.1366057181844633
Mortality and hospitalization together were reduced by 37%.	3.312354707972468

Both studies show a significant reduction in mortality in patients treated with <beta>-blockers.	3.6053156153758317
The ongoing COMET study compares <beta>1-selective blockers like metoprolol with vasodilatative <beta>-blockers like carvedilol in patients with chronic heart failure.	3.105144092090816
Large clinical registries demonstrate clinical practicability of <beta>-blocker treatment of patients with chronic heart failure.	3.5224123974721997
All patients with stabel chronic heart failure ought to be treated with <beta>-blockers additional to a basic therapy with ACE inhibitors, diuretics, and digitalis.	3.220922691864625
The <beta>-blocker therapy regimen is to start with low doses and to increase the dose carefully:"Start low and go slow".	3.4401140078500383
