Background: It has been suggested that inflammatory processes play a role in the pathogenesis of acute coronary syndromes (ACS).	3.3050953013631794
C-reactive protein (CRP) is a classic acute phase protein.	3.1797355127170612
It is yet unclear whether, in addition to established markers as troponin T (TnT), determination of CRP in patients admitted for ACS contributes significantly to the diagnosis and prognosis of ACS.Patients and Methods: We investigated 50 patients with ACS (59.4 SD 13.9 years) in the first hour after admission and 4-24h later with respect to TnT (Elecsys, Roche Diagnostics) and CRP (biokit, modified Quantex CRP plus, analytical sensitivity 0.02mg/dL).	3.397050098169722
Fifty percent of the patients were classified as having unstable angina retrospectively.	4.879566063337956
All patients were followed in the 6 weeks post discharge regarding death and recurrent ACS.Results: The cumulative event rate at 6 weeks after discharge was 62.5% for patients being CRP and TnT positive compared to 35.3% in TnT positive and CRP negative patients.	3.029716357598823
In TnT negative patients a positive CRP test predicted 33.3% of events and 28.8% of patients negative for CRP and TnT had events at 42 days post discharge.	2.8849605923539188
Logistic regression analysis regarding the primary endpoint including TnT and CRP (4-24h values), age, gender and diagnosis resulted in independent prediction of ACS or death by TnT (cutoff 0.1µg/L, p=0.048, odds ratio=7.5) and CRP (cutoff 0.862mg/dL, p=0.026, odds ratio=5.3).	3.040947368823878
Sensitivity/specificity for AMI diagnosis were 69.6%/75% for TnT and 12%/72% for CRP in the first hour and 91.3%/68.2% for TnT and 68%/72% for CRP 4-24h later.Conclusions: Besides TnT, high sensitivity CRP determination has no additional value for early AMI diagnosis.	2.966962509033834
The prognosis of these patients during the first 24 hours is significantly and independently predicted by CRP measurements in addition to troponin T.	4.031628537145198

Repeat coronary artery bypass graft operations are associated with a significantly higher perioperative morbidity and mortality, patency rates are lower and late clinical outcome is worse than in primary surgery.	3.632687226670891

Cerebral involvement with the occurence of convulsions is the defining factor for eclampsia.	3.1119015407315644

Results of surgery are still moderate.	3.4356887823908298

Different technical approaches were established: a) three-dimensional in vitro cultures of chondrocytes for the development of vital tissue transplants and b) interacting three-dimensional cultures consisting of different cell populations, such as BMP-transfected mesenchymal cells.	3.813954395191482
The preshaped artificial tissue constructs were cultured in perfusion chambers to maintain a stable diffusion of nutrients during the in vitro pre-formation step.	3.0134182188707817
Subsequently, pre-formed tissues were implanted into nude mice and into 4mm articular joint defects of rabbits.	2.8688064656112364
Transplants were found to produce cartilage typic morphological patterns and matrix.	3.719274060461043
80% of the transplants remained stable in vivo.	3.0862358349472037
However, 20% of the tissues are resorbed or replaced by a fibrous tissue.	3.3353212785568993
These results demonstrate that current artificial cartilage transplants are already feasible for plastic reconstruction.	2.8616713628465678

The follow-up period averaged 6.9 years.	3.0686552773656812

During the operation less complications arose in comparison to patients with hip dysplasia and osteoarthritis.	3.3248246071187206
Regarding the rate of infection after operation there were no differences between the 3 groups.	4.623155973169345

In our opinion this is due to the fact that these rheumatics were operated by posterior approach.	3.3045884814309803
Patients with rheumatoid arthritis were satisfied most with their surgeries.	3.1040285979526376

Sepsis developing on the basis of a postoperative infection is a rare, but life-threatening event.	4.015988733840809
Early diagnosis of postoperative complications usually facilitates decisive intervention and a favorable prognosis.	3.242547424631656
If the right moment is missed, endothelial damage leads to the release of inflammatory mediators and generalized systemic infection (SIRS).	3.3843735810636453

Profiles of fundamental frequency sound pressure levels and voice duration are measured separately in clinical practice.	3.3227832380095816
It was the aim of the present study to combine the two examinations, in order to estimate the relationship between pitch, sound pressure level and voice duration and to develop a new computer-assisted graph.	3.5998121342660143

We have termed this "phonetography".	3.0544724070998948

In one-third of the healthy volunteers, the values of the piano voice duration were greater than those of forte for almost all pitches examined.	3.486296415821987
In two-thirds of the healthy subjects the values of forte voice duration were partly greater, as were those of piano voice duration.	3.065575493825151
All of the patients showed voice duration values greater for forte than for piano.	3.421625922830591
The results of the study demonstrate that the 3D phonogram is a useful tool for obtaining new insights into various relationships of voice parameters.	3.2672707974113453

Positron emission tomography (PET) is a noninvasive functional method for the study of solid tumor perfusion, metabolism and interaction with different therapeutic agents.	3.743749009256832
The aim of the study was the investigation of the metabolism of hepatocellular carcinomas (HCC) and the kinetics during a treatment with intratumoral ethanol by PET.	3.1405334175373922
The ongoing study includes seven patients with child A cirrhosis and HCC (UICC stage III-IVA; tumor size 3-6 cm).	3.172744085106468
Dynamic PET studies (60 min) with 18F-fluordeoxyglucose (FDG) were performed prior to therapy to assess tumor viability.	3.356880218958698
The evaluation of the FDG data demonstrated a liver-equivalent uptake in six of the tumors (well and moderately differentiated HCC), which were poorly delineated against the normal liver parenchyma.	3.719258312100332
One moderately differentiated HCC showed an increased FDG metabolism, indicating no correlation between histology and metabolism.	3.4264051698051
A dose of 37-80 MBq 11C-ethanol was applied together with a nonlabelled therapeutic dose of the drug via a puncture needle positioned under sonography.	3.3097321505497694
Five out of seven tumors demonstrated a high 11C uptake shortly after the end of the ethanol injection followed by constant 11C-ethanol concentration during the whole study period of 45 min.	3.1760735186020614
The PET data demonstrated no significant elimination of the 11C-ethanol from the tumor and no accumulation in the surrounding liver tissue.	3.552681411902891
One case showed a decrease of the intratumoral 11C-ethanol concentration due to a punkture of a tumor vein, and in another case the surrounding liver parenchyma demonstrated significant 11C uptake in the early phase following paratumoral injection of the drug.	3.7691281483516343
In conclusion, PET is a useful tool for the study of the mechanism and the kinetics of percutaneous intratumoral ethanol injection of HCC.	3.5258470434381386
During the last decade, many investigations were conducted in order to understand the mechanisms involved in the development of acute lung injury (ALI) or acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS).	3.3231977803695996
However, the increasing knowledge, instead of clarification, leads us to realize that these terms may assemble a wide variety of lung pathologies.	2.7473750029594393
Indeed, many circumstances can result in these syndromes and no particular factor has been defined to distinguish ARDS of one etiology from another.	3.298073332223901
We are still ignorant about which factors lead to the extended inflammation from pneumonia to ARDS, while it is not clear whether the timing of events are determined by some mediators.	3.4615169761469673
Furthermore, in the clinical arena, there is no clear distinction between pneumonia, severe pneumonia which may lead to ALI and then ARDS.	4.1015726370023815
This review is an analysis by an ICU clinician of the different points of view of these syndromes and intends to give a global vision of the numerous factors implied, emphasizing the complex interactions between them.	3.3281856152562246
The present state about new potential treatments directed on mediators is summarized.	2.7813248890335434
The aim of the study was to evaluate if a combined physiologic-therapeutic scoring system (MARIS = Marburger Intensive Score) offers better outcome prediction compared to scoring systems, which are based either only physiologically (APACHE II = Acute Physiology and Chronic Health Evaluation II) or only therapeutically (TISS = Therapeutic Intervention Scoring System) in medical intensive care medicine.	2.7410314884688973
Main outcome parameters employed were hospital mortality, severity of disease classification and length of hospital stay.	3.3589001175257684
During a 12-months period (1993/94), 531 consecutive patients (ICU stay >4 hours) being admitted to a medical ICU of a tertiary care university hospital were prospectively investigated.	3.309520415124533
The day-1-scores of MARIS, APACHE II, and TISS were determined and the patients were followed until hospital discharge or death.	4.1725279219145985
There was no advantage in using the combined scoring system (MARIS) neither in discrimination between survival and non-survival (hospital mortality; areas under the ROC-curve: MARIS = 0.84, APACHE II = 0.86, TISS = 0.78) nor in severity classification (relationship between day-1-scores and hospital mortality: p<0.001 (chi2-Test) in all three systems).	2.8785614868160856
In contrast only for the combined system (MARIS), a dependence of length of hospital stay from day-1-scores in the analysis of survivors only and in the analysis of all patients (survivors and non-survivors) (p<0.001; ANOVA) could be demonstrated.	4.452443908523963
In conclusion the combined physiologic-therapeutic scoring system (MARIS) did not offer a better outcome prediction concerning hospital mortality and severity classification compared to the established systems in critically ill patients.	2.92823558344906
Its use may be advantageous in evaluating the relationship between day-1-scores and length of hospital stay, which for economical reasons has become a parameter of growing interest in intensive care medicine.	3.248020191546588

Less frequently epidermal cysts, hairshaft abnormalities, natal teeth and laryngeal involvement may be seen.	2.9394062838393546

There were no significant differences among the three groups with regard to biometrical or operative data.	3.2895455180020106

In a series of 473 autopsies the over all occurrence of PET was 13.3%.	2.8770479991440587
The highest frequencies were found in fire victims (31%), persons who had died after intensive care (24%), cardiac death (22%), drowning and intoxication (16% each).	3.3633160895109815
At first sight cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) seemed to influence the occurrence of PET, because the rate was 11% without and 19% with CPR (x2: p < 0.05); an aspect which has been mentioned in the literature.	3.3831776111043297
However, further analysis showed that a higher rate of PET could only be observed in causes of death where PET are often fround irrespective of CPR, whereas in the other groups PET (with or without CPR) are uncommon.	3.8864512229433057
Furthermore, a case-by-case analysis showed that in several cases with PET after CPR the causes could clearly be attributed to conditions other than CPR.	3.473992352406984
In a second series of autopsy cases with only cardiac deaths (181 cases), the influence of age and body mass on the rate of PET was statistically significant and there was a tendency for more frequent PET with increasing heart weight.	4.018190115571487
On the other hand, no statistically significant influence of CPR on the rate of PET could be found in this relatively homogeneous group.	3.3333646808148636
Media reports convey the impression that the incidence of fatal accidents in the European Alps has been increasing yearly at an alarming rate.	3.4390683716790478

Because of varying definitions of "mountain accident" used in these countries, available data about the number of fatalities are not comparable.	3.4946963712214223

At surgery, the tumors were thought to be malignant, most likely liposarcomas.	3.8575662948522016
The histological examination showed the characteristic appearance of elastofibromas with spindle-shaped fibroblasts, which were separated by thick eosinophilic collagenous and elastic fibers.	3.076787016165713
Elastofibromas are benign mesenchymal soft-tissue lesions that mainly affect elderly women.	3.3913037258736995
In 10 % of the patients bilateral, often asynchronous tumors are seen.	4.319049722842642
Ninety-nine percent of the lesions are located in the subscapular region.	3.695148915535892
Occasional elastofibromas have been described in the extremities, head, and in the abdominal and thoracic cavities.	5.272221343653305

According to the "speed"-hypothesis of cognitive development, the slowing of information processing in old age is at the core of negative age differences in psychometric intelligence.	3.069918089550446
The present study investigates the "speed"-hypothesis for fluid intelligence at the individual level using Latent Growth Curve Methodology.	2.801403236002476
Date on 4 measurement points come from the Bonn Longitudinal Study of aging (N=128, mean age 67.2, 53% women).	3.06480913574883
Based on principal factor analysis, markers of mental speed were the WAIS Digit Symbol Test and simple psychomotor task.	2.82865789399845
As indicators of fluid intelligence the WAIS Object Assembly and Block Design were used.	2.9402853839583676
After separately fitting Latent Growth Curve Models for the trajectory of mental speed and fluid intelligence, a combined model showed no statistically significant improvement of fit for freeing the covariance between the two slope-factors.	3.189238545618485
Interpreting this result, contrary to the "speed"-hypothesis the intraindividual change of fluid intelligence does not relate to the according change of mental speed.	3.0680863566699337
For patients with dilative cardiomyopathy (DCM), the prognosis is highly unfavorable, even under conditions of optimal medication.	3.4053979016784557
Since there is increasing evidence that modifications of the immune system accompanied by the production of autoantibodies, e.g., against 1 ad-renergic or muscarinergic receptors, are involved in the pathogenesis of DCM, the elucidation of the possible functional significance of these autoantibodies has attracted increasing interest.	3.2720696545433414
In addition to the role of autoantibodies as markers for an autoimmune process, discussion of the possible pathogenetic mechanisms has centered on direct toxicity as well as on negative influencing of myocardial contractility and energy metabolism.	3.513288031900017
The effects gained through removal of autoantibodies by immunoadsorption therapy for DCM patients sheds light on the functional importance of autoantibodies in this syndrome.	2.9811400499776184
A pilot study conducted among DCM patients disclosed that immunadsorption took place in simultaneous conjunction with a reduction in the immunoglobulin level and with significant hemodynamic and clinical improvement.	3.2265397058987046
These results may be interpreted as indicating that autoantibodies play an active role in DCM and that their removal by immunadsorption possibly represents a highly promising future therapeutic concept.	2.9048214365158245

Gene therapy includes the transfer of genetic material performed by either viral or non-viral methods and in vivo or ex vivo.	3.4592274939162477
For melanoma the following approaches are suggested: vaccination with tumour-specific, HLA-associated antigens using peptides or `naked DNA', vaccination with melanoma cells transfected with cytokine genes or B7, adoptive immunotherapy with specific T-lymphocytes or transfected tumour-infiltrating lymphocytes, or transfection of tumour cells with a tumour suppressor gene whose dysfunction plays a crucial role in melanoma.	2.798058354528356

After the treatment the fractures were correctly set according to the rules of conservative bone fracture treatment.	3.723980395823697
The mean follow-up period for all patients was 31 months (range 3-50 months.	3.567569307877667

Apart from low-grade local reactions (swelling, haematoma, petechiae) no complications were observed.	3.2166341278333475
The treatment is noninvasive and requires little investment in terms of personnel or technology.	3.152022922566782

The sound transmission properties of three different commercially available middle ear implants and the prototype of a complete middle ear prosthesis (CoMEP) were evaluated with a special measurement system that permits standardized conditions.	3.4408027505220167
This system uses a mechanical middle ear model (MMM) which approximates the impedances of the tympanic membrane and inner ear.	2.7187096782425475
The implants were fitted under defined conditions into the MMM.	3.273725692361651
Displacement of the artificial stapes footplate of the MMM was measured with an optical probe.	3.4901747792546884
The measurements of different middle ear prostheses showed that the mass of the implant was the most important factor for optimum high frequency transmission.	4.245649439919285
The lightest implant (4 mg, titanium) showed the best results.	3.592384854295286
The CoMEP revealed the highest sensitivity because of a slight enlargement of the diameter of the artificial tympanic membrane.	3.8335981489376443
These findings show that the CoMEP is able to restore sound transmission to a normal range.	3.5383159322380644
In a second experiment one of the implants was fitted into the MMM with different forces.	3.6816778663991534
The increase of stiffness produced a slightly better high frequency transmission at the expense of low frequency sensitivity.	3.1212301646159006
Hence, the fitting of the implant may not be too stiff because of its loss of mobility within a significant frequency range.	3.460085116429832

Closed rupture of the anterior tibial tendon is rare.	3.8139475090945076
Fewer than 50 cases have been reported in the literature, perhaps because the symptoms are often neglected by the patient as well as by the doctor.	4.077175858892896
Most often the rupture occurs as a consequence of a sudden plantar flexion of the ankle and pre-existing degenerative changes of the tendon tissue due to systemic disease or iatrogenic local corticoid injections.	3.870375986314908
Differential diagnoses such as anterior tibial syndrome and peroneal nerve palsy can thus be excluded.	3.22828780219606
During the clinical examination the distal stump and the discontinuity of the anterior tibial tendon are often palpable.	3.4065943231121554
The clinical diagnosis can be confirmed by an ultrasound examination.	3.0474428441342507
An operation may be undertaken up to 3 months after the injury.	3.483395509022453
Preferred procedures are end-to-end anastomosis and transosseous refixation of the tendon, followed by a plaster cast for 6 weeks postoperatively.	3.8905316838761252

Background: According to literature, 30-60 % of pacemaker patients suffer from paroxysmal atrial fibrillation (PAF).	3.6219246079646448
As rapid tracking of PAF may cause severe symptoms in patients with dual chamber pacemakers, refined algorithms providing AV synchronous pacing during periods of sinus rhythm and preventing high ventricular rates during PAF are highly desirable.	3.308965359196269
Aim and method: This comprehensive paper introduces a new mode switching (MS) algorithm which uses either a fixed (Inos2CLS) or programmable (Logos) number of short intervals out of 8 consecutive atrial intervals to detect PAF.	2.79295442865751
If the MS criterion is fulfilled, a switch from AV synchronous pacing to nontracking mode is automatically performed.	2.791975714204066
The algorithm is described together with a discussion on optimization of the programming of parameters which may indirectly influence the MS sensitivity and specificity.	3.250157066022628
Results: This MS concept maintains the high sensitivity and fast reactivity towards PAF of the "mode conversion" in Actros and Kairos pacemaker systems, preventing a long time delay between onset of PAF, detection of the arrhythmia, and switch to nontracking mode.	3.2360304398818975
In addition, adequeate sensing and short blanking periods in the new MS concept enable reliable MS.	2.7774694591769804
The occurrence of atrial oversensing should be tested, as it may lead to inappropriate MS. Programmability of the MS algorithm may be advantageous for individual programming with respect to the patients' arrhythmia rate and atrial sensing performance, but the use of very restrictive or very liberal criteria should be avoided as both may lead to mode oscillations.	3.902350986701214
Finally, examples of stored diagnostic data are presented to assess MS reliability, identify possible problems, and optimize MS function during follow-up.	3.138652761872516

The neoplastic formations have been classified into tubuloalveolar structures, solid nests/aggregations and stromal cells of varying morphology.	2.921971077610061
The innermost cells of tubuloalveolar structures were characterized by marked expression of CKs (KL1 and MNF116), CEA and EMA, while in the outer ones there was moderate expression of vimentin, S-100 was expressed to a lesser extent and KL1, weakly but there was marked and consistent expression of MNF116.	3.003152780092889

Very early, i. e. in 1984, the German Medical Association developed professional laws for reproductive medicine.	3.358035913550029
In addition, the German government saw the need in 1990 for an "Embryo Protection Law" (Embryonenschutzgesetz).	2.843805417473125
Today, in the light of European integration, the medical profession's and state's obligations are challenged in different ways.	3.2219723404998923
Whereas the German Medical Association continuously works on professional guidelines for reproductive medicine and genetics - currently the case with preimplantation genetic diagnosis - the government must develop the sociolegal framework for ethically sound reproductive medicine, i. e. , in the areas of inheritance law, adoption law, family law, and law of succession, the latter especially in the case of discrepancies between genetic vs. social paternity in heterologous insemination.	2.944830665003768
In Crohn's disease, some concomitant neurological illnesses such as cerebral ischemia following arterial or venous thrombosis, subacute combined degeneration of the spinal cord following malabsorption of vitamin B12 or folic acid, opticus neuropathy, and polyneuropathy have been described.	3.1078053712252864
Cerebral vasculitis secondary to Crohn's disease seems to be a very rare phenomenon.	3.8123774984900036
We report on three such cases in three female patients (aged 26, 29, and 61 years).	2.9238586484517954
All patients became symptomatic with a hemiparesis; one complained additionally of a speech disorder, headache, and intermittent loss of orientation.	2.8187233591149523
In CT and MRI scans, multiple lesions were detected; cerebral angiography showed multiple stenoses of middle- and large-sized vessels that were compatible with cerebral vasculitis.	3.299453133391977
Serologic tests concerning vasculitis were inconspicuous at that time.	3.046187768399466
Under anticoagulation (in two cases) and immunosuppressive therapy, neurologic symptoms disappeared.	3.6650128426170743
The serin protease tryptase (ECNr.	3.1027502293154106
3.4.21.59), which is almost exclusively expressed in mast cells, is released by mast cell degranulation in an enzymatically active form together with other mediators, e.g.	2.944294313408247
histamine, into the extracellular space and the circulation.	3.4391239718494027
The capability of the enzyme to directly stimulate several cell types as well as to cleave polypeptide hormones and to activate pro-enzymes suggests a role for tryptase in inflammatory and tissue-remodeling processes.	3.114391120330374
Therefore, in the skin, a role of tryptase is suggested not only in mastocytosis and immediate type hypersensitivity reactions, but also in other inflammatory diseases, degenerative or neoplastic conditions as well as in wound healing, where an accumulation and/or activation of mast cells is found.	4.123820811604582
Extracellular tryptase may be superior to histamine as a parameter for the onset and course of immediate type reactions and as an indicator for the activation of mast cells in other conditions.	3.755366435277054
Its absence during histamine-liberating reactions may suggest basophil activation.	2.851212422515987
In addition, tryptase has been shown to be a sensitive and specific marker for the localization of mast cells in tissues.	3.6443269144198878
Background: Since the development of lacrimal endoscopes with which the mucosa and disorders of the lacrimal drainage system can be examined directly, the choice of surgical technique has changed decisively.	3.9736066195146083
Flexible miniendoscopes can be combined with a laser for the first time, allowing for exact localization of the stenosis and subsequent therapy.	3.9550987944883347
Surgery of tibial plateau fractures with joint involvement (AO classification 41 A1, B1-B3 and C1- C3) makes high demands on traumatological management.	2.795324195109846
By using modern, minimally invasive operative techniques for juxta-articular fractures, it is possible to prevent soft tissue injuries that might affect the functional result.	3.6906021297668112
The aim of this technique is to achieve the exercise stability obtained with standard procedures.	3.311268024448418
Arthroscopically assisted osteosynthesis not only minimizes the surgical soft tissue trauma, but also enables a precise assessment of the articular surfaces under the operation, as well as the simultaneous treatment of concomitant intra-articular injuries, a particular advantage as compared to conventional operative methods.	4.071619506139884
From a total of 54 patients with tibial plateau fractures, arthroscopically assisted osteosynthesis was performed in 34 patients at our clinic from September 1994 to January 1998.	3.6865768055862174
The follow-up of a total of 17 patients revealed good recoveries when assayed by means of the Lysholm and Delamarter score.	3.7401821250636718
We suggest that arthroscopically assisted, minimally invasive osteosynthesis can also be used in selected patients for the treatment of AO classification 41 C1-C3 fractures.	3.6309758637965084
Dorsal tension band fixation is a wide-spread technique of finger arthrodesis.	3.5197669049899805
When using a resorbable PDS-suture as tension band fixation a costly implant removal is not needed.	2.982603702193103
Aim of this study is the investigation of the primary stability of this technique in combination with the cup-in-cone-procedure.	4.311870316161117
From 6 degrees onwards the wire-tension-system requires a higher torque for bending, but in case of higher torque frequently leads to fracture.	3.3996990845460626
The examination shows that the thread-tension-band method by PDS-loop for the stabilisation of finger joint arthrodesis has a sufficient initial stability against bending forces.	2.9679979251970074
Modern medicine has succeeded in achieving enormous technical developments.	3.0707049048123762
One recent highlight has been the introduction of postmortem organ transplantation.	3.773567214757948
At the same time, serious objections have been raised concerning the radical changes in the cultural conception of the inviolable body.	2.9298784157806264
One major objection arises from the conflict of considering a brain-dead person as dead.	3.153645885981629
The presence of brain death is a prerequisite for post-mortem organ donation, because only during this phase of dying does the individual quality as dead while the organs, other than the brain, remain viable.	3.3877867592764557
The objection implies scepticism as to the physician's ability to distinguish a dead from a living person.	3.207908717266352
On the other hand, even the critics must rely on the physician's ability to discriminate, e.g., when to discontinue resuscitation.	2.8520550960841557
The medical community has not found reasons to restrict the definition of irreversible coma 25 years after its first formulation.	3.258065587203902
It must be clearly recognised that reasons other than medical ones can be decisive for refusing organ donation.	2.675435204581484
One ethical problem is the therapeutic benefit of organ transplantation.	3.531994035383744
The beneficiary of the treatment is not the donor, but another person, the recipient.	4.274529395475674
The concept of human dignity does not allow the use of a person fur purposes other than the ones he/she consents to, as Immanuel Kant stated.	3.097251466798251
Although the human corpse is not a person in the full sense, even if it is protected by the thought of respect for the former person, the life-interest of the organ recipient had to be considered legitimate.	3.8499406309666746
The resulting conflict between the respect for the donor and the life-interest of the recipient should be balanced by seeking the donor's consent as far as possible.	2.7767970236100257
The proposed information model seems adequate at the moment.	3.4229630353067084
The report dealt with the medical problems and harmonized them with the Christian value of solidarity.	3.155495878334341
The ethical alternatives to organ transplantation, however, are not mentioned.	3.652591679658966
Within this limitation, the report seems to adequately express the aim to strengthen individual competence and plead for fair perception of the neighbour's life-interest.	2.90042508187792
Starting point for this analysis are the mobility needs and requirements of elderly, as well as problems concerning access and use of public transport.	3.797032408518969
Elderly people as car drivers suffer from several performance deficits which are currently compensated by mobility restrictions and changed driving behaviour.	2.9261293081307818
Driver assistance systems, just available or soon on the market, are demonstrated and analysed with respect to their impact on elderly drivers.	3.4132575486434047
An expert evaluation comes to the conclusion that the most important systems for elderly are: emergency systems, enhanced vision systems and parking aids.	3.486346994481211
Emergency systems can call rescue teams automatically or at driver's request, and direct them to the emergency location.	3.311214176907364
Self imposed restrictions of elderly concerning night driving can partly be compensated by means of curve lightning and automatic dipping.	3.2482933356983033
Parking aids, using cameras or infrared technique are especially helpful for persons with movability problems.	3.074612039681096
The group of helpful, but not highly important driver assistance systems covers several means for longitudinal and lateral control of the car, comprising autonomous cruise control, antilock systems and electronic stability programmes.	3.143688772434513
The value and impact of these systems are analysed in the light of risk homeostasis theory.	3.652433001233073
Reduced work load and ease of mobility will at last result from user centered navigation systems, helping the elder driver also to move to new areas without orientational problems.	2.7223194447233694
The article demonstrates the particular importance of specific layouts of the man-machine-interface for elderly, to guarantee high acceptance and minimal distraction from traffic.	3.0061894664516924
Causal treatment regimens of proven effectiveness in controlled studies are only available for cases of male infertility resulting from hypogonadotropic hypogonadism.	3.3987418468079147
Drug treatment of retrograde ejaculation is also effective but has so far not been tested in double-blind, placebo-controlled randomized studies.	3.2642446713435294
The results of immunosuppressive therapy in cases of immunological male infertility are still controversial .	3.3208902480004103
In addition, antiphlogistic and antibiotic treatment of chronic male genital tract infections has not been shown to improve male fertility.	3.636281580968205
Inconsistent results have been obtained with empirical therapy - e.g., with kallikein, tamoxifen, clomiphene, pentoxifylline, mast cell blockers, testolacton, vitamin E, captopril, alpha receptor blockers, glutathione, indometacin, interferon alpha, growth hormone, zinc salts, ketoprofen, mesterone or testosterone undecanoate - or the studies performed are not sufficient to allow a final judgement.	2.892159365440508
Recent studies have indicated a possible impairment of sperm function by pure FSH, while GnrH and FSH have no influence on spermatogenesis in normogonadotropic men.	2.8373584661772036
In 40 patients with Alzheimer's disease (AD), in 5 patients with non-AD dementia and in 36 cognitively normal controls the concentration of protein tau was determined in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF).	3.647221547026566
Of the AD patients, 19 were very mildly demented (MMSE score from 25 to 28).	3.0308268539401375
Even in these patients, CSF tau was significantly more elevated than in controls.	3.453717608981849
In the non-AD patients protein tau was less increased.	3.679824723446133
Among the AD patients there was no association between CSF tau and severity of cognitive impairment or deficit in cerebral blood flow, determined by SPECT.	3.5321519268143495
Our findings suggest that CSF tau may be elevated even at the predementia stage of AD and be useful as a biological marker for the early recognition of the disease.	3.2983359439971895
The aim of our review is to summarize relevant data on the perioperative use of anti-ischaemic drugs in patients at risk for or with proven coronary heart disease.	2.967444119938837
The accessible medical literature according to current electronic information sources was explored.	3.032380709831206
One in every eight general anaesthetics is administered to a patient at risk for or with proven coronary heart disease.	2.8637514796952863
Of these patients, it is estimated that 20% - 40% have perioperative myocardial ischaemia (PMI), the majority being nonsymptomatic.	4.201067060577947
This figure correlates with the occurrence of postoperative cardiac complications and myocardial infarction.	3.6567119655804188
The anaesthetist therefore has an important role to play in reducing the rate of perioperative cardiac sequelae.	4.056235532009403
This can be achieved with good control of haemodynamic stability and the timely and appropriate use of antiischaemic drugs.	2.970498786465713
Nitrocompounds (nitrates, molsidomine) serve as the gold standard in current angina pectoris treatment.	3.2047316261982797
Acting as coronary and systemic vasodilators, they effect an immediate reduction in preload and have been shown to be the drugs of first choice for intraoperative myocardial ischaemia.	3.666052687518304
Beta-blockers reduce the rate of PMI to a greater extent than nitrates.	3.276288513590935
Single pre-operative administration of beta-blockers has also been shown to be beneficial in reducing theincidence of perioperative tachycardia, hypertension, and PMI.	3.494703102808845
Consequently, such one-time medication can be considered for previously untreated high-risk patients presenting for surgery.	3.7113096747348644
The continuation of oral calcium channel blockers to the morning of surgery also reduces the rate of PMI and myocardial infarction in coronary-bypass patients, and combination with beta-blockers enhances this effect.	3.582282717710637
Intra-operative diltiazem infusions are similarly advantageous in this patient group.	3.143100897323182
In addition to nitrates, calcium antagonists are the drug of choice for coronary vasospasm.	3.2045449157071846
Drugs inhibiting platelet aggregation have a particular role in patients with coronary heart disease, however, they also cause increased perioperative bleeding.	4.249957187780143
Consequently, it is recommended that these medications be discontinued 5 - 10 days prior to major surgery, with the exception of high-risk patients.	3.8207070702702692
Pilot studies using alpha2-agonists have shown reduced anaesthetic requirements and a reduction in PMI.	3.4055052601367217
The perioperative relevance of these drugs is currently being investigated.	3.5496802973665593
Beta-blockers, calcium channel blockers, nitrates, and possibly alpha2-agonists lead to reduced rates of PMI and other cardiac complications in risk patients.	3.0500744322147932
Current anti-anginal medications, with the exception of anti-platelet agents, should be maintained to the day of surgery and continued as soon as possible thereafter.	3.74206360075324
All of these drugs except anti-platelet agents may also be used intra-operatively, however, possible interactions with anaesthetic agents should be carefully considered.	3.8858236156100454
Inflammatory bowel diseases (Crohn's disease, ulcerative colitis) were thought to be psychosomatic disorders.	2.778481548979817
However, this argument has recently been questioned by many researchers.	3.0567904825603605
At the same time, biomedical factors have been described that were claimed to play a role in the aetiology and modulation of the course of inflammatory bowel diseases (IBD).	3.7941494641997187
In the present paper, the state of research regarding both biomedical and psychosomatic factors of the aetiology and course of IBD is reviewed and critically evaluated from a methodological perspective.	3.3054514883144432
Results covering the following topics are presented: epidemiology; sociodemographic variables; genetic factors; dietary factors and cigarette smoking; drugs; permeability of bowel epithelia; immunological factors; microbiological factors; psychiatric disorders, affective symptoms, personality factors; life events and psychosocial stress; quality of life; and coping with the illness.	3.1467534027781663
Among biomedical factors, a genetically based pathological immune reaction is highly probable.	3.2879986295611094
However, the findings of immunological disturbances are of a more descriptive nature and seem to explain not the aetiological process of the development of the disease, but rather a kind of disposition.	4.03806745609905
The question of which agents trigger the pathological immune cascade is still under investigation.	3.112573208791744
Interesting findings can possibly be expected of the psycho-neuro-immunological research in this area.	2.875753001398484
Results of research on psychological pathology (psychiatric disorders, personality factors) are inconclusive.	3.286200254241362
In particular, some modern, well-controlled studies have not been able to confirm the findings of the older literature.	3.7574047668322126
Part of the high rate of psychiatric morbidity might be due to effects of selective sampling of more disturbed subjects.	4.141496396637014
Research pertaining to the influence of distressing life events has also yielded inconsistent results.	3.4999562704343568
Prospective studies about the association of psychosocial stress and somatic symptomatology mostly demonstrated cross-sectional correlations which did not allow for causal interpretations.	3.139325313897471
However, coping research has shown interesting results that point to the mediating influence of coping strategies on the course of the disease.	2.904873644183097
Finally, perspectives for future research are suggested.	3.0951588011261597
Genital infection, particularly bacterial vaginosis (BV), increases the relative risk of prematurity.	3.1228122187232636
Detection of disturbances of vaginal milieu at an early stage and the use of suitable countermeasures such as intervention with antimicrobial substances can reduce the preterm birth rate.	3.3779013456201468
A pregnancy with a partial or complete hydatidiform mole and a coexistent living fetus is a rare condition.	4.000074286809057
Most cases are consistent with a twin pregnancy, with distinct borders between placenta and mole on sonography.	2.8789879704024752
We report a case with a single placenta with cystic structures resembling histologically a complete hydatidiform mole.	3.1361529535753947
The pregnancy resulted in a diploid female fetus in the 34th week of gestation with marked hypotrophy.	3.2601986344947904
The non-molar part of the placenta showed a complex alteration of villous maturity resulting in intrauterine growth retardation but a living fetus.	3.019174642996109
No malignancy occured post partum.	3.3117078699438665
The clinical and pathogenetic aspects of this rare entity are discussed.	3.5971830018531836
So far, necrosis of the lunate bone has been interpreted in the literature as a phenomenon with a traumatic, primarily vascular-arterial or mechanical causation.	3.179901466788002
These models seem problematic, since neither the patients' histories nor the macroscopic-radiographical or histological appearances can be reconciled with them.	3.1535209437935405
In contrast, the model of a primarily venous aetiopathogenesis accepted for idiopathic necrosis of the femoral head is now examined.	2.9224598510014665
Evaluation of 125 cases of lunate bone necrosis treated in the Department of Orthopaedics at the University Hospital in Heidelberg between 1958 and 1993 made it possible to reconstruct the spontaneous course of the condition.	3.9525202857311386
X-Ray material, core spin tomographic images and material from a prospective study carried out in 49 patients with unexplained painful conditions of the wrist were available.	3.7969798466865856
A stage-by-stage progression emerged, which initially caused alterations only in the MR image, while the X-ray picture remained unremarkable.	3.842933590466043
It was recognized from the spontaneous course that subsequent changes in the shape of the diseased lunate bones were always the result of the necrotic transformation process and never the cause of it.	3.7445311820272766
This meant that fractures were excluded as a possible cause of necrosis of the lunate bone.	3.5253045142780732
The spontaneous course was used as the basis of a stage-related classification for lunate bone necrosis.	3.8919700308328187
In a pressure measurement test, the behaviour of the intraosseous pressure in 16 necrotic lunate bones, 16 healthy lunate bones and 16 healthy capitate bones was tested under various functional conditions.	3.1542304675395294
The pressure fluctuations in the capitate bones were very slight, while in the healthy lunate bones pressure increased significantly during extension of the wrist.	3.1329719425954567
The position-dependent pressure increases in the lunate bones indicated that the venous drainage was constantly in jeopardy.	3.6363750333614324
The pressure increases in necrotic lunate bones were significantly in excess of those in healthy ones; in some cases they were far in excess of the systolic blood pressure.	3.4931848641012704
The anatomical causes of the pronounced pressure increases were examined experimentally.	3.1920930207399323
After staining of both the arteries and the veins, epoxy sheet plastination was used to fix six fresh cadaver arms in the neutral position and six in extension.	3.172650470745232
The anatomical preparations made it possible to see that venous drainage from the lunate bone was being prevented; this explained the pronounced pressure increases.	3.078624810153228
The unphysiological position of the base of the radius inclined in the palmar direction relative to the hand axis when it was extended dorsally was the crucial factor in the development of necrosis.	3.767842653572392
Evaluation of the histories of the patients with necrosis of the lunate bone made it clear that trauma was not significantly involved in the causation, while manual work had an important role.	3.7260564920158914
Most manual activites are performed with the wrist in extension.	3.6175753606130057
Any extension favours triggering of bone necrosis through congestion in the venous trunk.	3.187349524419969
Thus, our investigations have shown that the beginning of this illness starts with congestion such as occurs with every extension of the wrist, which is initially physiological, before further factors favouring the process cause it to take a pathologic course.	3.5927769058175825
The results of the German National Health Interview and Examination Survey 1998 confirm allergies as widespread diseases in Germany.	2.721600866915806
In total 40 to 43 % of the adult population have or have had an allergic disease.	3.249825554509255
The morbidity was assessed using a self-administered questionnaire and a personal interview performed by a physician.	3.7418773081760883
The agreement between questionnaire and interview data is greater than 90 % for allergic rhinitis, food allergy and urticaria and about 80 % for contact dermatitis and asthma.	3.18405348590144
The results of both assessment methods showed remarkable differences between East and West Germany.	2.7513272254105368
Using the interview data 17 % of the West but only 11 % of the East German adults have/had e.g.	2.801054304498321
Comparable differences exist for contact dermatitis.	3.4759184398200182
Many people with allergies suffer or have suffered from several allergies.	3.0620077495171993
Frequent patterns of combination are food allergy/allergic rhinitis and asthma/allergic rhinitis.	3.030072594383107
The relative increase is higher in East than in West.	3.2135312239691505
The time trend in prevalence of asthma could only be calculated for the West German population.	3.148184985284202
The results show a remarkable increase here, too.	3.0546314184876397

Higher aggressiveness has been suggested as an important clinical feature.	4.123864836643972

The criteria for histological diagnosis have been outlined by Carcangiu et al.	2.6623206919277576
Because of its aggressiveness, radical treatment at primary surgery appears advisable.	2.8215266509396573
Its clear distinction from undifferentiated (anaplastic) and medullary (C cell) cancers is important, as thyroglobulin is regularly synthesized by cancer cells.	2.8576259899124694
Enrichment of radioactive iodine makes such treatment feasible postoperatively and at relapse.	3.0922883090141164
Follow-up should be performed as in highly differentiated papillary and follicular thyroid cancer.	3.3195724122011447

While all cancers were advanced at the initial diagnosis, the observed disease courses were in agreement with the assumption that insular carcinoma is a more aggressive form of differentiated thyroid cancer.	3.18547516347153

The surgical management of vesicovaginal fistulae (VVF) is a matter of controversy.	3.034122367478649
This study deals with our experience with transvaginally treated patients suffering from VVF.	3.7593934409556256
Between 1966 and 1996, 64 patients with VVF were treated surgically.	3.8194184867199725
The VVF occurred in the course of hysterectomy in 54 patients, was due to radiotherapy in 7, was a result of obstetric complications in 2 patients, and occurred after colporrhaphy in 1 patient.	4.413045786698323
In 60 of these 64 patients closure of the fistula was carried out transvaginally.	3.8041548022799687
Fourteen of these 60 patients (23 %) had undergone prior surgical attempts to close the VVF (1 to 3 procedures).	3.364058380356893
Transvaginal surgery was successful at first attempt in 55 of these 60 patients (92 %).	3.1918603608012504
The other 5 patients were successfully treated by a second procedure (again transvaginal: n = 3; transabdominal: n = 2).	3.3820068014740974
In conclusion, the transvaginal approach to close VVF is of advantage, avoiding an abdominal incision and reducing postoperative morbidity.	2.755203503422326
In the vast majority of the cases isolated VVF can be treated successfully by transvaginal repair.	4.069907623370694
Myotonic dystrophy is an autosomal dominant multisystem disorder involving muscle, brain, heart, eyes, and endocrine organs.	3.221133166471073
The underlying mutation is an expanding trinucleotide CTG repeat in the 3'prime untranslated region of a serine-threonine kinase gene on chromosome 19q.	2.6971702814687752
A statistical correlation exists between the CTG copy number and the severity of the disease.	3.191046213259611
Infants with severe congenital myotonic dystrophy have been shown to have on average a greater amplification of the CTG repeat than is seen in the non-congenital myotonic dystrophy population.	3.810814927554979
However, not all patients with many CTG copies develop congenital myotonic dystrophy.	3.2563379896285545
We present 13 patients with more than 1500 CTG trinucleotide repeats and show their variable clinical course.	3.1587349206584916

In 300 patients with 339 coronary lesions the percent diameter stenosis (%-DS) was assessed both by visual estimation and by digital quantitative coronary angiography (DQCA) by use of an on-line computer workstation.	3.167449644239897
The decision for coronary angioplasty in the same setting ("prima vista"-PTCA) was based on history, evidence of ischemia and visual estimation of %-DS.	3.478534472666846
In contrast to DQCA visual estimation led to a bimodal distribution with a nadir at ~55% between two peaks at ~45% and ~75% and a mean of 70.5  +/-  19.6%.	3.1074595248740327
Visual estimation underestimated lesions in the range of 30-55% and overestimated the %-DS between 55-99%.	3.6095808575835058
Visual estimation revealed a %-DS >= 60% in 251 stenoses (74.0%) of the 339 lesions, an estimate that led to subsequent "prima vista"-PTCA.	2.9903564539663656
Conversely, DQCA revealed only 184 stenoses (54.3%) with a %-DS >= 60%; thus, 86 stenoses (25.3%) did not meet the morphologic indication criteria for PTCA.	3.1416710824550087
The bimodal distribution of stenosis severity according to visual analysis with an overestimation of borderline stenosis severity reflects a tendency for "self-referral" of patients for PTCA.	3.182978779261501
DQCA serves as an objective tool in the decision-making process for PTCA and may reduce "cosmetic" interventions or justify to defer PTCA.	3.6147523295285713
Especially in the selection process for "prima vista"-PTCA DQCA-quantification of stenosis severity is recommended.	2.8240272287081223
S-100 protein and neuron-specific enolase (NSE) serum concentrations serve as markers of cerebral damage in cardiac surgery, neurology, or after head injury.	3.1980795571968352
In these circumstances, S-100 and NSE levels correspond with the results of neuropsychological tests.	3.5034956643199973
The present study investigated the diagnostic value in orthopaedic patients after joint replacement.	2.954545186778204
Since its introduction in clinical use more than ten years ago, propofol is well appreciated for sedation and supplemental hypnosis in anaesthesia.	3.2838725284986667
However the substance is approved only for anaesthesia in children elder than three years.	3.139637971432643
As can be substantiated by many data reported in literature, there are no pharmacokinetic or pharmacodynamic reasons whatsoever to withhold propofol from the younger children; this applies both to the use as a narcotic supplement and as a short term hypnotic for diagnostic and therapeutic interventions.	3.3766614164781767
A sufficient therapy should be based on a differential diagnosis by means of an active standing test or a tilt-table test.	4.201272954426033
Three typical pathological reactions of blood pressure and heart rate can be differentiated.	3.574192492482842
The hypoadrenergic orthostatic hypotension is characterised by an immediate drop in blood pressure (systolic drop >20 mmHg below base line within 3 min) with or without compensatory tachycardia.	3.568506116555815
Tachycardia (>30 beats per minute above base line within 10 min) without significant blood pressure drop but with a fall of cerebral blood flow indicates a postural tachycardia syndrome.	3.22880052991608
In general, there is no further somatic dysfunction.	3.697172176304609
Increased venous pooling is thought to be the assumed pathomechanism.	3.8374933552552646
A reflex mechanism evokes the neurocardiogenic syncope after a certain time of standing: sympathetic inhibition yields a strong blood pressure drop and vagal activation bradycardia.	2.8052719274885085
Proved therapies include use of the mineralocorticoide fludrocortison (hypoadrenergic orthostatic hypotension), of the a-agonist midodrin (postural tachycardia syndrome) and of b-blockers (neurocardiogenic syncope).	3.2123922009849806
Due to didactic reasons one can distinguish 3 gropus of such disorders: -  Paradigmatic diseases of the spine with an inherent proneness to stiffness.	3.0958263075672936
-  Rare diseases which involve a certain danger of stiffening the spine.	3.031466347534515
-  Rigidity of the spine due to scientifically unrecognised morphologic phenomena.	3.403499294661487

Several different theories exist about the orign of kinetosis and the space adaption syndrome, with individual sensitivities differing significantly.	2.884831302165109
One explanation involves the hypothesis of a different otolith mass between the right and left statolith organ and especially a difference in the utricles.	3.42773198511778
A difference in mass results in a different sensitivity to acceleration.	3.883585396539567
For this reason we measured interindividual variances in saccular and utricular otolith mass.	2.452699623360084
Since the anatomy of the vestibular organ in vertebrates is based as similar principles, we selected fish (salmon and trout) as our study model to facilitation preparations.	2.8082091021684086
The maximum difference in mass in the saccule was 17% and was generally smaller in the utricle, although in individual cases was much higher.	3.2048697612453734
We assume that a misbalanced sensitivity of the statolith organs occurs but is totally compensated for by the vestibular system as long as physiological motion patterns take place.	3.103141133931312
Decompensation leads to kinetosis under non-physiological motion patterns.	3.058336663882383
When the vestibular system is better balanced and has an equally distributed otolith mass to both sides, the possibility for developing kinetosis or space adaption syndrome is much less likely.	3.174708533125152

We measured glucocorticoid receptor (GR) number and affinity as a function of the exposure of cells to different amounts of IL-6.	3.309345979216033
Incubation for 20 h with IL-6 at increasing concentrations up to 2000 pg/ml yielded a significant increase of GR binding sites in both cell lines.	3.420712032911685
IL-6 was also able to reverse the inhibitory effect of dexamethasone (1 µmol/l) on GR in both cell lines.	3.307259139988456
In MG-63 cells, expressing higher concentrations of GR, IL-6 deprivation via a specific anti-IL-6 antibody (100 ng/ml) significantly decreased GR.	3.291962864155199
In Saos-2 cells, expressing lower concentrations of GR, a 40 h treatment with human IL-1 (10 ng/ml) significantly increased both IL-6 production and GR.	3.537215293800197
Our results provide evidence that IL-6 is an autocrine positive modulator of GR number in human osteoblasts.	3.1106077934106224

The simulation of unilateral deafness is very rare.	3.6304533013952214
Objective findings are of special interest if it happens.	3.8834767538402204
A patient with alleged deafness on the left-hand side due to commotio cerebri was treated in our hospital.	2.9504686028488445
Pure tone audiometry showed deafness on the left-hand side and normal hearing on the right-hand side.	3.3157661392675415
However, stapedius reflexes were found ipsilaterally left as well as contralaterally right, at 0.5 to 2 kHz with a stimulation of approxamately 90 dB SPL.	3.075478900433608
Transiently evoked otoacoustic emissions (TEOAE) and distortion-product otoacoustic emissions (DPOAE) were measured.	2.8749269848313537
The TEOAE had the same reproducibility but a very low response on both sides, such that inner ear function could not be evaluated.	3.5400783802192812
In comparison, the DP gram showed clear DP amplitudes over the whole frequency range on both sides.	3.021827592061041
Nonphysiological DPs could be excluded by assessing the DP growth rate at three different frequencies.	3.6536902757662144
By means of brainstem electric response audiometry (BERA), with which the IV/V complex was detectable up to stimulation with 20 dB SPL clicks, and the Stenger test, a neural or central hearing loss could be excluded.	3.077110726689411
Normal hearing on the left-hand side was thus confirmed.	3.34858707415998
In cases of simulated deafness it is possible to prove a normal inner ear function by DPOAE.	3.1653076955013564

Radiofrequency catheter ablation is the treatment of choice in atrioventricular nodal reentrant tachycardia.	3.7544970306412706
Electrophysiologic investigations in 623 patients revealed eight mechanisms of tachycardia ablation: Ablation of fast (I) or slow(II), modification of fast (III) or slow AV nodal pathways (IV), modification of both pathways (V), ablation of fast and modification of slow (VI), ablation of slow and modification of fast pathways (VII) and ablation of both pathways (VIII).	3.321818036424652
The criteria of diagnosis of these eight mechanisms of tachycardia ablation are described.	3.11050895409979
Follow-up showed fewer relapses in patients with ablation (0-2%) in comparison to patients with modification of a single AV nodal pathway (8-12%).	4.28031134590356
Alteration of both pathways includes an increasing risk of total AV nodal block, which occured in 7 patients (1.1%).	3.5100641163769883
Detailed analysis of the mechanism of catheter ablation is recommended in all patients after radiofrequency current delivery for AV nodal reentrant tachycardia to estimate the risk of relapsing during follow-up or development of total AV block in the particular patient in case of a further ablation procedure.	4.768884316263263
An increasing life expectancy leads to a higher number of persons aged 70-84 years and persons aged 85 years and older.	3.174281277135699
Information concerning changes in the spectrum of psychiatric morbidity is rare.	4.60083465329666
The Berlin Aging Study was based on a representative age- and gender-stratified sample (n = 516) of Berlin citizens aged 70-100 years and older.	3.3401081086117395

On the self-rating scale (BL) 10 % of all persons reported severe subjective complaints, 32 % moderate complaints.	3.2845795177495645
On the BPRS, 17 % showed severe psychopathological symptomatology, 75 % at least mild symptoms.	2.907337126037675
Following the criteria of DSM-III-R, 23.5 % of all persons had a psychiatric disease, 4.2 % a disease of severe intensity.	3.1416389653866137
When the DSM-III-R diagnoses "Not Otherwise Specified" (NOS) were included 40.4 % of all subjects were diagnosed by the clinical judgement of the psychiatrists to have a psychiatric disease.	3.148542972527795
The most frequent psychiatric diseases were insomnia (18.8 %), depression NOS (17.8 %) and dementia (13.8 %).	2.743157175483409
Dementia showed the well-known age-related increase, whereas no other incidences of psychiatric morbidity were age-related.	3.919697950916533
Persons aged 70-84 years did not differ in the investigated psychiatric variables from persons aged 85 years and older, the only exception being the prevalence of dementia.	3.20577605689497

The sonographic diagnosis of malignant lymphoma in childhood is described.	4.066730485346635
Malignant lymphomas are sonographically relatively uniform: initial enlargement of the lymph nodes and organs involved and disturbance of normal echo texture by mainly hypoechoic lesions can be found.	3.268794895202364
Generally, four sonographic patterns of infiltration are described: diffuse, small nodular, large nodular and bulky type.	2.89834669903133
Secondary, tumor-related or inflammatory complications (e. g. dislocation or compression of vessels, thoracic inlet syndrome, venous thrombosis, ileus, urinary retention, abscess and effusion) can be sonographically evaluated.	3.609836674945145
Response to therapy correlates with normalization of size and echo texture and recovery from tumor-related complications.	3.2387381705195795
Differential diagnosis with ultrasound is based on the topographic distribution and echo pattern of infiltration and, with certain restrictions, on the echogenicity of lesions and perfusion feasible with Doppler sonography.	3.5796364823949185
The primary diagnosis has to be established histologically.	3.885159061195249

The German social security legislation has recognized only recently the concern of quality assessment in the field of social and medical services.	3.2529969203318396
The legal frame for quality assessment in the field of medical treatment was enacted in the sickness insurance provision (Social Code - Book V) only in 1989.	3.0224836513773417
Quality assessment is considered to be a part of the production of medical services and, therefore, is regulated in the context of providing medical services.	4.11393703519496
The legal provisions do not establish standards for quality and quality assessment.	3.185319898351361
Due to the variety of medical services, quality assessment is not regulated in an exhaustive or systematic manner.	3.400831444803801
According to the law, providers of medical services (doctors, hospitals) are bound to participate in quality assessment.	3.2763556153496696
As internal quality assessment prevails in the definition of the various measures of quality assessment and the control of quality in all fields of medical treatment, external quality assessment is also prescribed for hospitals.	4.559501750433733
Because the establishment of quality assessment is considered to be a part of the service production organization, consumers (patients) or their representatives are not involved in the definition, establishment, and control of quality assessment.	3.990450068208798
The participation of patients should be provided by law.	3.708285818259014

Material and Methods: To discuss these aspects, the documented data on TAPP operations that have been carried out in this department since 1993 were analyzed.	3.3305153689779403

Results: A total of 778 teaching procedures were performed by 10 surgeons with an individual experience of 30.5 operations (median).	3.2637323957895568
Before starting the first procedure, 89 were done by assistants operating the camera.	3.2389523668334808
The morbidity of teaching operations was 1.9 % compared to 1.4 % for those performed by experts.	2.98724433054612
After a median follow-up of 23 months there were two recurrences (0.23 %) in the expert group and none in the teaching group (follow-up 16 months).	3.553664868585703
Conclusion: Because of the potentials of standardization of the TAPP technique, the results of teaching were equal to expert operations.	4.31715469652433
Therefore, TAPP is suitable for application in a routine setting.	3.685634148640761

To minimize the risk of bleeding, we improved the high-frequency technology in several steps.	3.606698999269901
To achieve this, the output signals of commercially available high-frequency generators were modulated to the effect that each cut results in an efficient coagulation zone in the tissue at excellent cutting quality.	3.4095105928686347
Laboratory and in vitro studies using porcine kidneys as well as clinical trials showed good cutting characteristics accompanied by a significant reduction of bleeding.	4.279373804585078

The historical opinion that the intima layer of a ruptured artery of muscular type could stop bleeding by "rolling in" should be controlled experimentally.	2.964027313745078
Five segments of human femoral/popliteal artery (3-4 cm long) were overstretched until complete rupture occured.	3.69984862942449
Furthermore a longitudinally split and a partially oblique incised segment were ruptured.	2.8836182734649762
As morphological findings a sandclock deformity was observed in the region of rupture.	3.9479963794882726
This phenomenon was induced by adventitia layer, which closed the ends of ruptured media layer like a Chinese finger trap.	2.9487719725382115
In the longitudinally split segment a transverse rupture of the media layer could be observed, while the fibers of adventitia layer were pulled out when the traction was continued.	3.409881324539113
Neither macroscopical nor microscopical signs could be found for "rolling in" of intima or media layer.	2.616091274242167

There are two types of diabetes mellitus.	3.159384812966287
Type I, insulin-dependent diabetes (IDDM), which becomes manifest before the age of 40, is the result of an absolute deficiency of insulin.	3.7429284683131194
Type II, the non-insulin-dependent diabetes (NIDDM), develops in the elderly and is caused by a relative insulin deficiency.	3.8207772045964257
Patients with type-I diabetes are prone to the development of ketoacidosis, while type II causes hyperglycaemic, hyperosmolar, nonketotic coma.	3.3110371671263463
Apart from these acute metabolic alterations, the long-term complications of diabetes are of concern to the anaesthesiologist.	3.370191106790172
Hypertension, coronary artery disease, renal insufficiency and autonomic neuropathy are common and can result in myocardial ischaemia, cardiovascular instability and gastroparesis, with an increased risk of aspiration.	4.2947043496621005
Limited movement of the atlanto-occipital joint can cause difficult intubation.	3.247341590821225
To avoid perioperative metabolic catastrophy, blood glucose concentration should be kept between 6.7 and 10 mmol - l-1 (120 - 180 mg - dl-1).	3.076710303141909
Hypoglycaemia can result in neurological damage, whereas hyperglycaemia causes impaired wound healing and susceptibility to infections and worsens ischaemic damage to the myocardium and brain.	3.692493439105035
Perioperative diabetes management depends on the severity of the surgical procedure and the type of diabetes.	4.434970812507691
All type-I diabetics, whatever operation being performed, need insulin.	3.2338988199495247
The intravenous route is recommended as it allows better adjustment.	3.761265772163836
After determination of the fasting blood glucose level, insulin is given at a dosage of 0.5 - 1 U - h-1 (at gluc<11.1 mmol - l-1), 1.5 - 2 U - h-1 (at gluc 11.1 - 16.7 mmol - l-1) or 3  U - h-1 (at gluc>16.7 mmol - l-1).	2.686991071151914
In addition, 5 - 10 g glucose - h-1 is given.	3.703191428058346
In type-II diabetes the oral antidiabetic drug is withheld.	3.1669728451715895
During minor surgery the blood glucose concentration is monitored frequently, and if necessary insulin (with gluc>13.9 mmol - l-1) or glucose is given.	3.160506834180188
In most cases of major surgery insulin therapy will be necessary.	3.3037049684909765
Administration should follow the guidelines listed for type-I diabetes.	3.2409128340505418
Whether the intravenous or the subcutaneous route is used for insulin, repeated glucose determinations are mandatory.	3.1741746597385156
If ketoacidosis develops the volume depletion is treated with normal saline.	3.2910654831427832
For hyperglycaemia and acidosis insulin (3 - 6 U - h-1) with 10 - 20 mmol - h-1 potassium phosphate is given.	3.8292832243503443
Bicarbonate is only indicated when the serum pH is lower than 7.1.	3.7971416109999057
It must be borne in mind that perioperative management of diabetes does not end with postanaesthesia care.	2.801623229938607
At the beginning of the 19 th century, institutional care for the insane was established by the various German states.	2.9222628825491936
At first, the separation of curable and incurable patients influenced psychiatric care and the construction of hospitals.	3.099522116116911
The combination of care and cure in one hospital in Illenau was a turning point in institutional care.	3.031459361408337
Contradictory tendencies characterized the second half of the 19 th century: the integration with general medicine in the cities, on the one hand, the social separation and cure in the seclusion of the countryside, on the other.	3.1908901485859564
The following building styles were dominant: in England, panoptic architecture; in the United States, linear staggered structures; in France, the "carrés isolés"; and in Germany, the structure of blocks with cross-axes.	3.0054428023822206
At the end of the 19 th century, the system of pavilions was internationally accepted; occupational therapy and mental care in the countryside were introduced.	2.8612198159339566
From the First World War until the end of the 1960 s, a standstill in psychiatric buildings was noted in Germany, and institutional care came under increasing criticism.	3.248400856676581
There was a reorientation from the middle of the 1970 s as a result of more effective therapeutic possibilities.	3.370470294975988
A variety of complementary institutions, outpatient and partly inpatient therapies, which were recommended by the "Psychiatrie-Enquête", started to be realized.	3.217729707118724
Principles of organization like the construction of a communicative quiet inner room, or grading the rooms from public to private, were structurally integrated.	2.810332131153451
Specific structural requirements for the construction and design of psychiatric hospitals should be evaluated in more detail by post-occupancy methods.	3.339779929436344

Other important techniques were CT, MRI, and angiography, which may contribute to a reliable diagnosis of vascular or biliary complications.	3.4901665436750844
Results: Second to primary organ dysfunction, vascular complications are the most frequent cause of graft loss.	3.6518332374128164
Thrombosis of the hepatic artery is the most common and most serious vascular complication, with a reported incidence from 4 to 42 %.	3.3911374895894753
Bile duct sludge, leaks and strictures are frequent complications after liver transplantation, which can contribute to graft dysfunction.	3.6750463226460717
Biliary tract complications usually occur within the first 3 months and require interventional radiological or surgical therapy.	3.7497669297112965

The classification of acetabular fractures and especially the diagnosis of additional lesions can be misleading, when the personal experience is limited and the decisions are based only on conventional radiographs.	4.120668853775666
The introduction of Spiral-CT with multiplanar reformations and 3-D views has improved the quality of visualization.	3.6558537189369966
Due to their higher costs, the need of these additional diagnostic tools is frequently questioned.	3.5840911825330157
This paper discusses the relevance of plain radiographs, 2-D-CTs, 3-D-CTs and Femursubtraction-CTs (FsCT) for the classification of acetabular fractures, based on a controlled study.	3.990223205063036
Methods: Thirty physicians with different levels of experience in acetabular surgery were divided in three groups of 10 each: group I comprised residents without operative experience in acetabular surgery, group II was physicians with 3-10 years of operative experience, and group III was experts in acetabular surgery.	3.576431828952029
The task for each candidate was to classify the fracture according to Letournel and to identify all additional injuries within the hip joint (e. g. marginal impaction, head fractures, etc.).	3.0087620341502523
The different diagnostic "levels" could be ordered stepwise according to personal need and no time limit was given.	2.8018653585313853
The case was finished when the candidate presented his final diagnosis.	2.984936876747408
The use of the different radiographs, the preliminary diagnosis, the changes in diagnosis, and the final decisions were recorded.	4.207042030946632
These findings were correlated with the different levels of experience and against a "consensus classification" which was generated by thorough discussion, and the use of intraoperative information and postoperative radiographs not accessible to the candidates.	3.9505230031000886
Results: The "correct" fracture classification based on plain radiographs was: group I, 11 %; group II, 32 %; group III, 61 %.	3.3728815452427403
Based on 2-D-CT a "correct" diagnosis was reached by 30 % in group I, by 55 % in group II, and by 76 % in group III.	4.144340670612922
With consideration of the "transient forms" in acetabular fractures based on Letournel and the 3-D-CT used mainly by group I, the rate of "correct" classifications rose to 65 % in group I, 64 % in group II and 83 % in group III.	3.8311881891486728
The modifiers were diagnosed "correctly" in group I by 37 %, in group II by 56 %, and in group III by 73 %.	4.369160070237719
The use of the 3-D-CT and especially the Fs-CT by group I resulted in an improvement in the rate of correct classifications to 61 %, whereas in group II the Fs-Ct was used only exceptionally.	3.6762135186238507
The 2-D-CT was the basis for the diagnosis of the additional lesions in acetabular fractures within all groups resulting in 73 % complete diagnoses in group III.	3.791355262961202
This study showed the importance of CT for the exact analysis and classification of acetabular fractures.	3.864103896709685
In particular, the secondary reformations in CT and the 3-D-views dramatically improved the rate of "correct" classifications in the group of surgeons with limited personal experience in acetabular surgery.	3.410951519589518
This allows the less experienced an acceptable level of "correct" diagnoses, so that the treatment options can be weighed correctly.	3.331104630166876
Among the "experts" a rate of divergent classifcations of approximately 20 % was observed, especially in "transient" forms of acetabular fractures.	3.601607263153193

Today, enzyme therapy with proteolytic enzymes still only plays a minor role in clinical practice, partially due to the belief that intestinal resorption of macromolecules is impossible.	3.310362671767561
However, there is scientific evidence of intestinal resorption and a subsequent increase in proteolytic serum activity, and placebo-controlled randomised clinical trials have demonstrated positive effects of enzyme therapy.	3.413310725791207
The documented effects include the reduction of oedema and resorption of haematoma, resulting in pain reduction and better mobility.	3.556209962368205
There are indications to use such therapies in the areas of general surgery, traumatology, plastic surgery, and dental surgery.	3.1979563094389296
A further effect is higher tissue concentration of antibiotics in combination with proteolytic enzymes.	3.69347847213605
In gynaecological treatments, enzymes are administered in breast surgery and to reduce the side effects of obstetrical injuries.	3.7310137436693305
Further studies concerning enzyme therapy are justified because of the interesting possibilities offered by these substances and a favourable relationship between costs and benefits.	3.233540345155839
High-frequency ventilation and inhaled nitric oxide represent - among others - two treatment options in hypoxemic respiratory failure of neonates.	2.961439701448433
We report the case of a term infant with meconium aspiration syndrome, who only responded favorably to inhaled nitric oxide following the initiation of high-frequency ventilation.	2.9924413679714332
At an oxygenation index of 17 we started treatment with nitric oxide in order to reverse right-to-left shunting and improve oxygenation.	3.415176578511985
How- ever the respiratory situation did not improve, the oxygenation index increased to 25.	3.29290475891445
