Again oxyena-tion was unaffected with an oxygenation index of meanwhile 31.	2.9793229470341758
At that stage of a second trial of inhaled nitric oxide was started at a concentration of 10 ppm while continuing high-frequency ventilation.	3.3418907026380906
Immediately oxygenation improved significantly, the oxygenation index decreased to 9 within several minutes after restarting nitric oxide.	3.056378742576767
This effect on oxygenation was sustained for the duration of several days during high-frequency ventilation until gradual weaning from iNO could be performed.	3.51902997540264
Learning microsurgery of the middle ear requires preparations of temporal bones.	3.5976060004215356
Ethical and moral restrictions in obtaining specimens make training and research with temporal bone preparations increasingly more difficult.	2.9945249641362928
Due to the complex structure of the temporal bone with its communicating cavities, the manufacture of facsimiles up to now has been impossible.	3.2601439884741485
Rapid prototyping techniques must be able to produce identical objects from an original one.	3.0154348885396445
By using CT scans of temporal bones from anatomic preparations and patients we have been able to reconstruct 3D pictures on a CAD workstation.	3.190141738124736
We are now able to incorporate data in a stereolithographic system to create an anatomic facsimile of the temporal bone.	3.1066420173432934
It is possible to produce a considerable number of these facsimiles from the same real object.	3.899499111827651
With this method we can produce models of human structure for medical teaching, training and research.	3.3322421580644397
Our artificial preparations of temporal bones correspond to both the material characteristics and anatomic details of human structures, allowing various surgical exercises to be carried out.	3.0558630702752527
During the past few years the treatment of rheumatoid arthritis, the most frequent of the rheumatic inflammatory systemic diseases has improved a great deal.	4.640175228217764
The treatment strategy is based on the one hand on the so-called prognostic factors and on the other hand on the extent of the inflammatory activities, especially during the first phase.	4.730844209481283
Numerous controlled studies and meta-analyses have enabled optimal application of the basic disease-modifying drugs, with regard to efficacy and side effects.	3.8375480070284134
During the first stage of these disease, the immunobiological substances against pro-inflammatory cells are employed.	3.1922113016482543
Improved knowledge of physiotherapeutic treatment, correct diet and careful observation of the patient's progress with the aid of questionnaires enable optimal care with regard to life quality.	3.8898031005402536
Intrinsic positive end-expiratory pressure (PEEPi) occurring during mechanical ventilation depends on expiratory time constants, expiratory volume and expiration time as well as on external flow resistance (tubes, valves, etc.).	2.9359618832740155
It is not routinely determined in mechanically ventilated patients, but it is necessary to optimize respirator settings.	3.955906280943922
The aim of the present study was the validation of an automated PEEPi determination method implemented in the respirator EVITA (Drägerwerke, Lübeck) in mechanically ventilated patients with acute lung failure.	2.9117027070867554
The method was validated in ten sedated, myorelaxed patients with respiratory insufficiency of different etiologies (five with restrictive, and five with obstructive pulmonary disease).	3.1988201017828235
PEEPi was determined using the volume constant ventilatory mode at ZEEP or at an external PEEP of 5 as well as 10 cm H2O.	3.6607699644567138
PEEPi was first determined with the automated method implemented in the EVITA (five measurements at each end-expiratory pressure level; PEEPEvita).	2.9432737721504965
Steady-state was attained between each measurement.	3.3826665132017
These values were compared to the results obtained with end-expiratory occlusion (external, computer-controlled valve in the inspiratory limb of the circuit) at the respective pressure levels (PEEPEEO).	3.6765286254434932
The average of five measurements at each PEEP level with each method was defined as PEEPi for the particular ventilatory situation.	3.173560334514642
Gas flow was measured at the proximal end of the endotracheal tube with a heated pneumotachometer (Fleisch no.	3.2522675753381782
2, Fleisch, Lausanne, Switzerland) and a differential pressure transducer.	3.9083785386510237
Tracheal pressure was determined in the same position with a further differential pressure transducer (Dr. Fenyves & Gut, Basel, Switzerland).	3.4677755861167796
After A/D conversion, data were sampled with a frequency of 20 Hz and processed on an IBM compatible PC.	3.115258495390547
Software for data collection and processing as well as for control of the occlusion valve was self-programmed.	4.118771288236364
For the statistical analysis we used the Mann-Whitney U-test or Wilcoxon signed-ranks test; a P value less than 0.05 was considered significant.	2.7146018943965817
At the given respiratory setting and without PEEP patients with obstructive lung disease had a higher PEEPi (median: 6.4 cm H2O; range: 5.0 - 9.6 cm H2O) than those with restrictive pulmonary disease (median: 2.3 cm H2O; range: 0.8 - 3.0 cm H2O) (P<0.05).	3.1044524810831367
Increasing external PEEP to 5 or 10 cm H2O significantly decreased the pressure difference between PEEPi and external PEEP (P<0.05), but was unable to eliminate it completely.	3.5873098347736323
There was no statistically significant difference between PEEPEEO and PEEPEvita (P=0.43; Wilcoxon signed-ranks tests).	2.745558334344809
Regression analysis showed a highly significant correlation between PEEPEEO and PEEPEvita values (r=0.985, P<0.001; y=1.03x-0.18).	3.085519319989986
PEEPi occurs during ventilation in patients with obstructive and restrictive lung disease.	4.1684931491599055
The difference between external end-expiratory pressure and PEEPi decreases with increasing external PEEP.	2.8976515496123136
However, PEEPi may increase with increasing external PEEP in some instances.	3.0744774472208434
The reason for this may be that the PEEPi determined at the proximal end of the endotracheal tube represents only a mean value of different PEEPi values of various lung regions.	3.1104133435932373
Increasing external PEEP only partially alters this mean value due to an effect on PEEPi values lower than external PEEP.	3.241559309468355
The PEEPi values measured by the EVITA respirator compared with classical end-expiratory occlusion with an external valve were nearly identical.	3.29719114981416

Following institutional approval, 40 ASA physical status I and II women scheduled for minor gynaecological surgery gave informed consent to participate in this randomized, double-blind comparative study.	3.1301489744883044
Five minutes before induction of general anaesthesia, 20 patients received a single intravenous (IV) dose of 4 mg of ondansetron and the remaining 20 received 1.25 mg droperidol IV.	3.481616604230534
Anaesthesia was induced with 2.1 - 4 mg/kg of thiopental and 0.1 mg of alfentanil IV and maintained with 65% nitrous oxide and 1.5% - 3% enflurane in oxygen.	3.296491365457428
On pain stimuli another 0.2 - 0.4 mg of alfentanil was given.	3.160298096638423
Total effective antiemetic response was defined as the absence of nausea and vomiting for 24 h postoperatively.	4.212176432601928
The incidence of nausea, vomiting and the number of patients showing total antiemetic response as well as the incidence of adverse effects were compared with the chi2 test and P<0.05 was considered significant.	3.7231992888906453
Patients were similar with respect to age, height, body weight and total anaesthetic agents received.	3.1392324288969213
Duration of anaesthesia and the time until awakening was not significantly different among groups.	4.1239741356118405
Postoperatively 7 out of 20 patients given 4 mg of ondansetron and 3 out of 20 patients with droperidol vomited (n.s.).	3.094436013164882
The incidence of nausea was 11 out of 20 in the ondansetron group, and 4 out of 20 in the droperidol group (P<0.05).	3.4347074897958394
Sixteen patients in the droperidol group and 8 patients in the ondansetron group showed a total effective antiemetic response (P<0.05).	3.839918014218659
Postoperative sedation and well-being scores did not differ significantly among groups.	3.878001812817186

Hydromorphone is a µ receptor agonist opioid.	3.1095334854907533
According to WHO recommendations, hydromorphone is to be classified in step III of pain therapy.	3.4037704441917733
An oral formulation with a prolonged duration of action of 12 hours has been evaluated only recently.	3.4679382957388367
The controlled release capsule is especially suited for the regular twice a day administration in cases of severe and persistent pain.	3.6191551019633663
The oral formulation of hydromorphone increases the number of opioid analgesics available for pain therapy in step III.	3.7158293464044485
Hydromorphone is recommended when morphine fails to produce sufficient pain relief (despite increase of doses) or causes intolerable side effects (despite treatment of symptoms).	3.0052216879913347
In principle, no differences in efficacy of morphine and hydromorphone are to be expected.	3.487837328902086
However, clinical experience shows that changing one opioid analgesic to another one can improve the treatment of patients so that hydromorphone may replace another opioid analgesic to which a patient fails to respond well or develops side effects.	3.3067775117295453
The dose of hydromorphone equivalent to 2 times 30 mg controlled release morphine is about 2 times 4 mg.	3.0025621881292657
The values for the absorption, bioavailability and maximum plasma concentration after the administration of controlled release hydromorphone every 12 hours -of three times the dose- are equivalent to those of an immediate release tablet given every 4 hours.	3.4337832389163623
In several open label and controlled studies, hydromorphone proved to be of good efficacy in the treatment of acute and persistent pain, especially in patients with severe cancer pain.	4.712594961892393
With regard to the incidence of side effects, no significant differences between morphine and hydromorphone could be established.	4.498243163214768
In general, the side effects of hydromorphone are typical for opioid analgesics.	3.593048959477957

Acute compartment syndrome of the thigh has been infrequently reported in the literature.	2.871252236353643
Closed femoral fractures and blunt soft tissue trauma are the main causes of this injury.	4.065688142473612
The multiple injured patient in this case report developed a compartment syndrome of the thigh after intramedullary nailing of a comminuted fracture of the femur.	3.6090426647249876
Fasciotomy was performed two days after surgery because of extense swelling of the thigh in the ventilated and sedated patient.	3.392985659582488
Sciatic and femoral nerve palsy was recognized after extubation of the patient nine days after the injury.	4.10489964544401
During the following weeks the paresis of the femoral nerve recovered but neither motor nor sensory function of the sciatic nerve could be demonstrated.	3.408324931839197
No direct nerve injury could be detected but there were adhesions around the nerve as a sign of compression neuropathy caused by the compartment syndrome.	3.621944222282172
The tibial component of the sciatic nerve showed a complete recovery within the next months but there was a persisting peroneal nerve palsy.	3.707030579010167
Conclusion: Early clinical symptoms of a compartment syndrome like pain, paresthesia and paresis can not be ascertained in a ventilated and sedated patient.	3.100930090707775
Tense swelling of the muscles is often the only detectable sign.	3.9399822105465074
Frequent measurements of compartment pressure should be done in these patients.	3.589172809030198

Background: Mode switching aims to maintain a ventricular rhythm that matches metabolic needs during both sinus rhythm and atrial tachyarrhythmias.	3.014448863463945
This allows patients with atrial arrhythmias to benefit from AV synchronous pacing modes.Aim and method: Beat-to-beat mode switching in Diamond and Clarity pacemakers is designed to maintain a relatively stable ventricular rhythm, ensuring consistent ventricular filling patterns.	2.957914663525939
Atrial tachyarrhythmia detection is based on a continuous analysis of the atrial rhythm.	4.910996442491455
A too rapid increase of the atrial rate with a beat-to-beat acceleration > 15 bpm is considered to be an atrial tachyarrhythmia.	3.7908257255459663
Atrial pacing restores AV synchrony immediately after cessation of the atrial tachyarrhythmia, effectively avoiding retrograde conduction.	3.1653906936121228
Dedicated diagnostic functions allow one to monitor the incidence of atrial tachyarrhythmias and to study atrial and ventricular events just prior to its onset.	4.133169401256476
Both the mode switching and rate responsive function are fully automatic, rendering follow-up procedures easy and less time-consuming.	3.2553806039524313
Conclusion: Reliable detection of all atrial events is essential to guarantee appropriate mode switching.	3.33867064670153
Therefore, the pacemaker stores the distribution of the amplitude of all atrial events, both during sinus rhythm and atrial tachyarrhythmias, which facilitates the appropriate programming of the atrial sensitivity.	3.3578241084309592

Blood glucose alterations prior to cerebral ischaemia are associated with poor neurologic outcome, possibly due to extensive lactic acidosis or energy failure.	3.1929038078710366
Cerebral effects of hyper- or hypoglycaemia during cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) are less well known.	2.990550094785981
In addition, little information is available concerning cardiac effects of blood glucose alterations.	3.1234012772971984
The aim of this study was to evaluate the effects of pre-cardiac-arrest hypo- or hyperglycaemia compared to normoglycaemia upon haemodynamics, cerebral blood flow (CBF) and metabolism (CMRO2), and regional cardiac blood flow during CPR subsequent to 3 min of cardiac and respiratory arrest and after restoration of spontaneous circulation.	2.8711278880593802
After approval by the State Animal Investigation Committee, 29 mechanically ventilated, anaesthetised pigs were instrumented for haemodynamic monitoring and blood flow determination by the radiolabeled microsphere technique.	2.6976222811039956
The animals were randomly assigned to one of three groups: in group I (n=9) blood glucose was not manipulated; in group II (n=10) blood glucose was increased by slow infusion of 40% glucose to 319 +/- 13 mg/dl; in group III (n=10) blood glucose was lowered by careful titration with insulin to 34 +/- 2 mg/dl.	3.7714534257527923
After 3 min of untreated ventricular fibrillation and respiratory arrest, CPR (chest compressor/ventilator (Thumper) and epinephrine infusion) was commenced and continued for 8 min.	3.0181738739200865
Thereafter, defibrillation was attempted, and if successful, the animals were observed for another 240 min.	3.3425984093974344
Cerebral perfusion pressure (CPP), CBF, CMRO2, coronary perfusion pressure (CorPP), and regional cardiac blood flow were determined at control, after 3 min of CPR, and at 10, 30, and 240 min post-CPR.	3.5252826048103874
In group I, 4/9 animals (44%) could be successfully resuscitated; in group II 4/10 (40%); and in group III 0/10 (0%).	4.191520382866112
In group I, CPP during CPR was 26 +/- 6 mmHg; CBF 31 +/- 9 ml/min/100 g CMRO2 3.8 +/- 1.2 ml/min/100 g; CorPP 18 +/- 5 mmHg; and left ventricular (LV) flow 35 +/- 15 ml/min/100 g. In group II: CPP=21 +/- 5; CBF 21 +/- 7; CMRO2 1.8 +/- 0.8; CorPP 16 +/- 6; and LV flow 22 +/- 9; and in group III: CPP 15 +/- 3; CBF 11 +/- 8; CMRO2 1.5 +/- 1.1; CorPP 4 +/- 2; and LV flow 19 +/- 10.	3.6601791753053416
During the 240-min post-resuscitation period, there were no differences in CBF, CMRO2, or LV flow between groups I and II.	3.1343940058704627
Hypoglycaemia prior to cardiac arrest appears to be predictive for a poor cardiac outcome, whereas hyperglycaemia does not impair resuscitability compared to normoglycaemia.	3.3733333269524812
In addition, hyperglycaemia did not affect LV flow, CBF, or CMRO2.	2.8344920479324247
However, it has to be kept in mind that haemodynamics and organ blood flow do not permit conclusions with respect to functional neurologic recovery or histopathologic damage to the brain, which is very likely to be associated with hyperglycaemia.	4.103432349190139

Malignant lymphomas, originating from peripheral T or NK cells, are rare tumours in Europe and account for less than 10% of all malignant lymphomas.	3.559376358657038
In this review, the salient features of the more frequently occurring entities derived from T or NK cells will be presented.	2.779514581253863
Nasal NK/T cell lymphoma is mainly found in the nose and paranasal sinuses and often, but not always, display an angiocentric growth pattern leading to coagulation necrosis.	3.5195983367702053
The tumor cells consistently express CD56, CD2 and the EBER molecules encoded by the Epstein-Barr virus.	2.5971969906857635
Clonal T cell receptor gene rearrangements are often absent indicating, in the majority of cases, a derivation of these tumors from NK cells.	3.6088493611306114
Enteropathy-type intestinal T-cell lymphomas often arise in patients with celiac disease and have a dismal prognosis.	4.074470998030849
The tumour cells express T cell antigens, CD103 and cytotoxic molecules, but are negative for CD4.	3.0196045125171547
Approximately 20% of the cases display CD56 mostly in combination with CD8.	4.904033777465228
Recently, an early purely intraepithelial form of this tumour was identified.	3.3729950157441375
Histologically these cases resemble celiac disease, however the intraepithelial lymphocytes often exhibit an abnormal immunophenotype with absent CD8 and T-cell-receptor protein expression, and, they are clonal by molecular analysis.	3.343917460984505
Clinically, the patients suffer from refractory sprue or ulcerative jejunitis.	2.9121125256710463
The prognosis is bad with the patients often dying from malnutrition or an invasive tumour-forming T-cell lymphoma.	3.275873825783923
Angioimmunoblastic T-cell lymphoma is defined by characteristic morphological findings (atypical lymphoid cells in part with pale cytoplasm, arborizing high endothelial venules and large FDC-meshworks) as well as clinical features (systemic symptoms, signs of a dysregulated immune response).	3.350045947070681
Peripheral T-cell lymphomas, that do not fit into a distinct entity, are classified in the REAL and the new WHO classifications as peripheral T-cell lymphomas unspecified.	3.482262778601291
These display a broad morphological spectrum (including the T-cell lymphomas of different cell sizes, Lennert's lymphoma and T-zone lymphoma of the Kiel-classification) and in general are clinically aggressive.	3.526688665104577
Causes and courses of the diseases are subjected to a change of an increasing life expectancy on the one hand and technically highly developed medicine on the other hand.	3.4179797355304555
Since a growing number of elderly people is denying intensive medical interventions which serve the purpose of keeping them alive despite severe diseases, the problem of euthanasia imposes direct questions.	3.2645300815585037
A central role is played by the active-passive difference and its moralistic legitimacy.	3.0922138185903494
The difficulties of this difference are discussed below on the applicable level of ethical discussions.	2.8649169439309268
At the same time, knowledge of the danger is being made aware that in a maximal therapeutical orientated medical care system the desire for euthanasia may become identical with the reverse side of this care system.	3.1866958007917305
Isolated severe head trauma (SHT) or SHT in combination with multiple injuries are important factors for the prognosis of morbidity and mortality in patients suffering from the consequences of accidents.	4.339009154329285
The prognosis mainly depends on the presence of primary mechanic brain injury and the development of secondary brain damage.	3.590423702913873
Causes for the development of secondary brain damage are the intracranial space demand after traumatic injury and edema formation which may result in iscemia, as well as inflammatory processes.	3.745472240060947
Both isolated SHT and polytrauma with or without brain damage may result in a systemic inflammatory response syndrome (SIRS) due to the synthesis of cytokines and other inflammatory mediators which may cause a single or multiple organ failure (MOF).	3.6535544448859323
Often the organism is able to survive isolated traumatic injuries and functional disturbances, but in combination or cumulation they may be lethal.	3.754060836907005
The hypermetabolism after SHT is often regarded as an interaction between the central nervous system and the whole organism by the activation of the neuroendocrine axis.	4.073644287006371
In contrast to the consequences of SHT for the whole organism, multiple injuries after polytrauma may affect brain functions, such as the shock dependent disturbance of the brain perfusion accompanied by brain hypoxia which may lead to an aggravated prognosis.	3.477898200100696
Moreover, coagulation, metabolism and fracture healing are influenced by the onset of SIRS as well.	3.717426478409311
Our knowledge about the bidirectional inflammatory interaction between brain and whole organism is still limited.	3.52277687467561
In this context, the effects of secondary surgical interventions which may additionally stress a traumatized body have to be considered and are the subject for actual clinical discussions and experimental studies.	3.452771868737222
This article tries to summarize some important aspects on this topic.	2.870337214920439

The management of an acute exacerbation is guided mainly clinical severity which has implications on the decision of outpatient management, hospital management or intensive care treatment.	3.2517589207917155
Cardiopulmonary comorbidity and the number of previous exacerbations are prognostic factors.	3.9180981921716924
The first-line therapy of each exacerbation is the intensification of drug-treatment with 2-agonists and anticholinergics.	3.6693120346231716
Systemic steroids as a short-term course are advocated if hospital-treatment is necessary.	4.014908120449737
Infections of the respiratory tract are a frequent cause of acute exacerbations.	4.492615218237136
However, a colonization with potential pathogenic microorganisms is found in many patients in the stable state.	3.7582281956090724

As a consequence the number of intubations and the attributable morbidity and mortality are reduced.	3.5269920241382975

Schwartz and coworkers therefore created a point system as a guide in clinical decision making.	3.020968847698226

Aside from new insights into the pathophysiology of the long QT-disorder, it is expected that genetic diagnostics will offer substantial help to ascertain long QT-syndrome in patients with borderline electrocardiographic and clinical findings and improve risk stratification in long-QT family members.	4.118257509400535
Performing linkage analysis, coupling of autosomal-dominant congenital long QT-syndrome (Romano-Ward Syndrome) to chromosomes 11 (LQT1/11p15.5), 3 (LQT3/3p21), 7 (LQT2/7q35), and 4 (LQT4/4q25-27) was demonstrated.	3.283908316158537
More recently, the disease genes in long QT-syndrome 1, 2, and 3 could be identified.	3.8874348017837836
Analysis of the base-pair sequence allowed detection of several different mutations in different families illustrating genetic heterogeneity.	2.884413694471113
Aside from diagnostic aspects, molecular genetics may also guide pharmacological therapy by identifying the specific ion-channel disorder leading to QT-prolongation and sudden death.	2.7080427528194604

Cranial dural fistulae are rare; when they occur, it is usually difficult to detect them at an early stage.	3.9879701734155923
With a view to the question of possible progress in diagnosis we now report on seven patients with lateral dural fistulae fed by branches of the external carotid artery.	3.2311637689061463
The examination was carried out before selective arteriography using cw-Doppler sonography and colour coded duplex sonography in combination.	3.3240178291991556
Sonographic criteria for detection of hyperperfusion take account of flow velocity as well as pulsatility.	4.0484868796247495
In all cases hyperperfusion of the external carotid artery and the common carotid artery was detected.	3.433917847789867
In most of these cases pathologic findings were also observed at the occipital artery, and more rarely in the contralateral external carotid artery or the ipsilateral vertebral artery, in addition.	3.7862023560934013
A possible source of error arising from confusion of blood vessels was present with the cw-Doppler sonography, but not for colour coded duplex sonography.	3.292399678463277
Therefore, cranial dural fistulae characterized by a high shunt volume can be diagnosed correctly by indirect Doppler sonographic criteria using cw-Doppler and duplex sonography.	3.184558700426397

Nowadays, restorative proctocolectomy is considered the "gold standard" in the surgical therapy of ulcerative colitis.	3.6329225637820826
Alternative procedures such as Brooke ileostomy or Kock pouch are limited to special indications.	3.165521354844031
Preservation of function is the decisive advantage of the ileoanal pouch, but preservation of function is not equal to quality of life.	3.308074074517911
Quality of life is a multidimensional concept that is difficult to define and measure.	2.8939791187765556
Quality of life can only be assessed by standardized and validated quality-of-life questionnaires.	3.5965549821907996
Preoperatively, patients with ulcerative colitis have a restricted quality of life, depending on the intensity of their disease.	3.722535734414582
Proctocolectomy is the curative therapy and improves quality of life.	3.27084462547406
When evaluating quality of life it is not essential if patients are treated by Brooke ileostomy or restorative proctocolectomy.	3.884932194951498

The "Total Quality-of-Life Index" is not impoved.	3.5116185012572383
Preoperatively, patients should be informed that preservation of function by restorative proctocolectomy is accompanied by an increased postoperative morbidity in comparison to other procedures.	3.6069226207607343
Decreased quality-of-life results when complications occur postoperatively that cannot be controlled over a long period of time.	3.261836029474784
In some cases excision of the ileoanal pouch may be the most sensible way of solving the problems.	3.6756679851112506

The objective of this investigation was the experimental determination of the contact pressures in the hip joint for characteristic phases of the gait cycle.	3.449459440293451
The joint forces determined in vivo with telemetric endoprosthesis by Bergmann et al.	2.7286143702970667
(1993) were converted into a pelvic reference system, based on kinematic gait analysis.	3.410123932519652
In eight cadaveric hip joints (age 18-75 yrs.)	3.193161758800671
the reaction forces were applied corresponding to four phases of the gait cycle (heel strike, mid-stance, heel off, toe off) and the pressure distribution determined with FUJI pressure sensitive film.	3.0199744546578517
We found maxima of 10 MPa during mid stance.	2.9745898538253113
The areas of highest pressure were located in the ventro-superior aspect of the acetabulum (anterior part of the acetabular roof) and in the dorso-inferior aspect of the lunate surface.	4.396153641006421
The pressure distribution was relatively constant during the four phases and the maxima did not vary proportional to the applied load.	2.9214781194910966
The normal pressure distribution in the hip appears to be determined by the physiological incongruity of the articular surfaces and the inhomogeneous bony support of the acetabulum.	4.4957374431060595
During operative interventions this normal load transfer should be restored as accurately as possible.	2.690189632925447

A 43-year-old patient was admitted for severe claudicatio in his right leg, doppler ultrasound and angiography revealed an occluded right common iliac artery.	3.275303408724962

Background: The implantation of a femoro-popliteal bypass graft represents the gold standard in the management of arteriosclerotic occlusive disease in the femoro-popliteal region.	3.2752797110887193
Application of interventional techniques has permitted the development of a novel, endovascular implantable bypass system.	3.342743427323408
The device is placed within the lumen of the superficial femoral artery.	2.8564253445762953
The present study investigated the technical properties of the new system in cadavers, with subsequent evaluation of its application in humans.	3.387903899057365
Methods: The endopass consists of a thin-wall polycarbourethane tube with a total length of 53 cm.	3.3798331077102817
The distal end is connected with a self-expanding stent prothesis 4 cm in length.	3.1980098127796794
Endovascular implantation is performed through a groin incision.	3.352819589771608
Following antegrade ringstripper-TEA, the endopass is introduced into the femoral artery after placement of a guide wire.	3.744250435707674
The proximal anastomosis is performed surgically.	3.1598742973677196
Results: The technical requirements and feasibility of the system were tested on 12 cadaver extremities.	3.5547305807236524
Implantation of the device proved technically successful in seven of eight extremities with significant occlusion of the superficial femoral artery.	3.3146222689327915
The most important problems included the complete ringstripper-TEA, the placement of the guide wire following the TEA, and the expansion of the endopass.	3.3092052264840905
Following approval by the ethics commission, the endopass was implanted in five patients between June 1997 and March 1998.	3.53658345580247
In three patients, the endopass remained patent and has functioned well.	3.6633124696568036
One patient with poor vascular outflow suffered an early noncorrectable occlusion, while in the remaining case, perforation secondary to the ringstripper procedure forced us to abandon the attempt.	3.0432876331126146
Conclusion: Experience from the cadaver study and initial human applications confirm the feasibility of this method.	3.516899920405845
Further development and methodological improvement, however, are necessary requiring additional, larger studies on patients.	3.6794634056377697

In order to evaluate patients' exposure to radiation in computed tomography, dose quantities such as the computed tomography dose index (CTDI), multiple scan average dose (MSAD) and dose free in air on the axis of rotation are used.	2.8706544161929717
The CTDI and the MSAD, derivable from the CTDI, are a good measure for the absorbed doses in the examined volume, but they do not take the biological sensitivity of the organs into account and do not describe the radiogenic risk that is actually relevant for patients and doctors.	3.2940958826412756
The dose on the axis of rotation is not an accurate measure of the effective dose and the radiogenic risk.	3.297867957925462

Prognosis of patients surviving acute myocardial infarction has substantially improved over the last two decades.	3.875186009830409
However, stratification of patients at risk for death due to arrhythmic events remains a clinical challenge.	3.399319974731031
Due to the important role of the autonomic nervous system in the genesis of sudden death, autonomic markers such as heart rate variability and baroreflex sensitivity have recently gained attention as risk stratification parameters.	3.4332019557634967
The present study reports the results of noninvasive risk stratification in 411 consecutive postinfarction patients treated due to contemporary therapeutical guidelines with a high proportion of patients discharged with a patent infarct related artery.	3.2803306074681435
The diagnostic arsenal of risk parameters comprised heart rate variability, baroreflex sensitivity, and more traditional markers such as non-sustained ventricular tachycardia, left ventricular ejection fraction, and ventricular late potentials.	3.278674867337986
Patiens were followed for a mean of 33  +/- 21 months.	4.2070723440055415
Stepwise logistic regression analysis revealed that left ventricular function, both autonomic markers, and the patency of the infarct related artery were independent predictors of the prospectively defined primary study endpoint, i.e., all-cause mortality plus ventricular tachyarrhythmic events.	3.258669922873037
With respect to the secondary endpoint (ventricular tachyarrhythmic events), left ventricular function, heart rate variability, and infarct vessel patency were independent predictors.	3.3030099027833986
Ventricular late potentials and nonsustained ventricular tachycardia had no predictive value with respect to ventricular tachyarrhythmic events.	3.4490153008040485
These findings from a large prospective long-term study demonstrate the value of markers of cardiac autonomic tone in identifying infarct survivors at risk for malignant ventricular tachyarrhythmias and sudden death.	3.4072413143636946
K+ Channels and Cardiotoxicity of Drugs: Implications for Drug Toxicity Assessment - The time required for repolarization of the ventricles can be measured as the QT interval of the ECG and is determined primarily by activation of the delayed rectifier K+ current (IK), which consists of a rapid component (IKr) and a slow component (IKs).	3.459209968763374
Prolonged repolarization is detected as a longer QT interval on the ECG.	3.1634143214484323
During prolonged APs, increased inward currents induce early afterdepolarizations, which increase the risk of Torsades de pointes (TdP) cardiac arrhythmias.	2.9475884001057815
TdP arrhythmia is characterized by an apparent twisting of the electrical axis around the isoelectric line.	3.307711220955773
It has a rate of 150 to 250 beats/min and it can occasionally degenerate into ventricular fibrillation that may be fatal.	3.546118751385486
The incidence of drug-induced TdP arrhythmias is highest among class IA and class III antiarrhythmic agents.	3.03149118655596
However, under certain clinical conditions, also several non-cardiovascular medicinal products induce QT interval prolongations in the ECG or TdP arrhythmias.	2.7854151630578206
Since all drugs known to cause TdP block IKr, an early evaluation of possible effects on APs of cardiac myocytes expressing IKr channels during the developmental phases of novel drugs seems to be recommended.	3.230254157378793
If in-vitro electrophysiological studies show the new active substance to induce AP prolongation and/or K+ channel blockade in appropriate models and at relevant concentrations,  either further development of the new active substance may not be justified or the risk factors predisposing to TdP arrhythmias should be taken into account in further clinical studies.	3.6703900546728456
Carcinoma of the penis is a malignant epithelial tumor of ominous prognosis if not adequately treated.	3.4754647425262397
To a large extent the probability of positive lymph nodes is determined by the grade of the primary lesion.	4.364508370057936
In turn the number of positive nodes greatly influences the survival.	3.73163767315052
In the past the complications of radical ilioinguinal lymphadenectomy have decreased their timely indication.	2.837732773047648
If delayed lymphadenectomy is performed, the survival rate is reduced by approximately 50 % as compared to the results of immediate lymphadenectomy.	4.40815602502615
The modified inguinal lymphadenectomy described by Catalona leads to less complications.	2.888993332752736
If performed without delay it should lead to improved survival in patients with higher stage and high grade penile cancer.	3.949089735501341
Recently suggested employment of adjuvant and neoadjuvant chemotherpy may further enhance the survival.	2.991327781249313

During the last years, life-long secondary prevention with difluconazole was established.	2.8952319668374025

Measurements were repeated at the same time of day after 1 week.	3.855819479131174
In addition, we compared two different electrode positions in 16 eyes: (1) across the cornea along the lower lid; and deep in the conjunctival sac.	3.2072014302350422
With position (1) the amplitudes were found to be higher by 20% than (2).	4.777749996325414
We calculated the coefficient of variation (CV) of amplitude as a measure of reproducibility.	3.0759710415197246
CV was 7 +/- 1% for the steady-state PERG, 9 +/- 1% for the transient PERG, 12 +/- 2% for the steady-state VEP and 14 +/- 3% for the transient VEP.	4.004516158552694
For the latency of the PERG, the intersession CV was found to be 1.5%.	3.642665579460279
Amplitude reproducibility was somewhat higher under steady-state as compared to transient stimulation; we attribute this to the high noise rejection of the Fourier analysis.	3.4904533556828734
Altogether, the amplitude reproducibility of the PERG is somewhat higher than that of the VEP.	3.219503432405665

Regional perfusion of the lung is not distributed homogeneously within the organ.	3.7740714051332414
based on the isolated canine lung.	4.656179888782808
The concept stresses the importance of different gravitational forces along the vertical axis of the lung resulting in three zones in which no pulmonary perfusion (zone 1), waterfall-like perfusion (zone 2), and continuous blood flow (zone 3) prevail.	4.0608993969178595
In this article, we review recent publications in which observations have been made which cannot be explained by the West model.	3.1171533566054936

The pulmonary vasculature is composed of repetitions of one structural unit: the vessel bifurcation.	2.811685144002875
Apart from its size, each single bifurcation is similar to all others.	3.171481892091815
The pulmonary vessel tree can, therefore, be considered to be self-similar.	3.8028444769171643
Self-similarity has been identified as a design principle of living nature.	3.353829360731237
Self-similar objects can produce heterogeneity which is also self-similar when viewed at different scales of magnification.	3.037065655963528
For measurement of the structure of such objects and their function, i.e., in this case the heterogeneity of pulmonary perfusion, fractal geometry is best suited.	3.7077816436706277
Distribution of blood flow within the lung can be described by means of fractal analysis, and all phenomena of perfusion distribution can easily be explained when applying this concept.	3.839174836769265
Furthermore, since the basis of fractal analysis is pulmonary vascular anatomy, it lends itself for the study of blood flow distribution.	4.059419597218007
A major advantage is the independence of fractal parameters from resolution of perfusion measurements.	3.0868656883115095
Thus, fractal analysis can be used to compare results that have been obtained using different resolutions and different species.	3.7387542445753708
Fractal methods have previously been used in medicine for other purposes.	3.7463404496923522
Nonlinear analyses of heart beat variability can predict the onset of malign cardiac dysrhythmias hours before actual appearance in the ECG.	3.369220088695926
Very similar methods applied to electrical brain activity have been shown to allow prediction of epileptical seizures approximately 15 min prior to appearance of clinical symptoms.	3.202693498795199
In part I of the paper the biomechanical and technical background of the EPTT using the MPT fixator and the indications for this procedure have been described.	3.5261010308408296
In part II we report about the clinical application of the EPTT in 67 patients with a wide spectrum of repairs and reconstructions of the extensor mechanism.	4.471864971606009
48 patients had fresh injuries, 18 of them with severe concomitant knee lesions and 19 patients had neglected rsp.	3.538886337783503
There were 4 deep infections, two of them related to the MPT fixator.	3.6870511915236506
In the patients with uneventful healing the fixator remained in place for 7.3 weeks in average.	3.35811709634607
There were 5 patients with partial patellectomy and tendon reattachment because of lower patella pole comminution and 12 patients with tendon reattachment ruptured at the inferior patella pole or suture repair in midsubstance rupture.	3.087834338507756
The clinical results according to the IKDC score were rated in 3 patients as normal, in 10 patients as nearly normal and in 4 patients as abnormal.	3.483473880908878
This rating was highly dependend on the subjective judgement by the patients who considered their operated knees not as normal as the contralateral knees.	3.6086608719301108
From our clinical experiences and results we can derive that the EPTT enables the surgical management of extensor mechanism disruptions with a minimum of internal fixation material and provides a safe protection of the repairs and reconstructions during the healing period.	3.4133459330441602
The EPTT allows immediate unrestricted functional rehabilitation and early walking without crutches.	3.033353438700107
Thus the EPTT represents an effective alternative to the patello-tibial cerclage with a wire or synthetic ligaments.	3.0470954503039693
Ondansetron is more effective than a placebo in treating postoperative nausea and vomiting (PONV), but it has not been proved to be superior to established antiemetics for prophylaxis or therapy.	4.041617999476817
We compared ondansetron vs droperidol for the treatment of PONV.	3.762921421105686
Our prospective, randomized double-blind study was performed between 15 October 1992 and July 1993; it included 271 gynaecological ASA I - III inpatients who had been operated on under general anaesthesia with intubation.	3.437255237427281
Patients were excluded if: there was no informed consent; it was an ambulatory or emergency operation; the patient was pregnant or breast feeding; allergies were being treated with antihistamines; drug addiction was present or convulsions or Parkinson's disease; any pre- or intraoperative antiemetic medication had been administered.	3.2455975268449455
All patients wishing an antiemetic and/or suffering from at least one emetic episode during the first 24 h postoperatively received either 8 mg ondansetron or 1.25 mg droperidol from identical 4 ml ampoules intravenously.	3.23044952456441
The verbal nausea score (1=none, 2=mild, 3=moderate, 4=severe) was recorded every 30 min for 4 h, then before and 2 h after each antiemetic dose.	3.3513502897455294
All emetic episodes and the interval between administration and effect were also noted.	3.457364584306852
Patients were interviewed 36 - 48 h postoperatively on subjective effects, side-effects and individual acceptance.	3.471705704503269
After oral premedication with diazepam, anaesthesia was induced with thiopental, in a few cases with etomidate or propofol.	3.279815243639034
Relaxation was achieved with pancuronium or atracurium and, when indicated, with succinylcholine.	3.2901793389813845
Muscular relaxation was antagonized with neostigmin and glycopyrrolate.	3.107779667894622
Gastric content was aspirated once after intubation.	3.2214706016594277
Anaesthesia was maintained with nitrous oxide/oxygen, enflurane, halothane or isoflurane and fentanyl up to 0.3 mg. Statistical evaluation was performed by the unpaired Student's t-test and the Mann-Whitney U test.	3.138963710697195
Categoric variables were examined by the 2 test.	4.399024684693618
Significance was defined as P<0.05.	4.0890548840428735
Of 271 patients, 100 (37%) experienced PONV.	3.5263406485886217
The groups were statistically comparable with respect to demographic data, type and duration of operation, emesis record, perioperative uterotonic medication.	3.759398065121296
Twenty patients in the ondansetron group and 27 in the droperidol group received the first antiemetic within 2 h, the other patients up to 17 h after extubation.	3.5810934318504155
The reduction of these parameters after medication was similar.	3.2329395280213085
Complete response over 6 h was 60% in the ondansetron and 68% in the droperidol group.	3.8275845551406413
In both groups the first medication failed in 4 cases during the initial 2 h. Twenty of the ondansetron and 16 of the droperidol patients needed a second dose; among these 2 and 4, respectively, a third ampoule.	3.5063045206435146
No rescue medication was necessary over 24 h and a mean of 1.4 ampoules was administered in both groups.	3.4549962779696135
Onset and quality of emetic action were identical in both groups.	3.0756114816708315
It was not possible to evaluate 25 interviews due to linguistic or amnestic problems.	3.0225151726399204
Multiple side-effects were noted frequently.	4.312349364893886
Injection pain was reported significantly more often in the droperidol, pruritus in the ondansetron group.	3.874941850365653
Ninety-three percent of the ondansetron and 85% of the droperidol patients opted for the same drug for future PONV treatment.	3.3093227974455974
Ondansetron (8 mg) and droperidol (1.25 mg) proved to be equally effective when used as a postoperative antiemetic.	3.883923209385518
Both drugs showed similar side-effects.	3.3171054030053164
Due to differences in methods it was difficult to compare our results to those obtained in other studies.	3.4656343001095604
Paradoxical embolism is well-known in theory but rarely encountered in clinical practice.	3.6860551174332663
The typical pathophysiological background is the coincidence of venous thrombosis, elevated right atrial pressure, and a consecutive right-to-left shunting via a patent foramen ovale or an atrial septal defect.	3.661832916034368
This review summarizes the results of internal cardioversion of atrial fibrillation in comparison to external cardioversion.	4.290724735685712
Internal cardioversion was achieved by positioning defibrillation electrodes in the right atrium and coronary sinus (alternatively in the left pulmonary artery).	3.906454296666128
In previous studies also a combined internal/external cardioversion was used by locating a defibrillation electrode in the right atrium together with a cutaneous patch electrode.	3.2053020960815886
Although in comparative studies the success rate of 91-93% with internal cardioversion is higher compared to success rates of 67-79% with external cardioversion, the conventional method of external cardioversion remains the method of first choice.	3.4653459403787092
The success rate of internal cardioversion after failed external cardioversion ranges from 73 to over 90%.	2.9258444571836444
Possible indications for primary internal cardioversion are: induced atrial fibrillation during electrophysiological studies, atrial fibrillation after cardiothoracic surgery and cardioversion of atrial fibrillation in patients with permanent pacemaker implants.	3.4588916460435915
Objective: The objective of the study is to evaluate the importance of home care for patients with advanced tumor diseases and for their families.	4.920355317084588
VDD single-lead systems use floating ring electrodes for atrial sensing.	2.9233580724766717
To ensure an optimal atrial sensing function, knowledge of the interactions between electrode design, pacemaker, amplifier and implantation technique is required.	3.1515112081904704
In this overview, technical determinants of atrial sensing concerning atrial ring configuration (surface area, ring spacing, full/half ring), design of the lead (insulation material, conductor coil configuration), and amplifier design (differential amplifier, sensing impedance, bandpass filter) shall be explained and related to determinants at implant (AV distance, site of implantation, atrial position, intraoperative measurement technique).	2.992980792962832
(1) Ring configuration: Bipolar atrial full ring systems have proved to be efficient with narrow (5-10mm) or wide (15-30mm) ring spacing, as well as bipolar half ring systems with DAB configuration and narrow ring spacing.	3.4364122360470137
Especially in a position close to the atrial wall, a wide ring spacing detects a less clear-cut signal than a short ring spacing; on the other hand, with a wide ring spacing, sensing is less compromised if the rings move to a worse position further away from the wall.	3.2568158699784377
A narrow ring spacing detects a sharper signal if positioned close to the atrial wall, but a considerable reduction of sensed P wave amplitude may result if it moves away from the wall or to an oblique angle relative to the atrial depolarization front.	3.0250408305724203
(2) Design of the lead: Polyurethane as insulation material provides a higher stiffness than silicone insulation.	3.0622400257184417
A coaxial conductor configuration increases stiffness and consequently the possibility to manipulate the atrial part of the lead.	3.691587428922724
Thus, if a position close to the atrial wall is desired, the combination of a coaxial conductor coil, polyurethane insulation, and a narrow ring spacing seems most promising.	3.4660699512006174
(3) Amplifier design: For atrial sensing in VDD systems, bipolar sensing, differential amplifier, high sensing impedance (>=2k), and a wide bandpass filter (e.g., 10-100Hz) should be realized.	3.3617953951043544
Especially the inclusion of a relatively low frequency range (10-40Hz) is important, because compared to a fixed atrial electrode, a higher quantity of the atrial signal sensed by a floating electrode is in the low-frequency range.	3.9293810929016573
(4) Implantation: To choose the best fitting electrode, a preoperative assessment of the size of the right cardiac cavities should be performed.	4.080895912994772
Correct interpretation of the sensed P wave amplitude and prediction of sufficient sensing after connection with the pacemaker is only possible with exact knowledge of the measurement technique of the intraoperative pacing system analyzer and the connected permanent pacemaker device (bandpass filter, signal peak-to baseline or peak-to-peak).	3.3260285326168497
Attention should be paid to the fixation of the electrode at the site of insertion to avoid postoperative dislocation of the ring electrodes.	3.7831019524571823
Knowledge of different electrode/pacemaker specific parameters and special aspects at implantation is a prerequisite for optimal function of VDD single-lead systems.	2.9516734765366626
Preoperatively, considerations should concern the choice of the electrode (AV distance, ring spacing) and implantation strategy (position close to or rather apart from the atrial wall).	3.2797239428451066
An atrial position may only be accepted if sufficient sensing can be documented with a measuring method similar to that of the implanted pacemaker.	3.3668566340569432
Objectives: To investigate the agreement (and its potential dependency on extravascular lung water) between transpulmonary (TPID) and standard pulmonary artery (PAID) thermodilution cardiac output  measurements.	2.8511179287977937

Epidemiologic studies show that the incidence rises with age.	4.398678460529687

To this day, urinary incontinence in later life is considered "normal" and "caused by old age."	3.3954552764731187
However, among other age-related reasons, the main cause of this disorder is postmenopausal hormone deficiency.	4.058614690599236

Recurrent abdominal pain (RAP) is one of the most common pain syndromes in childhood, with prevalence rates ranging from 10 to 20% in all school-age children.	2.876646001368398
In nearly 50% the complaints persist over many years of their life-span to adolescence or adulthood.	2.380328196648745
Although the empirical findings have increased in the last decade, our knowledge about the etiology, pathogenesis, and pathophysiology is still very limited.	3.324559697787684
Current approaches suggest that we understand recurrent pain syndromes as a complex and multidimensional disturbance (biopsychosocial paradigm).	2.564319863267869
In this respect there is strong evidence for the major importance of psychosocial causes (daily hassles, specific life events), psychopathological factors (anxiety, depression, somatization disorder), and social environmental influences (mother's psychopathology, social modelling, reinforcement) in the pathogenesis of functional abdominal pain.	3.2486020978188264
The noticeable correlation with other pain syndromes and functional disturbances indicates that recurrent pain may possibly be a manifestation of a basic somatization disorder.	3.4274777418127296
The unfavourable long-term prognosis supports the need for early and specific interventions.	3.407799906488586
Psychological treatment requires a medical examination to exclude organic origins.	3.426344053048584
Some of these invasive diagnostic procedures can be very difficult, expensive and distressing for the child.	3.2009159822608595
Behavioural medicine is based upon having an extensive family history and symptom analysis.	3.410426374071413
The psychological interventions applied in clinical practice include prophylaxis, reduction of pain symptoms and environmental modification.	2.805714176340304
In recent years there has been an increasing trend to create more complex and multidimensional behavioural treatment programs for children.	2.1215439065420525
Although preliminary data on the use of these behavioural medicine programs have shown some promise, further investigations are needed to examine the applicability and effectiveness of specific interventions in the treatment of abdominal pain symptoms.	4.3697107704067895

However, is there a clinical relevance?	3.987872264405652
Thus, the present study was designed to identify parameters of vocal performance and acoustic features which are significantly more similar in monozygotic twins than in non-related persons.	3.1777097242440187
In our hypothesis, comparable prerequisites for an increased vocal load in a profession or in an artistic education of the voice could be due to these similarities.	3.2198356281282305
We compared intra-pair differences with data from a control group.	3.039168370608012
Moreover, we examined the correlation of intra-pair differences with the age of the monozygotic twins.	3.6305182191254666
A greater difference in older twin pairs than in younger pairs could show the effect of an exogene influence.	3.3606278731626276
In addition to the few phoniatric studies in twins in the literature, we used current methods for acoustic analysis.	3.6150940923956196
We found significant differences in seven of ten parameters (vocal range, highest and lowest vocal fundamental frequency, fundamental speaking frequency, maximum voice intensity, number of partials, vibrato of intensity; U-test by Mann-Whitney).	2.9809122142671676
No correlation of the differences of the identical twins with age was found in the examined parameters.	4.284414427491796
The voices of identical twins are significantly more similar than those of non-related persons regarding the above mentioned features.	3.541452594363869
Thus, the suitability of the voices of monozygotic twins for professions with a high demand on voice is comparable.	3.087145445428641
Results of the group comparison correlate largely with the literature.	3.3613357017734242
The missing correlation with age could be due to the fact that the environmental effects were not measurable, and/or the development of the voice is more influenced by genetic effects.	3.985138586335782

The vascular organization of human spermatic cord was analyzed by means of injection and by casting preparation of the testicular artery and veins of the pampiniform plexus after orchiectomy.	3.436835350468657
After leaving the human testis, the testicular veins are organized in two main groups and form two vein plexus.	3.0791349352403934
One of these vein groups forms a tight plexus around the testicular artery.	2.5731356648762085
Computer-aided 3-D reconstructions based on the paraffin serial sections of the human spermatic cord allowed us to demonstrate the relation between the blood vessels and the other tissue structures of the spermatic cord.	4.048315254924397
The results obtained allowed us to subdivide the human spermatic cord into three compartments.	2.9067151531722573
The dorsomedial compartment contains the vas deferens and its blood vessels.	3.0270588466626256
The middle compartment contains the testicular artery and the vein group which forms a tight plexus around this artery.	3.1528758532916603
The ventrolateral compartment contains a vein group which shows no topographic relation to the testicular artery.	3.355912332828885
This vein group is embedded in a large, macroscopically visible volume of fatty tissue.	3.1683228761943147
To be sure of sparing the testicular artery during antegrade sclerotherapy this vein group should be prepared.	3.1493102324336593

These findings and the successful therapy underline reports of the literature and point to a pathogenetic mechanism of an immunologically triggered disturbance of the striatal dopaminergic system, at least in a subgroup of GTS.	3.664448515409396

All three patients suffered from autoimmune polyglandular syndrome type II.	3.245033523305311

The high rate of coronary artery disease (CAD) mortality needs preventive intervention.	3.1330580445403013
Several studies have documented the effectiveness of LDL-cholesterol lowering in CAD primary prevention.	3.3775606717405964
The West of Scotland Prevention Study resulted in risk reduction by about one third through LDL-cholesterol lowering.	2.995618280310473
The data indicate that specifically patients at high risk benefit from lipid reduction.	3.172805126083553
High risk patients have besides high LDL-cholesterol one or more additional risk factors such as family history of premature coronary artery disease, hypertension, smoking, low HDL-cholesterol or diabetes.	3.380136189825498
Therapy primarily aims at life style changes, secession of smoking and weight reduction as well as dietary changes to achieve LDL-cholesterol levels of 115-175 mg/dl (3-4.5 mmol/L), depending on the individual risk constellation.	3.6059092928227674
This strategy allows to reduce the number of patients needed to treat in order to prevent one CAD event (56 in isolated hypercholesterolemia) to 14-24 in high risk persons, approaching the number (n=13) known for effective lipid lowering in secondary prevention of coronary heart disease.	3.308828954264625
One hundred and three cases of Spitz nevi were reviewed.	3.6469805991092277
36% of these patients were adults.	4.697907210909907
The lesions in children occurred primarily on the face and secondarily on the trunk followed by the extremities.	3.837639794525928
In adults, they affect the legs in women, and the trunk in men as does malignant melanoma.	3.8392988846941094
Clinically they were diagnosed more frequently as Spitz nevi in children and adolescents than in adults.	3.434046344822708
Spitz nevi were most commonly mistaken clinically for "common" melanocytic nevus, hemangioma, verruca, fibrous histiocytoma, molluscum contagiosum, granuloma pyogenicum, keloid, and melanoma.	2.799818351161219
Histologically, there are various expressions of Spitz nevi, but they are usually compound melanocytic nevi with little pigmentation and typically large spindle- and/or epithelioid melanocytes.	3.7220578597855707
There are only small histopathological differences between Spitz nevi in childhood and adulthood: one important feature rarely seen in Spitz nevi of adults is multiple mitotic figures at the dermo-epidermal junction but rarely at the base of the melanocytic nevus.	2.7568279309426766
Nevus Reed is considered to possibly be a distinctly pigmented variant of Spitz nevus.	3.442814416996157
A few months ago an endovascular implantable PTFE stent graft became commercially available.	2.8348408377174086
Since May 1998 we have treated 15 patients with extensive vascular occlusion at the femoropopliteal level.	3.6649755341166954
The implantation is carried out via a single inguinal approach in combination with conventional vascular surgical techniques like orthograde ringstripping of the superficial femoral artery, local TEA and patch-grafting of the femoral bifurcation, angioplasty, local lysis, etc.	3.351926103834218
The self-expanding thin-walled PTFE stent prothesis appears to be a viable alternative to the femoropopliteal P1 bypass and can be performed under local anesthesia, percutaneously or through a small inguinal incision.	3.5791391595622133

Radiological and orthopaedic outcome in severe and moderate haemophilia A and B patients undergoing long-term prophylactic treatment were prospectively investigated focusing on the age of onset of prophylaxis and the number of joint bleedings prior to treatment.	3.797269953482676
We report on 21 patients with severe and moderate haemophilia A and B receiving prophylactic treatment of between 3.1 and 16.1 years duration.	3.0431486048835046
Three patient groups were evaluated according to the age at onset of prophylaxis.	4.415716655196493
In group I (n = 8) prophylactic treatment was initiated in the first 2 years of life.	3.634028690941474
Patients of group II (n = 6) received prophylaxis at the age of 3-6 years.	3.918476635644178
Late-onset or secondary prophylactic treatment was started at the age of 6 years and above in 7 patients (group III).	3.867486291019915
All patients received virus-inactivated F VIII or F IX concentrates at dosages of 30-40 IU, in some cases up to 50 IU/kg body weight i. v. three times per week for those with haemophilia A and twice per week for those with haemophilia B. Elbow, knee and ankle joints were investigated at 3-4 yearly intervals according to the radiological and orthopaedic scores recommended by the World Federation of Haemophilia (WFH).	3.0852327264394126
The total number of joint bleedings before and after start of prophylaxis were recorded in all patients.	3.51384802341234
In group I 7 out of 8 patients had unaffected joints with constant radiological and orthopaedic scores of zero or 1, after a median of 11.25 years of prophylactic treatment.	3.0152511617772375
One patient in this group demonstrated mild radiological alterations (score 4).	3.396879732003861
Patients of group II showed neither radiological nor orthopaedic alterations at study entry.	2.6198809422152056
Treatment group III already showed considerable joint damage at study entry with a median radiological score of 11 (0-33) and a median orthopaedic score of 4 (0-11).	3.8845802058453187
Despite prophylactic treatment both, orthopaedic (median 8, range 2-12) and radiological scores (median 19.5, range 2-47) deteriorated after 3 years.	3.1340074426913733
Prior to onset of prophylaxis no or only one joint bleeding occurred in treatment group I.	3.209421121296752
In group II, a median of 6 joint bleeds (range 1-8) were reported before prophylaxis was started.	3.826503348081724
Patients of group III usually experienced a median of more than 10 joint haemorrhages (range 6-10 or more).	3.8659181760262546
Under prophylactic treatment the number of joint bleedings decreased significantly in groups II and III.	3.9935409043474763
However, radiological and orthopaedic scores increased as a sign of progressing osteoarthropathic alterations in patients reporting more than 6 joint haemorrhages before onset of prophylaxis whereas no joint alterations could be assessed in patients with no or only one joint bleeding episode prior to prophylaxis.	3.473140905483725
Even a small number of joint bleedings seems to cause irreversible osteoarthropathic alterations leading to haemophilic arthropathy.	3.128671566876193
Once apparent, further progression of joint damage could not be arrested despite of prophylactic treatment (group II and III).	3.762468259733118
In order to prevent haemophilic arthropathy, effective prophylaxis should be started before or at least after the first joint bleeding in severe haemophilia A and B.	3.5751077797598714
The hemodynamic treatment of septic shock consists of fluid repletion, maintenance of an adequate cardiac output, and restoration of mean arterial pressure.	3.3283445259490927
Norepinephrine is a potent vasopressor that can be considered when the patient is adequately fluid resuscitated, when cardiac output is greater than 3.5 l/min/m2 (or Sv O2>=65%) and when blood pressure remains low.	3.9687319219639052
The objective is to achieve and maintain a mean arterial pressure of 60-70 mmHg, or more in some patients (older or hypertensive patients).	3.47128849464015
Renal effects of norepinephrine were evaluated in several studies; urine output, creatinine clearance, and osmolar clearance are significantly increased.	3.3041257729660485
Norepinephrine is perfectly suited in situations of high renal output and low renal resistance, as is the case in septic shock patients.	3.2004465562229165
The effect on oxygen transport is unpredictable.	2.887342830044958
The effects on lactate concentrations were poorly evaluated, but several studies suggest that the drug does not worsen and can even improve tissue oxygenation of septic shock patients.	3.239694047695409
Provided that cardiac output is maintained, treatment with norepinephrine is without negative effects on splanchnic tissue oxygenation.	3.4603580428195206
In conclusion, the clinical experience with norepinephrine strongly suggests that this drug can successfully increase blood pressure without deteriorating cardiac output and organ function.	3.150703306325558
Whether using norepinephrine in septic shock patients effects mortality as compared to dopamine or epinephrine still requires a prospective study.	3.3941940111034152

Quantitative tissue Doppler echocardiography is a new diagnostic approach to left ventricular systolic performance.	4.132357173951221
The aim of the present study was to validate a recently developed method based on the computer software TDI-Labor enabling a variable time and space related measurement of regional wall velocity from tissue Doppler images.	2.776607020420917

The same images were employed for comparative measurement of the mean endocardial velocity using the conventional M-mode slope approach.	3.366744412339429
Tissue Doppler data of the subendocardial wall velocity were found to correspond closely to the mean endocardial wall velocity (y = 0.97x + 0.17; r = 0.77; p < 0.0001).	3.116302827848107

It has been used for almost 35 years as an intravenous agent for induction of anaesthesia and for long-term sedation.	3.903828337823875

This is not a major problem with long-term sedation during ICU treatment.	4.258432053009246
GHB has been used with good results for sedation of patients with severe brain injury, where it compares favourably with barbiturates.	3.9343776089498506
In animal studies, it seems to possess a protective action against hypoxia on a cellular and whole organ level.	2.964357873197952
However, in some experimental animals GHB has been shown to produce seizure-like activities, and the compound is being used to produce absence-like seizures.	3.760478834038167

The injustice of corruption is an irregular exchange between performing one's duty and benefits.	2.8236247499549734
According to this, an enterprise may give funds to a scientist for research purposes if no counter performance exceeding the research is associated with this.	3.454382947218687
However, it makes a difference if the scientist has to show his appreciation by influencing economic decisions of the clinic in favor of the enterprise.	3.0467434260533537

In a prospectively designed randomized study, we compared the efficacy of sublingual nitroglycerine and intravenous enalaprilat in the out-of-hospital treatment of 46 hypertensive patients with pulmonary edema (defined as rales over both lungs and systolic blood pressure >200 mm Hg and diastolic blood pressure >100 mg).	2.9510297045936595
The out-of-hospital treatment consists of oxygen (6 Ll/min) via a face mask, furosemide 80 mg i.v., opioids 10 mg s.c., and either sublingual nitroglycerine (n=23; initial dose: 0.8 mg; repetitive application of 0.8 mg every 10 min until a cumulative dose of 3.2 mg) or intravenous enalaprilat (initial dose: 2.5 mg; repetitive application of 2.5 mg every 30 min until a cumulative dose of 10 mg).	2.817554113586436
The aim of the antihypertensive treatment was a reduction of systolic blood pressure below 160 mm Hg and diastolic blood pressure below 90 mm Hg until admission to the emergency department.	3.0483253588219497
In the emergency room, an arterial and venous blood sample was taken to determine the respiratory (pO2, pCO2) and metabolic status (pH value; base-excess; serum lactate) of the patient.	3.6503563314115066
Successful antihypertensive treatment was observed in 13/23 (57%) patients of the enalaprilat group and 15/23 (65%) patients of the nitroglycerine group (p=0.54).	3.8057040516254763
Systolic and diastolic blood pressure on admission were similiar in both treatment groups (systolic RR: enalaprilat: 179 [31] mm Hg; nitroglycerine: 184 [38] mm Hg; p=0.59; diastolic RR: enalaprilat: 96 [14] mm Hg; nitroglycerine: 101 [14] mm Hg; p=0.12).	3.006479849552882
No significant differences were observed between the enalaprilat and the nitroglycerine groups concerning respiratory and metabolic parameters on admission (pO2: 67 [15] vs. 64 [17] mm Hg; p=0.50; pCO2: 46 [9] vs. 47 [13]; p=0.75; pH value: 7.27 [0.12] vs. 7.27 [0.09]; p=0.98; BE: -4.2 [3.7] vs. -5.7 [4.1]; p=0.23; lactate: 4.2 [3.3] vs. 4.2 [2.7]; p=0.98).	2.4033085738877187
Intravenous enalaprilat did not exhibit any advantage compared to nitroglycerine in terms of blood pressure reduction or respiratory and metabolic parameters on admission to the emergency room.	3.4186741750067005
We conclude that enalaprilat is no substitute for nitroglycerine in the out-of-hospital treatment of hypertensive patients with pulmonary edema.	2.6166561870944105

The ethics of interrupting life-sustaining treatment in critically ill patients have been worked out by a Task Force on Ethics of the Society of Critical Care Medicine (1990).	2.9024492571690104
A consensus was found that the patient may judge to forego therapy; ethically it is then appropriate to withhold or withdraw therapy.	3.3269356479624883
According to the consensus, withdrawing an already initiated treatment should not necessarily be regarded as more problematic than a decision not to initiate treatment.	3.1563092792727088
In my mind, however, there is a great difference between withdrawing or withholding, e.g., ventilation.	3.7348373561026085
A dissentive opinion by some members of the Task Force stated that hydration and nutrition other than high-technology or parenteral nutrition are key components of patient care, and should not be equated with medical intervention.	3.320074450006422
The ethical problems associated with active euthanasia (physician-assisted suicide or death) as practised in the Netherlands are also discussed.	3.024212232340175
In most countries this practice seems unacceptable.	2.965004048803583
From 30 years experience in ICM, there are many more ethical questions and case reports without clear solutions.	3.4381831354406627

The following study focused on the mechanical conditions of no 6 Ethibond, 5 mm Mersilene tape and 5 mm Polylene tape.	3.0649315691825283
The material were tested as loops with a length of 30 mm including the knot similar to intraoperative conditions.	3.0348911539779215
The ultimate tension load and elongation of the conditioned and unconditioned loops were investigated under cyclic load of 50 N and 100 N using a tension load machine.	2.839043392010016
The ultimate tension load increased significantly only for Mersilene from 416 N to 462 N. However, the highest ultimate tension load showed Polylene with 479 N. The oscillating load up to 100 N revealed for unconditioned loops and elongation of 4.1 mm for Ethibond, 2.9 mm for Polylene and 5.4 mm for Mersilene.	2.8235454640113455
The elongation decreased significantly for the conditioned loops to a maximum of 1.4 mm.	3.3615330118959452
Concerning the amplitude during the period of oscillating load there was found a significant reduction as well.	3.758719506857148
Based on our results Polylene showed the best mechanical properties.	3.0347136606627902

The principle of photodynamic therapy (PDT) for rheumatoid arthritis consists in specifically concentrating a drug (photosensitizer) in the synovium.	3.093811343709274
Subsequent activation of the photosensitizer by means of a laser leads to a cytotoxic effect.	4.48850566432662
The practicability of PDT was tested in an animal model of IgG-induced arthritis in rabbits.	3.4265839285745616
Photosan-3, 5-aminolevulinic acid and BPD-MA were administered intraarticularly or intravenously.	3.408668768522926
In this model, concentration of the photosensitizer in the synovial lining cells, the lymphoid infiltrate, and the skin was seen.	4.328243601271856
After laser irradiation a selective demarcation and destruction of the synovium by prior administration of Photosan-3, not constant by BPD-MA and without therapeutic effect by 5-aminolevulinic acid, was observed.	3.0292270121517277
In contrast, bradytrophic tissues such as cartilage, meniscus, and ligament structures were changed neither macroscopically nor microscopically in all series.	2.6813892742359258
PDT thus offers ideal preconditions for minimal invasive treatment of chronic inflammatory joint diseases because of its selectivity and efficacy.	3.71235981229306

The contrast media with an iodine concentration of 350 mg/ml had an osmolality of 618 or 810 mosm/kg.	2.9564478137032797
A contrast medium volume of 80 or 90 ml was injected in the abdominal aorta.	3.5808522329014667
The mean flow was 13.9 ml/s.	3.211193920231569
The two contrast medium injections were separated by an interval of 10 min.	3.370977595494573
No analgesic premedication was given.	3.5215639957982603
The pain and heat intensity was semiquantatively measured using a visual analogue scale ranging from 0 (no heat/pain) to 100 (intractable heat/pain).	3.0359519913704758
The median after the first injection was calculated as 40 for iomeprol and 70 for iopentol.	3.4172210516478687
The comparison of heat and pain sensations after the second injection showed a less distinct difference with a scale rating of 60 for iomeprol and of 65 for iopentol.	2.9150615784656706
The statistical variance was highly significant (p < 0.01) in favor of iomeprol.	3.965602957096726
Shampooing is the most common form of hair treatment.	4.632172782730858
Shampoos have primarily been products aimed at cleansing the hair and scalp.	3.145742319850182
The diversity of qualities demanded from a good shampoo by today's consumer go far beyond this general function.	2.774715802893014
A cosmetic benefit is expected, and the shampoo formulation has to be tailored to all the possible variations associated with hair quality (dry, greasy, permed, bleached, dyed), age (baby shampoo), care habit (frequency of shampooing) and specific problems relating to the superficial condition of the scalp (dandruff, seborrhea).	3.181362141790986
Selected ingredients of shampoos that have been popular with the consumer are currently under attack because of potential risks associated with their use (e. g. halogenated organic compounds, formaldehyde, musk fragrances, and crude coal tar).	2.990834640386063
Our standard graduate training programs devote limited attention to  the subject of shampoos, and much of the readily available information concerning shampoos is supplied by the industry.	2.9636384184212097
We should be increasingly aware that our patients look to us to supply independent information on what can be expected from a shampoo to enable them to make more informed choices at the consumer level.	3.113869913915838

Dysphagia is related to the impairment of food passage from the mouth to the stomach.	3.624603541737163
Globus pharyngis implies the frequent and often painful sensation of a lump in the throat that usually does not interfere with swallowing and may even be relieved by food intake.	2.8581123420183436
Structural lesions of the cervical spine such as diffuse idiopathic skeletal hyperostosis are rare causes of dysphagia.	3.6577804913800525
Dysphagia following anterior cervical fusion as well as globus and dysphonia due to dysfunction of the vertebral joints are more likely.	4.1947701364610515
Symptoms with swallowing fluids indicate a neurogenic origin.	3.2261111803677074
Dyscoordinated swallowing, nasal reflux, dysphonia or general weakness may also occur.	3.3654575139984346
Chronic aspiration with respiratory compromize is the main consequence in a variety of neurological disorders as well as in cases of postsurgical dysphagia.	4.426440926038031

Disorders of the esophageal phase of deglutition can produce retrosternal pain, heartburn, regurgitation and vomiting, as well as laryngeal and respiratory signs.	3.446796163343469
Esophageal motility disorders include lower achalasia, tumors, peptic strictures, inflammatory diseases, drug-induced ulcers, rings and webs.	3.0566343144225248
Motility disorders present with aperistaltic, spontaneous contractions, diffuse esophagospasm, or a hypermotile esophagus.	3.1377489111510077
Gastroesophageal reflux with esophagitis must always be excluded, especially in patients with a globus sensation.	4.316761180636484
The multiple features of the appearance of the symptoms of dysphagia and globus makes multidisciplinary approach necessary in order to establish a diagnosis and begin effective treatment.	3.7476871680207813

In one of the cases the tumor could be the cause of the known electrophysiological disturbance of the conduction system (av-block) and of the sudden and unexpected death.	4.396621493710603
A case of delayed death after a low-voltage accident is presented.	3.0947591915256294
At first, an obvious source of electricity was not found.	3.16770781216255
However, electric marks were found on the fingers.	3.305129363207529
The identification of the conductor was performed by analysis of the metallisation of the electric marks.	3.65226221970542
The location of the probable conductors in a boiler under the hand basin and the discovery in a standing position prior to collapse in a bathtub indicates that the capability to act was preserved for a short time period.	2.7804332985749274

The patient does not have any evidence of tumor in the relatively short follow-up period of 10 months.	3.8365634065492547
Background: To find out the incidence of spontaneous pubertal development in girls with Turner syndrome we investigated patients with a bone age of at least eleven years.	3.9180556450896136
Results: 6 out of 17 patients showed spontaneous puberty.	3.5087649236488474
There exists no clear correlation between karyotype and phenotype on the one hand and incidence of spontaneous puberty on the other.	3.309240119305485
Basal as well as stimulated gonadotropin levels in the late childhood could better indicate spontaneous puberty in Turner syndrome.	3.538942373502877
Conclusion: In contrast to the generally held opinion spontaneous pubertal development is not rare in girls with Turner syndrome.	3.0283742306504418
Therefore estrogen replacement therapy should be started only after it became certain that there will be no spontaneous puberty.	3.240099265162477

All patients had undergone previous operations, some several times.	3.019698017180226
The recurrence rate of 13 % appeared to be low after a short follow-up.	3.5093801812623746

In five patients a shortened prewarning period was noticed.	3.027982183537101

Hypertrophic cardiomyopathy is a disorder which primarily affected the myocardium.	3.39407863211219
It is characterized by a hypertrophic left ventricle that shows normal systolic function but impaired diastolic relaxation.	2.7366085909846327
The most important complication of HCM, sudden cardiac death, is mainly responsible for a mortality of approximately 3.5% in childhood.	3.10188978896917

A prospective study was performed on 72 patients with osteochondritis dissecans (OD) of the knee and ankle to compare plane radiography, MRI and arthroscopy before therapeutic procedures.	3.419742871472099
Special interest was placed on the assessment of fragment stability with radiological methods for staging related therapy.	3.410208884476699
Using conventional radiography, OD of the condyles was staged according to the classification of Rodegerdts and Gleissner and OD of the talus suggested by Berndt and Harty.	3.3315615158604093
MRI staging was performed by morphology of the interface of the OD.	3.901191278629528
Arthroscopical staging based on the classification of Guhl.	4.743556313000782
There was an excellent correlation between the stages in MRI and arthroscopy, showing correct prediction of stable and unstable fragments in 92%.	3.226125449235521
In contrast, fragment stability could not be efficiently assessed by conventional radiology because fragments could be stably fixed in cases of bony separation.	3.3287986251523476
MRI is indicated before performance of staging-related therapy of OD to select patients with stable fragments for conservative therapy and those with unstable OD for surgical therapy.	3.221284140669617

CT revealed a diagnosis of diaphragmatic rupture with intrathoracic liver dislocation.	3.357403040075209
The liver was replaced and the extended dorsal diaphragmatic rupture was closed primarily via an abdominal approach.	3.098922232786013
